title: VP of Sales, EMEA
description:
**About Remote**
 Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how\-it\-works to learn more or if you’re interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.
   

  

 Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under\-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask \& encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.
   

  

 At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.
   

  

**All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!**
**The Opportunity**
 Remote is at the forefront of the global employment revolution, empowering companies to hire and scale internationally with ease. As our
 **Vice President, EMEA** 
 , you will own and accelerate our growth in one of the most dynamic and diverse markets in the world. This is a rare opportunity to lead a high\-performing team, shape a category\-defining product's success, and make a lasting impact on how businesses access global talent.
   

  

 We’re seeking a
 **high\-impact, strategic, and execution\-focused leader** 
 with a deep understanding of solution and platform selling, mastery of enterprise deal cycles, and a passion for scaling SaaS sales organizations. You’ll bring a
 **maniacal obsession with metrics, storytelling, and value\-based selling** 
 —ensuring our teams lead with business impact rather than price. If you're an
 **advocate of best\-in\-class sales methodologies** 
 like
 **The Challenger Sale, MEDDPICC,** 
 or similar frameworks, and can turn sales into a repeatable, predictable, and scalable engine, we want to talk.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Revenue \& Market Leadership**
* Own and drive revenue growth across EMEA, developing and executing strategies to exceed aggressive sales targets.
* Build and refine a solution\-based selling strategy that ensures our teams lead with business impact and value rather than competing on price.
* Develop a high\-impact go\-to\-market plan, balancing acquisition, expansion, and retention across SMB, Mid\-Market, and Enterprise segments.
* Lead regional expansion efforts, ensuring we maximize our market opportunity across key industries and geographies.
* Build and enforce a maniacal focus on sales metrics—tracking pipeline, conversion rates, cycle times, deal velocity, ACV growth, and retention.


**Sales Strategy \& Execution**
* Architect a repeatable and scalable sales motion, leveraging methodologies like The Challenger Sale, MEDDPICC, SPIN Selling, or Command of the Sale to drive predictable revenue outcomes.
* Lead the team in storytelling and executive selling, ensuring we deeply connect with customers on a strategic level.
* Partner closely with Marketing and Sales Development to drive high\-quality lead generation and create an efficient inbound and outbound motion.
* Leverage advanced AI\-driven sales intelligence to improve conversion rates, optimize performance, and unlock new opportunities.
* Optimize sales processes, automation, and technology to increase productivity and accuracy in forecasting.


**People, Culture \& Team Development**
* Hire, coach, and develop a high\-performing, elite sales leadership team to scale the organization.
* Foster a culture of accountability, execution excellence, and customer obsession.
* Drive a continuous learning culture, ensuring all sellers are trained in leading sales methodologies and consistently refining their craft.
* Design high\-impact incentive and compensation structures that drive performance and reward top talent.


**Cross\-Functional Leadership \& Strategic Impact**
* Work with Revenue Operations to create AI\-powered forecasting and analytics dashboards that provide real\-time revenue insights.
* Partner with Product \& Engineering to advocate for customer\-driven innovation, ensuring our roadmap aligns with market needs.
* Act as a thought leader and evangelist, representing Remote at industry events, executive briefings, and partner engagements.


**What We’re Looking For**
**Must\-Have Experience \& Leadership**
* Extensive sales leadership experience in high\-growth SaaS environments, with strong experience leading multi\-level sales organizations across multiple geographies.
* Deep expertise in solution selling, platform sales, and value\-based selling, ensuring customers buy on business impact, not price.
* Obsessed with sales methodologies—fluent in The Challenger Sale, MEDDPICC, SPIN Selling, or other proven enterprise sales frameworks.
* Proven ability to scale sales organizations to $100M\+ revenue and build high\-performing teams in a rapidly growing company.
* A data\-obsessed, metrics\-driven leader with a strong grasp of revenue intelligence, pipeline analytics, and forecasting.
* A master of narrative\-based sales and executive storytelling, able to translate product capabilities into compelling business cases.
* Experience in HR Tech, Payroll, FinTech, or adjacent SaaS markets is highly preferred.


**Exceptional Leadership \& Execution Skills**
* High\-impact leader who thrives at both strategic and tactical levels, seamlessly transitioning between vision\-setting and hands\-on execution.
* A top\-tier recruiter and talent magnet who attracts, develops, and retains elite sales talent.
* A strong executive presence and boardroom\-ready communicator, able to influence senior stakeholders and enterprise decision\-makers.


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Previous experience in HR Tech, or similar category\-leading SaaS firms.
* Background in international markets, multi\-currency pricing models, and global go\-to\-market strategies.
* Prior experience leading through significant market expansion, transformation, or M\&A activity.


 🚀 Ready to build something extraordinary? Apply today and help us redefine the future of work.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Our full benefits \& perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:
   

  

* work from anywhere
* flexible paid time off
* flexible working hours (we are async)
* 16 weeks paid parental leave
* mental health support services
* stock options
* learning budget
* home office budget \& IT equipment
* budget for local in\-person social events or co\-working spaces


**How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)**
 We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.
   

  

 You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your
 **life\-work balance** 
 is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.
   

  

 If that sounds like something you want, apply now!
   

  

**How To Apply**
* Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
* We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.
* If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


 We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.
   

  

 At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.
   

  

*Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.*

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Senior Data Analyst \- Amsterdam \| 40 hours** 




  





 Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as
 **Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox** 
 . Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.
 



  





 We are looking for a highly motivated and detail\-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data\-driven decision\-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
* Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
* Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
* Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
* Design dashboards that enable informed, data\-driven decisions.
* Analyze growth to identify high\-performing areas and new opportunities.
* Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
* Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.



  





**You:** 



* 3 to 5 years of experience in a data\-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
* Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
* Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
* Hands\-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
* Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
* Strong attention to detail and problem\-solving abilities.
* Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
* Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
* Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non\-technical audiences.



  





**We offer:** 



* A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
* Hybrid way of working
* 26 holidays per year (based on full\-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
* Unlimited access to all our high\-end fitness locations for you and a \+1
* Unlimited access to well\-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
* An inspiring head office, a short 10\-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
* A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Do you want to help us on our journey to build the ultimate online playground?**
 Hey \- we're Poki! We're a tech scale\-up on a mission to create the ultimate online playground . Currently, more than 90 million monthly players around the world come to us for easy access to the best games, created by our thriving game developer community consisting of 500\+ game developer teams. We're always looking for new insights and opportunities to increase the value we offer to players and game developers, and so we’re looking for a
 **Business Intelligence Analyst.**
**What This Role Is About**
 Poki is a multisided platform designed so players from all over the world have easy and free access to the best games, while our game developer community is able to generate earnings. The developers release their games through our platform, Poki for Developers, where they can test, iterate and evaluate their games. In order to monetise the games we work with a select group of advertisers, ensuring quality advertisements on the playground.
   

  

 Our analysts are responsible for providing the rest of the team with opportunities. Through actionable insights they help both the internal team, and our game developers to grow and create business value from petabytes of raw data.
   

  

**Your Challenge As a Business Intelligence Analyst At Poki**
* Grow our player base by improving the efficiency of our marketing. Look into the ways that players find us so we can double down on what works and improve what doesn’t.
* Help the team talking to game developers to understand what games to focus on. Which games can grow our playground. And do we serve the needs of our players when it comes to content.
* Find ways to improve the value we deliver to our players on the playground. Help to improve the discoverability of games by evaluating common patterns and understanding how we can make the experience better.
* Spot opportunities to improve our monetisation logic. We control the timing and placement of advertisements. Look into the monetisation patterns for different segments of players and help to find the right balance between play and ads.


**You Could Be Our Business Intelligence Analyst If**
* You’re a critical thinker, and have 4\+ years experience as an analyst
* You’re business savvy, and eager to optimize for performance
* You’re curious to understand the complex dynamics of a multi\-sided platform (balancing the needs of players, game developers, and advertisers).
* You have experience with structuring data with SQL (BigQuery, Snowflake or similar products).
* You have experience with data visualization (Lookerstudio, Tableau or similar products).
* You are based in The Netherlands, and able to work on\-site regularly at our office in Amsterdam.


**Why Work At Poki**
* Direct impact on the experience of our community of 500\+ game developers, and our 90 million monthly players.
* A lot of personal responsibility and freedom, plus the chance to work together with a diverse, international, talented and self\-motivated team.
* Play is how we learn; we make sure everyone is being challenged and and offer an annual training budget.
* Opportunity to connect with colleagues through work retreats, drinks every Thursday and team activities.
* A full time contract and opportunity to join our Employee Participation Plan
* A hybrid work environment that includes a vibrant office environment with catered lunch, flexible working hours, work from home budget, and travel costs covered for those living outside of Amsterdam.


*Are you curious? You may very well be our next Business Intelligence Analyst, so hit apply and tell us more about yourself!*

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real\-time performance insights and connect the enterprise \- accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.
   

  

 HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry\-specific solutions.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
* Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision\-making
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
* Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
* Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
* Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
* Optimize data processes for performance and scalability


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
* Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
* Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities


**Benefits**
**Why choose HSO?**
**Freedom and flexibility**
 An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.
   

  

**Culture**
 An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!
   

  

**Development and growth**
 A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.
   

  

**A good remuneration package**
 An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.
   

  

**Do you want to be part of a fast\-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!**

title: Data Scientist - Product Insights
description:
At Catawiki, every day brings the extraordinary! Whether it’s , a , or , we encounter exceptional objects every day.
 


  


 We're a one\-of\-a\-kind marketplace for buying and selling special objects! Each week we offer over 75,000 unique items in auction
 *,* 
 carefully curated by our passionate in\-house experts.
 


  


 Having sold over 20 million unique objects to date, we’re on a mission to become the world’s most popular destination for special objects. As a growing, diverse and sustainable scale\-up, we proudly live by our core values:
 


  

  
* Taking ownership and driving impact
  
* Being open to change and feedback
  
* Being passionate about our mission and our customers.
  


  


 If these values resonate with you, we’d love to explore how you can join us on this exciting journey!
 


  

**About the role and team** 
  


 With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 19 data scientists and engineers that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science \& Analytics team plays a central role in that.
 


  


 We are looking for a
 **Data Scientist \- Product Insights** 
 to work with our Product teams and leverage data to identify user journey opportunities and measure success of our product features and teams.
 


  


 You will be part of the Data Science Product Insights Team helping us make sense of our data, finding actionable insights and creating self\-service opportunities by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.
 


  


 In this role no two days will be the same: you will build dashboards, design robust A/B tests, uncover trends in user behaviour, collaborate with your Data colleagues on discovery for a new ML model, or enhance the reliability of our data pipelines. Whatever the task, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping Catawiki’s product solutions and deliver real impact.
 


  

**What You'll Do** 
  

  
* **Own analytics for a broad product area** 
 – Unlike at larger companies where analytics roles are more specialized, at Catawiki, you’ll take full ownership of a major part of the platform. This could mean leading analytics for all buyer\-facing features, all seller\-facing experiences, or everything related to fulfillment. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders and proactively identify opportunities by deeply understanding Catawiki’s user behavior.
  
* **Turn data into insights and recommendations** 
 – You’ll go beyond tracking metrics—you’ll define and refine key success measures, uncover trends, and translate data into clear recommendations. Your insights will help shape Product decisions, flag opportunities, and drive the strategy forward. Through dashboards and reports, you’ll make sure the right information is always at hand to guide the business.
  
* **Leverage advanced analytics** 
 – Using techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and A/B testing, you’ll analyze user behavior, identify actionable insights, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features to ensure continuous improvement.
  
* **Enable data\-driven decision\-making at scale** 
 – You’ll identify and implement self\-service data solutions that empower Product teams to make informed decisions faster. Beyond Product analytics, you’ll contribute to foundational data projects like building scalable data pipelines, improving data accessibility, and expanding our A/B Experimentation program.
  


  

**Who You Are** 
  

  
* **Experienced data professional** 
 – You have a strong quantitative background and 3\+ years of experience in data science or analytics, ideally in an online company.
  
* **Technical skills** 
 – You're proficient in SQL and comfortable writing code to transform data into insights, whether in Python, R, or another language. You can handle large datasets, manage complex data pipelines, and work with tools like Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, and data transformation tools like dbt or Dataform.
  
* **Statistical expertise** 
 – You have a solid understanding of statistics and can apply techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and hypothesis testing to extract meaningful insights from data.
  
* **Web and app analytics** 
 – You have experience with tracking tools like Google Analytics (GA) and Google Tag Manager (GTM), helping to measure and optimize user behavior.
  
* **Data\-driven experimentation** 
 – You understand A/B testing principles and how to apply them to drive meaningful insights.
  
* **Turning data into action** 
 – You don’t just analyze data—you extract insights that drive business decisions, even with minimal engineering support.
  
* **Strong communicator** 
 – You work effectively with business owners, engineers, and leadership, translating data insights into clear recommendations.
  


  

**Where You’ll Be** 
  


**This role is based in our Amsterdam office, in the Netherlands.** 



  

**Why You'll Love Working with Us** 
  

  
* **Create a Visible Impact** 
 by working at scale in a global organisation that serves millions of customers across 80\+ categories. In our flat structure, every role has a broad scope that directly impacts both our customers and the business.
  
* **Learn and Grow with Us** 
 through our Learning \& Development initiatives, which include clear development plans and mentorship programmes designed to support your career progression.
  
* **A Culture of Connection** 
 defines us. We’re a passionate, diverse and collaborative team of 800\+ Catawikains and 60\+ nationalities, all coming together to build a one\-of\-a\-kind marketplace. We foster an inclusive and queer\-friendly work environment, committed to making every Catawikian feel welcomed and empowered. Whatever your story, we encourage you to bring your unique perspective to our team.
  
* **Celebrate Life’s Moments** 
 with us at Catawiki. When you join us, you’ll receive a €100 Catavoucher, and on each birthday, you'll get a €50 Catavoucher to celebrate. Enjoy an extra day off each year to "Pursue Your Passion". We also recognise significant work anniversaries (3, 5, 8, 10 years) with additional time off, plus extra leave for life’s big moments like marriage, engagements, or moving house.
  


  


 Please note that benefits can vary by location. For specific information regarding what’s available in your country, please consult your recruiter.
 


  

**Our Offices and Way of Working** 
  


 Our vibrant offices in Amsterdam, Paris and Lisbon are designed to inspire and connect. Most Catawikians are within commuting distance of one of our offices and enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. This means we typically ask you to be in the office 2 out of 5 days, roughly 40% of your working time, to collaborate and connect with your colleagues. Of course, if the job description specifies that the role is 100% remote—such as for certain expert or sales positions—then that arrangement will apply.
 


  

**Interested?** 
  


 Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to .
 


  


*If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*

title: Product Analyst
description:
In a nutshell
   

  

 As a Product Analyst at Picnic, you’ll be a key driver of innovation, solving complex challenges with cutting\-edge solutions. Your work will be impactful—you’ll harness data, uncover opportunities, and craft strategies that break boundaries, redefining how people shop for groceries.
   

  

 When you join Picnic, we’ll align your first project, team, and team lead to match your unique skills and aspirations. This tailored start sets the stage for your journey to becoming a Product Owner.
   

  

 Tricks of the trade
   

  

* Solving real\-life puzzles: Tackling critical business questions that shape Picnic’s business model every day. Curious about the questions?
* Innovating across borders: Working on projects spanning three countries and contributing to Picnic’s in\-house innovation, shaping the business model as we grow.
* Building sustainable solutions: Using data and technology to develop solutions which are impactful and scalable.
* Owning solutions end\-to\-end: Taking full ownership of projects, from conceptualization to implementation across different areas of the business
* Leading with ambition: Using your relentless determination and grit to take the driver's seat and redefine the grocery shopping experience.


 Your superpowers
   

  

* Master’s degree in Engineering, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or an equivalent quantitative study
* 1\-3 years of work experience in a fast\-paced environment, start\-up, scale up or business consulting
* Problem\-solving mindset and passion for tackling complex challenges
* Strong communication skills which allow you to explain complex analytical concepts in a simple and effective way
* Proficient with SQL and Python or excited to learn
* EU citizenship or valid visa to work in the EU


*Note: This is not a one\-time hire. We’re hiring for this role throughout the year as part of our ongoing growth and expansion.*
 Picnic Perks
   

  

**🥗Fresh Lunch, coffee, and snacks**
 Our offices are equipped with fully\-fledged coffee bars and a kitchen and chefs. They prepare delicious fresh and warm lunches every day so you can keep your energy up.
   

  

**🚲Health insurance discount \& bike plan**
 We have a partnership with CZ (a health insurance provider). Picnic employees get a discount on CZ insurance packages between 5% and 15%. Furthermore, through our partnership with Lease a Bike, you can rent\-to\-own a new (e)bike at a discounted rate
   

  

**🗺️Relocation**
 If you’re moving from another country to join Picnic we make it as smooth as possible for you. We’ll cover your flight costs for you and your partner and kids, your first month's rent and moving costs (up to €2000\), and help you with the 30% tax ruling setup and application.
   

  

**🍎Learning \& development**
 You’ll get ample opportunity to work on yourself at Picnic. We offer personal development through Lepaya courses, Academy trainings, and more. Interested in improving your mental wellbeing? Through OpenUp you get free access to trained psychologists and many courses.
   

  

**💻All the rest**
 At Picnic you get 25 holidays, we cover your travel expenses and offer a pension plan. And your phone and laptop are on us, as well.

title: Junior Financial Risk Specialist - Valuation
description:
ING’s purpose is ‘Empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business’. Every ING colleague is given the opportunity to contribute to that vision. We champion self\-reliance and foster a collaborative and innovative culture. The Orange Code is our global manifesto for how we stay true to our purpose and our tradition of reinvention and empowerment. It is made up of ING Values (we are honest; we are prudent; we are responsible) and ING Behaviours: (you take it on and make it happen; you help others to be successful; you are always a step ahead). For us, success will only be achieved if we act with Integrity .
  
  

Some companies see diversity as a box to be ticked. We see it as fundamental to our success and we encourage a proper work/life balance. At ING, you will be judged on your performance in line with the Orange Code. And that’s a promise.
  
The role is part of the Financial Risk/Trading Risk Management (TRM) department. The department comprises a large team of market risk, product control, valuation and counterparty credit risk managers \& analysts, with expertise in the risk management of financial markets.
  
  

Team Overview
  
The vacancy is in the TRM/Centralization, Valuation \& Product Control team which, amongst others, is the centre of expertise for valuation and product control topics within the bank. It is an international team with an informal and open atmosphere, with team members working across Amsterdam and London, all working together with a strong delivery focus. The team is responsible for setting/designing the valuation framework and implementation in terms of fair and prudent valuation. The team is currently being extended with the intention to deliver the ‘Valuation Program’. After (or in parallel to) the delivery of the program, the team will become responsible for the BAU management of the newly designed processes/activities.
  
  

Roles and responsibilities
  
The role is focused on delivering valuation regulatory and accounting requirements across different regional hubs. You will be involved in a variety of topics related to valuation risks (mostly for trading but also for banking books) to deliver the ‘Valuation Program’, which aims to address new regulatory requirements and higher model risk management expectations in this area. The key focus over the next few years will be on valuation (re)developments, where you will play a key role in the design, development, implementation, testing and roll out to production of IFRS and Prudent Valuation (AVA) related enhancements across several asset classes.
  
  

As part of the ‘Valuation Program’, you will be critical supporting the team to ensure the successful and timely delivery of one or multiple workstreams in the project , which will be aligned to committed regulatory \& internal deadlines. A high\-level overview of these workstreams is presented below:
  
  

Designing, implementing, and maintaining a compliant fair and prudent valuation framework and governance for all Fair Value books.
  
  

Designing and implementing the framework to assess the observability, accuracy and uncertainty of market data used as input in valuation activities, as well as monitoring and analysing the results from these assessments and propose different market data sources when required.
  
  

Development, implementation and roll\-out of IPV \& Valuation Adjustment models (such as market price uncertainty, close\-out costs, concentrated positions, future administrative costs, etc), as well as ensuring appropriate model risk management for these models, in line with internal and regulatory requirements.
  
  

Development, implementation and roll\-out of other fair valuation related activities, such as Fair Value Hierarchy, Day One P\&L or new product initiatives where valuation modelling requirements/implications should be addressed and followed up.
  
  

How to succeed
  
We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  
To succeed in the delivery of these workstreams, you will need:
  
  

Flexibility in the way and scope of working, as all workstreams in the Valuation Program are strongly interrelated and scope prioritizations might change based on delivery deadlines and other dependencies.
  
  

Build relationships and work together with multiple stakeholders such as Front Office, Finance, Risk, Product Controllers, IT, Development \& Validation Quants and market data providers for successful delivery and implementation of re\-developed processes/models, ensuring that newly designed methodologies and models are appropriate and their impacts are well understood and agreed.
  
  

Engagement/follow up with regulators, auditors and the industry on valuation related items.
  
  

Ability to work with large data sets and systems, in an environment where data \& processes are largely fragmented and manually managed.
  
  

Ensure operational excellence of valuation processes, maximising automation possibilities to provide a robust and compliant operational valuation framework, including delivering IT specifications to implement strategic solutions.
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

A gross salary between € 3\.678,97 and € 7\.088,63
  
  

24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
  
  

Pension scheme
  
  

13th month salary
  
  

8% Holiday payment
  
  

Hybrid working
  
  

Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
  
  

An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
  
  

About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.

title: Quantative Risk Analyst
description:
Quantative Risk Analyst**At a glance**
---------------


As a modelling and risk expert, you will be responsible for data quality, process optimization, modelling, validation, implementation and testing of the risk systems. You present our risk models in the risk committees and to our regulators.  

What do you see when you envision the next step? Work on achieving your goals and develop yourself professionally and personally. Tell us your story. We want to hear it!

**Your job**
------------


As a quantitative risk specialist in the Quantitative Risk Management department, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. You will be responsible for the development and maintenance of the risk models and data frameworks, but you will also coach and provide business input to team members while developing / improving risk models. Here, you can apply your leadership and quantitative skills and experience on various datasets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will be responsible for delivering important project goals, working together with junior and experienced risk colleagues.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will work within a highly motivated, international team of colleagues with a strong quantitative background (e.g. econometrics / mathematics). Together with your team members, you will be challenged to find creative and innovative solutions for our business and our clients. You will co\-operate with our IT team and the different risk teams in an agile way to organize, develop and implement solutions in our IT systems.

**Your profile**
----------------


Requirements:  

* Demonstratable experience (\> 5 years) in the field of risk model development and / or validation.
* A master in a quantitative field, e.g. econometrics / mathematics.
* Deep understanding of financial risk models, data, products and markets.
* Structured and accurate way of working.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbally as in writing, with the ability to articulate complex risk concepts clearly to stakeholders.
* You are pro\-active by discussing problems before they manifest and actively proposing solutions to the team and / or our stakeholders.
* A collaborative attitude and the ability to build relationships across different departments and regions, managing conflicting priorities and diverse perspectives.
* Great team player, who can motivate and coach other colleagues.
* You take initiatives to find the best solutions for our stakeholders.
* Proven programming experience in Python.
* Fluent in English; Dutch is a plus.
* Experience with C\+\+, Tableau and / or Dataiku is a plus.
* Strong interest in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning is a plus.
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally.
* Work in an innovative and international team.
* Opportunity to improve your knowledge about financial products and risk models.
* Opportunity to develop yourself as a team player.
* The opportunity to pro\-actively work on your vitality and fitness.
* A competitive monthly salary (incl. a benefit budget of 11%).
* A personal development budget of EUR 1\.000 per year.
* An annual public transportation pass for unlimited travel.
* A solid pension plan.
* The possibility to work (partially) remote and flexible.
* Interesting work and challenging projects.
* A team that likes to help and strengthen each other.
**Interested?**
---------------


Are you interested? Please apply for this vacancy as soon as possible. For more information for the role, please contact Alfred Yee (alfred.yee@abnamroclearing.com). We look forward getting to know you.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

title: Financial Analyst, Cost Accounting
description:
**Financial Analyst, Cost Accounting**

**Purpose of the role**


This position is in the Cost of Sales \& Inventory COE (COSI) organization, which performs end to end Cost and Inventory accounting and provides support to our global manufacturing and distribution network. We are a diverse and international team based in Amsterdam, operating in global and dynamic environment.

**Main responsibilities**

* Create and maintain product cost for assigned manufacturing and distribution entities, and support global productivity calculation during annual budget process
* Analyze and report production results to business partners
* Review consolidated cost and intercompany profit differences at HQ level
* Analyze inventory movements, standard revision, and purchase price variances
* Collaborate with country finance teams, shared service center and HQ teams during financial close, take corrective actions where needed
* Reconcile inventory related P\&L and Balance sheet accounts
* Participate in process improvement and business transformation projects

**Your profile**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, or another related field
* 3 years of relevant analytical work experience in finance/accounting
* Experience with SAP and BI tools is preferred
* Advanced MS Excel and data analytics skills
* Fluency in written and spoken English is mandatory
* Proactive, team player with enthusiasm to learn
* Cost accounting and/or experience in a manufacturing environment is a plus

* An Excel test will be part of the selection process
**Secondary Job Description**

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6\.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre\-existing agreement is in place. title: Finance Bakery Sr Analyst
description:
*Founded in Parma in 1877, Barilla is now a global company present in more than 100 countries worldwide. Recognized as a symbol of Italian know\-how, “****The Joy of Food for a Better Life****” is Barilla’s purpose to bring people closer to the joy of good food and making quality the choice for a better life. It's a commitment from field to fork, to bring to the world tasty, joyful and wholesome products, made with selected raw materials from responsible supply chains. Because what we eat today can change our tomorrow. Because good food is a joy for the present and a choice for a better future.*

  



Barilla International is looking for a Finance Bakery Senior Analyst, within the Finance Bakery unit, based in Amsterdam.  

The role will report to the Finance Bakery Associate Director.

  


**Job Purpose**

  

  

Supports Category Business, partnering with business functions. Ensuring Financials reliability. Leverage on Data and on a broader business understanding to take decision. Looking forward attitude.

  


**Key Accountabilities**

  

  

Global Finance Wasa:  

* Finance lead for innovation projects Category Business Partner
* Support category and region growth plan
* Finance led for BDG and Forecasts, strategic plan 3 years / 10 years
* RCA and Capex management
* Marketing expenses support
* Driving synergies across categories and countries
* Support Supply Chain projects
  


Finance for Bakery Category:  

* Category Business Partner
* Lead global performance reporting
* Lead category BDG / forecast consolidation
  


**Requirements**

  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Economics
* 1\-2 years of experience in controlling (FMCG / Multinationals)
* Fluency in English
  


Barilla is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of Barilla to prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state and local laws and ordinances, nationally and internationally. Other classifications include, but are not limited to, family status, health status, multicultural differences, political ideas and sexual orientation.

title: Data Analyst - Insight Generation for High-Tech Strategy
description:
Netherlands Data Science Eindhoven Hybrid
Turn data into actionable insights and drive strategic decisions in the high\-tech industry.

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high\-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast\-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high\-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology \& Engineering
* Energy \& Renewables
* Life sciences \& Pharma
* Digital \& IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision\-making in the high\-tech industry. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.


Key Responsibilities:

* Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
* Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
* Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to understand business needs.
* Present findings in a clear and impactful manner.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


* Bachelor’s or Msc degree in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related fields.
* 3\-5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
* Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
* Strong analytical and communication skills.
* Knowledge of the high\-tech industry is a plus.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


TMC is an international high\-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.


At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.


As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long\-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long\-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance\-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high\-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out\-of\-the\-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Biomedical Research Analist in-vivo research
description:
**About this position**
-----------------------


The Metabolic Health Research (MHR) department focuses on advancing knowledge and technology in the field of biomedical health and drug development. We aim to develop revolutionary technologies that make the discovery, development, and production of therapeutic drugs faster, cheaper, and greener. Our state\-of\-the\-art laboratories are located at the Leiden BioScience Park.
**What will be your role?**
---------------------------


As a Biomedical Research Analyst in the MHR team, you will work on a variety of projects that contribute to the development of new drugs, particularly for diseases related to obesity\-disrupted metabolism. These projects focus on biological issues such as cardiovascular diseases, liver metabolism, fibrosis, and diabetic nephropathy. You will work with various pre\-clinical in\-vivo mouse models and apply various analytical techniques and biotechnical procedures. The research is conducted in a close\-knit team of professionals in an open and informal culture.  

  

**What will you do?**
* Prepare and conduct experiments using various techniques, including performing biotechnical procedures and surgeries on laboratory animals (mice), histology, microscopy, tissue culture, cell culture, ELISAs, and various biochemical assays.
* Analyze, process, and present experimental data in close collaboration with the scientists and project leaders who are ultimately responsible for the projects.
* Advise and collaborate with scientists on the techniques to be used and the setup of procedures and analysis methods.
* Keep up with developments in the field and identify new opportunities.
* Once a month, you will have a weekend shift in the animal facility (under very good working conditions).
* Ensure the quality of work execution.
**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


* You have at least a Bachelor Degree, preferably with a background in medical biology, cell biology, molecular biology, and/or biochemistry.
* You are a highly motivated medical biological/biochemical/cell biological (research) analyst with laboratory experience in this field.
* Experience with surgical techniques and biotechnical procedures is necessary. We ask you to clearly indicate your experience in this area in your CV and/or motivation letter.
* An article 13f.2 WOD or article 9 WOD qualification and competence is a necessity.
* Histology experience and experience with managing breeding lines is a plus.
* You have good written and verbal communication skills in English.
**What you'll get in return**
-----------------------------


Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3\.500 and € 4\.500 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8\.33% and a flex budget (5\.58% \+ € 180\). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.  

  

TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect:
* An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field.
* The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs.
* 33 days annual leave on a full\-time basis.
* An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics.
* We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel.
* Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues. That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly.
* Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home.
* A good pension scheme.

Read more about tailoring your benefits package.


**TNO as an employer**
----------------------


At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you: who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state\-of\-the\-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters: impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer.  

  

At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion.
**The selection process**
-------------------------


Please apply before the 20st of April, 2025\. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.  

  

A certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.
**Has this job opening sparked your interest?**
-----------------------------------------------


Then we’d like to hear from you! Please contact us for more information about the job or the selection process. To apply, please upload your CV and covering letter using the ‘

title: Senior Business Analyst – Name Screening
description:
### **Senior Business Analyst \| Hybrid (NL)**



Shape the Future of Financial Crime Compliance!



We are looking for a **Senior Business Analyst** to strengthen a **Sanction and Name Screening** department. In this role, you will bridge the gap between **business and technology**, ensuring compliance with the latest regulatory requirements while optimizing **screening applications**. You will work in a **high\-performing DevOps squad** focused on delivering **compliant, scalable, and innovative solutions**.



### **What You’ll Do**



✅ Conduct **broad business analyses** and act as a bridge between various stakeholders.  

✅ Implement **business rules** and optimize **alert scenarios** for sanction screening.  

✅ Prepare **management reports** for senior management and external regulators.  

✅ Guide **model validations** and implement findings from internal audits.  

✅ Work closely with a **DevOps Squad** to develop new sanction screening applications.  

✅ Translate complex **business needs into technical solutions** and user stories.  

✅ Align with **compliance teams** to ensure solutions meet all regulatory standards.  

✅ Communicate effectively with **technical and non\-technical stakeholders**.



### **What You’ll Bring**



✔️ **3\+ years of experience** in a similar role, ideally in **Sanction Screening** or a **Financial Economic Crime (FEC)** domain.  

✔️ Strong **data analysis, data mapping, and data quality skills (SQL)**.  

✔️ Experience refining **user stories** and collaborating in Agile teams (**Scrum, DevOps, SAFe**).  

✔️ Ability to **simplify complex processes** and communicate with international stakeholders.  

✔️ **Knowledge of sanction screening algorithms, rules, and thresholds (Pre).**  

✔️ A **proactive, analytical, and solution\-driven** mindset.  

✔️ Strong **documentation and stakeholder management** skills.  

✔️ Experience with **enterprise IT landscapes**, compliance regulations, and risk management.  

✔️ Fluent in **English** (Dutch is a plus).



### **What’s in It for You?**



 Work on **mission\-critical compliance solutions** with a global impact.  

 Hybrid working model – collaborate with **international teams**.  

 Engage in **cutting\-edge FinTech** within a **fast\-evolving regulatory environment**.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**About the Client**  
Our client is a leading provider of innovative Warehouse Management Software (WMS) solutions. Their software helps companies worldwide optimize their warehouse processes, from inventory management to order processing. As a customer\-centric organization, they are committed to supporting their customers with both technical expertise and operational insights. They are now looking for a skilled Business Analyst with a passion for technology, logistics, and customer satisfaction to join their team.

**Responsibilities**

* **Requirement Gathering**: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements. Translate these requirements into detailed functional specifications for system improvements and new features.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting**: Perform data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement. Generate reports and dashboards to facilitate informed decision\-making.
* **System Analysis and Support**: Provide technical and functional support for the WMS solutions. Analyze system performance and implement enhancements to improve efficiency and user experience.
* **Process Improvement**: Evaluate existing business processes and recommend optimizations to streamline operations and increase productivity. Develop and implement best practices for WMS usage.
* **Training and Documentation**: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for system processes, configurations, and user guides. Conduct training sessions for end\-users to ensure optimal system utilization.
* **Issue Resolution**: Investigate and resolve technical and operational issues related to the WMS solution. Coordinate with IT and vendor support teams as needed to achieve timely resolution.
* **Project Management**: Assist in project planning and execution for WMS\-related initiatives. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and meet quality standards.
* **Quality Assurance**: Perform quality checks on delivered solutions to ensure they meet the set requirements and stakeholder expectations.

**Qualifications**

* **Education**: A degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Supply Chain Management, or a related field is preferred. Equivalent work experience will also be considered.
* **Experience**: Minimum of 3\-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably within the supply chain or logistics industry. Familiarity with WMS solutions is advantageous.
* **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in WMS functionality, data analysis tools, and reporting software. Strong understanding of system integration and ERP systems.
* **Analytical Skills**: Excellent analytical and problem\-solving abilities. Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
* **Communication Skills**: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
* **Project Management**: Demonstrated experience in managing projects, including planning, execution, and stakeholder management.
* **Agile/SCRUM Methodology**: Familiarity with SCRUM and agile work processes is highly desirable.
* **Attention to Detail**: High level of attention to detail and accuracy in fulfilling responsibilities.
* **Investigative Spirit**: A curious and investigative mindset, with a drive to uncover insights and propose innovative solutions.

**Key Competencies**

* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and WMS\-related software.
* Flexibility and adaptability in a fast\-paced environment.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €3\.600,00 \- €5\.000,00 per maand

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Auto van de zaak

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 4206 Gorinchem

title: WMS Business Analyst
description:
Job Overview

We are looking for skilled Industrial Engineering (IE) Specialists to support the migration process between Warehouse Management Systems (WMS). The selected professionals will be instrumental in evaluating and enhancing operational efficiencies during the transition, ensuring alignment with business objectives and process standards.

Key Responsibilities

* Understand existing warehouse processes and account operations.
* Differentiate between essential and optional requirements.
* Assist in validating business requirements and align them with system capabilities.
* Translate business needs into system\-level specifications with a focus on process optimization.
* Evaluate the impact of system changes on operational efficiency, ensuring business processes remain within set benchmarks.

Additional Responsibilities

* Collect and analyze data required for developing accurate work measurements.
* Maintain operational planning data to identify improvement opportunities.
* Ensure proper application and accuracy of work measurements through audits.
* Identify and document deviations from established standards and propose corrective actions.
* Assess long\- and short\-term forecasts to adjust operational plans accordingly.
* Create analytical reports and respond to ad hoc data requests.
* Maintain documentation for forecasts, planning spreadsheets, and staffing models.

Qualifications \& Skills

* Bachelor’s degree or international equivalent in Engineering or a related field (preferred).
* Experience in WMS (Warehouse Management System) migration is highly desirable.
* Strong understanding of operational process improvements and barriers.
* Technical aptitude in system reporting, data integration, and database management.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, database maintenance, etc.).
* Industrial Engineering experience preferred.
* Flexibility to work in shifts, including weekends and travel, as needed.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €4\.000,00 \- €4\.500,00 per maand

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: Product Owner Financial Messaging
description:
### **Job Information**


Date Opened


**03/27/2025**Industry

**Full time**Work Experience

**1102 BH**### **Job Description**


For ING Bank in the Netherlands, we are looking for a Customer Journey Expert to join the team of our SWIFT/IRM/GFME Financial Messaging Platform, with experience in the SWIFT domain and preferably Payments or Treasury.  

  

  

The CJE works most of its time in a squad within ING’s Agile organization, together with other experts to achieve the squad’s mission. The CJE has expertise in the areas of product management (SWIFT, MT and MX messaging, ISO20022\) and process optimisation. **Role and responsibilities**  


As a Customer Journey Expert:  

* You have an end\-to\-end responsibility for the operation, management and improvement of our SWIFT internal messaging service (IRM). You will fulfil the role of Product Owner within a cross border squad (Amsterdam/Brussels).
* You have multiple stakeholders both within and outside of ING.
* In your role of product owner, you manage and prioritize the backlog at the level of user stories, derived from features and epics.
* You define business requirements for the development of products and services and play a supporting role in the Quarterly Business Reviews.
* You define, measure and improve key product metrics.
* You combine in depth product knowledge, strategic and business thinking, customer insights and analytical thinking to generate recommendations to evolve the products.
* You continuously improve the processes and operations around our financial messaging.
* You pro\-actively build relationships with the 42 ING branches that use your services.
* Align cross\-functional stakeholders across the organization, including sales, operations and customer support.
* Rigorously leverage data and analytics to drive decisions, features and design.
* Recommend future improvements of user documentation, training of customers, sales and operations.
+ Keep abreast with trends in the industry and share information throughout the organization.
+ Ensure our license to operate by secure and flawless 24/7 operations while ensuring regulatory compliance.

* You work with Risk, Compliance, and Legal stakeholders, to make sure our products and services comply with regulation and policies

### **Requirements**

**We are looking for:**  


A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and known for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals.  

* A Master or Bachelor degree
* 3\+ years of relevant experience as a Customer Journey Expert or equivalent position e.g. as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Project lead or Business Consultant
* Experience with working in projects and/or programs is a must have
* Experience in banking and payments is a must have
* A high level of organization is key, as well as eye for detail in capturing risk information and following up on actions
* Structured person and excellent in administration and documenting complex risk related information
* You are an energetic, pro\-active thinker, motivating person who can work as part of a multidisciplinary team and who can also work independently, think and act out of the box and take accountability
* You are naturally a collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals
* You are excellent in capturing information, drive that forward and while doing so are resilient and focused
* You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose solutions to problems
* Fluent in English (verbally and written), Dutch is a plus
* Possess strong analytical skills and takes decisions based on data and facts
* Able to simplify solutions and processes and tell the story clearly, structured and convincing
* Strong social and communication skills; you are comfortable with collaboration and reaching out across Tribes and functional boarders and serve as liaison when needed
* You easily connect and align stakeholders within all levels of the ING organization, from IT Lead to IT and DevOps engineer and from Tribe lead to peers and colleagues, all with the ING customer journey in mind
* You are creative and an out\-of\-the box thinker, proactive, who likes to work in a multidisciplinary team in an agile environment
* Able to take it on and make it happen: realization skills and work under pressure if the situation requires it

### **Benefits**


**What we offer:**
  

* 12 months contract with the possibility of extension, aiming for internal employment at ING after 18 months.
* A 36 or 40 hour workweek with flexible hours and a hybrid working model (office and home\-based).
* Salary range: €5\.060 \- €7\.685 gross per month (based on 36 hours per week, based on experience).
* Additional benefits: holiday allowance, **13th month** and **pension contributions** .
* **Relocation services** avaialable for international candidates.

Ready to strenghten the ING Bank team? Do you recognize yourself in this profile and are you ready for a new challenge? Send us your resume and motivation and who knows; you might soon be our new colleague!

title: Strategy & Planning Business Analyst – Foods Benelux & Europe
description:
**UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR A STRATEGY \& PLANNING BUSINESS ANALYST – FOODS EU \& BENELUX**


Location: Weena, Rotterdam – the Netherlands


Local conditions apply


Full\-time/Part\-time


For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will first consider candidates based in the Netherlands. If you are based outside of the Netherlands and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but we can only take your application on if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the Netherlands.

**ABOUT UNILEVER**


With 3\.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.


At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.


We want our business to flourish, and we know that our success depends on others flourishing around us. That's why our purpose is to make sustainable living commonplace, and why sustainable, long\-term growth is at the heart of our business model.


Join the Foods European \& Benelux CSP Strategy, Insights \& Digital Commerce team to drive the integration of analytics across both the offline and online retail landscapes.


This pivotal role bridges the gap between digital commerce and traditional retail analytics, empowering Foods Europe \& Benelux with actionable insights to drive growth in key channels and markets.  

  

As part of the CSP Strategy, Insights \& Digital Commerce team, you will focus on omnichannel analytics—bringing clarity to performance across offline retail stores and digital commerce platforms. You will play a vital role in leveraging data to uncover opportunities, optimize the shopper path to purchase, and improve sales performance for both offline and online channels. The role also focuses on capability building, working closely with markets and key teams to embed a robust omnichannel analytics framework.

**WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE?**

* Drive the omnichannel analytics agenda for Foods Europe and Benelux, ensuring seamless and automated integration of insights from offline (brick\-and\-mortar) and online (digital commerce) channels.
* Analyze multi\-source data to deliver a comprehensive view of customer and consumer shopping behavior across channels.
* Lead the design, development, and maintenance of business metrics, reports, and dashboards to track omnichannel performance and inform strategic decisions.
* Translate abstract datasets into real\-world, shopfloor recommendations.
* Provide insights on key performance metrics such as sales velocity, profitability, share of shelf, promotional effectiveness, and omnichannel return on investment (ROI).
* Collaborate with markets to optimize category growth by identifying and reducing friction points in the shopper journey.
* Work closely with the Foods CSP team to embed an omnichannel analytics framework across key European markets.
* Partner with digital commerce specialists, retail media leads, shopper marketing teams, and customer development teams to ensure alignment on omnichannel strategies.
* Facilitate capability building by training teams in omnichannel analytics best practices and fostering a data\-driven decision\-making culture.
* Build simple Proof\-of\-Concept tools (i.e. in Excel) to show value and make the case for scaling and automating
* Collaborate with the top six European markets (Benelux, United Kingdom \& Ireland, France, Italy, Germany, and Poland) to drive consistency in omnichannel analytics approaches.
* Provide tailored support for strategic retail partners, including key players in brick\-and\-mortar retail and digital commerce platforms.

**SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**

* Strong expertise in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting multi\-channel retail data to provide actionable insights.
* Proven ability to deliver end\-to\-end analytics solutions, from data extraction to strategic recommendations.
* Experience in developing and managing dashboards and reporting tools to track business KPIs.
* PowerBI/SQL is a plus
* Knowledge of the omnichannel landscape, including brick\-and\-mortar retail, digital commerce, and rapid delivery platforms.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong ability to present complex data to cross\-functional teams.
* Experience in category management or Data \& Analytics is a plus.
* Ability to work across European markets and adapt global frameworks to local contexts.
* Fluent in English.

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**  

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting \& dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package: excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
* Flexible cross\-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities \& wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company\-paid holidays to further ensure your work\-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40%\-60% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Homework allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy.

**EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!


Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

*Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.*

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*

*Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.*

title: Financial Analyst, Cost Accounting

This position is in the Cost of Sales \& Inventory COE (COSI) organization, which performs end to end Cost and Inventory accounting and provides support to our global manufacturing and distribution network. title: Junior Financial Risk Specialist - Valuation
description:
ING’s purpose is ‘Empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business’. Every ING colleague is given the opportunity to contribute to that vision. We champion self\-reliance and foster a collaborative and innovative culture. The Orange Code is our global manifesto for how we stay true to our purpose and our tradition of reinvention and empowerment. It is made up of ING Values (we are honest; we are prudent; we are responsible) and ING Behaviours: (you take it on and make it happen; you help others to be successful; you are always a step ahead). For us, success will only be achieved if we act with Integrity .
  
  

Some companies see diversity as a box to be ticked. We see it as fundamental to our success and we encourage a proper work/life balance. At ING, you will be judged on your performance in line with the Orange Code. And that’s a promise.
  
The role is part of the Financial Risk/Trading Risk Management (TRM) department. The department comprises a large team of market risk, product control, valuation and counterparty credit risk managers \& analysts, with expertise in the risk management of financial markets.
  
  

Team Overview
  
The vacancy is in the TRM/Centralization, Valuation \& Product Control team which, amongst others, is the centre of expertise for valuation and product control topics within the bank. It is an international team with an informal and open atmosphere, with team members working across Amsterdam and London, all working together with a strong delivery focus. The team is responsible for setting/designing the valuation framework and implementation in terms of fair and prudent valuation. The team is currently being extended with the intention to deliver the ‘Valuation Program’. After (or in parallel to) the delivery of the program, the team will become responsible for the BAU management of the newly designed processes/activities.
  
  

Roles and responsibilities
  
The role is focused on delivering valuation regulatory and accounting requirements across different regional hubs. You will be involved in a variety of topics related to valuation risks (mostly for trading but also for banking books) to deliver the ‘Valuation Program’, which aims to address new regulatory requirements and higher model risk management expectations in this area.
