The key focus over the next few years will be on valuation (re)developments, where you will play a key role in the design, development, implementation, testing and roll out to production of IFRS and Prudent Valuation (AVA) related enhancements across several asset classes.
  
  

As part of the ‘Valuation Program’, you will be critical supporting the team to ensure the successful and timely delivery of one or multiple workstreams in the project , which will be aligned to committed regulatory \& internal deadlines. A high\-level overview of these workstreams is presented below:
  
  

Designing, implementing, and maintaining a compliant fair and prudent valuation framework and governance for all Fair Value books.
  
  

Designing and implementing the framework to assess the observability, accuracy and uncertainty of market data used as input in valuation activities, as well as monitoring and analysing the results from these assessments and propose different market data sources when required.
  
  

Development, implementation and roll\-out of IPV \& Valuation Adjustment models (such as market price uncertainty, close\-out costs, concentrated positions, future administrative costs, etc), as well as ensuring appropriate model risk management for these models, in line with internal and regulatory requirements.
  
  

Development, implementation and roll\-out of other fair valuation related activities, such as Fair Value Hierarchy, Day One P\&L or new product initiatives where valuation modelling requirements/implications should be addressed and followed up.
  
  

How to succeed
  
We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  
To succeed in the delivery of these workstreams, you will need:
  
  

Flexibility in the way and scope of working, as all workstreams in the Valuation Program are strongly interrelated and scope prioritizations might change based on delivery deadlines and other dependencies.
  
  

Build relationships and work together with multiple stakeholders such as Front Office, Finance, Risk, Product Controllers, IT, Development \& Validation Quants and market data providers for successful delivery and implementation of re\-developed processes/models, ensuring that newly designed methodologies and models are appropriate and their impacts are well understood and agreed.
  
  

Engagement/follow up with regulators, auditors and the industry on valuation related items.
  
  

Ability to work with large data sets and systems, in an environment where data \& processes are largely fragmented and manually managed.
  
  

Ensure operational excellence of valuation processes, maximising automation possibilities to provide a robust and compliant operational valuation framework, including delivering IT specifications to implement strategic solutions.
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

A gross salary between € 3\.678,97 and € 7\.088,63
  
  

24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
  
  

Pension scheme
  
  

13th month salary
  
  

8% Holiday payment
  
  

Hybrid working
  
  

Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
  
  

An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
  
  

About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

title: WMS Business Analyst
description:
Job Overview

We are looking for skilled Industrial Engineering (IE) Specialists to support the migration process between Warehouse Management Systems (WMS). The selected professionals will be instrumental in evaluating and enhancing operational efficiencies during the transition, ensuring alignment with business objectives and process standards.

Key Responsibilities

* Understand existing warehouse processes and account operations.
* Differentiate between essential and optional requirements.
* Assist in validating business requirements and align them with system capabilities.
* Translate business needs into system\-level specifications with a focus on process optimization.
* Evaluate the impact of system changes on operational efficiency, ensuring business processes remain within set benchmarks.

Additional Responsibilities

* Collect and analyze data required for developing accurate work measurements.
* Maintain operational planning data to identify improvement opportunities.
* Ensure proper application and accuracy of work measurements through audits.
* Identify and document deviations from established standards and propose corrective actions.
* Assess long\- and short\-term forecasts to adjust operational plans accordingly.
* Create analytical reports and respond to ad hoc data requests.
* Maintain documentation for forecasts, planning spreadsheets, and staffing models.

Qualifications \& Skills

* Bachelor’s degree or international equivalent in Engineering or a related field (preferred).
* Experience in WMS (Warehouse Management System) migration is highly desirable.
* Strong understanding of operational process improvements and barriers.
* Technical aptitude in system reporting, data integration, and database management.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, database maintenance, etc.).
* Industrial Engineering experience preferred.
* Flexibility to work in shifts, including weekends and travel, as needed.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €4\.000,00 \- €4\.500,00 per maand

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Software Engineering
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI\+ Data \+CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.


The Account Receivable (AR) Systems team is part of Finance Revenue Operations and is responsible for the systems and technology utilized by the AR operations teams.


The **business systems analyst** will be responsible for systems support and management of prioritized enhancement initiatives. Core operational responsibilities include end user support, improving our operational infrastructure, and supporting key business initiatives. Other responsibilities will include KPI analysis and operational reporting to leadership.


AR Operations is a customer impacting and complex space, we are looking for someone who demonstrates motivation to learn new skills and technologies with a growth mindset. Having a keen eye for details, good communication skills and efficient time management are key success factors.


**Key Competencies:**

* Problem solving : Proven track record of identifying issues proactively and implementing solutions to mitigate risks.
* Analytical Thinking : Strong ability to break down complex technical problems into actionable solutions.
* Technical Proficiency : Extensive knowledge of data processing, systems analysis, process optimization and cloud infrastructure.
* Communication skills : Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of negotiating and resolving conflicts effectively.
* Cross Collaboration : Experienced in working in cross\-functional teams to deliver project outcomes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Production support : Handle system bug triage and provide business process support, technical advisory, compliance controls, and system configuration for AR and Revenue Operations.
* Requirements gathering : Collaborate with business users and subject matter experts to document business and technical requirements. Review business priorities, and/or analyze solution options \& risks.
* Project management support : Participate on projects and other initiatives from a technology perspective that impact the Finance organization.
* Testing : Develop and execute test plans and test cases to ensure business functionalities and technical solutions are achieved. Coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) with business stakeholders.
* Stakeholder management : Work closely with IT and other business units to execute new technology and functionality implementations. Able to communicate technical concepts to business users and vice\-versa.
* Continuous Improvement : Identify areas of improvement to increase process efficiencies, data integrity and optimization. Stay updated in accordance with industry best practices and company policy.
* Documentation : Create, organize and maintain technical and process documentation

**Required Qualifications:**

* Education : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field or equivalent work experience.
* Experience :



	+ Skilled in System Administration, preferably with Salesforce products
	+ Experience as a Systems Analyst or Product Analyst concentrating on system enhancements, product or technical program management
* Technical Skills :



	+ Functional understanding of SQL or other query languages
	+ Fundamental knowledge of CRM and cloud products, experience with Salesforce products is an advantage
* Familiarity with object oriented programming and cloud infrastructure
* Proven track record in technology implementations and development methodologies
* Soft skills :



	+ Adaptable working in a multicultural environment with flexibility to manage ambiguity, and changing priorities while delivering excellent results.
	+ Operates effectively as a member of a team spanning multiple time zones.

Preferred Skills:


* Understanding of Quote\-to\-Cash operations such as credit, billing, collections, bad debt, accounts receivables (AR), tax as well as revenue accounting
* ERP experience preferred and knowledge on e\-invoicing is a plus
* Functional system knowledge on Mulesoft, Oracle R12 and Marketing Cloud
* Programming language experience; Apex, Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS

Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non\-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Business Analyst Credits
description:
Business Analyst Credits**At a glance**
---------------


Are you ready to be a part of transformative changes in ABN AMRO's Credits Landscape? We're looking for passionate individuals who thrive on innovation and are eager to enhance their skills while revolutionizing end\-to\-end lending processes within Financing Solutions. As a member of our Credits Capability Grid department, you'll play a pivotal role in digitizing customer data and developing a central credit platform. Your mission will be to connect diverse stakeholders, translate business needs, and bridge the gap between end\-users and our IT department.

**Your job**
------------


In this dynamic role, you'll design and continuously improve digital lending processes, making a lasting impact on the future of credit facilities. As part of our Credits Facility Management team, you'll modernize technology to ensure data availability 24/7 and adapt administration to new requirements. Your responsibilities will include gathering requirements from end\-users and aligning with Business and IT stakeholders across Operations, Finance, Contracting, Risk, and Credit\-related teams.

 **Day\-to\-Day Tasks**

* Align with stakeholders on processes and business needs.
* Analyze services, APIs, business processes, information flows, and system requirements to identify opportunities.
* Translate product roadmap features into actionable user stories, prioritizing technical and functional requirements.
* Create visuals and documentation to foster organizational learning.
* Support implementation, collaborate on test design, and facilitate user acceptance tests.
**Working environment**
-----------------------

We invite you to join our DevOps team within the Credit Facility Management team, where collaboration drives success. You'll work closely with colleagues from Origination, Business Implementation, Regulatory, and subject matter experts from Operations, Risk, and Product Management. We're committed to nurturing a supportive and inclusive workplace culture, encouraging continuous learning and growth. If you're a team player with a collaborative spirit, we'd love to hear from you.

**Your profile**
----------------


As a problem\-solver, you excel in tackling complex challenges and structuring solutions. You take ownership, translating requirements into functionalities in partnership with our stakeholders and IT teams. You're a connector who bridges people and technology, and you thrive on creativity, stakeholder management, organization, and empathy towards end\-users. A willingness to learn about our software and processes is key.

 **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in any field.
* Strong analytical skills to identify solutions and present them convincingly.
* Experience in business analysis, coordination, and stakeholder management.
* Affinity for technology, data structures, APIs, and querying.
* Knowledge of Credit Lifecycle processes and Credit Facility Management.
* Excellent communication skills; adept at navigating complex stakeholder environments.
* Self\-starter with a critical eye and positive attitude.
**We are offering**
-------------------

At ABN AMRO, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of lending and empower entrepreneurs to make a societal impact. We value your experiences and personal perspectives, offering a dynamic environment with room for growth based on your ambitions and drive.

  

* Competitive gross monthly salary (up to €7,880 based on experience) on a 36\-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* Benefit Budget of 11% of your salary for additional employment benefits.
* 5 weeks of vacation annually, with the option to purchase up to 4 additional weeks.
* Personal development budget of €1,000 per year, up to €3,000\.
* Flexible work\-from\-home options, depending on your position.
* Annual public transport pass for free travel throughout the Netherlands.
* Excellent pension scheme.

  

Join us in shaping the future of lending with your problem\-solving skills and collaborative spirit. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Interested?**
---------------

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Please apply for this role!

*Note: you are in the possession of a Dutch working permit and living in the Netherlands.*

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
--------------------------------


Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
-----------------------------------------


Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Business Analyst C
description:
**This is what we offer you*** Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,331 and EUR 6,186 (scale 09\) for a 36 hour week
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


View all our benefits.
Becoming the market leader with happy customers doesn’t happen overnight. We need seamless integration and perfect processes in our (Force) Mid Office. As a business analyst within Area Lending services and administration you can really make a difference in defining these processes. You are the linking pin between the business stakeholders, IT, data (external) parties and architecture. By retrieving the question behind the question you are able to translate business requirements into what’s needed from an IT perspective.


As our new colleague, you combine information from our stakeholders, cross\-functional teams, and subject matter experts to analyze business needs. You then integrate this into the technical part of your role: gathering and documenting the requirements needed for the design, development, and testing of the full implementation. As a BA within our squads, you will translate business requirements into clear user stories and convert them into innovative and (re)usable solutions.


You will have a pivotal role between business and IT, you are able to talk just as easy with business representatives as to developers.

* Gathering business and technical requirements by organizing and leading requirement sessions with cross\-functional teams
* Developing user stories, validating them with the team, and ensuring that the user stories can be picked up in our backlog system (Azure DevOps)
* Contributing to the creation of the implementation plans, impact analyses, functional designs, and documentation of business requirements

**Practical Examples**

* Implementing the Force Mid Office as a package
* Help connect source data, like Ockto, to help our customers
* Fix Forward \& Fail Fast, Learn Fast

**Facts \& Figures**

* 32\-40 hours per week
* 1 million customers for mortgages
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world

 **Top 3 responsibilities**

* Define requirements to optimize the clients journey during the mortgage cycle.
* Describe the system requirements in the clearest way possible.
* Challenge the business to fully understand the business value for our customer.


As Mid Office teams we’re in the midst of a big transition to become the market leader. The Force application is pivotal for the success of this journey. And as a business analyst you’ll have direct impact on achieving our goals together.  



**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at team Aladdin in the acceptance and fulfillment cluster.

*‘Working in the Force teams learnt me how to balance optimally between business and IT. Our BusDevOps team helps me to take in all perspectives and perform optimally.’*


Paul Reith, Sr Business Analyst.


The 30 people in the Force squads go the extra mile to deliver business value for our Acceptance and Fulfillment journeys. . Working together is the way we work; as 1 passionate team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers.


Together with our customers, our members and our partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

**You and your talent**

* Domain knowledge of Dutch mortgages.
* Detailed description of requirements, use cases, user stories, business rules.
* Broad understanding of IT System development and architecture
* Stakeholder management
* Being able to understand Dutch.
* Sparrings partner for product owner and business

 **You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Business Analyst Mortgages at Rabobank.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Wabe Bakker, Tech Lead Housing via wabe.bakker@rabobank.nl.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.


\#LI\-AS3

title: Data Analyst
description:
**This is what we offer you*** Gross monthly salary between EUR 3,712 and EUR 5,300 (scale 08\) for a 36 hour week
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


View all our benefits.
As a team we deliver data\-driven insights to support the business decision making and optimizing their processes, enhance efficiency, and drive continuous improvement across the global FEC organization.


**You and your job**


As a Data Analyst you work in a team that is situated in a rapidly changing and challenging environment (i.e. external regulatory demands, new innovations, compliance requirements). In this role, you will be at the forefront of this emerging field, exploring uncharted territories and developing innovative solutions. Your ability to think creatively and take initiative will be crucial in being part of Business Insights.


You will collaborate closely with the business to understand their business needs. From there you will analyze FEC and customer data to generate actionable insights to help business stakeholders understand their business, risks and processes. Based on your analysis and findings you will collaborate with them to implement improvements.


Additionally, you are able to communicate complex data in a clear and understandable manner. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, a passion for process improvement, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross\-functional teams.


**Practical** **Examples**


* A new system is implemented to automate a number of customer outreach processes. You determine what new logging data has been made available and how these can be incorporated into our data models for analysis.
* The Chief FEC Officer wants to understand if we spend time reviewing clients that do not represent significant risks to the bank. You devise methodology to evaluate if this is thecase and prepare a presentation sharing your conclusions.
* A department head would like to have a better understanding of how future regulation would impact their portfolio. You formulate a plan of approach on how to bridge the gap between the functional requirements and the available data and tooling.

**Top responsibilities**


* **Data Exploration and Analysis**: Conduct thorough data exploration and analyze data to extract meaningful insights and support decision\-making.
* **Business Process Understanding:** Gain a deep understanding of business processes to contextualize data analysis.
* **Proactive advisory**: Identify the business needs and provide actionable recommendations to the business based on data analysis.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with cross\-functional teams to ensure data\-driven strategies align with business goals.

**Together we achieve more than alone**
  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our Data \& Insights team


The \~150 people in Area Data and Insights are positioned to make the bank increasingly data\-driven through the delivering of solid insights as well as implementing future proof data solutions for FEC. Working together is the way we work; as 1 results\-driven, data\-minded and analytical team at Rabobank.


Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.


**You and your talent**


* Bachelor or Master Degree
* Proven experience in using data analytics tooling (e.g. SQL, Python or Power BI)
* Experience with working Agile/Scrum
* You can understand functional requirements and translate them to technical designs
* You have a critical mindset with the ability to support stakeholders in their ambition to become more data\-driven in their decision making
* You feel confident in working in and with a diverse and complex stakeholder field
* You can cope with uncertainties and have a can\-do mentality
* Strong analytical skills, ability to learn quickly to understand complex topics
* Team player: you can work well with others, and you bring a positive energy to the team
* You are able to think ahead and to take initiative to improve and optimize
* You possess excellent communication skills in both Dutch and English

**You and the job application process**


* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Lex Verwayen, Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Junior Transaction Monitoring Analyst
Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**What we expect from this role**



As our Business Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to derive actionable insights and opportunities from our internal data. There is an emphasis on product and usage behavior, but also financial and commercial data play an important role. You will help us build a smarter, faster business by providing data\-informed answers to key questions like *"How can we improve our retention?"* or *"What is our churn risk from certain customer segments?"*.



You will partner closely with other teams and play an important role by building automated data pipelines, creating actionable insights while also enabling self\-serve analytics to support our strategic and business decision\-making.



We are looking for somebody who loves getting "into the data", improving data\-driven decision\-making processes, translating business questions into BI solutions, applying analytics rigour to strategic questions and collaborating effectively with others.



If you like to jump on a high\-speed train, enjoy all the learnings that come from a rapidly changing environment, get energy from having autonomy and enjoy an environment where decisions are made in a minute, this role might be for you!


**What you will be doing**


* **Generate accurate and reliable data insights**: break down business problems and turn raw data into actionable insights around user behavior (e.g. customer retention, cost\-usage analysis)
* **Enable data\-informed decision making:** empower all departments and management to make data\-driven decisions by providing relevant automated dashboards, tailor\-made insights or self\-serve analytics where needed
* **Build and maintain data infrastructure**: develop and optimize ETL pipelines to consolidate data from various raw data sources and integrate them into a unified database
* **Secure data reliability**: ensure data is consistent, accurate and trustworthy \- from collection to reporting

  


**What you will bring**


* 2\-4 years experience in a role in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or a related field \- ideally with previous experience in a fast\-paced environment (scale\-up, tech or product\-driven organisation)
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills – you break down complex problems using data and can translate ambiguous business questions into measurable insights
* Solid technical foundation — you have proven skills in SQL and Python and are comfortable with data modeling, setting up and managing ETL processes, and database design (ideally with previous experience with Airflow)
* Solid stakeholder management skills – you love to say "yes", but definitely know when to say "no". You keep everyone in the loop and can create a shared understanding across the team
* Excellent communication skills — you speak both "data" and "human" and can work with technical peers and non\-technical stakeholders
* Business intuition — you understand how different parts of the business connect and how to prioritize what matters most
* Autonomy \& initiative – you don't wait to be told what to do. You seek out problems, validate assumptions and propose solutions
* An eye for detail — you take pride in clean, accurate data and high\-quality wor
* Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics)


**What you get**


* A fast\-moving, high\-growth environment with plenty of opportunity to learn
* Full ownership of your domain, and the trust to shape your role
* A collaborative culture that values speed, clarity, and impact
* A chance to transform a traditional business impacting every day of our lives
* A fantastic location in the city centre of Amsterdam
* Great hangouts with brilliant people

title: Lead Business Analyst
description:
Country/Region: NL
Requisition ID: 22763
Work Model: Hybrid
Position Type: Permanent
Salary Range:
Location: NETHERLANDS \- EINDHOVEN \- DAF
**Title:** **Lead Business Analyst**
====================================

Description:
**Area(s) of responsibility**
-----------------------------


**Business Analyst \- Connected Vehicle Platform (CVP)**

**6 months contract to begin**


**Eindhoven, Netherlands, mostly onsite**


**max rate: 50 EUR per hour**


The will be part of the development team working on the initiative Phase 2 under the Global Connected Services (GCS) department. A project that will start in 2025 is targeted to develop a new global solution for collecting vehicle data from multiple data collection solutions, governance and distribution through common data services in conformity with privacy and cybersecurity legislation. Existing local solutions implemented in Phase 1 will be maintained during the project while existing data services will gradually be migrated to the new global solution. The business migration strategy and impacted business services need to be defined


OBJECTIVES  

* Build a good professional relationship with existing Product Owner(s), Information Analyst(s) and Architect(s)
* Obtain a complete overview for all business services in the scope of the project.
* Support and guide internal and external test teams during planning and execution of functional and user acceptance testing.
* Work in close cooperation with the Development Team and with the Subject Matter Experts as changes will take place based on both business and technical project activities.
* Cooperate in and live up to an Agile way of working. The development team will be working in sprints based on SAFe principles.

RESPONSIBILITIES \& OUTPUT  

* Engineer business processes, workflows and requirements, either by:


o supporting the responsible operational service delivery teams;  

o representing GCS when participating in work groups designing new business applications;  

o designing new internal processes in alignment with GCS internal stakeholders.  

* Engineer (non\-)functional requirements for business services.
* In close collaboration with Information Analyst(s):


o specify detailed Functional Designs for use cases and system interfaces, in close collaboration with the Solution Architect and in accordance with Solution Architecture Design.  

o Define and refine user stories on the backlog of the development team  

* Collect and document relevant information according to project scope and DAF standards.
* Design for privacy, in accordance with GDPR legislation.
* Design for cybersecurity, in accordance with UN\-ECE R155 legislation.
* Support the Data Architect with data governance definitions, data taxonomy and logical data modelling.
* Be in front and ahead of the development team, strongly supporting the Product Owner to manage DoR and DoD

**Essential job tasks**
-----------------------



PROFILE  

* A business analyst through and through, enjoying analyzing business cases, strategy, processes, roadmaps and requirements over IT solutions and architecture.
* Can be assertive, daring to take the initiative.
* Proactive attitude, self\-motivated, self\-disciplined.
* Accessible and good communication skills. Professional in the English Language.
* Able and willing to work in Eindhoven office 3\-5 days per week.
* Able and willing to work in a dynamic and innovative environment, stress\-resilient.
* Able and willing to backwards define requirements when not formally received/documented.
* Able and willing to communicate with multiple nationalities over different time zones.

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE  

* Master or Bachelor or related. 5\-10 years of relevant experience.
* Experience with the business domain and marketing and sales of digital services using connectivity solutions.
* Vast knowledge of automotive and connectivity.
* Knowledge of IT development lifecycle processes. (Pre)
* Knowledge of digital cloud solutions and data analytics. (Pre)
* Experienced working according to the Agile/SAFe framework. (Pre)

SKILLS  

* BPMN 2\.0 / UML / ArchiMate
* Stakeholder relationship management
* Strong management\-level presentation
* Agile principles
* Azure DevOps (Pre)
* Agile Scrum / SAFe (Pre)

title: Junior Transaction Monitoring Analyst
Quality Data Analyst
description:
**Requistion ID**: 80133

  

Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130\-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high\-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.

 **Bringing out the best in people**

  



As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.

  



Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:

  



**Develop faster** \- with our commitment to the best professional development.

  



**Perform better** \- as part of a high\-performance, empowering culture.

  



**Shape an industry** \- with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.

  



**Make a difference** \-by helping improve oral health worldwide.

 **Quality Data Analyst**

  

The Quality Data Analyst plays an important role in ensuring the accuracy, integrity and compliance of data within the ERP and related platforms. This position combines data analysis with operational coordinating, supporting Quality Assurance (QA) and Regulatory Affairs (RA) teams by managing, analyzing and optimizing data workflows to ensure compliance with industry regulations (e.g. EU MDR, FDA 21 CFR Part 820\).

 **Key Responsibilities :**

* Ensure compliance with the ISO13485 based Quality Management System, in accordance with Dentsply Sirona Policy, applicable worldwide regulations and standards (e.g. EU MDR, FDA and ISO)
* Coordinate data entry change management related to global and local ERP release processes and changes to products, ensuring proper documentation and validation.
* Support system improvements and QARA related data migration projects related to ERP processes.
* Analyze quality and regulatory product release status data to identify risks and improvement opportunities
* Generate and maintain reports, dashboards and KPIs for QA/RA teams, supporting process monitoring and audits.
* Act as the liaison between QA/RA and Supply Chain data management teams to ensure data accuracy and regulatory compliance.
* Work with cross\-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of QARA data in the ERP system.
* Train and support ERP users on best practices for managing QARA\-related data.
* Identify and implement process improvements for better data management and workflow efficiency.
* Work with IT teams to troubleshoot data integrity issues and system inconsistencies.
* Support data collection and coordination of QA/RA data related to support commercial \& supply chain improvement projects
* Support internal and external audits

 **Requirements and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s level education and/or work experience in data management, Life sciences, QA, Business administration or equivalent
* 3\+ years’ experience in establishing and maintaining regulated Quality Management Systems
* Excellent communication skills in English, as well as interpersonal relationship
* Experience in project management and leading process improvement methodologies
* Expertise in ERP Data management (e.g. SAP S/4\)
* Demonstrated experience in driving progress, taking initiative to achieve results.
* Have sound knowledge of data management principles, problem\-solving techniques and operational excellence

  

Dentsply Sirona is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. We appreciate your interest in Dentsply Sirona.


If you need assistance with completing the online application due to a disability, please send an accommodation request to careers@dentsplysirona.com. Please be sure to include “Accommodation Request” in the subject.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Are you passionate about bridging the gap between business needs and IT data solutions? Do you enjoy translating business needs into actionable insights through tools in BI and reporting? Are you excited about joining a new, innovative role in an international environment where your advice will drive impactful change?**

  

We are expanding our Data team! In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

  

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.


We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

**Data Analyst**
================

  



In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

 **The tasks and responsibilities are:**

* Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
* Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
* Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
* Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
* Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision\-making.
* Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
* Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
* Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
* Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.

 **About you**


We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:

* You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
* At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
* Strong proficiency and interest in SQL \& Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
* Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
* Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
* Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
* You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non\-technical teams and the other way around.
* Strong problem\-solving skills and attention to detail.
* You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.

 **What we offer**

* A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
* A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
* Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
* A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.

 **We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world\-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.**

 **Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?**

  

\#LI\-YH1

 **Recruitment process**


Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!


In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)


Phone: 010 440 5100  

E\-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

*Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in\-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).*


\#LI\-YH1

**The recruitment process**
---------------------------

**1**
Do you think you have what it takes? Apply for this vacancy via our website. Please include your resumé in your application.

**2**
We'll review your application and when we think we could be a match we will invite you for an interview to get to know you better. Sometimes the interviews will take place over multiple rounds.

**3**
If you are the preferred candidate for the role, we'll offer you a contract and welcome you to the Refresco team!


*Refresco believes that the principle of equal opportunities is fundamental to our company's values. Our long\-held aim is to provide just and fair treatment for all employees. We will not discriminate on the grounds of sex, age, disability, marital status, colour, race, religion, ethnic origin, sexual orientation or gender reassignment.*

title: Forecast Analyst
description:
+ \> 5 years, 3\-5 years

+ 36 \- 40 uur
+ Energy Trading

+ €85\.000 \- €120\.000


* You are situated at the heart of Eneco, right between production, sales, and trading
* You work on complex and analytical challenges in the dynamic energy market
* Our company values diversity and inclusion and strives to create a vibrant workplace in which everyone can grow and thrive personally and professionally

Why choose Eneco?
The energy transition is in full swing and Eneco is leading the way. Our goal? To be fully climate\-neutral by 2035\. This applies to our own business activities, but also to the energy we supply to our customers. For example, we develop wind and solar farms ourselves, and we help customers take sustainable steps every day with smart products and good advice. Now that we are part of Mitsubishi Corporation, our impact has increased, and we are accelerating the transition. We need your expertise to drive this change. As a **Forecast** **Analyst**, you’ll play a key role in supporting Eneco's trading activities through cutting\-edge analysis and modelling


What you’ll do
The Forecasting Team within the Short\-Term Desk at Eneco Energy Trade is responsible for delivering continoulsy updating forecasts of energy demand and renewable energy generation to support short\-term energy trading. As a Forecast Analyst in this team, you will be responsible for maximizing Eneco’s financial trading results in short\-term markets. This indirectly helps to make our 2035 climate ambition economically appealing. You will contribute by minimizing the (imbalance) costs of wind and solar production, as well as customer demand. With a fast feedback cycle, you will continuously seek ways to improve team performance.

  

We work closely with our Forecast Product Development team to develop, enhance and operationalize forecast products (e.g. in house wind and solar power forecast models). You will collaborate with traders by providing insights and decision support. Additionally, you will deploy products that monitor and report on our trade portfolio.

  

Our team is young and diverse, with a good balance of men and women from various international backgrounds. As a result, our working language is English. Within our team, we have two roles: Daily Business Analysts and Forecast Analysts. The Daily Business Analysts are more involved in daily operations. However, operational work is key to understanding where we need to further develop our software products. Therefore, you will start this position alongside our Daily Business Analysts to build your knowledge of the energy market, our role in it and our IT landscape. Later, if you are not part of the operations anymore, you will be on standby (during working hours) for issues that our operations team is unable to resolve independently. As a result, this role offers a well\-balanced mix of hands\-on work and coding. This empowers you to be creative, come up with improvements, and use your development skills for quick and tangible improvements, visible in a quick feedback loop.


Is this about you?
You bring:

* A quantitative MSc
* 4\+ years of data science working experience
* Proficiency in Python
* Pro\-actively initiating improvements and gathering feedback from traders
* Your drive is to get things done is key
* Your approach is analytical but also hands\-on and pragmatic
* Eneco Energy Trade is a very dynamic environment. Targets change frequently based on market circumstances or business opportunities. We need you to be flexible and focused at the same time.
* Knowledge and experience related (or similar) to software engineering or ML engineering is a plus.
* Relevant concepts include: DevOps, CI/CD, \`software\` testing, MLOps
* Relevant technologies include: Git, Databricks, Airflow, Snowflake, Docker, Azure Cloud
* You’ll work in a team with 10 colleagues and cooperate intensively with traders and IT. Good communication is crucial.
* Knowledge and experience of energy markets is a plus

You’ll be responsible for
Tasks:

* Collaborate with our Forecast Product Development team to develop, improve and validate forecasting models for wind/solar production and power/gas/heat consumption
* Develop monitoring and reporting software\-products to support the trade departments
* Work within a DevOps framework and promote this methodology, including Azure DevOps (CI/CD), Databricks, Docker, and Airflow, to the team.
* Validating and analyzing data (e.g., identifying irregularities and outliers in forecasting model outputs)
* Support Daily Business Analysts colleagues in operations

This is where you’ll work
At Eneco Energy Trade, some 150 colleagues work at the heart of the organization. This is where the supply and demand of energy converge. Where we bundle our own and external energy flows and ensure that there is enough energy to meet demand. The international team consists of several divisions: Sourcing \& Pricing, Trading, Portfolio Optimization, Structuring \& Organization, Business Development, Energy Operations \& IT Management.


What we have to offer


Gross annual salary between €85\.000 and €120\.000


FlexBudget


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice, it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
Want more information about our terms of employment?**Here's what you get from us**
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work\-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035\. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
For more information about the application procedure please email our Recruiter Sandy van Kits Sandy.vanKints@eneco.com


Applying straight away? That is also possible! You can also apply via our recruitment system. Click on the 'apply' button and send us your CV with a motivation letter. You will receive a response as soon as possible.

  

An online assessment and a (pre\-) employment screening are part of the selection procedure.

 *Acquisition in response to this advertisement is not appreciated.*

title: Digitally Enabled Sales Analyst
description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a dynamic professional for a pivotal role that will be essential to driving growth for the Tork brand on Amazon as well as with Tork’s Internet of Things (IoT) solution \- Vision Cleaning (TVC).


**What You Will Do**

* Manage the Amazon product listings across multiple European markets, ensuring accurate data (content \& pricing) and secured stock allocation to ensure products are live and available to buy.
* Collaborate with demand planners to forecast stock demand accurately, maintaining optimal inventory levels at Amazon.
* Continuously analyse sales and inventory trends, to drive insights for improvement of Amazon inventory or product portfolio into action.
* Develop best practices between Essity supply chain cross\-functional teams and Amazon.
* Collaborate with marketing function to enable local marketing and commercial support
* Provide dashboards, insights, sales material, tools, and local adaptations to ensure TVC commercial operations are working efficiently.
* Partner internally with relevant matrix functions such as Service Management, Product Marketing, Marketing Services, Pricing \& Commercial Analytics, GBIS, and IT. Partners externally with Amazon and supporting agencies.
* Manage and follow up regularly on critical success KPIs.
* Manage projects for activities that require a structured approach.
* Prepare and follow up for business reviews.

**Who you are**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or a related field.
* Proven experience in marketing, sales, or business intelligence.
* Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to adapt quickly in a fast\-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong skills in Microsoft Excel for data analysis and reporting. Skills in business intelligence software are a plus.
* Amazon experience is an advantage.
* Experience working with ship\-to\-consumption analyses is a plus.

**What We Can Offer You**

At Essity, our purpose is Breaking Barriers to Well\-being. We strive to make a positive impact on people, society, and the environment. As part of our team, you will be valued, supported, and encouraged to grow in an open and collaborative workplace.


Ready to take the next step in your career? Join us and help shape the future of customer service and order management!


Apply now and become part of a team that’s committed to innovation, collaboration, and excellence.


\#LI\-IB2


**Application End Date:**
-------------------------

29 apr. 2025
**Job Requisition ID:**
-----------------------

Essity251629

title: Data Analyst (Marketing)
description:
TicketSwap is on a mission to become the world’s favorite marketplace to safely buy and sell tickets. With over 15 million fans across 36 countries, we’re building a platform that fans love and trust. As we expand and innovate, we’re tackling exciting challenges – from enhancing our fan experience to scaling our platform globally.
   

  

 Driven by our passion for technology and live events, we are always looking for talented, data\-driven individuals to help us shape the future of fan experiences. At TicketSwap, our fans are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re on the hunt for a data\-savvy, organized, and proactive
 **Data Analyst** 
 to support mainly our
 **Performance Marketing** 
 and
 **CRM** 
 efforts.
   

  

 Are you ready to help elevate TicketSwap as the go\-to destination for fans worldwide? Read on to find out more! 👇
   

  

 Full\-time
   

  

* Amsterdam


**What You Can Expect From The Work**
**Based in Amsterdam working from our HQ, you will:**
* Analyze the performance of paid campaigns across channels like Google Ads, Meta, Tiktok, Snapchat and more.
* Measure and optimize the ROI of online and offline advertising initiatives.
* Monitor and report on budget allocation, campaign performance, and ad effectiveness.


**CRM And Retention Insights**
* Collaborate with the CRM team to analyze customer segmentation, retention strategies, and engagement patterns.
* Identify data\-driven opportunities to improve customer activation and retention across all stages of the lifecycle.


**Cross\-Team Collaboration**
* Work closely with marketing, analytics, and product teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable insights.
* Help prioritize and execute growth initiatives using data\-backed recommendations.


**KPI Reporting \& Dashboards**
* Develop and maintain dashboards to track critical metrics, including conversion rates, customer acquisition costs, and website/app traffic.
* Regularly report on marketing and CRM KPIs to guide strategy and execution.


**About You**
* You are based in The Netherlands, are an EU resident, or have an existing visa to work here. A relocation package is not provided.


**Educational Background**
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


**Professional Experience**
* 2/3 years of experience in marketing, business, or product analytics, ideally in a fast\-paced environment, marketplace experience is a huge plus.
* Hands\-on experience with analytics tools, including SQL and large datasets.
* Hands\-on experience with DBT or equivalent tool for data transformation


**Technical Skills**
* Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Power BI, Tableau, or Data Studio.
* Knowledge of statistical and data modeling tools (Python is a strong plus).
* Hands on experience with multi touch attribution models (Nice to have).


**Marketing Knowledge**
* Familiarity with CRM data analysis and customer journey optimization.
* Experience with ad platforms like Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, or DV360\.
* Knowledge of CDPs or DMPs (e.g., Segment, Rudderstack) is an advantage.


**Soft Skills**
* Exceptional attention to detail and problem\-solving abilities.
* Proven ability to work independently and proactively engage stakeholders.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


**Excited and ready to join our team?**
 TicketSwap is looking for the best and motivated talent out there no matter your nationality, gender, sexual preference or religious beliefs. 🚀
   

  

 Research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups tend to apply only if they check all the boxes. That’s a shame, as we want to build a diverse and inclusive team. If you know you’ve got what it takes but don’t quite meet every requirement for the role, we still encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Apply now – we'll take a look and get back to you as soon as possible! 💥
   

  

 Proactive acquisition from 3rd parties is not appreciated.

title: Data Analyst, European Derivatives
description:
**Job Description**
**Company Overview**
 At Cboe Europe, we inspire our people to solve complex challenges together because what we do matters. We provide the financial infrastructure that powers the global economy. As a leading provider of market infrastructure and tradable products, Cboe delivers cutting\-edge trading, clearing and investment solutions to market participants around the world.
   

  

 We’re building inclusive ways to support professional and personal development while strengthening the trust we’ve earned as a global market leader. Our teams are empowered to share ideas, actively pursue them and bring on a challenge. As champions of internal mobility and access to opportunity, we encourage our people to “go for it” and equip our managers with the training to coach their teams to the next level. Our Associate Resource Groups champion diversity, equity and inclusion, giving associates a safe space to network, share ideas and create opportunities.
   

  

 Sound like the place for you? Join us!
   

  

 Please note: The internal job title will be Business Analyst, European Derivatives.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 This role is integral to the business and responsible for supporting the Cboe Europe Derivatives Exchange (CEDX) in its ambitious growth plans to enhance market structure, improve market depth and pricing quality across the European landscape.
   

  

 CEDX is a small, hardworking and dedicated team, under the much broader and esteemed umbrella of Cboe Global derivatives, where no task is too big or too small.
   

  

 The individual will provide critical thinking based upon a thorough analysis of exchange traded derivative products including, but not limited to market structure and optimal pricing and incentive programme design. The individual will be proficient in data research and analytics and will be tasked with executing the long\-term strategic objectives of Cboe Europe’s Derivatives business.
   

  

 In this role, some of the core responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Establish and enhance key client metrics for use by Cboe Sales \& Coverage teams.
* Assist with monitoring of customer trends, the competitive landscape and regulatory developments to ensure ongoing competitiveness and effectiveness of Cboe’s pricing and offerings. Identify opportunities and develop adaptive responses proactively.
* Support Sales, Account Coverage, and Business Leaders within the Derivatives team with internal and external, regular and ad\-hoc analysis.
* Obtain a thorough understanding of the Product lifecycle and assist with the management of CEDX Product initiatives working closely with Technology, Product Management, Market Structure, Risk, Compliance, Legal, Market Data, Cboe Labs and Operations.
* Work with senior members of the Derivatives team in creating analysis that helps establish client and option business line metrics to drive strategic product development of CEDX.
* Assist the Sales team in preparing for client meetings and follow\-ups.
* Develop knowledge of Cboe technology, including but not limited to connectivity, order types, routing strategies in an effort to support and identify needs of member firms and prospective members.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**The ideal candidate has:**
* Bachelor degree or equivalent with a combination of education and experience in Finance, Economics, Business, Engineering or a related discipline; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* 2\+ years experience in Derivatives preferably with a solid understanding of the European Listed Derivatives landscape.
* Ability to create insightful analysis and strength of character to present it to a senior audience to drive decision making.
* Must possess strong analytical, quantitative and research skills
* Outstanding interpersonal skills and communication skills both written and verbal.
* Self\-starter with the ability to multi\-task effectively and independently within a fast\-paced environment.
* Excellent written and presentation skills.
* Highly proficient in MS 365 suite, SQL and programming (e.g. Python).


**Location Overview**
 The Cboe office in London is situated in The Monument Building, a modern space that spans two floors and features a spacious outdoor balcony. From the balcony, employees can enjoy stunning views of some of London's most iconic architectural landmarks, adding a unique touch to the work environment. The building is equipped with convenient amenities for office commuters, including bike storage and showers, making it easy for staff to freshen up after their commute. Its prime location in the heart of London's financial district ensures that employees have easy access to a variety of cafes, restaurants, and shops, creating an ideal balance of work and leisure.
   

  

 The office is located directly adjacent to the historic Monument to the Great Fire of London and is just across the street from the Monument Underground Station. This provides convenient transport links, with access to the West End in less than 15 minutes. The location blends the vibrancy of central London with the business\-centric atmosphere of the City, making it an attractive hub for professionals.
   

  

**Benefits And Perks Of Working For Cboe**
 We value the total wellbeing of our people – including health, financial, personal and social wellness. We believe standard benefits like health insurance and fair pay are a given at any organization. Still, you should know we offer:
   

  

* Flexible, Hybrid Work Environment
* Private Medical Insurance
* Life Insurance
* GP Service
* Fitness Corporate Membership
* Employee assistance Program (EAP)
* Eye Care
* Short Term Incentive (STI)
* Pension
* Income Protection
* Accident Insurance
* Business Travel Insurance
* Associate Referral Program
* Perks at Work
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Commuting Allowance
* LinkedIn Learning courses
* Service Awards
* Subsided Lunch
* Corporate Events
* Education Assistance
* Holiday (Annual Leave)
* Other Forms Enhanced Leave (Maternity, Paternity, Adoption, Compassionate Leave, Community Service / Volunteering Day \& School Visit)
* Working Abroad Days Allowance


**More About Cboe Europe**
 We’re reimagining the future of the workplace by focusing on what matters most, our people. Our journey is an inclusive one. We’re investing deeply in leadership programs and career development initiatives that ensure everyone has an equal chance to succeed. We celebrate the diversity in our communities, inside and out, and welcome new perspectives with equity, inclusion and belonging.
   

  

 We work with purpose, solving problems with ingenuity, collaboration, and a lot of passion. We’re an engaged and excited team connecting markets across borders and embracing growth in all its forms to achieve incredible outcomes.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Cboe on
 **our website** 
 and
 **LinkedIn** 
 .
   

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity**
 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer \- and celebrate our associates' differences, including race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age and disability.
   

  

*Any communication from Cboe regarding this position will only come from a Cboe recruiter who has a @cboe.com email or via LinkedIn Recruiter. Cboe does not use any other third party communication tools for recruiting purposes.*

title: Products Analyst
description:
**Job Title: Product Analyst** 




**Location: Utrecht (Hybrid)** 




**Start Date: April 2025** 




**Language: English Only** 




  





  





  





**About the Role:** 




  





 We are seeking two skilled Product Analysts to establish a single source of truth and integrate it into DBT (Data Build Tool). These roles require a strong mix of data, business, and technical expertise to support data modeling, transformation, governance, and collaboration across teams.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement data models using DBT (models, tests, seeds, snapshots, macros).
* Ensure data normalization and denormalization processes align with business needs.
* Define and manage KPIs and product analytics metrics.
* Align data models with business use cases and design a measurement plan.
* Work with product analytics tools and cloud platforms (Google Cloud preferred).
* Validate and test data in DBT (dbt test) to ensure accuracy and reliability.
* Define data contracts, SLAs, and implement version control (Git) and documentation (Colibra).
* Collaborate with engineering teams to align data sources and improve data pipeline efficiency.
* Engage with business stakeholders to ensure data models serve strategic objectives.
* Provide clear documentation and definitions for KPIs and data models.



  





**Required Skills \& Experience:** 



* Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
* Hands\-on experience with DBT and its core components.
* Understanding of product analytics and relevant KPIs.
* Experience with cloud platforms, ideally Google Cloud.
* Data governance knowledge, including validation, testing, and documentation best practices.
* Familiarity with Git for version control and Colibra for documentation.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work in a hybrid environment and engage with multiple stakeholders.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Opportunity to shape the data landscape within a dynamic environment.
* Work on impactful projects that drive business decision\-making.
* Collaborative and innovative team culture.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.



  





 If you are passionate about data, analytics, and business impact, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Data Analyst SIRA/RAS
description:
**This Is What We Offer You**
* Gross monthly salary between EUR 3,712 and EUR 5,300 (scale 08\) for a 36 hour week
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


 View all our benefits.
   

  

 We are looking for a data analyst who can join our SIRA/RAS squad and can deliver data\-driven insights to support the business decision making and optimizing their processes, enhance efficiency, and drive continuous improvement across the global FEC organization.
   

  

 The FEC SIRA (Systematic Integrity Risk Analysis )/RAS (Risk Appetite Statements) department is engaged in exploring, monitoring, and managing risks in the field of Financial Economic Crime. In a constantly changing world with uncertainty as a constant companion, the SIRA and RAS team need to keep an eye on new and emerging risks with the support of data. The FEC SIRA and RAS data squads explore and analyze data and build ad hoc insights as well as structural dashboards which supports the FEC SIRA and RAS team in their risk analysis and reporting internally as well as towards the De Nederlandse Bank. The ambition is to contribute to a resilient bank through effective risk management. The SIRA and RAS serve as powerful steering tools to make strategic decisions and effectively manage risks.
   

  

**You and your job**
 You will collaborate closely with the business to understand their business needs. From there you will analyze SIRA/RAS data to generate actionable insights to help business stakeholders understand their business, risks and processes.  Based on your analysis and findings you will collaborate with them to implement improvements based on your findings.
   

  

 Additionally, you are able to communicate complex data in a clear and understandable manner. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, a passion for process improvement, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross\-functional teams.
   

  

**Practical** 
**Examples**
* The risk managers in the SIRA team are preparing the SIRA 2025 report. With their requirements as basis, you develop dashboarding, visuals or ad hoc analysis on topics like sector risk, crypto transactions or transactions to high\-risk money laundering countries.
* As part of a Risk Assessment on Environmental Crime you work together with risk managers and data analysts to set possible red flags for this topic. Based on these red flags you advise the risk managers on available data points and next steps to deepen the analysis.
* The RAS team is working on new risk indicators for sanctions circumvention. To set their early warning limits they need historical data on transactions to and from possible risk countries. Together with the risk managers of the RAS team you set the requirements for the analysis. Based on these requirements you collect, clean and analyse data in our Databricks environment.


**Top 3 Responsibilities**
* You drive the analyses at hand, create the appropriate documentation, and present the conclusions to our stakeholders.
* You collaborate closely with stakeholders and translate complex data to clear insights to help them understand and improve their processes.
* Based on stakeholder discussions in the sprint reviews, you come up with ideas to improve our analyses. You experiment and discuss these potential improvements with the team the analysis.


**Together we achieve more than alone**
 We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our Data \& Insights team
   

  

 Approximately 160 people in Area Data and Insights are positioned to make the bank increasingly data\-driven through the delivering of solid insights as well as implementing future proof data solutions for FEC. Working together is the way we work; as result\-driven, data\-minded and analytical teams at Rabobank.
   

  

 Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 37 countries for over 9,000,000\+ customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
   

  

**You and your talent**
* Bachelor or Master Degree
* Proven experience in using data analytics tooling (e.g. SQL, Python or Power BI)
* Experience with working Agile/Scrum
* You have a critical mindset with the ability to support stakeholders in their ambition to become more data\-driven in their decision making
* You feel confident in working in and with a diverse and complex stakeholder field
* You can cope with uncertainties and have a can\-do mentality
* Strong analytical skills, ability to learn quickly to understand complex topics
* Team player: you can work well with others, and you bring a positive energy to the team
* You can think ahead and to take initiative to improve and optimize
* You possess excellent communication skills in both Dutch and English


**You and the job application process**
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Lex Verwayen, Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Finance & Risk Data Analyst
description:
****This Is What We Offer You****
* Gross monthly salary between EUR 3,179 and EUR 4,540 (scale 07\) for a 36 hour week
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


 View all our benefits.
   

  

****Job Description****
 We are looking for a finance professional who would like to work in a challenging and international environment to enable the bank in providing relevant financial insights and services to our (internal) clients. Do you have a strong affinity with these processes? Then please apply to this job if you are eager, willing to learn and have a can\-do mentality.
   

  

**You and your job**
 Imagine working in a context in which taking on challenges, participating in both operational tasks as well as projects and where innovation is key. As Finance \& Risk Data Analyst we’ve got you covered! In this role, you are at the heart of Rabobank Group.
   

  

 You will be a part of Tribe External Reporting. The Area Finance Reporting contributes to Statistical \& Financial information (reports and datasets) for the Wholesale \& Rural business of the Rabobank globally. You will collaborate closely with the other reporting analysts in the Area. You are surrounded by energized and inspired colleagues and together you will tackle various regulatory reporting and other data related challenges. This role offers you the opportunity to partner and liaise with several departments, such as local finance, product control and business control and our (international) regulators. We strongly believe that working in multidisciplinary teams will lead to the best results. You will be challenged and encouraged to show initiative when working on innovative projects and improving processes and systems.
   

  

**Facts \& Figures**
* 36 hours per week;
* An Area consisting of 12 squads and appr. 100 employees (Finance, IT and Data specialists);
* Almost 44,000 Rabobank colleagues around the world.
* Onsite: 1/2 days in the office. The rest is work from home.


****Top 3 Responsibilities****
 As a Finance \& Risk Data Analyst you can make a difference:
   

  

* Collecting and validating data from various sources, investigating and resolving inconsistencies and errors, preparing reports for our regulators and analysing shifts in the figures (run);
* You are actively engaged in process improvement in current work, maintain contact with stakeholders, and participate in projects (change);
* You are focused on process improvements and gaining efficiency in the reporting process and have an eye for structurally solving data quality issues.


**You and your talent**
 You are a pro\-active team player with a strong, yet flexible mentality to get things done. Customer focus, analytical and communication skills, personal development and results oriented are clearly essential for the role of Finance \& Risk Data Analyst.
   

  

 Collaboration is our way of working. Our Area/Squads join forces to deliver (non\-)financial information which are part of all the external and internal reporting of the Rabobank. There are multiple squads and every squad has 5 to 10 members. There is cooperation within the squad but between the squads too.
   

  

**Required knowledge and experience:**
* A Master’s degree in a financial related course (e.g. financial management or accounting);
* Knowledge of financial products (e.g. interest rates, derivates)
* Experience with / interest in regulations concerning reporting (e.g. IFRS);
* Affinity with data and IT (minimum MS Excel);
* You master the English and Dutch language.


**Growing a better world together**
 You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission?  We do so in countless ways, such as:
   

  

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature \& Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


****This Is What We Offer You****
