 We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36 hour working week), you can also expect:
   

  

* Up to € 3\.460,00 based on 36 hours (scale 7\);
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance;
* Extra budget of 10% of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out;
* A monthly home working allowance of up to € 40,\-
* A personal development budget of € 1,400,\-
* A combination of working from home and at the office;
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport.


 This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Regulatory Reporting Manager based on a 36\-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions\-of\-employment.
   

  

**You and the job application process**
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Natasja Severijns, Corporate Recruiter via natasja.helder\-severijns@rabobank.nl.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
**Data Quality Analyst** 




  





 The Data Quality Analyst plays an important role in ensuring the accuracy, integrity and compliance of data within the ERP and related platforms. This position combines data analysis with operational coordinating, supporting Quality Assurance (QA) and Regulatory Affairs (RA) teams by managing, analyzing and optimizing data workflows to ensure compliance with industry regulations (e.g. EU MDR, FDA 21 CFR Part 820\).
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities :** 



* Ensure compliance with the ISO13485 based Quality Management System, in accordance with Dentsply Sirona Policy, applicable worldwide regulations and standards (e.g. EU MDR, FDA and ISO)
* Coordinate data entry change management related to global and local ERP release processes and changes to products, ensuring proper documentation and validation.
* Support system improvements and QARA related data migration projects related to ERP processes.
* Analyze quality and regulatory product release status data to identify risks and improvement opportunities
* Generate and maintain reports, dashboards and KPIs for QA/RA teams, supporting process monitoring and audits.
* Act as the liaison between QA/RA and Supply Chain data management teams to ensure data accuracy and regulatory compliance.
* Work with cross\-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of QARA data in the ERP system.
* Train and support ERP users on best practices for managing QARA\-related data.
* Identify and implement process improvements for better data management and workflow efficiency.
* Work with IT teams to troubleshoot data integrity issues and system inconsistencies.
* Support data collection and coordination of QA/RA data related to support commercial \& supply chain improvement projects
* Support internal and external audits



  





  





**Requirements and Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s level education and/or work experience in data management, Life sciences, QA, Business administration or equivalent
* 3\+ years’ experience in establishing and maintaining regulated Quality Management Systems
* Excellent communication skills in English, as well as interpersonal relationship
* Experience in project management and leading process improvement methodologies
* Expertise in ERP Data management (e.g. SAP S/4\)
* Demonstrated experience in driving progress, taking initiative to achieve results.
* Have sound knowledge of data management principles, problem\-solving techniques and operational excellence
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing
job_function: Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, and Distribution

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**This is Adyen**
 Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H\&M, and Microsoft \- making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.
   

  

 For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.
   

  

**Data Analyst, Merchant Operations**
 Adyen is looking for a data analyst with a focus on Merchant Operations to join our team in Amsterdam. This team helps to embed analytics into the decision\-making processes for specifically the Merchant Operations teams within the operations function.
   

  

 Merchant Operations is a large department with various teams such as onboarding operations, merchant risk and AML. You will be working together with the Merchant Operations leadership team to help them to make data\-driven decisions and drive scalable services. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset together with excellent project management skills.
   

  

 Whether you come from the payments space or not, we need you to be an independent and enthusiastic thinker who can facilitate our growth by scaling internal projects and focus on continuous optimization and automation.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify the necessary data required to address questions, extract the required data, build dashboards and perform analysis on Global Merchant OPS metrics
* Work closely with the leaders from the Merchant Operations department to support business decisions based on the analytics
* Continuous performance optimization\- in\-depth collaboration with all stakeholders of the different processes in order to optimize the performance targets
* Storytelling\- turn your findings into effective communication and concise and actionable advice by connecting the data to a story
* Innovation\- develop initiatives for further reporting optimizations, to improve the data visualization and usability by merchants and other teams within Adyen


**Who You Are**
* You have at least 5 years of relevant working experience
* You have the ability to extract meaningful insights from large datasets and turn them into clear recommendations to the stakeholders
* You are proficient in writing queries in SQL; experience with BI tools, and data analysis languages such as Python
* You have a proven track record in project management skills, you know how to drive business projects in a structured manner and you are not afraid to ‘build as you go’
* You love to work in an international environment, and to build strong relationships with global and multicultural teams
* Preferably, you have an affinity for AML/KYC and operational processes, and you're interested in learning more about it
* You can communicate fluently in English, both written and spoken


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**
 Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them \- voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.
   

  

 Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**What’s next?**
 Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.
   

  

 Please note that this role is a full\-time position in Amsterdam. It will require a relocation in case you live outside of the Netherlands.
   

  

**We do not offer remote only roles and will only consider applications in English language.**

title: Analytics Expert
description:
**Are you our new colleague?** 




**We’re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global** 




**Diemen \- Netherlands, hybrid, fulltime** 




  





**BR\&AF** 




 The business risk and audit function (BR\&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR\&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on: the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in\-control statements.
 



  





 The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control \& audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.g. digital, talent, client, back office \& shared service centers and fraud \& forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk \& audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning \& development, quality improvement \& methods, analytics and PMO.
 



  





 Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR\&A Partners and support group) form the BR\&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR\&AF.
 



  





**how you will contribute** 




 You are part of the Business Risk \& Audit Function (BR\&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back\-, Mid\- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting \& Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your data analytics experience you enhance BR\&AF's delivery to management bringing insight on Randstad's in\-control situation.
 



  





**As analytics expert you:** 



* support building and rolling out the BR\&AF analytics roadmap.
* perform technical data analytics, including data visualization, data reports, data cleansing scripts, and data validation as part audits, risk management, internal controls support and combined assurance projects and activities.
* assist in taking the audit projects in Randstad to the next level through researching and evaluating new analytics concepts and technologies (e.g. generative AI/machine learning) in support of BR\&F practices.
* collaborate as an integrated part of audits teams in the definition and execution of analytics.
* support non analytics professionals within the function growing their capabilities enabling them to leverage analytics more effectively.
* are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR\&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.



  





**what you will be doing** 



* as co\-creator support the analytics lead in the development and roll out the data analytics roadmap
* lead the build out of the control structures to ensure sustainable analytics technology including data retention and clean up logic
* participate in risk assessments, periodic sampling, and data\-driven root cause analysis.
* perform data analysis procedures, including data profiling, data mining, trend analysis, and predictive modeling. Apply statistical techniques and visualization tools to analyze large volumes of data and identify patterns, anomalies, and potential audit risks.
* perform data collection, clean, analyze and report processes from various internal and external applications and databases, as well as other data sources when necessary.
* interpret the results of data analysis and provide meaningful insights to audit teams and BR\&AF management.
* review and validate data analytics work performed by audit teams.
* identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
* act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.



  





**who will you work with** 



* business risk \& audit partners
* partners/communities within applications operations and data management both at randstad global as well as in our operating companies
* external co\-source partners
* IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
* BR\&AF stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners



  





**what you will bring** 




 You bring a hands\-on and in depth understanding of data science and analytics concepts and structures combined with a drive to develop and roll out impactful analytics. With your drive for results you are able to balance short term delivery needs with mid term needs for standardization and sustainability of solutions. You understand the people, process, and technology dilemma's that go into building out analytics and are able to translate this into practical business cases both within the risk \& audit function as well as over other functions.
 



  





**As an Analytics Expert you:** 



* have minimum 8 years of relevant experience
* have minimum a master degree in business information management, computer science, or Mathematics and related accreditation (e.g. CAP/CDMP/CISA/CISSP)
* have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English preferably combined with proficiency in one of the following languages: Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian and /or German
* have a strong independent mindset
* are experienced in international stakeholder management \& change
* are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
* have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development
* have a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on analytics
* deliver on the roll out of analytics through the 3 pillars of people, process and technology.
* integrate technological developments into practices (e.g. generative AI)
* effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing non analytics experts to take ownership of initiatives and results



  





**your competencies** 




 Within Randstad we defined the following Human Forward Leadership competencies:
 


* delighting people: connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client\-centric solutions.
* performing today: resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
* leading change: manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
* securing the future: drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
* creating clarity: showing line of sight: making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
* courage to challenge: shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances
* collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity: manoeuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people\-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization



  





**what’s in it for you** 




 We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.
 



 We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad
 
 here
 
 .
 



  





**people at the heart of everything we do** 




 Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.
 



 Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website:
 
 www.randstad.com
 




  





**If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner:** 
 jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk
 



  





 The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

title: GTM Engineer (Full-Stack)
description:
**GTM Engineer (Full\-Stack) \|** **naptha.ai**
===============================================

**About this role**
-------------------


Naptha AI is seeking a talented Go\-to\-Market Engineer with full\-stack development skills to join our innovative AI startup. In this role, you'll design and build technical experiments that showcase our cutting\-edge AI technology to developers.


Working directly with our founding team, you'll create demo applications, integrations, interactive landing pages, and developer onboarding experiences. This position is perfect for engineers who combine strong technical abilities with growth mindset and want to make an immediate impact in a fast\-paced environment.

* Design and build technical GTM experiments including demo apps, integrations, and interactive landing pages
* Work directly with the founders on small bet initiatives from idea to shipped product
* Integrate our AI technology into real\-world use cases and showcase its value to developers
* Spin up mini tools, plugins, or prototypes to test positioning, features, or distribution channels
* Implement lightweight analytics to measure outcomes and iterate quickly
* Collaborate with backend engineers and product to ensure velocity and alignment
* Engage with early adopters (mostly developers) to gather feedback, unblock them, and learn what sticks

**Why Join Us**
---------------

* Shape how our product gets into the hands of developers and how it evolves with them
* Work directly with the founding team in a no\-red\-tape environment
* Own projects end\-to\-end, from idea to implementation to impact
* Be one of the first hires in a company built on technical excellence and fast iteration

**In this role, you’re a good fit if you have:**
------------------------------------------------

* 3–6 years of experience as a full\-stack engineer, ideally in early\-stage startups
* Strong front\-end skills (React, Next.js or similar) and backend familiarity (Node, Python, etc.)
* Experience working with APIs, SDKs, or developer tooling is a big plus
* Ability to build and ship fast — even if it's scrappy, prioritizing learnings over perfect code
* Comfort jumping on calls with users, writing docs, or implementing quick fixes in production
* Bonus: Experience with AI/ML APIs, SDKs, or infrastructure tools
* Bonus: Experience in growth engineering, developer advocacy, or building for developers
* Bonus: Experience working in an environment driven by experimentation and iteration

**About the hiring process**
----------------------------

* Video interview with hiring manager
* Take\-home project
* Presentation of take\-home project to panel
* Interview with co\-founders

**Compensation \& Benefits**
----------------------------

* Highly competitive salary and significant equity stake
* Role and compensation scaled to your experience
* Remote\-first work environment
* Full medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Flexible PTO policy
* Learning and conference budget


We're looking for software engineers with a product and growth mindset who are excited about rapidly testing ideas, gathering feedback, and iterating on product experiences. If you thrive in fast\-paced startup environments, enjoy full\-stack development with React and Node.js, and are passionate about creating developer tools and AI applications, we want to talk to you.

**Keywords:** Full\-Stack Engineer, Frontend Developer, React Developer, Next.js, Node.js, Python, JavaScript, Growth Engineer, Developer Experience, AI, Machine Learning, Startup, GTM, Go\-to\-Market, Developer Tools, SDK, API Integration, Product Development

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Location: Netherlands
\|
Agency: Data \& Tech Global \- United States
Ref\#: 16018
\|
Job Function: Strategy
\|
Type of Contract: Regular **A day as a** **Senior** **Backend Software Engineer at bGenius \-** **Kinesso****:**



You start your day attending the stand\-up of the development team, seeing if anybody needs help and everything is on track, whether remotely or in the office. Every other Friday involves wrapping up the last story point, taking part in the international demo showcasing this sprint's achievements. During lunch that day we celebrate the successful sprint.

  



Post\-lunch you dive into two key tasks: Retrospective and (personal) improvement. This could involve helping team members, refining processes, exploring new technologies or addressing complex challenges. Spotting an invite for the poker meeting next week, you accept and wind down for the weekend with drinks and snacks, proud of another week of impactful contributions.

  


**Your Role:**



We're seeking a Senior Backend Software Engineer to join our innovative team. As a member of the team, you'll contribute to architecting and implementing backend solutions, promoting best practices, and supporting the growth of other team members.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Contribute to architecting and developing scalable backend solutions.
* Implement backend features using technologies such as Java, AWS, Spring Boot, Docker and PostgreSQL.
* Support the growth and development of other backend team members.
* Collaborate closely with cross\-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of frontend and backend functionalities.
* Promote best practices in backend development, including code quality, performance optimization, and security.
* Contribute to initiatives aimed at improving backend architecture, tooling, and processes.
* Keep up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends, advocating for their adoption where appropriate.


**Preferred Skills:**


* Substantial experience in backend software development.
* Proficiency in Java, experience in frameworks like Spring are a plus.
* Demonstrated ability to contribute to technical initiatives and influence decision\-making.
* Higher professional education (HBO) level of thinking and working. Having an HBO\-level education is advantageous but not a requirement.


**What we offer:**


* Hybrid working, part of which is done from our locations in Groningen and Amsterdam.
* Collaborating with international teams on tooling and products used around the world.
* Working in an environment where your opinion and expertise is valued and sought after.
* A challenging job with plenty of room for technical innovation and the opportunity to make an international impact.
* Opportunity for further development, both internally and externally.
* Working in an Agile environment.


**Kinesso/bGenius:**



KINESSO is the technology\-driven performance marketing agency that sits at the very heart of IPG Mediabrands, providing actionable growth for both our agency partners and clients. We turn 'action' into 'outcome' for our clients, leveraging our unique capabilities in optimization, analytics, AI, and experimentation. KINESSO has brought together the collective power of what was formerly Matterkind, Reprise, and Kinesso under one collective entity that will serve as the most powerful delivery engine in the industry. We have extensive offerings spanning across performance marketing, data, and technology. Fueled by a deep understanding of consumer behavior, we offer an end\-to\-end engine of planning and optimization while also delivering on data\-driven strategy for social platforms, actionable growth in e\-commerce, and creating curated marketplaces specific to each client's function and needs. The company has more than 6,000 employees operating in more than 60 countries. Learn more at www.KINESSO.com.


**Questions:**



If you have any questions or are interested in this role, feel free to contact Jaana Hermans at jaana.hermans@kinesso.com

title: Senior Consultant IHS Benelux
description:
At Medtronic you can begin a life\-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. You’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world.


**A Day in the Life**
=====================

Our Integrated Health Solutions (IHS) people are supporting our customers beyond products and devices to create more value for patients. Integrated Health Solutions builds on Medtronic‘s combination on process optimization expertise, therapy knowledge and capital resources. The team members are seasoned professionals with in\-depth knowledge of the healthcare value chain. IHS currently partners with hospitals and clinics, offering solutions that help care providers optimize costs and outcomes while driving higher value and patient satisfaction.
  

  

We are company that helps patients every day to improve their lives through medical device technologies and solutions. If you have an expertise in consulting and would like to become part of dynamic environment within great multinational company, please consider joining tender team and help us to support our bold mission.
  

  

As Medtronic Integrated Health Solutions Senior Consultant, you will connect with client hospitals, understand and analyse their most pressing business challenges and deliver high value services which improve their quality, productivity, and patient\- and staff experience.
**Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned:**

* Working with your team on projects across our partnerships to deliver quality and improve healthcare
* Driving complex transformational change
* Designing and implementing growth strategies
* Developing and streamlining patient\-focused care pathways
* Improving operational excellence helps hospitals innovate and optimize, e.g. Same\-day discharge, Remote care, Regional collaboration, New care concepts, Growth programs
* Helping physicians and hospital management improve outcomes
* Developing actionable plans for immediate improvement and driving implementation
* Capturing learnings and best practices to continuously help its international network of clients
* Sharing and communicating determined best practices actively with clients and the team.

**Required Knowledge and Experience:**

* 5\-8 years of relevant consulting experience (preferred), healthcare consulting or 8\+ years of industry experience
* Healthcare industry knowledge or experience
* Proven track record in driving end to end transformations: from analysis to implementation
* Relevant Master’s degree (preferred) with excellent academic \+ extracurricular results
* Project management: planning \& coordinating, communicating \& influencing, relationship building, achieving milestones, resolving issues and managing risks
* Fluent in English and Dutch
* Problem\-solving, preferably core consulting skills
* Data\-analytics
* Presentation and communication
* A rounded blend of analytics and implementation skills
* Change management
* Partnering and collaboration (team\-player)
* Willingness to work and travel within Benelux
* Willingness to travel occasionally across EMEA
* It is possible to work alternately on site and remotely, depending on the consultancy assignments.

**Physical Job Requirements**  

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.


**Benefits \& Compensation**
============================

**Medtronic offers a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package**  

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.  

  



**About Medtronic**
===================

**We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions.**
**Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 95,000\+ passionate people.**
**We are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. From the R\&D lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. We have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.**

company_description: CAREERS THAT CHANGE LIVES Do meaningful work, make a difference, and improve lives.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Arabic speaking)
description:
**Welcome to SkillLab**


At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change \- a transition towards skill\-based labor and education markets. Our AI\-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient markets by connecting people with jobs and education through the universal language of skills. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 35\+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.


SkillLab’s innovative use of AI was recognised with awards like Google AI for Impact, UNESCO Top 10 uses of AI and the European Social Innovation Competition 2021, among other awards.

**Your team**


You will join our User Experience (UX) team as our new Senior User experience/User Interface (UX/UI) Designer. You will be part of an join an expert UX team who champions user\-centered design, driving product success through insightful research and intuitive interface development.


Also, you will work in an international environment of ±65 SkillLabers from ±30 different countries in the heart of Amsterdam.


You will directly report to Dan, who is the UX Lead.


The UI/UX professionals that make the UX team so special are Giulia, Dimas, and Lorenzo.


You will also cooperate with our product management, engineering and Data science teams within the product function.


We are proud of the people we collaborate with and excited to work at a company with a strong social mission. We hope you will be too!

**Your responsibilities**

* You will be the UX owner of one or more of SkillLab’s major enterprise clients. You will work with clients and internal stakeholders to align on scope, product definition, and co\-create design solutions.
* You will contribute to the development of new features and products by understanding clients' needs through engagement workshops, concept development and iterative user research.
* You will work at different design altitudes to map out user journeys, create end\-to\-end flows, and produce detailed user interface design specifications for implementation.
* You will maintain and evolve our design system; introduce new components and adapt existing components to accommodate new functionality while maintaining interoperability with existing components.
* You will identify opportunities for foundational user research, and define, scope, plan and execute research with support from a dedicated User Experience Researcher.

**Requirements**

*Your skills*

* 5\+ years of work experience in User Experience Design or a related role, eg. User Interface, Interaction, Graphic, or Product design, etc. Combined experience in building products in\-house and working with external clients will be highly appreciated.
* Arabic language knowledge at a native level.
* Ability to present and advocate for design decisions with clients and stakeholders, ensuring alignment between user needs and business objectives.
* Deep understanding of user\-centered design principles.
* Proficiency in Figma design and prototyping.
* Data\-informed approach to making design decisions, leveraging usability testing, usage analytics, market research, etc.
* Flexibility and agility to adapt to changing requirements, and the initiative and leadership to create clarity from uncertainty
* Experience working directly with product managers and software engineers to maintain and use design systems

**Extra awesome**

* Experience planning and executing formative and evaluative UX research
* Experience working with HR tech, E\-learning or matching platforms
* Expertise in designing user experiences informed by best\-practices of designing for ML\- and recommender\-based systems

**Salary, start\-date \& location**

* We use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high\-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 55k\-65k Euro per year.
* We accept applications on a rolling basis, and we envision a start date as soon as possible.

**Benefits**

* You will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year (20 days as the statutory minimum holiday entitlement in the Netherlands plus 5 extra days from SkillLab).
* You can work flexibly from our office in Amsterdam and home within the Netherlands. You can also extend your holiday stay in a different country and work from abroad for a limited period of time.
* You will get an extensive relocation support to move to Amsterdam including visa sponsorship if needed, 30% ruling, your plane tickets, covered real estate agent fees etc.
* You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development.
* You will have access to mentors \& coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator).
* You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Alleo app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores.
* You will join our bi\-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, the Netherlands etc.

**What else to know?**

* Get 4 tips for your job application at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/skilllabjobapplication
* Read more about our compensation framework: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/skilllab\-compensation
* Learn more about SkillLab’s social life: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/social\-life\-at\-skilllab
* SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds. Read more about DEI: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/diversity\-equity\-and\-inclusion\-at\-skilllab

title: Director, Field Service Northern Europe
description:
The **Director of Field Service Northern Europe** will be responsible for leading and managing our field service operations across the region including Germany, UK, Ireland and the Nordics. This strategic leadership role is focused on driving excellence in service delivery, ensuring customer satisfaction, and aligning field service activities with the company’s overall goals. The ideal candidate will provide direction and oversight to a team of field service leaders and support groups, while also working cross\-functionally to maintain and enhance service quality standards. This role is critical to enhancing PerkinElmer’s reputation as a leader in delivering high\-quality, reliable solutions to our customers across all segments.

**Leadership \& Team Management:**


o Lead, mentor, and develop a team of field service leaders to meet performance objectives.


o Foster a culture of continuous improvement, high performance, and customer\-centricity within the field service team.


o Oversee recruitment, training, and professional development to ensure technical and customer service excellence.


o Implement Daily Management and Problem Solving fundamentals a spart of LEAN conversion efforts

**Service Delivery \& Customer Satisfaction:**


o Ensure the efficient and effective delivery of field services, including installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repairs for PerkinElmer's products.


o Drive strategies to improve response times, quality of service, and overall customer satisfaction.


o Address complex customer issues in a timely manner, ensuring the highest standards of service delivery.

**Operational Excellence:**


o Manage the field service budget, ensuring the efficient allocation of resources.


o Implement and optimize field service processes and workflows to enhance productivity and reduce operational costs. o Collaborate with cross\-functional teams, including product management, sales, and support, to ensure seamless execution of service contracts and maintenance programs.

**Strategic Planning \& Reporting**:


o Develop and execute strategies to drive the growth and performance of the field service function in alignment with company objectives.


o Analyze field service performance data and provide regular reports to senior management, offering actionable insights to improve service delivery.


o Continuously evaluate emerging trends and technologies to enhance service offerings and stay competitive in the market. · Compliance \& Quality Assurance: o Ensure compliance with all relevant industry regulations, safety standards, and company policies. o Maintain high standards of quality control for all service activities to ensure consistency and reliability.

**Basic Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus).
* At least **10\+ years** of experience in field service management, with a proven track record of successfully leading a team of field service engineers or technicians.
* Strong understanding of service delivery in a technical environment, preferably within the healthcare, life sciences, or related industries.
* Demonstrated experience in managing complex service operations, customer relations, and cross\-functional collaboration.
* Proven leadership abilities, with a focus on team development, motivation, and performance management.
* Exceptional communication, problem\-solving, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to develop and manage budgets, timelines, and operational goals.
* Strong knowledge of service management software and tools.
* Ability to travel as needed to meet customer demands and oversee field operations.

**Preferred Characteristics**

* **Strategic Vision**: Ability to anticipate market trends and drive forward\-thinking strategies to maintain PerkinElmer’s competitive edge in the field service sector.
* **Customer\-First Mindset**: Demonstrated passion for delivering outstanding customer service and exceeding customer expectations.
* **Data\-Driven Decision Maker**: Comfort in utilizing data and analytics to improve service operations, track performance, and make informed decisions.
* **Change Management**: Experience in leading teams through organizational change, especially within the context of evolving service models or business needs.
* **Collaborative Leadership Style**: Ability to collaborate cross\-functionally with various departments, including sales, marketing, product development, and customer support, to enhance service outcomes and drive business growth.
* **Continuous Learning and Adaptability**: A proactive attitude toward staying current with industry advancements, new technologies, and continuous improvement processes.
* **Multinational Experience**: Experience working in global teams and managing field service operations in diverse cultural environments

title: People Analytics Data Scientist
description:
You will work as a data scientist in our ING Global Strategy \& People Analytics team where we build and deploy analytics products, data science models \& dashboards to support all decisions about ING employees making ING a great place to work for.
  
  

You will work in a squad on the front\-line closely with business translators and data engineers to agree on the best way to support our stakeholders. You will play a pivotal role in the development and delivery of advanced analytics products embedded in ING’s HR processes.
  
  

How to succeed
  
We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  
  

**We are looking for you, if you:**  

have a good knowledge about machine learning and data science models
  
  

have hands\-on in SQL \& Python
  
  

have experience with git \& (big plus) with CI/CD tools in Azure DevOps
  
  

have experience in explaining your complex analysis to stakeholders
  
  

support the squad’s product owners with refining \& planning business questions
  
  

have willingness to learn, both on technical and interpersonal levels
  
  

(big plus) have experience with Power BI
  
  

**Roles and responsibilities :**  

Design, analyze and interpret business hypothesis and explore datasets through using available tools, you can manage stakeholders with their business challenges end\-to\-end, from problem, creating hypotheses, to building a small POC to show viability \& feasibility
  
  

Build or improve data\-driven analytical products using data science techniques
  
  

Recommend ideas to business when data and results are available through good visualizations or algorithms, you always think one step ahead, for example the best way of implementation
  
  

Assist users to understand the data science principles and when needed provide an explanation for the model behavior and possible correcting actions
  
  

Contribute to the data science chapter through knowledge sharing, improving our technical WoW, adopting new algorithms or technologies, presenting your work to the analytics community, and supporting team members with your expertise
  
  

Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting. Individual development of our employees is particularly important and that is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. The role is “Data Scientist III” in the global ING job architecture with a monthly salary (depends on your experience) in the range of 4\.367,65 and 7\.088,63 based on a 36\-hours working week.
  
  

Are you keen to know more or apply?
  
For further inquiries, please contact the recruitment team. We are looking forward to getting to know you. An assessment of technical skills will be a part of the selection process. Your name and email address will be shared by the third\-party assessment provider. Please check Privacy Statement for ING Job Applicants https://www.ing.com/Privacy\-Statement.htm
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

* A salary indication in scale 10 between 4,367 and 7,088 EUR based on a 36\-hour working week
* 24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues


About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Who we are**  

Artefact is a leading global consulting company dedicated to accelerating the adoption of data and AI to positively impact people and organizations. We specialize in data \& AI transformation and data marketing to drive tangible business results across the entire enterprise value chain.



Artefact offers the most comprehensive set of data\-driven solutions per industry, built on deep data science and cutting\-edge AI technologies, delivering AI projects at scale in all industry sectors. From strategy to operations, we offer an end\-to\-end approach and solutions: data strategy, data quality and governance, data platforms, AI Factory, data\-driven customer experience, and marketing ROI. Our 1500\+ employees operate in 22 countries (Europe, Asia, Americas, Middle East, Africa) and we partner with over 1000 clients, including some of the world's top 300 brands such as Samsung, L'Oréal, and Sanofi.



Do you want to be at the forefront of helping clients on their digital and data journeys while positioning Artefact as a leader in innovation? Join our forward\-thinking team in a rapidly growing environment with ample career advancement opportunities. If you're passionate about technology and data, this is your chance to make an impact!


### **What you will be doing:**



As a **Senior Data Scientist**, you will lead and conduct ambitious projects aimed at transforming clients through data. Your day\-to\-day responsibilities will include:


* **Leading transformational projects:** spearheading ambitious projects that utilize data to transform our clients' operations and strategies.
* **Developing data science solutions:** creating innovative data science products and solutions for both clients and our internal data science team.
* **Applying data science in marketing contexts:** leveraging data science methodologies to enhance **marketing analytics, customer segmentation, attribution modeling, and campaign optimization**.
* **Building client relationships:** collaborating closely with your Consulting counterpart to understand client needs and strengthen relationships.
* **Upskilling the team:** contributing to the development of our data science team by sharing knowledge, mentoring junior Data Scientists, and promoting our work within other data departments.
* **Ensuring quality deliverables:** caring for team morale and ensuring that all missions are delivered to a high standard, providing feedback and support to less experienced team members.
* **Optimising code:** writing highly optimized code to advance Artefact's internal toolbox and knowledge base.

### **What you will learn with us:**


* **Real\-World impact:** deliver impactful projects by developing end\-to\-end machine learning pipelines to solve real\-world problems across various industries**, including marketing and customer intelligence.**
* **Collaborative solutions:** work in feature teams alongside other data scientists, ML engineers, data engineers, software engineers, and product owners to build complex solutions.
* **Software engineering improvement:** enhance your software engineering skills by applying ML Ops best practices while working with machine learning teams.
* **Expertise development:** become an expert in one of our data science practices: Time Series Forecasting, MLOps, NLP, Computer Vision, Optimization, or Customer Intelligence, including marketing analytics, attribution modeling, and incrementality testing.
* **Algorithm discovery:** discover state\-of\-the\-art algorithms and test them on real\-world data during client projects.

### **What we are looking for:**



We're seeking someone who has:


* **Educational background:** a completed Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, machine learning, mathematics, or related subjects).
* **Hands\-On experience:** at least 2\-3 years of experience in data science, analytics, or consulting, preferably within a marketing or digital context.
* **Marketing or digital context experience:** knowledge of various marketing channels and platforms, including their roles within the media mix is considered a plus.
* **Technical skills:** strong knowledge of data processing, algorithms, and data architecture, along with proficiency in tools like Python, SQL, and R.
* **Analytical mindset:** a passion for working with data to derive actionable insights and solve complex problems.
* **Communication skills:** excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to discuss both technical and non\-technical topics with clients and team members.
* **Curiosity and passion:** a genuine interest in continuous learning and exploring new technologies and tools in data and AI.

### **Why you should join us:**


* **Learning and development:** join a team of passionate Data Scientists and Engineers who will support your growth and provide ample learning opportunities.
* **Culture of celebration:** we pride ourselves on creating a collaborative and fun work environment with regular team events and activities.
* **Competitive rewards:** enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including a competitive salary, phone \& travel reimbursements, remote work allowance, and a Onefit membership discount.
* **Work\-Life balance:** we offer flexibility with a hybrid working environment that lets you balance personal and professional commitments.
* **Fuel your day:** enjoy a healthy and delicious daily lunch from our extensive organic buffet.
* **Weekly unwind:** take advantage of our weekly massage sessions to de\-stress and relax.
* **Centrally located:** our office is conveniently situated near the station for easy commuting.
* **Career growth opportunities:** we're committed to your professional development, offering continuous learning and internal promotion opportunities.

### **Join us now and be part of the future:**



Artefact is experiencing exciting growth, and this is the perfect time to join our dynamic team and contribute to our success story.  

**Come join us!**

title: Lead Business Analyst
description:
Country/Region: NL
Requisition ID: 22763
Work Model: Hybrid
Position Type: Permanent
Salary Range:
Location: NETHERLANDS \- EINDHOVEN \- DAF
**Title:** **Lead Business Analyst**
====================================

Description:
**Area(s) of responsibility**
-----------------------------


**Business Analyst \- Connected Vehicle Platform (CVP)**

**6 months contract to begin**


**Eindhoven, Netherlands, mostly onsite**


**max rate: 50 EUR per hour**


The will be part of the development team working on the initiative Phase 2 under the Global Connected Services (GCS) department. A project that will start in 2025 is targeted to develop a new global solution for collecting vehicle data from multiple data collection solutions, governance and distribution through common data services in conformity with privacy and cybersecurity legislation. Existing local solutions implemented in Phase 1 will be maintained during the project while existing data services will gradually be migrated to the new global solution. The business migration strategy and impacted business services need to be defined


OBJECTIVES  

* Build a good professional relationship with existing Product Owner(s), Information Analyst(s) and Architect(s)
* Obtain a complete overview for all business services in the scope of the project.
* Support and guide internal and external test teams during planning and execution of functional and user acceptance testing.
* Work in close cooperation with the Development Team and with the Subject Matter Experts as changes will take place based on both business and technical project activities.
* Cooperate in and live up to an Agile way of working. The development team will be working in sprints based on SAFe principles.

RESPONSIBILITIES \& OUTPUT  

* Engineer business processes, workflows and requirements, either by:


o supporting the responsible operational service delivery teams;  

o representing GCS when participating in work groups designing new business applications;  

o designing new internal processes in alignment with GCS internal stakeholders.  

* Engineer (non\-)functional requirements for business services.
* In close collaboration with Information Analyst(s):


o specify detailed Functional Designs for use cases and system interfaces, in close collaboration with the Solution Architect and in accordance with Solution Architecture Design.  

o Define and refine user stories on the backlog of the development team  

* Collect and document relevant information according to project scope and DAF standards.
* Design for privacy, in accordance with GDPR legislation.
* Design for cybersecurity, in accordance with UN\-ECE R155 legislation.
* Support the Data Architect with data governance definitions, data taxonomy and logical data modelling.
* Be in front and ahead of the development team, strongly supporting the Product Owner to manage DoR and DoD

**Essential job tasks**
-----------------------



PROFILE  

* A business analyst through and through, enjoying analyzing business cases, strategy, processes, roadmaps and requirements over IT solutions and architecture.
* Can be assertive, daring to take the initiative.
* Proactive attitude, self\-motivated, self\-disciplined.
* Accessible and good communication skills. Professional in the English Language.
* Able and willing to work in Eindhoven office 3\-5 days per week.
* Able and willing to work in a dynamic and innovative environment, stress\-resilient.
* Able and willing to backwards define requirements when not formally received/documented.
* Able and willing to communicate with multiple nationalities over different time zones.

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE  

* Master or Bachelor or related. 5\-10 years of relevant experience.
* Experience with the business domain and marketing and sales of digital services using connectivity solutions.
* Vast knowledge of automotive and connectivity.
* Knowledge of IT development lifecycle processes. (Pre)
* Knowledge of digital cloud solutions and data analytics. (Pre)
* Experienced working according to the Agile/SAFe framework. (Pre)

SKILLS  

* BPMN 2\.0 / UML / ArchiMate
* Stakeholder relationship management
* Strong management\-level presentation
* Agile principles
* Azure DevOps (Pre)
* Agile Scrum / SAFe (Pre)

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**What We Do:**
As the world becomes increasingly connected, the demand for cybersecurity solutions has never been greater. Forescout stands at the forefront of this critical need, delivering automated cybersecurity that ensures continuous alignment between our customers’ security frameworks and their evolving digital environments. Our platform protects all asset types, including IT, IoT, OT, and IoMT, helping organisations navigate and secure the complexities of the modern connected world.

Join us in securing the world. We seek resourceful, driven individuals to collaborate as one team, delivering exceptional customer experiences. We’re passionate about tackling the toughest security challenges and staying ahead with innovative solutions. Here, every idea is valued, and visionaries are welcomed. Bring your unique perspective and help shape the future of cybersecurity with us.
**Position Overview:** We are seeking an experienced Senior Software Engineer with deep expertise in cloud infrastructure, networking, and modern data services—particularly within Azure environments. The successful candidate will play a critical role in designing, building, and optimizing the infrastructure and services underpinning our cybersecurity data ecosystem.
**Key Responsibilities:*** Architect, develop, and manage robust cloud infrastructure solutions leveraging Azure services such as Azure Synapse, Azure Data Explorer (ADX), and Azure Networking.
* Ensure high availability, security, and scalability of our cloud infrastructure to support extensive data workloads.
* Develop data pipelines and infrastructure automation using Python, Java, and optionally Perl, enhancing performance, reliability, and operational efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to integrate cloud services with broader cybersecurity initiatives, though prior cybersecurity expertise is not mandatory.
* Provide technical leadership, mentor junior engineers, and drive best practices across the team.

**Required Qualifications:*** Strong foundational knowledge of cloud computing concepts, particularly in Azure (including Synapse Analytics, ADX, Azure Networking).
* Demonstrable experience with infrastructure management and network configuration in **Azure**.
* Proficiency in **Python and Java**; familiarity with Perl is beneficial but not required.
* Experience or familiarity with Apache Spark is a plus.
* Proven track record of building resilient, scalable cloud infrastructure.


**Preferred Qualifications (Nice\-to\-have):*** Exposure to cybersecurity concepts, though not required.
* Experience with big data platforms and frameworks such as Spark.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD, infrastructure\-as\-code).


We encourage you to apply if you meet most but not all the desired skills and experience listed in this job posting. We value competencies, aptitude, and a great attitude as supplement to experience.
**Why Join Us:*** Contribute to building innovative solutions at the intersection of cloud technology and cybersecurity.
* Opportunity to work in a challenging, high\-impact role within a rapidly evolving technology landscape.
* Be part of a team that values continuous learning, innovation, and technical excellence.

**What Forescout Offers You:**
Competitive compensation and benefits – generous PTO policy, and much more.
Collaborative and innovative environment – make an impact on worldwide security while working on the hottest technology.
Leadership that supports and encourages professional growth and development.

At Forescout, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of background, experiences, and perspectives leads to innovation, creativity, and better decision making. We strive to create an environment where all team members feel valued, respected, and empowered. We actively promote equal opportunities and fair treatment for all individuals, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. By embracing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, we aspire to build a successful culture where we work together and win together as One Team.

\#LI\-AO1

title: Service Technician
description:
Service Technician


Wärtsilä is a world leader in marine technology and leading the industry's transformation towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. With the world’s widest portfolio and service network, we – Wärtsilians \- deliver efficient, safe and sustainable integrated products and solutions to enhance the business of our customers. The opportunities presented through digitalisation and new technologies are offering a new era of shipping. Did you know that shipping is the world’s most efficient mode of transportation and that 88% of the world's trade is carried by sea?  

  

We want to change the course towards an interconnected and cleaner maritime future and are constantly on the lookout for future\-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services \- together. Are you ready to jump onboard?

“Does your technical heart beats faster for smart technologies? Join our team to see the world, gain knowledge and experience, and never forget to have fun in a job you love!”  


**Field Service Technician Marine – Central Europe**  


We are now looking for a Field service Technician to join our field service team which will become acquainted with different disciplines within our portfolio, like 4\-stroke and Propulsion both electrically and mechanically. After your acquaintance, we will determine in good consultation in which discipline you familiarize and specialize yourself in.  


**What will you be doing?**
In this position, you first will be acquainted and basically trained in several disciplines. Training will be done through our online training programs, following Face to Face training at our Land and Sea Academy’s, cooperate in our local workshops and in the Field together with your skilled and mentoring colleagues. After your acquaintance period is finalized, your training will continue in a specific discipline, and you will be trained to Field Service Engineer with the opportunity to develop yourself further to Super intendent.  


For us to be the best match, we expect you to have low basic knowledge of Electronics and/or Mechatronics.  


As a Field Service Technician your work will focus on these responsibilities:
* Follow all arranged product trainings
* Follow workshop procedures
* Follow all required safety trainings
* Listen, observe and learn

  


To be successful in this role, we expect you to have:
* Flexible mentality
* A “can do” mindset
* Safe work standard
* Proper and respectful work ethics
* Resident in the Netherlands and in possession of a driver's license.

  


In this role you will travel primarily in the central Europe region, while further abroad every now and then won’t be a problem for you in good collaboration.  


**Why you and us?**
We at Wärtsilä believe in empowerment, ownership and taking responsibility of our work. We support each other’s growth, and co\-creation is the true basis of our innovation. We have courage to see opportunities and take initiative.
We are authentic and honest, and we strongly believe in that by being your own true self you can accomplish so much more. We don’t always get it right the first time, and if mistakes are made, we make sure to learn and grow from them. We want everyone to voice their opinions freely. That is why we have built an environment that empowers you and everyone around you, and where you can feel safe and cared for. Are you eager to be part of this ambition?  


**This is Wärtsilä;**  

Wärtsilä Marine Power leads the industry in its journey towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. Our portfolio of engines, propulsion systems, hybrid technology, and integrated powertrain systems deliver the reliability, safety, and environmental performance that Wärtsilä’s Smart Marine vision encompasses.  


We offer our customers performance\-based agreements, lifecycle solutions, and an unrivalled global network of maritime expertise. www.wartsila.com/marine Wärtsilä is a global leader in smart technologies and complete lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. By emphasising sustainable innovation, total efficiency and data analytics, Wärtsilä maximises the environmental and economic performance of the vessels and power plants of its customers.  



Last application date: 15/04/2025  


At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job\-relevant merits and abilities.
company_description: Enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services.

title: Senior BI Engineer
description:
**Your Role in Our Story:**
---------------------------



As a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer at ACT, you will have a key role in managing and modernizing the Business Intelligence Platform. The BI Platform is completely built on top of Microsoft Azure SaaS Services and follows the Microsoft Reference Architecture for small and midsize businesses. In addition to daily tasks like Data Analysis, Data Integration, Data Modelling and Report Design, as part of the BI team you will also be responsible for activities like gathering the requirements from the business, testing, implementing or changing the CI/CD pipelines and monitoring the usage of the deliverables.



We are hiring Senior BI Engineers with a strong focus on back\-end development, technology platform development, and technical expertise to join our team. On a tactical and strategical level your input would be valuable regarding the changes that will happen to the platform including but not limited to the addition or removal of Azure Services, cost optimization, security and compliance improvements and task automation. In addition, transitioning to Microsoft Fabric is in the roadmap together with replacing a few components of the Platform in order to enable additional technical capabilities like unit testing and increase the operational efficiency



Operational activities like Business Support, performing bi\-weekly releases are shared across the team members and thus they will also be your responsibility from time to time. In addition, we aim to document our BI Platform and thus you will be documenting in Confluence the new Data Integration pipelines, new Data Models etc.



You will be actively participating in all scrum activities in BI and help the team to further improve the way of working. You will work with most of the departments in the company and thus build a high\-level view of the business. Prior knowledge in the business areas including Sales, Finance, Operations, Risk is highly appreciated.



We do appreciate and promote teamwork, helping each other and keeping a positive atmosphere in the team. In essence, your role involves:


* Managing and further enriching the BI Data Warehouse.
* Integrating new source systems and transforming data using Azure Data Factory.
* Designing, Implementing and Documenting new Data Models.
* Creating and Optimizing Data Pipelines.
* Developing and managing Semantic Models in Power BI and Tabular Models in AAS based on best practices recommended from Microsoft.
* Implement Row Level Security in AAS and Power BI.
* Creating and updating Power BI reports and dashboards.
* Creating or enriching the CI/CD Pipelines in Azure DevOps.
* Migrating reports from Excel and other legacy tools to the Data Warehouse and Power BI platform.
* Communicating well with business users and helping them turn their business requirements into desired output.
* Demonstrating Data and Analytics solutions to the business counterparts.

**Your Expertise:**
-------------------



To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates with the following qualifications and attributes:


* Minimum of 5 years of experience with Microsoft Azure or other Cloud Platforms is required.
* Educational background in IT \& Business, Business Information Technology, or equivalent.
* Proficient knowledge of SQL, TSQL, PL/SQL or other variants.
* Strong understanding of dimensional modelling, star schema, snowflake schema, and data vault methodologies.
* Able to write, execute, interpret and optimize queries.
* Experience with Power BI / Data visualization tools.
* Experience with Git and building CI/CD Pipelines are a plus.
* Knowledge of different Microsoft Reference Architectures for Business Intelligence.
* Experience with Azure Logic Apps, Azure Synapse Analytics, PowerApps and Azure Automation is an advantage.
* Experience with technologies including DataBricks, Dbt, Snowflake or other cloud data platforms is an advantage.
* Knowledge on the concepts including Medallion Architecture, Data Mesh, Data Vault is an advantage.
* Knowledge of data streaming and real\-time analytics solutions is an advantage.
* Knowledge of Python or a similar programming language is an advantage.
* Highly motivated, positive individual looking for opportunities to show your skills and learn new things.


Please note that after an initial phone screen, candidates will be required to complete a technical assessment before proceeding to a business interview with the hiring team.



If you meet these criteria and are ready to contribute your expertise to a dynamic and challenging environment, we encourage you to apply.

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer
description:
Exciting and uplifting career moments are waiting for you at the **PPHE Hotel Group.**
Every day we create valuable memories for our guests and stakeholders – accross our international portfolio of prime hospitality real estate, encompassing iconic hotels, seaside resorts, glamping and campsites, destination restaurants, buzzing bars and more! And driving it all, behind the scenes, are our support teams.

**The Role:**
As a **Senior Cloud Data Engineer**, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You will support with the development of the company's data platform on GCP, driving its architecture, implementation, and maintenance, while ensuring it meets the company's needs and goals. You will support the company’s strategy by developing dashboards and visualisations answering key analytical needs.

**Key Responsibilities*** Data Solutions: Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for analytics and operational use, ensuring efficient data flow and processing. Design and implement processes for data integration and transformation, ensuring seamless data flow between systems.
* Data Visualization: Create visualizations and reports using tools such as Looker to unlock valuable insights and support real\-time decision\-making by integrating seamlessly with cloud\-based datasets and systems.
* Data Governance and Quality: Ensure data quality and consistency across various sources, implementing best practices for data governance, data security, and compliance. Establish and enforce data management policies, standards, and procedures to ensure reliable and accurate data across the organization.
* Cloud Solution Selection and Cost Management: Select appropriate cloud solutions to meet business needs, managing cloud costs effectively to ensure budget alignment and cost efficiency.
* Technical Partnerships: Manage relationships with technical partners and consultants to ensure smooth collaboration and alignment with company goals. Communicate with rest of teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate with peer data engineers, fostering their professional growth and development. Prioritize business requirements as communicated by the Data Insights Lead. Collaborate with departments and stakeholders to align data solutions with business needs and ensure effective project delivery.
* Documentation and Performance Monitoring: Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation for data processes, pipelines, and infrastructure. Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and optimize system performance to ensure reliability and efficiency.
* AI Initiatives: Be an integral part of AI projects for the group, contributing technical expertise and supporting the implementation of AI solutions. Participate in cross\-functional projects to integrate AI models into data pipelines and deploy them in production environments. Stay updated with the latest AI and machine learning trends, tools, and technologies to drive innovation within the company.

**Requirements:**

* Academic degree in Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science or related fields
* Solid experience in developing in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or similar cloud based solution
* Relevant programming skills (Python, SQL, Java)
* Proven experience with developing and maintaining dashboards and data analysis solutions. Good knowledge of Looker is a plus
* Evidence required of self\-managed projects and assisting more junior members
* Previous experience with hospitality data use cases, working with Property Management System data, will be a strong plus
* Results driven and dedication to answer business users’ needs, along with flexibility to adjust to changes in strategy when necessary
* Full working proficiency in English
* Already being based in the Netherlands is a plus

**What you get as Senior Cloud Data Engineer:**

* Birthday bonus of €250 (gross, paid in the month of your birthday)
* Competitive salary
* Tasty meal during shift
* Industry pension plan
* 25 days holiday
* 1 extra day off for your wellbeing
* Exciting job opportunities within PPHE Hotel Group across Europe
* Discounted hotel rates (extends to the Radisson Hotel Group worldwide and family \& friends)
* 50% F\&B discount at our restaurants and bars (for your whole party)
* Travel compensation (max €200 net pm based on full\-time employment)
* Recommend a friend scheme (earn up to €750 for each friend who joins us)
* 8% holiday allowance (paid yearly in May)
* Flexible working policy (if applicable)
* Annual company parties and outings
* Exclusive discounts in the employee benefit store (www.personeelsvoordeelwinkel.nl)
* Discount on the collective health insurance from VGZ
* Departmental incentive schemes
* Great (online) Learning \& Development opportunities to grow your career
* An advanced onboarding program
* Access to the hotel gym during low peak hours


and more…**PPHE Hotel Group. Create with us.**
