title: Analytics Engineer – Cross-Skilling program
description:
**DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**

  

Your passion is data and analytics. You want to create value for our clients by uncovering, organizing, and making sense of data. You understand that it is important to build robust solutions. You feel comfortable operating in the sweet spot between business and engineering and are eager to learn more and build robust systems next to our experienced team!

 **WHAT YOU WILL DO TO MAKE ORGANIZATIONS DATA\-DRIVEN**

  

The Analytics Engineer is the bridge between business and analytics. You understand what data can bring to the organization. With your effective communication skills, you help uncover business needs and how to support them with data, reporting, and visualization, enabling data democratization by improving the reliability and accessibility of data products. In the past our team has implemented software engineering best practices to write production\-grade data pipelines, making high\-quality data available for creating business value with analytics. We enjoy great success in making top organizations data\-driven — just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team!

  

Check out our website or one of our customer stories to get a more detailed understanding of what we do.


Interested in learning more about how and why the role of Analytics Engineering emerged? You can read this blogpost from one of our Analytics Engineers!

 **WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE A CONSULTANT AT XEBIA DATA**

  

As a consultant at Xebia Data, you will have projects of varying length. Some are 2 weeks, some are 1 year, most are in between. Every project is different, as is every client. We, however, always deliver the best quality possible. It is not always easy, but it is always rewarding. You will have exposure to different companies, different problems, different systems and solutions. You will be surrounded by experts in different fields, and you will learn so many new things in a short time. Xebia Data offers the perfect environment to shine as a data professional.


You will never be alone on this journey. We have all experienced imposter syndrome, had a difficult project, or felt down at times. We know what it takes, we know it is difficult sometimes, and we will be there for you when you need it. We say People First, and we mean it.


Xebia Data offers you great benefits too, of course!

* You can enjoy, for free, healthy lunches and not\-so\-healthy drinks/snacks at our offices.
* You can use the great benefits we offer for your physical and mental well\-being.
* You get a generous tech budget.
* You can build/test/experiment anything you want in our sandbox environments in GCP, AWS and Azure.
* You can attend our Xebia Knowledge Events, a bi\-weekly afternoon where our colleagues present their work and learnings.
* You can work on that innovative idea of yours during the monthly Xebia Data Fridays.
* You have 5\.000 Euros and 6 days of development budget per year which you can spend on anything that will make you a better data professional (starting from your second year).
* You also have a monthly mobility budget to spend on leasing a car, or leasing the e\-bike of your dreams, or getting a NS Business Card.
* Finally, we have a modern and dog friendly office in Amsterdam, Oostenburg.

 **WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

  

Within the Analytics Engineering team, we are looking for like\-minded people that we would like to work with. We are not looking for a specific type of professional. We all come from very different cultural and educational backgrounds. We love this diversity, and have built an inclusive culture around it. We do not judge, instead, we care about and support each other. We share a genuine curiosity about what we do, and together we get better at it every day. We look for people with this mindset before anything else. What we value the most is your curiosity and willingness to learn.

  

The Cross\-Skilling program is for candidates with data experience seeking to accelerate their technical prowess and focus on data. You will learn from seasoned colleagues and boost your career! **Do you have hands\-on experience with data, but want to grow into an Analytics Engineer by expanding your technical skills or expanding your knowledge? Then this program is for you!**


The program commences in **September 2025**, starting with a month of training conducted by our colleagues, designed to level up your technical skills. Following this, **you’ll immediately embark on client projects with the support of the Xebia Data team!**


If you already have ample experience working in analytics engineering, take a look at our regular Analytics Engineer role.

### **THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF…**

  

✅ You love creating value by solving various problems with data, in the most sustainable and robust way.


✅ You are trained as a data analyst, scientist or engineer but have a deep interest in data modelling and software engineering best practices.


✅ You are a jack\-of\-all\-trades, who wants to become a true authority in the field by learning new skills and trying out the latest data tools.


✅ If you live in the Netherlands.

  

THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF…

  

❌ You always take the academic approach to data and analytics and find it hard to be pragmatic.


❌ You do not enjoy communicating with stakeholders, getting to know the needs of the business, and formulating sustainable solutions.


❌ You do not want to become an authority. You are hesitant to take a proactive approach and bring your ideas forward.


❌ You dislike sharing knowledge by leading trainings, organizing workshops, or writing blog posts.


❌ You just graduated and don’t have any professional experience.

title: RAM System Engineer
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands**Reliability Specialist**


At the headquarters in Hengelo, the System Engineering department is responsible for designing new products and guiding both software and hardware development. Within this department, the Specialty Engineering team—consisting of around 30 engineers—handles the specification, analysis, and design of various system aspects, including system safety, eco\-design, reliability, availability, maintainability (RAM), human factors, diagnostics, data analytics, and electromagnetic compatibility (EMC).

**About the Job**


At Thales, our advanced radar and combat management systems must meet high standards for operational availability. As a Reliability Engineer, you’ll be an integral part of the System Engineering team, significantly contributing to system availability. Acting as an expert in reliability, availability, and maintainability, you play a key role in the design process. Currently, three full\-time reliability engineers work in this specialized team, alongside other designers involved in ensuring system reliability.


In the design phase, you’ll model solution approaches, analyze design alternatives, and assess them for reliability and maintainability. When appropriate, you’ll advise on alternative solutions that could offer better outcomes. You’ll skillfully balance effort, risks, other considerations, and the final result.


Your work will involve collaboration with other system engineers and professionals across disciplines such as design, testing, logistics, and product teams. You’ll study both theoretical and practical failure behaviors of systems at the component integration level, creating reports in the required customer format.


Reliability analyses of Thales Netherlands’ system components are conducted at the printed circuit board level through reliability prediction, and you’ll contribute to these processes, providing insights to the engineers involved. You’ll also incorporate practical insights from real\-world data on reliability and maintainability into future analyses and recommendations.


As an expert, you’re expected to stay up\-to\-date with developments in your field, gain experience with software tools and modeling techniques, and proactively engage with related engineering disciplines.

**About You**


We’re looking for a new colleague who:

* Holds a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical field
* Has a strong interest in RAM engineering (DfR, RBD, FMECA, MTBF, MTBCF, MTTR, 217Plus, parts stress, etc.)
* Can perform failure rate and MTBF calculations using tools and information provided by design engineers or suppliers
* Has an affinity for electronic components and electronics in general
* Wants to be part of the design process for complex technical systems
* Can see the big picture while also diving deep into technical details
* Possesses strong analytical and conceptual skills
* Is communicative, proactive, and comfortable discussing technical details as well as abstract concepts
* Works well both independently and as a team player in multidisciplinary teams
* Has a good command of English, both spoken and written

**What’s in It for You**

* You’ll be part of a dynamic team in a high\-tech, innovative, international environment
* Opportunities for growth within the organization, whether technical, managerial, commercial, or international
* Space for personal development and individual initiative
* A modern workplace with attention to work\-life balance and flexibility
* 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance, and the option to personalize your employment conditions (e.g., buying/selling hours, internet costs, bike plan, corporate fitness, union contributions, or relocation costs)

title: Diagnostics Developer
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands**About the team**


At the headquarters in Hengelo, the System Engineering department is responsible for designing new products and overseeing software and hardware development. Within this department, the Specialty Engineering group (consisting of about 30 engineers) focuses on the specification, analysis, and design of system aspects, including safety, eco\-design, reliability/availability/maintainability (RAM), diagnostics, data analytics, and electromagnetic compatibility (EMC).

**About your future job**


When developing advanced radar systems, Thales aims to minimize maintenance needs, ensure maintenance is simple and preferably predictable, and enable remote assistance if necessary. To achieve this, the Maintenance Intel team provides diagnostics, both through automated diagnostics embedded in products and via (remote) analysis of logged product data.


As a **Diagnostics Developer**, you will be responsible for developing automatic diagnostic functions for one or more radar products or components. During the design phase of a radar product, you will begin by writing specifications. The development teams will use these specifications to ensure your requirements are considered in the hardware and software development. This results in a complex product composed of dozens to hundreds of replaceable hardware components for transmission and reception functionality, digital processing, optics, servos, power distribution, and climate control—all incorporating your requirements.


You will regularly collaborate with electrical, mechanical, and software designers to identify potential failures, analyze their manifestations, and suggest improvements. You will dive into the design details and gain an in\-depth understanding of the system. Using this knowledge, you will create a model of hardware failure behavior and interactions—a complex model that predicts how a defect propagates and manifests as a pattern of software alarms and other indicators. With our tools, you will convert this model into software embedded in the product, allowing end users to receive system health information. During the step\-by\-step product integration, you will validate and refine this model in collaboration with the integration team. Your responsibility is to ensure that the product can ultimately diagnose itself accurately.


Once the system is in use by customers, you will assist service engineers with diagnosing difficult\-to\-troubleshoot problems. As a **digital detective**, you will use analysis tools to interpret logged product data, identifying and explaining abnormal product behavior. Based on your findings, you will provide feedback to service engineers and contribute to developing algorithms that will allow our data platform to automatically generate insights and recommendations in the future.

**Main tasks**

* Assessing the **self\-testability** of an electrical, mechanical, optical, or software design and suggesting improvements to enhance testability
* Developing a **diagnostic model** for a product or product components
* Improving the **diagnostic model** based on test results
* **Analyzing** logged product data to diagnose issues and improve the diagnostic model
* Continuously **enhancing** diagnostic system functions and tools in collaboration with your team

**We are looking for a new colleague who**

* Has a **bachelor’s (HBO) or master’s (WO) degree**
* Has experience with **Python** and preferably also with **Linux**
* Has an **affinity for electrical, mechanical, and software design**
* Possesses **strong analytical and conceptual skills**—able to think abstractly while also handling technical depth
* Is a **team player** who enjoys working in **multidisciplinary teams**, is communicative, takes initiative, and can collaborate effectively with engineers from various fields and departments
* Has a **good command of English**, both written and spoken

**What’s in it for you?**

* Be part of a **great team** in a **high\-tech, innovative, and international** environment
* Opportunities for **career growth** within the organization—whether technical, managerial, commercial, or international
* **Personal development** and room for **initiative**
* A **modern workspace** with a focus on **work\-life balance and flexibility**
* **40 vacation days per year**, **travel reimbursement**, and the ability to personalize your benefits package, including:


	+ Buying/selling hours
	+ Internet costs
	+ Bicycle plan
	+ Corporate fitness
	+ Trade union contribution
	+ Relocation costs

**Interested?**  

Click **"Apply now"** below to submit your application!

**Diversity Statement**  

We actively support working arrangements that fit your lifestyle and help you achieve your goals. Equal opportunities, inclusion, and an informal culture are fundamental to our success. Your **well\-being and happiness** matter to us! That’s why we offer flexibility in work arrangements, including **part\-time hours, job sharing, remote work, or flexible start and finish times**.

**Security Requirements**  

In line with Thales' **Baseline Security** requirements, candidates must provide proof of **identity, work eligibility in the Netherlands, and employment/education history**. Some positions may require **security clearance**, which involves additional documentation. For more details on security clearance requirements, please refer to the **General Intelligence and Security Service**.

title: Integrity Reliability Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We employ around 21 000 people mostly in our core markets in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK.

 **Job Description** **Step into a crucial role where innovative analytics and hands\-on engineering converge to drive wind turbine integrity and reliability. As an Integrity Reliability Engineer at Vattenfall, you’ll transform raw data into actionable insights, ensuring peak performance across our growing renewable portfolio. Collaborating with cross\-functional teams, you’ll develop and refine cutting\-edge dashboards, anticipate failure modes, and champion risk\-based decisions—all while shaping the future of clean energy. If you thrive on solving technical challenges, optimizing complex systems, and fostering a data\-driven culture, join us and power the journey toward a fossil\-free tomorrow.**


You will join **Asset Integrity** within Generation as our new **Integrity Reliability Engineer**, where we focus on ensuring the reliability and integrity of our wind farms across their entire lifecycle. This team serves as the central hub for analyzing, visualizing, and continuously improving integrity\-related data, with a main emphasis on reliability. By working closely with Asset Integrity Engineers, the Integrity Data Engineer, and other technical specialists, you will help develop and maintain dashboards, processes, and tools that keep our wind farm operations safe, efficient, and future\-ready.


Generation is the organization that is fully accountable for the Asset performance of Vattenfall’s offshore wind farms. This includes operating the wind farms through optimization of revenues in relation to the power market and maintaining the wind farms in a healthy, safe, sustainable and cost efficient way to ensure best availability and full compliance with requirement.

**Be in your element with BA Wind**


Our wind, solar and batteries business offers a unique opportunity to be in your element working to help harness the forces which will take us to fossil freedom.


As part of BA Wind, you will play a key role in one of the most exciting pipelines in the industry with 24GW of capacity stretching out more than a decade ahead across our key European markets.


You won’t only be involved in developing projects but also pioneering cutting\-edge innovation, new business models and ways of working with communities and the environment. Working as part of a leading European utility also means you could be helping a growing number of major businesses and brands achieve their own sustainability goals through partnerships.

 **Qualifications** **Your role**  

  

As an **Integrity Reliability Engineer**, you will be key contributor to developing and visualizing data\-driven insights on wind turbine reliability, always with risk mindset. Your primary focus is to support the development and refinement of dashboards—covering technical availability, workorder management, WTG performance, and more—that present a clear picture of asset health and visualizes risks to the entire organization. Collaborating closely with our Asset Integrity Engineers and the Integrity Data Engineer, you will use risk and reliability\-driven data analyses to optimize turbine performance, inform data\-based maintenance plans, and maintain asset integrity for a growing portfolio of wind farms. This position requires both technical expertise and a creative mindset to identify innovative solutions that enhance the reliability and visualizes the risks of our assets.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

**Reliability \& Analysis**:

* Conduct reliability evaluations for wind turbines and wind farm systems, estimating failure rates and consequences, focused around visualizing risks.
* Develop and implement ideas and concepts to improve our reliability models and analytical approaches.

**Asset Integrity Management**:

* Contribute to the ongoing development of the Asset Integrity Management System, ensuring the integrity of assets is maintained, documented, and visible throughout their lifecycle.
* Lead efforts in reliability and condition data management, supporting risk\-based decisions on asset maintenance.
* Advise colleagues on reliability analysis, troubleshooting, and operational best practices.

**Standardization \& Processes**:

* Document and standardize reliability\-focused technical decisions, processes, and tools.
* Support continuous development of the Asset Integrity framework by preparing and updating technology/process documents, ensuring a systematic approach is applied.

**Contract \& Stakeholder Support**:

* Provide reliability\-focused input to Employer Requirements and contractual agreements, collaborating with Procurement and Commercial Management on contract standards.

**IT Tools \& Innovation**:

* Identify requirements for IT tools or reporting dashboards to support reliability and integrity efforts.
* Test, validate, and provide feedback on new or updated tools, ensuring user\-friendliness and relevance.
* Offer training and support to stakeholders to maximize the dashboards’ impact.

 **Your profile / who are you?**


To excel in this position, you need industry experience in wind turbines or a related energy sector, with a particular focus on risk and/or reliability analysis and troubleshooting. You bring a proactive, forward\-thinking approach to your work, coupled with proven expertise in failure rate modelling and reliability tools (e.g., Reliasoft Weibull\+\+, BlockSim). Knowledge of mechanical and electrical systems, combined with a analytical foundation (potentially including risk management, mathematics or engineering with a reliability focus), enables you to produce clear, actionable insights. You communicate confidently in English, both verbally and in writing, and thrive on collaborating in cross\-functional, international teams. Your systematic work ethic, positive mindset, and ability to balance technical challenges with commercial considerations ensure that you deliver high\-quality solutions while fostering strong relationships across the organization:

* B.Sc or M.Sc. in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or Mathematics with a focus on reliability analysis.
* Industry experience in offshore wind or related energy sectors.
* Proven background in risk management and/or post\-processing field failure data and predicting failure rates using tools like Reliasoft (Weibull\+\+, BlockSim).
* Understanding of failure rate modelling and failure rate sensitivity analysis.
* Familiarity with wind turbine troubleshooting and maintenance in real\-world environments.
* Knowledge of management systems, processes, and procedures relevant to asset integrity.
* Result\-oriented mindset with strong organizational and prioritization abilities.
* Innovative thinker with the courage to propose new solutions and concepts.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative attitude, fostering teamwork across different functions.
* Effective communication skills in English (spoken and written); Danish or German language skills are a plus.
* Flexible approach to travel activity.

 **Why not start your journey to working for fossil freedom by applying now?**

 **Location** Kolding, Denmark – London, United Kingdom – Amsterdam, Netherlands.

 **Additional Information** **Our offer**

**Looking for a career with growth?**


Looking for a role where your superpowers can be leveraged to the maximum and with limitless opportunities for growth?


The scale and ambition of our wind, battery and solar business means you can really find your element with us. We’ll also provide you with all the learning and development you need to expand your horizons.


We strive to be the best place to work in the industry with highly competitive pay and conditions and an open, supportive culture. A commitment to a healthy work\-life balance aims to ensure everyone plays to their strengths, whatever their background and experiences.


You will be part of a growing team of 1,700\+ colleagues from 50\+ nationalities where our positive approach to diversity is reflected in the fact that more than a quarter of staff are women.

 **More Information**


For more informationabout the position, you are welcome to contact hiring manager Daniel Muus, daniel.muus@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter Christian Pathuel, christian.pathuel@vattenfall.com


We welcome your application in English no later than 15\.04\.2025\. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.


At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to building a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.


The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre\-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfil within Vattenfall and will be performed by a third party, Validata.


Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classified the final candidates might be subject to a security vetting process, according to Swedish legislation.

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Tech Graduate Program
location: Capelle aan den IJssel, ZH, NL
description:
ADP is hiring **Associate Graduate Developers.**


In this role, you will join a team to build and debug ADP’s cloud\-based payroll, tax, HR, and benefits solutions to help our customers save time, stay compliant and manage costs.


No two days are the same. As you join ADP, after your initial extensive trainng programme, you will work alongside a team of other passionate, creative developers to complete sprints identified during scrum meetings, where we tackle problems and prioritise what we code next. From concept to code, you’ll spend your days building new features as you continue to learn, grow and be supported by a team of experienced developers.


To thrive in this coding career, you’ll need to enjoy leaning new things and adapting to new languages and tools, both, industry standard and propriety. You’ll also benefit from some prior exposure to front\-end, scripting, and back\-end development. You don’t need to know every tool, but you’re an enthusiastic creator who likes to stay current and looks forward to trying new solutions. You’re always looking for that next best thing to make tools better.


Eagerness, enthusiam, creativity and team spirit are must\-haves in this job.  

You'll learn new things, get opportunities to grow your career, and develop solid friendships as we design what's next for ADP and the industry.


Like what you see?**Apply now!**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**


**Here’s what you can expect on a typical day in the life of an Associate Software Engineer at ADP.**

* We’ll start each day with a scrum, working together to understand responsibilities, ID any issues, and communicate coding priorities. As a Developer, you’ll do more than code, you’ll communicate, collaborate and seek to gain clarity and understanding from more experiencd colleagues and requirements from the product Owner.
* Working in two\-week sprints, you must keep up with timelines and coding standards, which will already be documented and brought to your attention.
* **Variety of work.** There is no typical day. You could work on anything from migrations to delivering new features, product enhancements, or creating new services.
* We’re always learning new codes and operating with a “figure it out” mentality.
* We’re working on products with tech that we’ve never used before. Inevitable challenges will arise, and we’ll rely on you to look for a solution.
* You’ll work in a continuous development environment using Git/Bitbucket and automatic build and testing.

**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**


* A bachelors or masters degree is great but not strictly required. What’s more important is proving that you have the skills to do the job.

We are hiring across multiple developer profiles.


* You could be someone with knowledge of Java (additional Kotlin familiarity would be a plus)  

Any exposure to any of these technologies would be desirable: Spring Boot, Docker Containers, Object Oriented programming **to develop on Backend**
* But you also could be a developer ready to learn and embrace new Frontend and Backend frameworks working with new technologies (RAD development / Configuration\-based development).

In either case you will have a logically minded approach, you will be adaptable and willing to learn with a high attention to details.


Nice\-to\-have: some SQL knowledge of data structure and concepts, some experience of code testing would be a plus, interested in code performance and quality.


**YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:**


* **Team collaboration.** You will be supported by a strong spirit of knowledge sharing and mutual assistance.
* **Challenge your solutions.** Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, develop a sense of ownership, and be willing to sometimes challenge one another’s ideas to net out the best solution.
* **Deliver at epic scale.** We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We’re obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.
* **Be surrounded by curious learners.** We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.
* **Act like an owner \& doer.** Like the idea of being mission\-driven and committed to navigating change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and develop your own abiolity to solve problems. You like the growth that comes from developing your strengths. We are hands\-on and willing to master our craft.
* **Give back to others.** You want to learn what it is to do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP’s Philanthropic Foundation.
* **Join a company committed to equality and equity.** Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.

What are you waiting for?**Apply today!**


**A little about ADP:** We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud\-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down\-to\-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.


**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion \& Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.


**Ethics at ADP:** ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life\-at\-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.
company_description: We create experiences, products, and services that people love using every day.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Arabic speaking)
description:
**Welcome to SkillLab**


At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change \- a transition towards skill\-based labor and education markets. Our AI\-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient markets by connecting people with jobs and education through the universal language of skills. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 35\+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.


SkillLab’s innovative use of AI was recognised with awards like Google AI for Impact, UNESCO Top 10 uses of AI and the European Social Innovation Competition 2021, among other awards.

**Your team**


You will join our User Experience (UX) team as our new Senior User experience/User Interface (UX/UI) Designer. You will be part of an join an expert UX team who champions user\-centered design, driving product success through insightful research and intuitive interface development.


Also, you will work in an international environment of ±65 SkillLabers from ±30 different countries in the heart of Amsterdam.


You will directly report to Dan, who is the UX Lead.


The UI/UX professionals that make the UX team so special are Giulia, Dimas, and Lorenzo.


You will also cooperate with our product management, engineering and Data science teams within the product function.


We are proud of the people we collaborate with and excited to work at a company with a strong social mission. We hope you will be too!

**Your responsibilities**

* You will be the UX owner of one or more of SkillLab’s major enterprise clients. You will work with clients and internal stakeholders to align on scope, product definition, and co\-create design solutions.
* You will contribute to the development of new features and products by understanding clients' needs through engagement workshops, concept development and iterative user research.
* You will work at different design altitudes to map out user journeys, create end\-to\-end flows, and produce detailed user interface design specifications for implementation.
* You will maintain and evolve our design system; introduce new components and adapt existing components to accommodate new functionality while maintaining interoperability with existing components.
* You will identify opportunities for foundational user research, and define, scope, plan and execute research with support from a dedicated User Experience Researcher.

**Requirements**

*Your skills*

* 5\+ years of work experience in User Experience Design or a related role, eg. User Interface, Interaction, Graphic, or Product design, etc. Combined experience in building products in\-house and working with external clients will be highly appreciated.
* Arabic language knowledge at a native level.
* Ability to present and advocate for design decisions with clients and stakeholders, ensuring alignment between user needs and business objectives.
* Deep understanding of user\-centered design principles.
* Proficiency in Figma design and prototyping.
* Data\-informed approach to making design decisions, leveraging usability testing, usage analytics, market research, etc.
* Flexibility and agility to adapt to changing requirements, and the initiative and leadership to create clarity from uncertainty
* Experience working directly with product managers and software engineers to maintain and use design systems

**Extra awesome**

* Experience planning and executing formative and evaluative UX research
* Experience working with HR tech, E\-learning or matching platforms
* Expertise in designing user experiences informed by best\-practices of designing for ML\- and recommender\-based systems

**Salary, start\-date \& location**

* We use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high\-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 55k\-65k Euro per year.
* We accept applications on a rolling basis, and we envision a start date as soon as possible.

**Benefits**

* You will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year (20 days as the statutory minimum holiday entitlement in the Netherlands plus 5 extra days from SkillLab).
* You can work flexibly from our office in Amsterdam and home within the Netherlands. You can also extend your holiday stay in a different country and work from abroad for a limited period of time.
* You will get an extensive relocation support to move to Amsterdam including visa sponsorship if needed, 30% ruling, your plane tickets, covered real estate agent fees etc.
* You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development.
* You will have access to mentors \& coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator).
* You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Alleo app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores.
* You will join our bi\-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, the Netherlands etc.

**What else to know?**

* Get 4 tips for your job application at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/skilllabjobapplication
* Read more about our compensation framework: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/skilllab\-compensation
* Learn more about SkillLab’s social life: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/social\-life\-at\-skilllab
* SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds. Read more about DEI: https://skilllab.io/en\-us/news/diversity\-equity\-and\-inclusion\-at\-skilllab

title: People Analytics Data Scientist
description:
You will work as a data scientist in our ING Global Strategy \& People Analytics team where we build and deploy analytics products, data science models \& dashboards to support all decisions about ING employees making ING a great place to work for.
  
  

You will work in a squad on the front\-line closely with business translators and data engineers to agree on the best way to support our stakeholders. You will play a pivotal role in the development and delivery of advanced analytics products embedded in ING’s HR processes.
  
  

How to succeed
  
We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  
  

**We are looking for you, if you:**  

have a good knowledge about machine learning and data science models
  
  

have hands\-on in SQL \& Python
  
  

have experience with git \& (big plus) with CI/CD tools in Azure DevOps
  
  

have experience in explaining your complex analysis to stakeholders
  
  

support the squad’s product owners with refining \& planning business questions
  
  

have willingness to learn, both on technical and interpersonal levels
  
  

(big plus) have experience with Power BI
  
  

**Roles and responsibilities :**  

Design, analyze and interpret business hypothesis and explore datasets through using available tools, you can manage stakeholders with their business challenges end\-to\-end, from problem, creating hypotheses, to building a small POC to show viability \& feasibility
  
  

Build or improve data\-driven analytical products using data science techniques
  
  

Recommend ideas to business when data and results are available through good visualizations or algorithms, you always think one step ahead, for example the best way of implementation
  
  

Assist users to understand the data science principles and when needed provide an explanation for the model behavior and possible correcting actions
  
  

Contribute to the data science chapter through knowledge sharing, improving our technical WoW, adopting new algorithms or technologies, presenting your work to the analytics community, and supporting team members with your expertise
  
  

Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting. Individual development of our employees is particularly important and that is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. The role is “Data Scientist III” in the global ING job architecture with a monthly salary (depends on your experience) in the range of 4\.367,65 and 7\.088,63 based on a 36\-hours working week.
  
  

Are you keen to know more or apply?
  
For further inquiries, please contact the recruitment team. We are looking forward to getting to know you. An assessment of technical skills will be a part of the selection process. Your name and email address will be shared by the third\-party assessment provider. Please check Privacy Statement for ING Job Applicants https://www.ing.com/Privacy\-Statement.htm
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

* A salary indication in scale 10 between 4,367 and 7,088 EUR based on a 36\-hour working week
* 24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues


About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**What We Do:**
As the world becomes increasingly connected, the demand for cybersecurity solutions has never been greater. Forescout stands at the forefront of this critical need, delivering automated cybersecurity that ensures continuous alignment between our customers’ security frameworks and their evolving digital environments. Our platform protects all asset types, including IT, IoT, OT, and IoMT, helping organisations navigate and secure the complexities of the modern connected world.

Join us in securing the world. We seek resourceful, driven individuals to collaborate as one team, delivering exceptional customer experiences. We’re passionate about tackling the toughest security challenges and staying ahead with innovative solutions. Here, every idea is valued, and visionaries are welcomed. Bring your unique perspective and help shape the future of cybersecurity with us.
**Position Overview:** We are seeking an experienced Senior Software Engineer with deep expertise in cloud infrastructure, networking, and modern data services—particularly within Azure environments. The successful candidate will play a critical role in designing, building, and optimizing the infrastructure and services underpinning our cybersecurity data ecosystem.
**Key Responsibilities:*** Architect, develop, and manage robust cloud infrastructure solutions leveraging Azure services such as Azure Synapse, Azure Data Explorer (ADX), and Azure Networking.
* Ensure high availability, security, and scalability of our cloud infrastructure to support extensive data workloads.
* Develop data pipelines and infrastructure automation using Python, Java, and optionally Perl, enhancing performance, reliability, and operational efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to integrate cloud services with broader cybersecurity initiatives, though prior cybersecurity expertise is not mandatory.
* Provide technical leadership, mentor junior engineers, and drive best practices across the team.

**Required Qualifications:*** Strong foundational knowledge of cloud computing concepts, particularly in Azure (including Synapse Analytics, ADX, Azure Networking).
* Demonstrable experience with infrastructure management and network configuration in **Azure**.
* Proficiency in **Python and Java**; familiarity with Perl is beneficial but not required.
* Experience or familiarity with Apache Spark is a plus.
* Proven track record of building resilient, scalable cloud infrastructure.


**Preferred Qualifications (Nice\-to\-have):*** Exposure to cybersecurity concepts, though not required.
* Experience with big data platforms and frameworks such as Spark.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD, infrastructure\-as\-code).


We encourage you to apply if you meet most but not all the desired skills and experience listed in this job posting. We value competencies, aptitude, and a great attitude as supplement to experience.
**Why Join Us:*** Contribute to building innovative solutions at the intersection of cloud technology and cybersecurity.
* Opportunity to work in a challenging, high\-impact role within a rapidly evolving technology landscape.
* Be part of a team that values continuous learning, innovation, and technical excellence.

**What Forescout Offers You:**
Competitive compensation and benefits – generous PTO policy, and much more.
Collaborative and innovative environment – make an impact on worldwide security while working on the hottest technology.
Leadership that supports and encourages professional growth and development.

At Forescout, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of background, experiences, and perspectives leads to innovation, creativity, and better decision making. We strive to create an environment where all team members feel valued, respected, and empowered. We actively promote equal opportunities and fair treatment for all individuals, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. By embracing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, we aspire to build a successful culture where we work together and win together as One Team.

\#LI\-AO1

title: Service Technician
description:
Service Technician


Wärtsilä is a world leader in marine technology and leading the industry's transformation towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. With the world’s widest portfolio and service network, we – Wärtsilians \- deliver efficient, safe and sustainable integrated products and solutions to enhance the business of our customers. The opportunities presented through digitalisation and new technologies are offering a new era of shipping. Did you know that shipping is the world’s most efficient mode of transportation and that 88% of the world's trade is carried by sea?  

  

We want to change the course towards an interconnected and cleaner maritime future and are constantly on the lookout for future\-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services \- together. Are you ready to jump onboard?

“Does your technical heart beats faster for smart technologies? Join our team to see the world, gain knowledge and experience, and never forget to have fun in a job you love!”  


**Field Service Technician Marine – Central Europe**  


We are now looking for a Field service Technician to join our field service team which will become acquainted with different disciplines within our portfolio, like 4\-stroke and Propulsion both electrically and mechanically. After your acquaintance, we will determine in good consultation in which discipline you familiarize and specialize yourself in.  


**What will you be doing?**
In this position, you first will be acquainted and basically trained in several disciplines. Training will be done through our online training programs, following Face to Face training at our Land and Sea Academy’s, cooperate in our local workshops and in the Field together with your skilled and mentoring colleagues. After your acquaintance period is finalized, your training will continue in a specific discipline, and you will be trained to Field Service Engineer with the opportunity to develop yourself further to Super intendent.  


For us to be the best match, we expect you to have low basic knowledge of Electronics and/or Mechatronics.  


As a Field Service Technician your work will focus on these responsibilities:
* Follow all arranged product trainings
* Follow workshop procedures
* Follow all required safety trainings
* Listen, observe and learn

  


To be successful in this role, we expect you to have:
* Flexible mentality
* A “can do” mindset
* Safe work standard
* Proper and respectful work ethics
* Resident in the Netherlands and in possession of a driver's license.

  


In this role you will travel primarily in the central Europe region, while further abroad every now and then won’t be a problem for you in good collaboration.  


**Why you and us?**
We at Wärtsilä believe in empowerment, ownership and taking responsibility of our work. We support each other’s growth, and co\-creation is the true basis of our innovation. We have courage to see opportunities and take initiative.
We are authentic and honest, and we strongly believe in that by being your own true self you can accomplish so much more. We don’t always get it right the first time, and if mistakes are made, we make sure to learn and grow from them. We want everyone to voice their opinions freely. That is why we have built an environment that empowers you and everyone around you, and where you can feel safe and cared for. Are you eager to be part of this ambition?  


**This is Wärtsilä;**  

Wärtsilä Marine Power leads the industry in its journey towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. Our portfolio of engines, propulsion systems, hybrid technology, and integrated powertrain systems deliver the reliability, safety, and environmental performance that Wärtsilä’s Smart Marine vision encompasses.  


We offer our customers performance\-based agreements, lifecycle solutions, and an unrivalled global network of maritime expertise. www.wartsila.com/marine Wärtsilä is a global leader in smart technologies and complete lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. By emphasising sustainable innovation, total efficiency and data analytics, Wärtsilä maximises the environmental and economic performance of the vessels and power plants of its customers.  



Last application date: 15/04/2025  


At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job\-relevant merits and abilities.

title: Analytics Engineer – Cross-Skilling program
description:
**DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**

  

Your passion is data and analytics. You want to create value for our clients by uncovering, organizing, and making sense of data. You understand that it is important to build robust solutions. You feel comfortable operating in the sweet spot between business and engineering and are eager to learn more and build robust systems next to our experienced team!

 **WHAT YOU WILL DO TO MAKE ORGANIZATIONS DATA\-DRIVEN**

  

The Analytics Engineer is the bridge between business and analytics. You understand what data can bring to the organization. With your effective communication skills, you help uncover business needs and how to support them with data, reporting, and visualization, enabling data democratization by improving the reliability and accessibility of data products. In the past our team has implemented software engineering best practices to write production\-grade data pipelines, making high\-quality data available for creating business value with analytics. We enjoy great success in making top organizations data\-driven — just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team!

  

Check out our website or one of our customer stories to get a more detailed understanding of what we do.


Interested in learning more about how and why the role of Analytics Engineering emerged? You can read this blogpost from one of our Analytics Engineers!

 **WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE A CONSULTANT AT XEBIA DATA**

  

As a consultant at Xebia Data, you will have projects of varying length. Some are 2 weeks, some are 1 year, most are in between. Every project is different, as is every client. We, however, always deliver the best quality possible. It is not always easy, but it is always rewarding. You will have exposure to different companies, different problems, different systems and solutions. You will be surrounded by experts in different fields, and you will learn so many new things in a short time. Xebia Data offers the perfect environment to shine as a data professional.


You will never be alone on this journey. We have all experienced imposter syndrome, had a difficult project, or felt down at times. We know what it takes, we know it is difficult sometimes, and we will be there for you when you need it. We say People First, and we mean it.


Xebia Data offers you great benefits too, of course!

* You can enjoy, for free, healthy lunches and not\-so\-healthy drinks/snacks at our offices.
* You can use the great benefits we offer for your physical and mental well\-being.
* You get a generous tech budget.
* You can build/test/experiment anything you want in our sandbox environments in GCP, AWS and Azure.
* You can attend our Xebia Knowledge Events, a bi\-weekly afternoon where our colleagues present their work and learnings.
* You can work on that innovative idea of yours during the monthly Xebia Data Fridays.
* You have 5\.000 Euros and 6 days of development budget per year which you can spend on anything that will make you a better data professional (starting from your second year).
* You also have a monthly mobility budget to spend on leasing a car, or leasing the e\-bike of your dreams, or getting a NS Business Card.
* Finally, we have a modern and dog friendly office in Amsterdam, Oostenburg.

 **WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

  

Within the Analytics Engineering team, we are looking for like\-minded people that we would like to work with. We are not looking for a specific type of professional. We all come from very different cultural and educational backgrounds. We love this diversity, and have built an inclusive culture around it. We do not judge, instead, we care about and support each other. We share a genuine curiosity about what we do, and together we get better at it every day. We look for people with this mindset before anything else. What we value the most is your curiosity and willingness to learn.

  

The Cross\-Skilling program is for candidates with data experience seeking to accelerate their technical prowess and focus on data. You will learn from seasoned colleagues and boost your career! **Do you have hands\-on experience with data, but want to grow into an Analytics Engineer by expanding your technical skills or expanding your knowledge? Then this program is for you!**


The program commences in **September 2025**, starting with a month of training conducted by our colleagues, designed to level up your technical skills. Following this, **you’ll immediately embark on client projects with the support of the Xebia Data team!**


If you already have ample experience working in analytics engineering, take a look at our regular Analytics Engineer role.

### **THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF…**

  

✅ You love creating value by solving various problems with data, in the most sustainable and robust way.


✅ You are trained as a data analyst, scientist or engineer but have a deep interest in data modelling and software engineering best practices.


✅ You are a jack\-of\-all\-trades, who wants to become a true authority in the field by learning new skills and trying out the latest data tools.


✅ If you live in the Netherlands.

  

THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF…

  

❌ You always take the academic approach to data and analytics and find it hard to be pragmatic.


❌ You do not enjoy communicating with stakeholders, getting to know the needs of the business, and formulating sustainable solutions.


❌ You do not want to become an authority. You are hesitant to take a proactive approach and bring your ideas forward.


❌ You dislike sharing knowledge by leading trainings, organizing workshops, or writing blog posts.


❌ You just graduated and don’t have any professional experience.

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer
description:
Exciting and uplifting career moments are waiting for you at the **PPHE Hotel Group.**
Every day we create valuable memories for our guests and stakeholders – accross our international portfolio of prime hospitality real estate, encompassing iconic hotels, seaside resorts, glamping and campsites, destination restaurants, buzzing bars and more! And driving it all, behind the scenes, are our support teams.

**The Role:**
As a **Senior Cloud Data Engineer**, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You will support with the development of the company's data platform on GCP, driving its architecture, implementation, and maintenance, while ensuring it meets the company's needs and goals. You will support the company’s strategy by developing dashboards and visualisations answering key analytical needs.

**Key Responsibilities*** Data Solutions: Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for analytics and operational use, ensuring efficient data flow and processing. Design and implement processes for data integration and transformation, ensuring seamless data flow between systems.
* Data Visualization: Create visualizations and reports using tools such as Looker to unlock valuable insights and support real\-time decision\-making by integrating seamlessly with cloud\-based datasets and systems.
* Data Governance and Quality: Ensure data quality and consistency across various sources, implementing best practices for data governance, data security, and compliance. Establish and enforce data management policies, standards, and procedures to ensure reliable and accurate data across the organization.
* Cloud Solution Selection and Cost Management: Select appropriate cloud solutions to meet business needs, managing cloud costs effectively to ensure budget alignment and cost efficiency.
* Technical Partnerships: Manage relationships with technical partners and consultants to ensure smooth collaboration and alignment with company goals. Communicate with rest of teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate with peer data engineers, fostering their professional growth and development. Prioritize business requirements as communicated by the Data Insights Lead. Collaborate with departments and stakeholders to align data solutions with business needs and ensure effective project delivery.
* Documentation and Performance Monitoring: Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation for data processes, pipelines, and infrastructure. Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and optimize system performance to ensure reliability and efficiency.
* AI Initiatives: Be an integral part of AI projects for the group, contributing technical expertise and supporting the implementation of AI solutions. Participate in cross\-functional projects to integrate AI models into data pipelines and deploy them in production environments. Stay updated with the latest AI and machine learning trends, tools, and technologies to drive innovation within the company.

**Requirements:**

* Academic degree in Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science or related fields
* Solid experience in developing in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or similar cloud based solution
* Relevant programming skills (Python, SQL, Java)
* Proven experience with developing and maintaining dashboards and data analysis solutions. Good knowledge of Looker is a plus
* Evidence required of self\-managed projects and assisting more junior members
* Previous experience with hospitality data use cases, working with Property Management System data, will be a strong plus
* Results driven and dedication to answer business users’ needs, along with flexibility to adjust to changes in strategy when necessary
* Full working proficiency in English
* Already being based in the Netherlands is a plus

**What you get as Senior Cloud Data Engineer:**

* Birthday bonus of €250 (gross, paid in the month of your birthday)
* Competitive salary
* Tasty meal during shift
* Industry pension plan
* 25 days holiday
* 1 extra day off for your wellbeing
* Exciting job opportunities within PPHE Hotel Group across Europe
* Discounted hotel rates (extends to the Radisson Hotel Group worldwide and family \& friends)
* 50% F\&B discount at our restaurants and bars (for your whole party)
* Travel compensation (max €200 net pm based on full\-time employment)
* Recommend a friend scheme (earn up to €750 for each friend who joins us)
* 8% holiday allowance (paid yearly in May)
* Flexible working policy (if applicable)
* Annual company parties and outings
* Exclusive discounts in the employee benefit store (www.personeelsvoordeelwinkel.nl)
* Discount on the collective health insurance from VGZ
* Departmental incentive schemes
* Great (online) Learning \& Development opportunities to grow your career
* An advanced onboarding program
* Access to the hotel gym during low peak hours


and more…**PPHE Hotel Group. Create with us.**

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
**Role:** 
 Lead Data Platform Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 IJsselstein
   

  

**About us:** 
 The Royal Terberg Group is globally active in the development, production, and service of specialized vehicles for ports, logistics, and waste collection. As a family\-owned company, we prioritize our people. Guided by our core values, we focus on sustainable growth and innovation, which has led to our success for over 155 years. Since 2014, we have been investing in electric vehicles and are extensively testing with hydrogen. We aim to responsibly manage our environment so that future generations can continue our success.
   

  

 When it comes to data, it is an exciting time to join our company as we are at a pivotal moment. We are in the midst of restructuring our data organization, defining and rolling out our data strategy, and working towards our future data architecture.
   

  

 You can be part of this journey and – together with the rest of the organization – help us to realize our growth ambitions by leveraging data!
   

  

**Your team:** 
 You will become part of our data team at Terberg Group, which is currently being expanded. From the group, our data team is responsible for building and maintaining the data platform for data users in all our companies. In this, you are working with data and cloud engineers to do this successfully (to be hired). Furthermore, there are data roles in our organization that focus on building datasets, reporting, and advanced AI \& data product teams (to be hired).
   

  

 As we are in the midst of changing data journey, we are actively looking for more roles to grow the team. The overall aim of the team is to optimize our company’s processes and achieve added value business goals through the effective use of data \& AI.
   

  

**Your role:** 
 As a Lead Data Platform Engineer, you will work on the data foundation of our organization. With your knowledge of Cloud, data structures, pipelines, and data platforms, combined with our ambitions and challenges, we will take steps together towards our future data\-driven organization. You will be broadly challenged with opportunities to develop in data architecture, data engineering, cloud engineering and data science.
   

  

 You will start by expanding and maintaining our ETL/ELT pipelines, professionalizing our data foundations (e.g., IaaC, CI/CD, central orchestration of pipelines, etc.) scaling our data Warehouse/Lakehouse, contributing to building data marts and data products, and setup (near) real\-time data flows.
   

  

 You will work closely with the members of the group data team, representatives from other Terberg companies, and you will have an important role in building our data team and technical platform. You will report to the Group Data Manager.
   

  

**Tasks and Responsibilities:**
* Data platform development: as Lead Data Platform Engineer you are responsible for building our data platform, with all its components: scalability, security, cost\-effectiveness, etc. You are expected to have a leading role in determining and maintaining our technical data platform, serving an array of different use cases like reporting, AI/ML cases, real\-time streaming, etc.
* Coaching colleagues: as the leading role in our technological data landscape, we expect you to work with other data roles in our organization to improve their skills and ways of working. For example, to make sure they use our data platform as effectively as possible.
* Data integrations and pipelines: you are responsible for building data pipelines that connect source systems with our data platform to create data products. We distinct analytical data streams and (near) real\-time data streams that feed into operational applications and external APIs. The data flows through our platform should provide clear lineage to support maintenance, monitoring, and the understandability.
* Data product management: as Platform Lead, you will have strong contributions to how we build our data products, making sure they are goal\-oriented (serving the purpose of the data product), cost\-effective, and sustainable (e.g. stable performance, possible to update, accessible, well\-described, and easy to maintain)
* Collaboration: as Lead Data Platform Engineer you will work in multidisciplinary teams with people in various roles to collectively provide the best data solutions for Terberg (also including internal, external, local, and group).


**Required Skills and Expertise:**
 We value curiosity and the ability to learn new techniques more than having the perfect experience for what we need today. However, there are some must\-have expertise that we expect from our Lead Data Platform Engineer.
   

  

**Must have:**
* Strong experience in the Azure Cloud
* Strong background in building and maintaining data pipelines (ELT/ETL), including both for analytical and real\-time purposes
* Strong proficiency in SQL (a.o. knowledge of stored procedures)
* Understanding of data governance, data quality, and security best practices
* Architectural knowledge of analytical data stores (like medallion architecture) and dimensional data modeling techniques.
* Curiosity and ability to learn new techniques and apply them hands\-on in a business context.
* Analytical problem\-solving skills: Both independently and as part of a team


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with at least a few from: Python, Bash/Shell, Scala, Go, DAX
* Experience in relevant tooling like: Data Factory, Synapse, dbt, Fabric, Data Bricks, APIs (incl. Gateways)
* Experience with IaaC and containerization, for example with Azure Bicep, Terraform, ARM JSON, Kubernetes, or Docker.
* Working in agile project environments and with tools like Jira, Confluence, etc.
* Experienced in using Git solutions like Azure DevOps or GitHub.
* Experience with ERP data and expertise in the manufacturing industry is considered a pre


**Profile of the ideal candidate:** 
 We're looking for a Lead Data Platform Engineer who loves solving problems and working with different teams to create top\-notch data solutions. You pay attention to detail and focus on designing solid data architectures. You're always eager to learn new things and apply them practically, while also being aware of your strengths and areas to improve.
   

  

**What do we offer you?**
 A dynamic and pivotal role within an international family\-owned company that is a market leader in its segment, with healthy expansion ambitions, and a continuous focus on innovation, improvement, and development.
   

  

* Competitive salary, ranging from €72K to €87K excluding company bonus
* Great additional perks: 25 days holiday allowance (option to purchase more), strong pension plan, office gym, yoga lessons, team events, and many more…
* Hybrid Work Environment: With flexible working hours to ensure a good work\-life balance.
* Professional and Personal Development: Opportunities for growth and training to further develop your skills.
* Multidisciplinary Teams: Work in diverse teams.
* Collegial Atmosphere: Enjoy a friendly work environment


**Apply now:** 
 are you the Lead Data Platform Engineer we are looking for? Apply directly!
   

  

 Not 100% sure about the fit between our company, the role, and you, please reach out to us and tell us what you think. We are looking forward to your application!
