title: Senior AI Expert 100% Remote (m/f/d)
description:
**Are you a highly skilled AI engineer with a passion to support in creating and maintaining AI tools?**  

  

**Who is Digistore24?**


Join one of Europe’s fastest\-growing tech companies, dedicated to shaping the digital future. We empower entrepreneurs worldwide by providing innovative e\-commerce solutions and expert guidance to help them turn their visions into successful businesses. Our company is built on a foundation of creativity, innovation, and a passion for technology. At Digistore24, you’ll be a part of a vibrant, forward\-thinking team that values individuality, sustainability, and collaboration while working to make a real impact in the digital landscape from anywhere you call home.

**Your new dream job**

* **Creating AI Applications Tailored to Business Use Cases Using OpenAI:** Design and implement advanced AI applications leveraging the OpenAI platform to address specific business challenges in areas such as customer and vendor support.
* **Integrating AI Applications into Existing Business Infrastructure:** Collaborate closely with the IT team to seamlessly integrate OpenAI\-powered functionalities into existing corporate systems and workflows.
* **Monitoring and Maintaining AI Applications:** Monitor the performance of deployed AI applications, ensuring they run efficiently and accurately, and implement regular updates and optimizations as necessary.
* **Data Analysis and Processing:** Process, analyze, and visualize large datasets to generate insights that are critical for fine\-tuning AI application performance and informing strategic decisions.
* **Participating in Training and Development Programs:** Actively engage in ongoing training to stay informed about the latest developments in AI, particularly within the OpenAI ecosystem, and continuously enhance technical expertise
* **Demonstrate Strategic Business Thinking**: You are product\-minded and take ownership of your work. You want to understand the problem, the business case, and make pragmatic decisions.

 **Your benefits at Digistore24**


You will play a crucial role in shaping our cutting\-edge projects in our collaborative work environment – while enjoying flexibility in working time and location.

* Enjoy the flexibility of working from your home office, provided you have uninterrupted internet access
* Benefit from regular further education and continuous learning opportunities
* Experience the stability of a highly successful German high\-tech company, funded by its product success and not by its investors
* Regular **further education**
* The **stability** of an extremely successful German high\-tech company that is **funded by its successful product** and not by investors
* Work in outcome\-focused teams with a culture of direct feedback
* **Modern equipment:** Utilize modern equipment in a flexible and international work setting
* International, **collaborative team** with strong cohesion
* Engage in spectacular Engage in spectacular team events across various European countries. across various European countries
* Enjoy **autonomy from day one**, with a friendly, informal atmosphere.
* Work in your **team on a first\-name basis**, without a dress code, and at eye level
* **Flexible working hours** from Mondays to Fridays
* **Flat hierarchies** and **short decision\-making paths**: our co\-founders are part of our team \- we operate on our own without external investors and reinvest everything we generate
* **Regular on\-the\-job training** \- You decide for yourself what you need for your further development, in consultation with the team lead
* **Personal responsibility** from day one: With us, you are not a cog in the system, but an important part of an A\-player team and are personally encouraged (and challenged!) by the team lead, including in monthly one\-on\-one meetings

 **Your superpower**

* **Analytical and Solution\-Oriented Thinking:** Strong ability to systematically analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions using critical thinking and structured approaches.
* **Passion for AI and Data Science:** High enthusiasm for AI powered applications and data science, with ongoing efforts to stay updated on trends and technologies in AI.
* **Project Management:** Experience in organizing and executing projects efficiently and goal\-oriented, with the ability to plan and deliver autonomously.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication abilities to convey technical information clearly to colleagues and stakeholders.
* **Flexibility and Willingness to Take on Challenges:** Openness to handle tasks outside core expertise when needed, showing motivation and contributing to team goals in unfamiliar areas.
* **Robust Software):** Strong ability to write clean, maintainable, and well\-documented Python code following best practices, including testing, version control, and modular design principles, to ensure the robustness and scalability of AI applications.
* **OpenAI API (Developing AI Applications with OpenAI):** Extensive experience in utilizing the OpenAI API to create and fine\-tune AI applications tailored to business use cases, including prompt engineering, model customization, and integration.
* **FastAPI (Deploying AI Applications via Documented API Endpoints):** Expertise in developing and maintaining API interfaces with FastAPI for securely and efficiently deploying OpenAI\-powered applications.
* **SQL, SQLAlchemy \& Pandas (Database Management):** Proficient in handling relational databases using SQL and SQLAlchemy. Skilled in data manipulation and extraction using Pandas for supporting AI\-driven applications and decision\-making.
* **Visualization Tools (Data Analysis and Insights):** Advanced skills in creating visual representations of data insights using tools like Matplotlib and Seaborn, aiding in business decision\-making and AI performance monitoring.

**This position is NOT right for you if you:**

* **…lack practical experience with AI application development and the OpenAI ecosystem.** This job requires hands\-on expertise in designing, deploying, and optimizing AI solutions using the OpenAI platform.
* **…are not willing to continuously learn and stay updated with the latest advancements in AI technology.** The AI field evolves rapidly, and ongoing learning is essential to remain effective and innovative in this role.
* **…struggle with working independently and taking initiative.** This position demands a high level of autonomy, problem\-solving skills, and proactive engagement with tasks and challenges.
* **…are inflexible about adapting to shifting priorities and contributing beyond your core responsibilities.** Flexibility to tackle diverse tasks and collaborate across functional boundaries is crucial for team success.
* **…have difficulty explaining technical concepts clearly to team members and stakeholders.** Effective communication, especially the ability to convey complex AI\-related topics in an understandable way, is key for this role.
* ... do not identify with **our values**

**Our values**  

https://careers.digistore24\.com/en/culture\-and\-core\-values


Please take a REALLY close look at the values. Are you ready to live them?

title: Founding AI Frontend Developer
description:
**Founding AI Frontend Developer \|** **naptha.ai**
===================================================

**About the role:** We are seeking a talented frontend developer to join our team as a founding member, focusing on rapidly developing and deploying dynamic user interfaces for products built on our custom multi\-agent system stack. This role involves creating intuitive, responsive, and powerful interfaces that enable users to interact seamlessly with our AI systems. The ideal candidate will have expertise in modern frontend development, UI/UX design principles, and experience with real\-time web applications and AI\-powered interfaces.

* Design and implement intuitive, responsive interfaces that effectively visualize complex AI agent interactions and workflows
* Develop and optimize React/JavaScript applications that support AI\-driven user experiences
* Rapidly prototype and iterate on UIs based on user feedback and evolving product requirements
* Work closely with our AI engineering team to ensure frontend components effectively leverage our multi\-agent system capabilities
* Create reusable UI components and establish frontend architecture patterns for future development
* Implement real\-time data visualization and interaction patterns that help users understand and control AI agent behaviors
* Ensure high performance, accessibility, and cross\-browser compatibility of all user interfaces
* Contribute to the overall product vision and help define the user experience of our multi\-agent systems

**In this role, you're a good fit if you have:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Web Development, Design, or related field
* 3\+ years of experience in frontend development with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in React, TypeScript, JavaScript, Vue, or similar modern frontend frameworks
* Experience with state management libraries (Redux, MobX, Zustand), responsive web design, and building complex interactive user interfaces
* Strong understanding of UI/UX design principles, HTML5, CSS3, and best practices for AI\-driven applications
* Familiarity with WebSocket, GraphQL, REST APIs or similar technologies for real\-time data handling
* Experience with data visualization libraries (D3\.js, Chart.js, Three.js, etc.)
* Knowledge of frontend build tools and workflows (Webpack, Vite, npm, yarn)
* Strong problem\-solving skills and ability to work in a fast\-paced startup environment
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross\-functional teams
* Passion for AI technologies, LLMs, and human\-AI interaction paradigms

**About the hiring process:**

* Video interview with hiring manager
* Take\-home project
* Presentation of take\-home project to panel
* Interview with co\-founders

**Compensation \& Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and equity stake for role and stage of company
* Commensurate with experience

title: Software Engineer II - Geospatial Data Processing
description:
*Ready to help shape the future of digital maps?*  

Our Map Data Processing Team in Map Visualization product unit, transforms TomTom’s raw map data into powerful, cost\-effective formats that fuel TomTom’s cloud\-based APIs. By tackling large\-scale data challenges, we make the world’s navigation faster, more accurate, and more accessible.  

We handle scalability and performance in processing massive geospatial datasets. Our work ensures that millions of end users—ranging from internal TomTom customers such as Map Display API, Premium Map Display and 3D Maps, to external partners like Bing Maps and automotive customers such as Stellantis and JLR. to see up\-to\-date and high\-quality maps. Our pipelines are built on modern AWS infrastructure, combining Java development, scripting, and geospatial expertise to meet evolving customer needs.
### **What you’ll do**

* Improve and extend our map data processing pipeline, which transforms TomTom's map data into rich, fresh, and cost\-effective formats for online map visualization.
* Work in an Agile team that own their backlog, apply Design Patterns, TDD, and SOLID principles, and strive for high\-quality code.
* Write clean, maintainable code using Java and scripting languages (Python, Bash).
* Optimize geospatial data transformations for speed, cost, and accuracy.
* Leverage AWS technologies, GitHub Actions, Docker, and Terraform to build and maintain scalable data pipelines.
* Participate in code reviews, share insights, and learn from senior engineers’ feedback.
* Investigate and fix issues in production environments, driving continuous improvements to our workflows and processes.
* Stay curious: step into new areas within the team’s domain, contributing to design discussions and feature implementations.

### **What you’ll need**

* A solid foundation in Java development (object\-oriented design, performance optimization).
* 2\-4 years of relevant software engineering experience or a comparable academic background.
* Hands\-on experience with AWS or similar cloud services.
* Hands\-on experience with CI/CD (e.g., GitHub Actions, Terraform).
* Basic knowledge of geospatial technologies (JTS, GDAL, PostGIS) or a strong interest in learning.
* Problem\-solving mindset: comfortable analyzing requirements, resolving straightforward issues, and delivering tested, efficient solutions.
* Team player attitude: open to collaboration, learning from others, and coaching more junior team members.
* Communicative and proactive: able to seek out help, clarify requirements, and drive tasks to completion.

**What we offer**  

A competitive compensation package, of course.  

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e\-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.  

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.  

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.  

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.  

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.  

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.  

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.  

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!  

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location. **Meet your team**  

We are the Map Visualization Product Unit. We develop map rendering technology that can be integrated into navigation systems and location\-based applications, providing our technology to our customers in the form of cloud\-based APIs and SDKs.  

We see quality\-management processes as a source of competitive advantage. As part of our product\-led and outcome\-oriented culture, we believe it is crucial to have mechanisms in place to measure and improve the quality of our products in a continuous manner so we can achieve our mission of mapping the world in real time. **At TomTom...**  

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first\-ever real\-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.  

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem\-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them. **After you apply**  

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow\-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs. **TomTom is an equal opportunity employer**  

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, *you*. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: At TomTom, we want to engineer the first real-time map. You might think it has been done before but it hasn't. Help us make it happen – become a mapmaking trailblazer.

title: Commissioning Engineer - Data Center
description:
**About the Job**  

Oleson specialise in delivering high quality talent and solutions that enhance the capabilities and operational excellent of our global customers.
We are focused on matching the dynamic needs of Data Centre and Life Science clients with skilled professionals, thereby driving innovations and in growth in these critical sectors.
**About the** **Role****:**
We are looking for a Commissioning Engineer to join our team. In the role you will partner with a hyperscale Data Center client to ensure delivery of mission critical projects.
**What you’ll do:**
Commission and integrate BMS for data centers, focusing on HVAC and process water systems.
Perform loop checks and sequence testing to verify system functionality.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure proper design and functionality.
Utilize Allen Bradley PLCs for automation, troubleshooting, and programming adjustments.
Integrate and maintain Ignition SCADA for real\-time monitoring and process visualization.
Troubleshoot and configure BMS networks, including switch configurations and communication issues.
Work with contractors and vendors to meet design and performance requirements.
Conduct field tests, resolve issues, and optimize system performance.
Document commissioning procedures, findings, and as\-built data.
Ensure compliance with safety standards.

**What you need:**
Proven BMS commissioning experience in data centers, with expertise in HVAC and process water systems.
Strong knowledge of Allen Bradley PLCs and Ignition SCADA.
Hands\-on experience with control system programming, ladder logic, and HMI/SCADA configuration.
Proficiency in BACnet, Modbus, and other BMS communication protocols.
Ability to interpret P\&IDs, electrical schematics, and sequence of operations.
Expertise in BMS network troubleshooting, including switch configurations.
Excellent problem\-solving skills and ability to work in fast\-paced environments.
Strong communication and teamwork abilities.

title: VR DEVELOPER - MEDIOR LEVEL - ONSITE
description:
**VR DEVELOPER \- LEVEL: MEDIOR \- ONSITE**


Beyond Sports is an AI\-based data analysis and visualization company that offers a new way of experiencing sports. Our Emmy Award\-winning visualization platform enables real\-time digital sports engagement solutions for leagues, broadcasters, brands and ultimately the end consumers. We deliver sports content spreading from traditional media all the way to the Metaverse. As part of Sony's Sports Businesses, we aim at shaking up the industry through data and entertainment.

  

WORK AS A VR DEVELOPER


We are looking for a VR Developer. You will collaborate with other highly skilled colleagues to reach the high standards we set out for our products. Besides that, you will support, guide, and motivate other developers and advance your skills and knowledge, introducing new technologies and methods to the team.

  

RESPONSIBILITIES


As a VR Developer, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of our VR Commentator product. You will have the chance to be the dedicated person for the VR Commentator selling product. You will create and manage solutions that are built for some of the largest sports organizations in the world.

  

CAPABILITIES

* Experience with Meta Quest devices (or similar)
* At least 3\-year professional work experience with Unity3D
* You have a strong knowledge of C\# development
* Experienced with GIT or similar version controls
* Experience with asynchronous programming
* Debugging skills
* Strong data\-structure logic, and technical design skills
* Being able to work independently and to take initiative
* HBO/Bachelor level working and thinking, but with a strong eagerness to learn and progress as well
* Ideally, you are living in the Netherlands or willing to move to the Netherlands
* You are allowed to work in the EU
* Available 40 hrs/week at the office

  

NICE TO HAVE

* Knowledge of OpenXR
* Previous working experience with facial tracking (e.g. Oculus Quest Pro)
* Previous working experience with body tracking (e.g. Vive trackers)
* Knowledge of Unity Editor programming
* Proficient with Azure DevOps or similar project management tools
* CI/CD experience
* Experience with Unity DOTS/ECS
* Experience in agile project management

  

WHY WORK AT BEYOND SPORTS?

* Work with sports industry\-leading data technology
* Work with the biggest sports organizations on projects that are seen by millions of people
* For most of our projects, there is much room for adding input and creativity.
* And of course, a large set of other benefits like:
* 25 holidays per annum
* Pension program
* Lunch program
* Company gym card
* Fresh fruit and beverages and Friday afternoon drinks
* Bi\-monthly team outings
* Play FIFA, Chess, or a game of table tennis in real\-life

title: Sponsoring & Partnerships Lead
description:
**This is what we offer you*** Gross monthly salary between EUR 8,491 and EUR 12,131 (senior kader A)
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A mobility budget: with this, you can tailor your transportation according to your own needs. For example, by leasing a car or receiving the full amount and arranging your own transportation
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


View all our benefits.
In this expert role within the global Communications and Corporate Affairs (CCA) department, your focus will be on stewarding, executing and amplifying Rabobank's sponsorship strategy so it contributes to the strength of the Rabobank brand. Whereby you ensure that sponsoring and partnerships are close to your heart and you have a proven track record of \+15 years in senior roles in the sponsoring domain with leading organisations.


We are looking for someone who sees sponsoring as a dedicated profession. And who is comfortable with carrying the prime responsible for optimizing large contracts, keeping partners on their toes, setting the bar in setting up and hosting high calibre client events, knows how to convert sponsoring into relationship building and driving business, and knows how to activate sponsorships for maximum value and impact for clients, brand, business and reputation, while relying on robust data\-driven analytics and monitoring.

**You and your job**


As a Sponsoring and Partnerships Lead, you will play a crucial role in shaping and executing Rabobank's sponsorship strategy. This position is of strategic importance to the bank, impacting our brand and identity, and involves complex and reputation\-sensitive tasks. Your expertise will be essential in maintaining, developing, and promoting our sponsorship initiatives, as an incremental part of our brand positioning and brand campaigns. At the same time, you are the one that excels in helping us build stronger relationships with key clients and business partners through events and hospitality.


In this role, you will be the key link aligning strategic sponsorship themes. You will be responsible for executing the overarching sponsorship strategies, create yearly data\-driven plans, and ensure their execution. Your ability to translate complex content into clear, meaningful storylines that are globally consistent and locally relevant will be crucial.


You ensure that there is a proper execution on activation of the contracts and alignment with important stakeholders, such as senior Rabobank leaders from the different business lines, the local banks and companies of the Rabobank Group.


You will be a trusted advisor to senior management and communication professionals. In case of significant issues regarding sponsorship topics, you will take a leading role in communications towards Rabobank business lines and domains, coordinating execution. You will proactively identify opportunities for external and internal communications on sponsorship\-related topics to strengthen our reputation.


Additionally, you will be open to initiating and delivering on strategic change projects. You will actively contribute to our department and help build the broader communications function through your knowledge and expertise in sponsoring, partnerships and branding. This is a diverse and dynamic role with significant responsibility.

**Creating impact**

* Contribute to Rabobank’s brand appeal and reputation as a cooperative bank;
* Help realize Rabobank’s sponsor and partnership strategy;
* Help leverage and activate the sponsorships to drive tangible return on investments among clients, members, employees and general public;
* Help build a strong communications community worldwide to leverage impact;
* First focus will be our home market Netherlands. However, our sponsoring portfolio also includes international partnerships and exclusive relationship events in other geographies.

**Facts \& Figures**

* Department of \+/\- 60 experienced colleagues
* 40,000\+ Employees world\-wide
* Business activities in 37 countries
* 9\+ Million customers around the world

**Top 5 responsibilities**

* Lead the execution of the sponsorship strategy, policies, frameworks and guidelines based on the brand strategy and communication strategy;
* Align the strategy with important stakeholders such as senior leaders, business line representatives, client teams, event teams and other specialists and colleagues within the bank;
* Promote the sponsorship strategy and policy of Rabobank, thereby contributing to the visibility and reputation of the bank;
* Ensure proper execution. Ensure the activation of contracts through campaigns and events;
* Responsible for managing and maintaining contacts in the field of sponsorship.

**The cooperative Rabobank, Our Bank**

You’ve probably come across our new brand campaign already: Our Bank. We have launched this new brand campaign September 2024 and it is essential the sponsorship strategy seamlessly integrates with the brand campaign strategy. We believe our cooperative mentality is the answer to the needs of today’s society: We address the growing need for connection and communities because Rabobank believes in the power of togetherness. We meet the need for genuine attention and involvement because Rabobank cares about society. And we respond to the need to be heard because Rabobank listens to the voice of our clients and members. Our sponsoring strategy is designed to enhance the impact of this campaign and elevate the power of our brand.

**The department \& teams**

The CCA department consists of the following sub\-teams: Branding \& Sponsoring, Communications Advice and Project Management, Public Affairs, Media Relations, Content Hub. The Branding \& Sponsoring team consist of around 12 people and includes roles to drive brand campaigns, visual identity, brand management, branded content, research, art affairs and sponsoring. At the moment sponsoring is run by the head of brand with two sponsoring managers. Given a new ambition and course change in sponsoring, your role is a new one. You are going to be the direct manager of the two sponsoring managers. And we plan to further strengthen the sponsoring part of the team. For this new role to be successful, collaboration with other teams across the bank is incremental. This includes the marketing teams as well as the corporate events teams of Retail NL, Wholesale \& Rural and RGO staff, as well as the many directors and marketing \& comms colleagues of the international regions (including US, Australia, Brazil) and the local banks in the Netherlands.

**You and your talent**


Professional collaboration, Customer focus, Problem solving, Change agility and Storytelling are Rabobank skills that are clearly essential for this role.  

You are a strong team player, with an international mindset. A strategic, data\-driven thinker with a practical and hands\-on mentality. Your organizational sensitivity is highly developed, and you are at ease when moving around in politically sensitive settings. In addition, it is important that you recognize yourself in the checklist below:

* Relevant university degree or equivalent;
* Relevant experience (15\+ years) in a demanding communications environment within a large organization/sponsor, relevant experience with strategic Sponsoring/Partnerships in another large organization or multinational is a must;
* Knowledge of and experience with brand building, reputation management and the Reptrak model;
* Excellent communications craftsmanship (writing, presenting, scripting, presentations, visualization, social etc.);
* Result and output oriented; self\-starting;
* Great project management skills;
* Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to influence without authority;
* Team player and trusted advisor to senior management;
* Fluent in English and Dutch.

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Sponsoring and Partnerships Lead at Rabobank before April 7th.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Chris Kersbergen, Head Brand Communications via Chris.Kersbergen@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Kelly van Lijssel, Corporate Recruiter via Kelly.van.Lijssel@rabobank.nl.
* We may hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Do you want to help us on our journey to build the ultimate online playground?**  

Hey \- we're Poki! We're a tech scale\-up on a mission to create the ultimate online playground. Currently, more than 90 million monthly players around the world come to us for easy access to the best games, created by our thriving game developer community consisting of 500\+ game developer teams. We're always looking for new insights and opportunities to increase the value we offer to players and game developers, and so we’re looking for a **Business Intelligence Analyst.** **What this role is about:**  

Poki is a multisided platform designed so players from all over the world have easy and free access to the best games, while our game developer community is able to generate earnings. The developers release their games through our platform, Poki for Developers, where they can test, iterate and evaluate their games. In order to monetise the games we work with a select group of advertisers, ensuring quality advertisements on the playground.
Our analysts are responsible for providing the rest of the team with opportunities. Through actionable insights they help both the internal team, and our game developers to grow and create business value from petabytes of raw data.
### **Your challenge as a Business Intelligence Analyst at Poki:**

* Grow our player base by improving the efficiency of our marketing. Look into the ways that players find us so we can double down on what works and improve what doesn’t.
* Help the team talking to game developers to understand what games to focus on. Which games can grow our playground. And do we serve the needs of our players when it comes to content.
* Find ways to improve the value we deliver to our players on the playground. Help to improve the discoverability of games by evaluating common patterns and understanding how we can make the experience better.
* Spot opportunities to improve our monetisation logic. We control the timing and placement of advertisements. Look into the monetisation patterns for different segments of players and help to find the right balance between play and ads.

### **You could be our Business Intelligence Analyst if:**

* You’re a critical thinker, and have 4\+ years experience as an analyst
* You’re business savvy, and eager to optimize for performance
* You’re curious to understand the complex dynamics of a multi\-sided platform (balancing the needs of players, game developers, and advertisers).
* You have experience with structuring data with SQL (BigQuery, Snowflake or similar products).
* You have experience with data visualization (Lookerstudio, Tableau or similar products).
* You are based in The Netherlands, and able to work on\-site regularly at our office in Amsterdam.

### **Why work at Poki:**

* Direct impact on the experience of our community of 500\+ game developers, and our 90 million monthly players.
* A lot of personal responsibility and freedom, plus the chance to work together with a diverse, international, talented and self\-motivated team.
* Play is how we learn; we make sure everyone is being challenged and and offer an annual training budget.
* Opportunity to connect with colleagues through work retreats, drinks every Thursday and team activities.
* A full time contract and opportunity to join our Employee Participation Plan
* A hybrid work environment that includes a vibrant office environment with catered lunch, flexible working hours, work from home budget, and travel costs covered for those living outside of Amsterdam.

*Are you curious? You may very well be our next Business Intelligence Analyst, so hit apply and tell us more about yourself!*

title: Environmental Coördinator
description:
**Location:** Leusden
  
**Hours:** 24\-32 per week
  
Who are we?
  
HVEG Fashion Group is an innovative organization that develops fashion solutions. On one hand, HVEG specializes in the design, development, procurement, and sale of a wide range of private label fashion for women, men, children, and babies. Additionally, shoes, accessories and optics (glasses and lenses) are a key specialty within the group. On the other hand, HVEG is increasingly active in brand activities and licenses, such as Bamboo Basics, Magic Bodyfashion, Brams Paris, Maison de Paris, MEXX, and Fred de Bretoniere.
  
Job overview
  
As an Environmental Coordinator, you will play a key role in collecting, analyzing, and reporting environmental data to support sustainability initiatives. Your focus will be on (CSRD) data collection and reporting, impact reduction in our products, and sustainable materials management. But there is also room for exploring new environmental initiatives. Through data\-driven insights, you will help develop and implement strategies to minimize the environmental footprint of products and processes.
  
Key responsibilities
  
* Gather and manage environmental data related to CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive) compliance.
* Conduct detailed data analysis to assess the company’s environmental footprint, including energy consumption, water use, waste, and CO₂ emissions (Scope 1, 2, and 3\).
* Develop and maintain sustainability reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Identify key environmental impacts in our production focusing on Greenhouse gases, energy, water, waste, and chemical usage, by collecting and analyzing data (Life Cycle Assessments).
* Develop and implement reduction plans to lower environmental impact, in alignment with company sustainability goals.
* Work with suppliers and internal teams to improve environmental efficiency.
* Manage materials data collection, ensuring accurate classification of certified and conventional materials.
* Analyze material usage to identify opportunities for more sustainable sourcing and product design.
* Develop a materials strategy to transition towards more sustainable and circular materials.
* Explore new environmental sustainability initiatives and drive innovation.


Qualifications \& Skills
  
* Degree (or in your last study year) in Sustainability, Environmental Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
* Passionate about sustainability.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Excel, or similar).
* Knowledge of Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) and textile industry sustainability standards.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to engage with internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage complex projects.
* A proactive team player with a problem\-solving mindset with attention to detail.


What do we offer?
  
* A dynamic work environment within an internationally operating company.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth within the organization.
* Personal development support through our HVEG Academy.
* A challenging role with responsibility and room for initiative.
* An awesome and open\-minded team with a strong focus on collaboration.
* Discounted sports membership via Bedrijfsfitness Nederland.
* Mental well\-being support through access to a digital coach/psychologist via OpenUp.
* 30% discount on our HVEG Brands Group brands.
* 25 vacation days per year on a 40\-hour workweek and three extra vacation days.
* A pension scheme.


Interested?
  
Send your CV and motivation to \[email protected].

title: Commissioning Engineer - Data Center
description:

Oleson specialise in delivering high quality talent and solutions that enhance the capabilities and operational excellent of our global customers.
We are focused on matching the dynamic needs of Data Centre and Life Science clients with skilled professionals, thereby driving innovations and in growth in these critical sectors.
**About the** **Role****:**

**What you’ll do:**

Expertise in BMS network troubleshooting, including switch configurations.
Excellent problem\-solving skills and ability to work in fast\-paced environments.
Strong communication and teamwork abilities.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands
   

  

**Business Intelligence Specialist**
*‘The goal is to turn data into information and information into insight’*
 The Enterprise Information Management team of Thales in the Netherlands is looking for an experienced BI specialist to further professionalize information management.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Thales in the Netherlands has committed to the objective to become a ‘data\-driven company’, where facts and unambiguous information are leading in decision making. As BI specialist, you will be responsible for gathering the requested business information and designing clear dashboards for our internal customer, the business user. At the start of the week, you check the sprint backlog to see what tasks are assigned to you. You align with the product owner and business analyst of the team and you are in touch with the business user to sharpen the information specifications. Together with the solution architect and data manager, you investigate which data is required to build the dashboard and together you determine how much time it will take to extract and validate the data. You are capable of executing ETL activities yourself. In the meantime, you start designing one component of the new dashboard in PowerBI. You are in close contact with the business user to agree upon the visual design. At the end of the sprint, which takes two weeks, you deliver the new component of the new dashboard, and in the next sprint you will extend your work with a new component.
   

  

 You play an important role in the internal digital transformation journey of Thales in the Netherlands. There is a lot of work to be done; you are a ‘go\-getter’ and consider this assignment, which we accepted as a team, to be a journey full of chances and possibilities. You are flexible and know how to work around challenges along the way. You are someone who dares to challenge the status quo and someone who brings new energy to our team. Also, you have strong communication skills and you know to address different audiences.
   

  

 There are many possibilities to build your career at Thales. You could further develop within the domain of BI, yet you could choose to specialize towards IT, or to increase your knowledge about our interesting business and grow to an operational position on the intersection of Business and IT. Furthermore, with some own initiative and a good portion of curiosity, you are able to continue your career at Thales at a completely different department.
   

  

 The most important activities are:
   

  

* Develop and design dashboards in PowerBI to meet the information demands of the business user
* ETL activities to extract and format data for the dashboards which need to be developed
* Contribute to the improvement of our work processes


**About You**
* Holds a relevant Bachelor degree in IT or Business\&IT
* Has basic knowledge of PowerBI
* Has extensive knowledge of SSIS and SQL and the ability to complete ETL activities independently
* Can align the business information request with the technical possibilities
* Is proactive, flexible, a go\-getter, and enthusiastic
* Knowledge of Mendix is a pre
* Good understanding of the Dutch language


**What's In It For You**
* Become part of a great team in a high tech, innovative international organization
* (International) opportunities for growth in tech\-, management\- and commercial roles
* Attention for personal development and own initiative
* A nice workplace in a modern building, where we value a good work\-life balance and flexibility
* 40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs


**Interested?**
 Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.
   

  

 To ensure that we are a good match, we can ask you to participate in an assessment.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
****Ready for a challenge?****
 Then Just Eat Takeaway.com might be the place for you. We’re a leading global online food delivery platform, and our vision is to empower everyday convenience.
   

  

 Whether it’s a Friday\-night feast, a post\-gym poke bowl, or grabbing some groceries, our tech platform connects tens of millions of customers with hundreds of thousands of restaurant, grocery and convenience partners across the globe.
   

  

**About This Role**
 As a Business Analyst in our Key Cities Program, you will provide crucial analytical support to drive performance across our 15 most strategic cities worldwide. You'll work closely with the Global Key Cities Lead and Program Manager to identify insights, build performance dashboards, and support data\-driven decision making.
   

  

 In this role, you'll analyze city performance data, create regular reports, identify trends, and support the development of business cases for key initiatives. Your analytical skills will be essential in helping our team track progress and identify opportunities for growth.
   

  

***Location: Hybrid\- 3 days a week from our Amsterdam office 2 days working from home***
***Reporting to: Head of Strategy and Planning, Commercial***
****These are some of the key ingredients to the role:****
* Develop and maintain performance dashboards tracking KPIs across all key cities
* Analyze city\-level data to identify trends, opportunities and areas for improvement
* Create regular performance reports and conduct city\-by\-city benchmarking
* Support monthly/quarterly business reviews with data\-driven insights
* Monitor competitive activity and market developments across key cities
* Collaborate with local teams to understand city\-specific challenges
* Help evaluate the effectiveness of playbooks and frameworks
* Convert data into actionable recommendations for city teams


****What will you bring to the table?****
* Proven experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar roles
* Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret complex datasets
* Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau preferred)
* Proficiency in SQL and Excel for data analysis
* Experience creating clear, compelling data presentations
* Ability to translate data into meaningful business insights
* Collaborative approach with ability to work with diverse stakeholders
* Intellectually curious with a proactive mindset
* Understanding of marketplace dynamics or food delivery is a plus


**At JET, This Is On The Menu**
 Our teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best\-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.
   

  

 Fun, fast\-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.
   

  

****Inclusion, Diversity Belonging****
 No matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees
   

  

 What else is cooking?
   

  

 Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.
   

  

****Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!****

title: Data Intelligence Consultant
description:
Do you just LOVE data? Do you have expertise with SAP and /or Databricks? Do you thrive on seeing how it can make real impact? Is your strength analyzing complex data sets, developing impactful data visualizations, and delivering valuable insights to support strategic decision\-making? Do you want to help to grow an international organisation from start\-up phase where your inputs are valued, challenging yourself daily?
 



  





 Our client is a leading cutting edge consultancy company providing strategic, data experience advice and implementation services to guide our customers to the top in their respective domains. Through their Data centric approach, they realise operational excellence using data\-driven insight to optimize the digital experience, enhancing their customers in various ways, making them more successful.
 



  





 With a spirit that is highly entrepreneurial and dynamic, aiming constantly to
 



 achieve the highest standards in everything they do using ground\-breaking tech, they promote a welcoming environment along with unlimited opportunities to learn and grow. This is what they are so proud of. They want to hear YOUR voice.

 • Lead various Business Intelligence / Data consulting engagements at the customer using tools such as SAP, Databricks and Snowflake
 



 • Connecting data sources, data preparation, build valuable dashboards \& apps
 



 across a variety of client industries and use cases
 



 • Drive the end\-to\-end process for creating reports and data visualizations
 



 • Work with customers to understand their business problems to be solved and
 



 business questions that need to be answered
 



 • Work closely with business functions such as Sales, Marketing, Finance, etc. to
 



 deliver key reporting and dashboard capabilities.
 



 • Drive knowledge sharing with your colleagues and customers
 



 • Continue to grow existing accounts
 



 • Mentor and develop consultants of all skills and experience levels
 



 • Have fun with your collaborative team where everyone can be themselves and are
 



 provided the opportunity to love their work and life.
 



  





**What You’ll Bring** 




  




* A passion for and experience with professional services with data and the desire to help customers thrive using its analytics features
* Proficiency leading teams of data engineers and analysts
* Analytical approach to problem\-solving; ability to use technology to solve business
* Technical expertise in SAP and Databricks
* A thirst to continually learn and share knowledge but also the message of our client

* skills across the end\-to\-end client relationship

**The techy requirements:** 




 • Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or related field
 



 • Experience on any or all cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Azure, and Google
 



 Cloud)
 



 • Proficiency in modern data architectures and relational database design and
 



 development
 



 • Proficiency and hands\-on experience with big data technologies
 



 • 5\+ years experience in a business intelligence or data analyst role
 



 • Experience with SQL, relational databases, and data mining
 



 • Experience with BI Tools (Domo, SAC, Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.)
 



 • Experience with (big) data platforms, such as Databricks, Snowflake, Azure, AWS, Hadoop or Spark
 



 • Advanced Excel skills for data analysis and reporting
 



 • Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
 



 • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skill
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 



* An encouraging working environment where you are encouraged to take responsibility and help to drive the company

* Mobility allowance
* Laptop, phone
* Working with highly respected thought leaders in the Data Analytics space

title: Data Business Analyst
description:
**Make an Impact in a Dynamic, International Environment as Data Business Analyst** 




 Data is the foundation of a secure and future\-proof bank. As a
 **Senior Business Analyst** 
*(5\+ year experience)* 
 , you will play a crucial role in structuring, analyzing, and optimizing financial and risk data. In this dynamic, international setting, your work directly impacts the security and stability of the financial sector.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a key link between business and data teams, you will gather requirements, conduct impact assessments, and design scalable data solutions for a large\-scale financial and risk data platform. This platform is vital for both internal decision\-making and regulatory reporting. Working alongside eight Scrum teams, you will help modernize the bank’s data infrastructure, ensuring compliance and future readiness.
 



  





 Your key responsibilities include:
 



 ✔ Translating complex business requirements into scalable data models and structures.
 



 ✔ Analyzing and optimizing data flows to enhance security and reliability.
 



 ✔ Collaborating with development teams to implement innovative data solutions.
 



 ✔ Improving reporting capabilities for internal stakeholders and regulatory authorities.
 



  





**About the Company** 




 Our client is a leading financial institution that heavily invests in data, technology, and innovation. You will work in a data\-driven environment where cutting\-edge tools and methodologies are at your fingertips. This company provides excellent opportunities for career development, both in the Netherlands and internationally.
 



  





**What You Bring** 




 ✅ 5\+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Business Consultant, Product Owner, or Solution Architect.
 



 ✅ Background in the financial sector, preferably banking.
 



 ✅ Strong expertise in Finance \& Risk, data warehousing, and BI solutions.
 



 ✅ Proficiency in Data Modeling (DataVault, dimensional), SQL, and Informatica.
 



 ✅ Experience with large\-scale, complex projects in an Agile environment.
 



 ✅ Excellent communication skills in English (Dutch is a plus).
 



  





 What’s in It for You?
 



 💰 Salary up to €70,000 gross per year (all included).
 



 🏡 Hybrid working for optimal work\-life balance.
 



 📈 Training, certifications, and career growth opportunities.
 



 🚀 Work on high\-impact projects using the latest technologies.
 



 🌍 A dynamic, international environment that strengthens your career profile.
 



  





**Ready for the Next Step?** 




 Are you passionate about data and eager to shape the future of financial security? Send your CV to
 **Rafael.tristan@rebels.io** 
 or apply now! 🚀

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Altum Consulting are supporting a global tech brand to recruit a experienced Senior Data Analyst to support the global FP\&A function in critical modelling delivery, AI analysis and forecasting.
 







**About the Role:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to lead our data analytics efforts. You will be responsible for managing large data sets, automating processes, and creating impactful visualisations. This role requires strong technical skills and the ability to translate data into actionable business insights.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Data Leadership:** 
	+ Manage and improve our data infrastructure and reporting.
	+ Establish best practices for data handling, automation, and visualisation.
* **Data Management \& Automation:** 
	+ Process and standardise large data sets from various sources.
	+ Automate data workflows using tools like SQL and PowerQuery.
* **Reporting \& Business Intelligence:** 
	+ Develop interactive dashboards using Tableau or similar tools.
	+ Apply advanced analytics techniques to provide insights.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** 
	+ Work with business teams to translate data into strategic recommendations.
	+ Ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* **Process Improvement:** 
	+ Identify and implement improvements to data processes.
	+ Stay updated on new data analytics technologies.



**What We're Looking For:** 



* 5\+ years of experience in data analysis and business intelligence.
* Proven ability to lead data analytics projects.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical or analytical field (e.g., Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics).
* Expertise in data manipulation and automation tools (e.g., SQL, PowerQuery, Power BI).
* Strong experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau).
* Strong problem\-solving and communication skills.



 Please contact George Brown on the attached details to discuss this role further.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The Team
  
  

The ING Pricing Architecture (IPA) platform consists of multiple components that enable real\-time and batch calculations of financial risk metrics and simulations (e.g. XVA, PFE, Value at Risk , Expected Shortfall , Bilateral Margining , pre\-deal derivatives Pricing ) which are driven by new banking regulations as well as advanced Risk analysis on the derivative product portfolio of Financial Markets (interest rates, credits, foreign exchange). This platform is in the heart of the IT landscape for our global dealing rooms and risk managers in Asia, Europe and Americas, with 7\-9 scrum teams spread across 4 locations (Amsterdam, Brussels, Bucharest and Singapore), cooperating to evolve it towards target ING Financial Markets IT vision.
  
The IPA DARE Purpose
  
We provide a fast, easy, secure and reliable Data, Analysis and Reporting Environment, based largely on the GCP technology in the public cloud. The purpose of this asset is to provide one system for FO (Front Office) and Risk Management business users to be used for both Intraday and End Of Day pricing, Risk Management and Position Management.
  
  

Your Roles and responsibilities
  
  

Even if you’ll start your day from the comfort of your home or drink your morning coffee at our office’s cafeteria, your day will be quite similar when comes to tasks. Here are your daily responsibilities:
  
As a Senior Data Engineer, you contribute and are responsible for the design, development, test automation, hardening (security, stability, deployment) and documentation of components and data pipelines for the extraction and provision of structured and unstructured data within a cloud infrastructure or between cloud and on\-premises systems.
  
You contribute to technology choices and architecture of newly built components and services
  
You have a strong focus on performance , large data sets and towards event\-driven architecture
  
You assess the efficiency of end\-to\-end processes by identifying and mitigating risks
  
You continuously improve and optimize the ingestion, post\-processing and reporting layer of the data platform
  
You standardize and reutilize automation patterns as part of the data ingestion and processing stages
  
You design and develop automated unit, integration and regression tests
  
You prove strong analytical skills, proactivity and ability to work in cross\-border international teams.
  
You work in an Agile environment, collaborate closely with the Product Owner and Customer Journey Expert to interpret business requirements and estimate, plan, implement, test and deliver as part of short delivery cycles.
  
You focus on delivering working software of high quality that satisfies customer requirements.
  
  

What you’ll bring to the team
  
  

**Experience :** 5\+ years of engineering experience.
  
  

**Tech stack/ knowledge:****Mandatory:**  

Proficient in relational databases and SQL.
  
Proven big data experience, either from an implementation or a data science perspective.
  
Strong coding experience in the likes of Java, Scala or Python.
  
Experience with GCP tech stack (BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Composer, Google Cloud Storage) or other public cloud providers equivalents (AWS, Azure)
  
Experience with Git, Maven, CI/CD (eg. Azure DevOps) and documentation tools
  
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (eg. Terraform)
  
Experience or affinity with IT Security concepts
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

DBT
  
Looker
  
Data governance, Data lineage, Data Catalogue (Metadata)
  
Apache Beam
  
Spark
  
Flink
  
Kafka
  
Automated testing framework
  
**Foreign languages:** English (advanced)
  
**Education:** A University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Financial Engineering or equivalent.
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

* A gross salary between € 4\.367,65 and € 7\.088,63
* 24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues


About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

title: Data Center Facilities Technician, Electrical II (English, Dutch)
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Associate's degree, trade school certification, or other certified training in a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of electrical experience in an industrial or commercial environment.
* Ability to lift, carry or move up to 50 lbs of equipment, the required use of OSHA standard safety equipment such as limited weight bearing work platforms, ladders, step stools and personal protective equipment (PPE) like safety harnesses.
* Ability to work non\-standard hours and work rotations/shifts.
* Ability to communicate in English and Dutch fluently, to support the client management in region as well as interact with local stakeholders.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* 5 years of experience in maintenance of electrical distribution systems or construction/technical environment or a related field
* Experience in data centers, hospitals, or power plants
* Knowledge of electrical systems used in a data center environment (e.g., Feeders, Transformers, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, ATS/STS units, PDU/PMM units)
* Knowledge of meters, devices, sensors, and troubleshooting utilizing standard hand tools, digital metering, or calibration/diagnostic equipment
* Ability to communicate with contractors who perform maintenance or upgrade work on the data center systems


About the job
  
  

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non\-critical electrical or mechanical system components).As an advocate for best practices, you develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.
  
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. We are an upbeat, creative, team\-oriented group of engineers committed to building and operating powerful data centers.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Inspect, maintain, and repair various data center systems.
* Provide daily assistance to technicians as you read blueprints/schematics/sequence of operations, conduct tours of systems, and assess their working order.
* Manage the uptime and maintenance of UPS, generators, electrical distribution, and control and monitoring systems.
* Operate, monitor, maintain, and respond to abnormal conditions in the data center facilities systems and equipment.
* Support startup, commissioning, and integration of new electrical equipment and systems into facilities infrastructure.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.
company_description: Our mission is to organize the world’s information and make it universally accessible and useful.

title: Data Engineer, Data Platform Experience
description:
Brief info about Vinted
-----------------------



Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second\-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20\+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second\-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second\-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.



Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.



The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position
------------------------------



We're looking for a Data Engineer to help evolve and scale a Data Platform in Vinted. As part of the Data Platform Experience team, you'll work with us on Data Platform components, such as Airflow, dbt, Looker, JupyterHub and related tooling. With challenges of scale, PB of data, thousands of models and thousands of jobs where seconds matter. This position presents a great opportunity to grow as a professional and take on new responsibilities. If you think you're up to the challenge – get in touch!


In this position, you'll
------------------------


* Build, automate and improve tooling around our Data Platform Experience team's scope.
* Manage and maintain infrastructure with code
* Monitor and troubleshoot issues related to the platform
* Work within platform team \& work closely with users to deploy, automate and scale applications
* Improve the reliability and cost effectiveness of the platform

About you
---------


* Experience in software development
* Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
* Proven experience of building software products
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Preferably with Terraform)
* Strong problem\-solving and troubleshooting skills
* Good written and spoken technical communication skills
* Preferred experience with CI/CD (Jenkins \| GHA), Airflow

Work perks
----------

* The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
* 25 days of paid annual leave
* Newest MacBook models
* Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
* Frequent team\-building events
* Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
* A daily lunch allowance
* ClassPass (Gym Membership subsidy)
* Pension plan with total contribution of 12%, 8% by the Company and 4% by employee
* A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
* An NS mobility card
* The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year \- 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU \- on workation
* A dog\-friendly office

Working at Vinted
-----------------


**Individual Learning Budget**



We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.


**Hybrid Work**



We've adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It's up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you'll spend working together in person.


**Equal Opportunity**



The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.



The salary range for this position is **€** **52,700 \- € 71,300** gross per year.
company_description: Vinted was founded in 2008 in Lithuania. Today Vinted is still headquartered in Vilnius, with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Hamburg, Kaunas and Paris and over 2,000 employees.

title: Chief Data Center Facilities Engineer
description:
**Are you a seasoned Data Center Engineer with extensive Electrical/Mechanical skills?**


Salute is a global leader in delivering Data Center services – firmly established in the US and with a rapidly growing client base across Europe and beyond.


This is an exciting time to join the team as we step up operations in new countries and commence work on new and challenging projects. As a result of this growth, we are looking to recruit and develop a Data Centre Chief Engineer.


The Data Centre Chief Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all electrical, mechanical, and fire/life safety equipment within the data center is operating at peak efficiency. This involves both planned preventative maintenance of equipment, daily corrective work, and emergency response to emergent issues. The Chief Engineer maintains relationships with third party vendors. Data center equipment that supports mission\-critical servers must maintain better than 99\.999% uptime. This equipment includes, but is not limited to, standby diesel generators, switchgear, UPSs, PDUs, AHUs, chillers, cooling towers, chemical treatment systems, pumps, motors, VFDs, and building automation systems.

**Requirements**

* Manage all SLA’s towards customers 100% Uptime (Temp., Hum, power, PUE/WUE, relation).
* Responsible for ensuring the safe, effective, and efficient delivery of planned maintenance, that meets all standards and procedures, by leveraging competent contractor/vendor resources with attention to quality.
* Ensures that the Manager of Operations is fully informed and briefed on all planned and corrective work occurring in the datacenter.
* Plans and implements customer requested work in a timely manner. Ensures that the customer and Manager of Operations are informed on the status and details of the work.
* In concert with the Manager of Operations:
	+ Plans work on 1\-line equipment according to Planned Preventive Maintenance Schedule, including roadmap to be approved by Manager of Operations and/or Nominated person in control of an electrical installation. (Dutch:” Installatieverantwoordelijke”)
	+ Prepares detailed Method of Procedure to be approved by Manager of Operations and/or nominated person in control of an electrical installation.
	+ Organizes all testing of mission critical equipment on the site.
	+ Responsible for ensuring that all work being done by contractors/vendors is logged in systems.
	+ Responsible for ensuring that all work being done by contractors/vendors is being done in accordance with the approved Method of Procedure.
* During normal working hours, responds to alarms, critical situations, and emergencies in a proper and timely manner. Responsible for communicating in a calm and clear manner and in accordance with the emergency response plan.
* Will take initiative to ensure that quality and efficiency standards are raised for all the equipment in the datacenter. This includes finding ways to deliver cost savings without sacrificing quality.
* Finds ways to increase energy efficiency without sacrificing continuity or uptime of the site.
* Administers in a correct and timely manner all executed work in accordance with all process and procedures.
* Works effectively and efficiently with others inside the organization
* In Emergencies, is responsible for the timely response to ensure safety and operational continuity on site.
* Is constantly monitoring the site to ensure that safety standards are met.

**Qualifications**

* Knowledge of Electrical and Mechanical systems in use in the Datacenter environment including transformers, generators, switchgear, UPS systems, ATS \& STS units, RPP units, chillers, CRAC/CRAH units
* Strong communications, both written and verbal, in leading teams and coordinating with peers and other disciplines on driving projects/issues to closure.
* Commitment to organizational excellence and constant awareness to seek opportunities to improve processes/quality of deliverables.
* Superb ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects/responsibilities.
* Superb ability to meet committed timelines, leveraging assistance/input from peers.
* Strong and effective team player in working with various disciplines and peer groups; can cover all gamut of tasks required to ‘getting a job done.’
* Strong attention to detail.

**Experience/Education**

* Education level complied with by WEB level 4 (WEB \= Dutch Adult and Vocational Training Act) with at least 7\-years of experience or HBO (Bachelor of Science/Bachelor of Engineering);
* LV/HV authorized to switch Certificate (NEN3140\-NEN3840\)
* Mechanical and/or Electrical training/education, with particular focus in power;
* Must have or be able to complete Safety for Operational Supervisors training (Dutch: “Veiligheid gezondheid milieu Checklist Aannemers” Abbreviation: “VCA”) and OSHA 30 shortly after start of employment.
* Relevant work experience in a data center or other critical environment.
* High school diploma or College Degree
* Good observation skills and problem\-solving ability
* Good verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English


The role is a full\-time position, and your base salary will be commensurate with experience but is expected to be highly competitive. The opportunity is located in Amsterdam, Netherlands and will include business travel as needed to meet business demands but will likely be nominal.


Here, at Salute, we value our people and take great pride in providing not just a job but fantastic career opportunities.


In addition to the opportunity to work in a great team and earn a competitive salary \- you'll gain access to cutting\-edge industry training that aims to enhance your skills and support your future development. Not only will you receive valuable on the job and structured training in your current role, but for those who are ambitious and motivated, the possibilities are endless.
