title: Freelance Data/AI Engineer
description:
At H2L Robotics, we’re looking for a freelance Mechatronics Technician.

**Your role**
-------------


At H2L Robotics, we're looking for a freelance **Mechatronics Technician** to temporarily strengthen our team during a colleague’s paternity leave. Your main focus will be building **Prototype 2 of our potato robot**. This innovative machine can detect diseased potatoes in the field and autonomously eliminate them — an important step toward more sustainable agriculture. Field testing is coming up soon, and your contribution is crucial to make that happen.


In addition to working on the potato robot, there’s room to take on other technical projects within the organization — from building test setups to supporting production or development challenges. You'll work independently, but always stay connected to our small and agile team.

**Your key responsibilities**
-----------------------------


As a Mechatronics Technician at H2L Robotics, you’ll take a hands\-on approach to solving technical challenges. You’ll seamlessly switch between mechanical, electrical, and software\-related tasks — always looking for ways to improve, speed up or simplify processes.


Your key tasks will include:

* Building prototype 2 of the potato robot in preparation for upcoming field tests.
* Performing hands\-on assembly, modifications, and troubleshooting.
* Designing and building test setups for new or ongoing projects.
* Supporting developers with technical challenges.
* Contributing to other technical activities, depending on your experience and interests.

**You**
-------


You're a practical technician who enjoys building, testing, and improving. You thrive in a small, flexible organization where you can take full ownership of your work. You're a quick learner, work methodically, and think ahead.


You bring:

* MBO/HBO (associate/bachelor) level in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, or a related field.
* 1–5 years of experience in a hands\-on technical role.
* Experience with mechanical and electrical assembly.
* A valid driver’s license (B; B\+E is a plus).
* Strong communication skills in both Dutch and English.

**About H2L Robotics**
----------------------


At H2L Robotics, we develop smart, sustainable robots for agriculture — from weeding and harvesting automation to precision farming. Always with one goal: creating machines that truly work in the field.


Our **potato robot** is one of our latest innovations. It autonomously identifies and removes diseased potatoes, helping to protect healthy crops and increase yield. **Prototype 2** is the next step toward a robust, fully functional system — and you can help make it a reality.

**Interested but have doubts?**
-------------------------------


Not sure if you meet all the requirements? Don’t worry! At H2L, we value enthusiasm and fresh perspectives as much as experience. Feel free to apply, and let’s explore how your skills can make a difference.


Submit your CV and portfolio via our website. If you have any questions, please contact our recruiter, Ralph Roels, at \+31 6 14139696\.

*Agency support is NOT needed!*

title: Applications Engineer, Data Center Solutions EMEA (m/f/d)
description:
**Date:** Mar 24, 2025


**Location:** Home Address, FR


**Company:** Corning


Requisition Number: 67848

  


Corning is vital to progress – in the industries we help shape and in the world we share.


We invent life\-changing technologies using materials science. Our scientific and manufacturing expertise, boundless curiosity, and commitment to purposeful invention place us at the center of the way the world interacts, works, learns, and lives.


Our sustained investment in research, development, and invention means we’re always ready to solve the toughest challenges alongside our customers.  

  

Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry\-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings – carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical\-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical\-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.

  


**Applications Engineer, Data Center Solutions EMEA (m/f/d)**

  


We are looking for a highly skilled Applications Engineer (AE) and French speaker to join our team in **Berlin, Germany**.

  

The AE will be responsible for representing Corning as a **Data Center product and solution expert across the EMEA region**, working closely with both internal and external customers. This role combines a blend of internal and external responsibilities, requiring a dynamic candidate with a robust background in network architecture, time management, and excellent communication abilities. The AE will develop a deep knowledge of Corning Optical Communications’ portfolio to deliver a quick and reliable support to our customers. The AE must understand the customer needs and promote the value of Corning solutions that meet those needs to maximize profitability.

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

  


* Collaborate with sales teams and external partners and customers to gather requirements and propose tailored solutions in alignment with Corning's product portfolio.
* Prepare comprehensive solution documentations for ICT systems in Data Center/LAN/GPON including Network Design Architecture, Bills of Materials (BOMs), Statements of Compliance, and rack elevation schematics.
* Respond to RFP/RFQ and advise customers (internal or external) about products and their use in various applications.
* Provide technical support and deliver training sessions, workshops, and presentations on Corning products directly to end customers, installers, and distribution partners.
* Provide pre\-sales and after sales customer support including product recommendation, system design, system installation training, testing, and troubleshooting at customer site.
* Create datasheets, technical papers, and customer responses as needed.
* Provide feedback to development/PLM (product line management) regarding new product evaluation, product improvements and compliance to regional standards and norms.
* Manage equipment inventory such as fiber optic splicing machines, network testing equipment and other devices to ensure availability for projects and support activities in EMEA.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of new IT tools or solutions aimed at automating work processes and enhancing team efficiency.

  




**Qualifications and Experience**

  


* **Required Education** (minimum required for consideration): University Engineering Degree.
* **Required Years and Area of Experience** (minimum required for consideration): Preferred Telecom, Data Center or ICT design and engineering: 2\-5 years.

  




**Required Skills:**


* Experience in designing ICT network solutions and architectures for the Data Center, OSP or LAN spaces.
* Experience in reviewing and generating technical documentation including but not limited to, Bill of Materials (BOM), product datasheets, Statement of Compliance, and RFP/RFQ.
* An agile individual who can juggle several tasks simultaneously and able to work with deadlines.
* Demonstrated technical support experience (customer oriented, field solutions, timely responses).
* Capable of conveying complex technical concepts to both technical experts and those with limited technical knowledge.
* Comfortable working in cross\-functional team environments and a willingness to collaborate and learn from others.
* Strong computer skills (MS Windows based: Office365, Power point, Word, Excel, Visio).
* **Strong English and French writing and speaking skills**. Additional languages such as Arabic or German are considered a plus.

  




**Desired Skills:**


* Good hands\-on skills: basic mechanical /troubleshooting/repair skills.
* Pre\-sales experience in active and passive telecommunication networks and ICT backbones.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Visual Basic, or others.
* Knowledge of or familiarity with international standards such as CENELEC, ISO/IEC, TIA/EIA, IEEE, etc.
* Preferably a professional relevant certification such as RCDD, DCDC, CNIDP, CDCDP or similar.
* Familiarity or experience with DC active equipment (switches, servers, storage, etc.).
* Project Management skills or certifications such PMP, ACP, PRINCE2 or similar.

  




**Travel Requirements:** up to 25% of the working time as required.


Primarily continental Europe. However, candidate must be prepared to travel anywhere within EMEA region including Israel, US or Asia for support. Flexibility to travel on short notice requiring overnight stay. Must have proper Visas or EU citizenship to allow unrestricted travel. Candidate must possess current and valid local driving license and clean driving record to allow renting vehicles as required.

  


**Hours of work/work schedule/flextime:**


Minimum 40\-hour week plus travel time as required. Some weekend work or travel required.

  


**Benefits**


* Flexible hybrid working model.
* Paid Time Off.
* Training \& Development.
* Performance Bonus.

  


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Location:** Utrecht

**Country:** The Netherlands

**Salary:** 64k \- 79k

**Description:**

**Shape the Future of AI in Real Estate**


Are you an experienced Data Engineer with a passion for developing scalable data solutions? We are launching an advanced AI assistant service designed for NVM members. Join our AI Assistant team and help shape the future of AI in real estate through innovation, collaboration, and the latest technology.

**Your Role**


As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing data architectures to ensure seamless and secure data access for AI applications. You will play a key role in building reliable data pipelines, collaborating with LLM engineers, and transforming innovative prototypes into functional solutions.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design and manage scalable data architectures for LLM use cases.
* Develop and maintain robust data pipelines from various sources to a vector database in AWS.
* Implement role\-based access control and data masking.
* Monitor and optimize data processes using dashboards, logging, and incident management.
* Present findings to stakeholders and contribute to the AI assistant's development.
* Work in an Agile environment to achieve project goals.

### **About the Company**


We are redefining real estate through data\-driven solutions. As the custodian of the Netherlands' largest real estate database, we use AI and machine learning to improve transparency, efficiency, and accessibility in the property market. Our mission is to provide professionals with innovative tools that simplify complex processes and unlock valuable insights.


Our team consists of over 50 professionals dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology and data. Our modern office in Utrecht offers free parking, hybrid work options, and a dynamic work environment that prioritizes collaboration and work\-life balance.

### **Ideal Candidate**


We are looking for a self\-motivated and curious data professional who enjoys working in a collaborative environment. You should be eager to learn, innovate, and deliver results.

**Requirements:**

* Strong expertise in SQL, Python, and cloud environments (preferably AWS).
* Experience with structured and unstructured databases.
* Knowledge of vector databases, semantic search, and data orchestration tools.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Experience in designing complex data architectures, integrating diverse data types, and implementing governance frameworks.

**Preferred but not required:**

* Familiarity with AWS services.
* Knowledge or experience in the real estate sector (NVM Wonen).
* Residency in the Netherlands at the time of application.

### **Working Conditions**

* Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days remote.
* 37 vacation days.
* Visa sponsorship and relocation are not available.

### **Company Culture**

* Informal and collaborative work environment.
* Diverse teams.
* A culture of trust, with self\-managing teams and freedom for individual initiatives.

**Heads up!**  

Were on the hunt for top talent on behalf of our awesome client! If this sounds like your kind of gig, hit that *apply* button! Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and we keep things 100% confidential. Were all about equal opportunities hereeveryones welcome!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The Team
  
  

The ING Pricing Architecture (IPA) platform consists of multiple components that enable real\-time and batch calculations of financial risk metrics and simulations (e.g. XVA, PFE, Value at Risk , Expected Shortfall , Bilateral Margining , pre\-deal derivatives Pricing ) which are driven by new banking regulations as well as advanced Risk analysis on the derivative product portfolio of Financial Markets (interest rates, credits, foreign exchange). This platform is in the heart of the IT landscape for our global dealing rooms and risk managers in Asia, Europe and Americas, with 7\-9 scrum teams spread across 4 locations (Amsterdam, Brussels, Bucharest and Singapore), cooperating to evolve it towards target ING Financial Markets IT vision.
  
The IPA DARE Purpose
  
We provide a fast, easy, secure and reliable Data, Analysis and Reporting Environment, based largely on the GCP technology in the public cloud. The purpose of this asset is to provide one system for FO (Front Office) and Risk Management business users to be used for both Intraday and End Of Day pricing, Risk Management and Position Management.
  
  

Your Roles and responsibilities
  
  

Even if you’ll start your day from the comfort of your home or drink your morning coffee at our office’s cafeteria, your day will be quite similar when comes to tasks. Here are your daily responsibilities:
  
As a Senior Data Engineer, you contribute and are responsible for the design, development, test automation, hardening (security, stability, deployment) and documentation of components and data pipelines for the extraction and provision of structured and unstructured data within a cloud infrastructure or between cloud and on\-premises systems.
  
You contribute to technology choices and architecture of newly built components and services
  
You have a strong focus on performance , large data sets and towards event\-driven architecture
  
You assess the efficiency of end\-to\-end processes by identifying and mitigating risks
  
You continuously improve and optimize the ingestion, post\-processing and reporting layer of the data platform
  
You standardize and reutilize automation patterns as part of the data ingestion and processing stages
  
You design and develop automated unit, integration and regression tests
  
You prove strong analytical skills, proactivity and ability to work in cross\-border international teams.
  
You work in an Agile environment, collaborate closely with the Product Owner and Customer Journey Expert to interpret business requirements and estimate, plan, implement, test and deliver as part of short delivery cycles.
  
You focus on delivering working software of high quality that satisfies customer requirements.
  
  

What you’ll bring to the team
  
  

**Experience :** 5\+ years of engineering experience.
  
  

**Tech stack/ knowledge:****Mandatory:**  

Proficient in relational databases and SQL.
  
Proven big data experience, either from an implementation or a data science perspective.
  
Strong coding experience in the likes of Java, Scala or Python.
  
Experience with GCP tech stack (BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Composer, Google Cloud Storage) or other public cloud providers equivalents (AWS, Azure)
  
Experience with Git, Maven, CI/CD (eg. Azure DevOps) and documentation tools
  
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (eg. Terraform)
  
Experience or affinity with IT Security concepts
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

DBT
  
Looker
  
Data governance, Data lineage, Data Catalogue (Metadata)
  
Apache Beam
  
Spark
  
Flink
  
Kafka
  
Automated testing framework
  
**Foreign languages:** English (advanced)
  
**Education:** A University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Financial Engineering or equivalent.
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

* A gross salary between € 4\.367,65 and € 7\.088,63
* 24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues


About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

title: Senior Data Center Shift Engineer
description:
**Are you a seasoned Data Center Engineer with extensive Electrical/Mechanical skills?**


Salute is a global leader in delivering Data Center services – firmly established in the US and with a rapidly growing client base across Europe and beyond.


This is an exciting time to join the team as we step up operations in new countries and commence work on new and challenging projects. As a result of this growth, we are looking to recruit and develop a Senior Data Centre Shift Engineer.


The Senior Data Centre Shift Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all electrical, mechanical, and fire/life safety equipment within the data center is operating at peak efficiency. This involves both planned preventative maintenance of equipment, daily corrective work, and emergency response to emergent issues. The Senior Data Centre Shift Engineer maintains relationships with third party vendors. Data center equipment that supports mission\-critical servers must maintain better than 99\.999% uptime. This equipment includes, but is not limited to, standby diesel generators, switchgear, UPSs, PDUs, AHUs, chillers, cooling towers, chemical treatment systems, pumps, motors, VFDs, and building automation systems.

**Requirements**

* Manage all SLA’s towards customers 100% Uptime (Temp., Hum, power, PUE/WUE, relation).
* Responsible for ensuring the safe, effective, and efficient delivery of planned maintenance, that meets all standards and procedures, by leveraging competent contractor/vendor resources with attention to quality.
* Ensures that the Manager of Operations is fully informed and briefed on all planned and corrective work occurring in the datacenter.
* Plans and implements customer requested work in a timely manner. Ensures that the customer and Manager of Operations are informed on the status and details of the work.
* In concert with the Manager of Operations:
	+ Plans work on 1\-line equipment according to Planned Preventive Maintenance Schedule, including roadmap to be approved by Manager of Operations and/or Nominated person in control of an electrical installation. (Dutch:” Installatieverantwoordelijke”)
	+ Prepares detailed Method of Procedure to be approved by Manager of Operations and/or nominated person in control of an electrical installation.
	+ Organizes all testing of mission critical equipment on the site.
	+ Responsible for ensuring that all work being done by contractors/vendors is logged in systems.
	+ Responsible for ensuring that all work being done by contractors/vendors is being done in accordance with the approved Method of Procedure.
* During normal working hours, responds to alarms, critical situations, and emergencies in a proper and timely manner. Responsible for communicating in a calm and clear manner and in accordance with the emergency response plan.
* Will take initiative to ensure that quality and efficiency standards are raised for all the equipment in the datacenter. This includes finding ways to deliver cost savings without sacrificing quality.
* Finds ways to increase energy efficiency without sacrificing continuity or uptime of the site.
* Administers in a correct and timely manner all executed work in accordance with all process and procedures.
* Works effectively and efficiently with others inside the organization
* In Emergencies, is responsible for the timely response to ensure safety and operational continuity on site.
* Is constantly monitoring the site to ensure that safety standards are met.

**Qualifications**

* Knowledge of Electrical and Mechanical systems in use in the Datacenter environment including transformers, generators, switchgear, UPS systems, ATS \& STS units, RPP units, chillers, CRAC/CRAH units
* Strong communications, both written and verbal, in leading teams and coordinating with peers and other disciplines on driving projects/issues to closure.
* Commitment to organizational excellence and constant awareness to seek opportunities to improve processes/quality of deliverables.
* Superb ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects/responsibilities.
* Superb ability to meet committed timelines, leveraging assistance/input from peers.
* Strong and effective team player in working with various disciplines and peer groups; can cover all gamut of tasks required to ‘getting a job done.’
* Strong attention to detail.

**Experience/Education**

* Education level complied with by WEB level 4 (WEB \= Dutch Adult and Vocational Training Act) with at least 4\-years of experience or HBO (Bachelor of Science/Bachelor of Engineering);
* LV/HV authorized to switch Certificate (NEN3140\-NEN3840\)
* Mechanical and/or Electrical training/education, with particular focus in power;
* Must have or be able to complete Safety for Operational Supervisors training (Dutch: “Veiligheid gezondheid milieu Checklist Aannemers” Abbreviation: “VCA”) and OSHA 30 shortly after start of employment.
* Relevant work experience in a data center or other critical environment.
* High school diploma or College Degree
* Good observation skills and problem\-solving ability
* Good verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English


The role is a full\-time position, and your base salary will be commensurate with experience but is expected to be highly competitive. The opportunity is located in Amsterdam, Netherlands and will include business travel as needed to meet business demands but will likely be nominal.


Here, at Salute, we value our people and take great pride in providing not just a job but fantastic career opportunities.


In addition to the opportunity to work in a great team and earn a competitive salary \- you'll gain access to cutting\-edge industry training that aims to enhance your skills and support your future development. Not only will you receive valuable on the job and structured training in your current role, but for those who are ambitious and motivated, the possibilities are endless.


\#EMEA

* Mechanical and/or Electrical training/education, with particular focus in power;
* Must have or be able to complete Safety for Operational Supervisors training (Dutch: “Veiligheid gezondheid milieu Checklist Aannemers” Abbreviation: “VCA”) and OSHA 30 shortly after start of employment.

title: Google Cloud Data Engineer
description:
- We are Devoteam, an AI\-driven tech consultancy with over 11,000 tech experts across 25 countries in Europe and the Middle East. At Devoteam, we strongly believe in the power of technology, with AI at the core of our approach. We collaborate with leading partners such as Google, Microsoft, AWS, and ServiceNow. In the Netherlands, we have around 300 experts, specializing in Cloud, Cyber, Data, and AI.


You’ll be part of a bunch of Tech Enthusiasts in a fail\-safe culture where everyone, from bright talents to experienced rockstars, is encouraged to continuously innovate and grow. We are a community that is proud of who you are and helps you to be the best version of yourself. Our dietary constraints: we’re allergic to unnecessary hierarchies and excessive processes. At Devoteam, the only constant is 'change'.

  
With a team of Data/Cloud \& Software Engineers you will take off on a journey to create a strategic product to facilitate and accelerate customer solutions on Google Cloud. You engineer based on the requirements of the project, but you are also not afraid to suggest solutions and propose your own ideas. You are a Google Cloud Expert, or are looking to become one in no time and learn from the best.


  
* \[Must\-have] Experience with development preferably in Python.
* \[Must\-have] Knowledge of the SQL programming language.
* \[Must\-have] Experience with data modeling and data warehousing.
* \[Must\-have] You know how to write properly documented and tested code.
* \[Must\-have] Experience with Google Cloud Platform.

**What we have to offer:**

* An exciting job where innovation in technology is not a buzzword but a reality.
* Continuous training \& development of soft\- and hard skills, including training at several Google locations.
* A competitive salary, in line with your profile.
* Additional benefits (permanent contract, bonus, lease car etc).
* An awesome team of colleagues \& regular team building activities.
* The ability to work with the world’s leading companies in technology and innovation.
* Hybrid way of working. Working remotely 4 weeks a year

  
- **For more information about this vacancy, please contact Floris Rienks via floris.rienks@devoteam.com.**

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
**Senior BI Engineer – Fintech / Sustainability / Green Energy / Trading – Amsterdam – 100K OTE** 




  





 Are you interested in working end\-to\-end on data from a fast\-growing fintech organization? And interested in having the freedom to choose and take ownership of multiple projects next to facilitating a huge migration to a modern environment? Read on!
 



  





***Keywords: Python, SQL, Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, Azure (Databricks, Data Lake, Data Factory)***




  





 Our client helps business reach their sustainability goals. They are a provider of energy and environmental solutions. They have trading systems related to energy to speed up the energy transition, focused on sustainable ways of doing this.
 



  





 The organization has a centralized data team responsible for the data services across various departments, including the complex trading data services. We are currently seeking to hire senior engineers for this team, which is accountable for the end\-to\-end data solutions within the company. This includes engaging with business units to provide dashboards, insights, and requirements analysis. The data can differ from department and your own input/ideas are valued.
 



  





 The data team is end\-to\-end. This includes developing data solutions to delivering them to data warehouses and dashboards. They also build and maintain the infrastructure foundational to the data platforms and lakes. The team manages and operates its environment and pipelines while creating new solutions, dashboards, and insights. They are currently in a migration towards a modern Azure\-based data landscape.
 



  





 We are looking to add a senior engineer to this team, preferably someone with a robust understanding of both the business and product aspects. The ideal candidate has a product mindset for data, has strong stakeholder management skills, and knows how to translate business challenges and requests into data solutions. Experience in the trading or energy sectors, and familiarity with a product mindset for data, are nice to have.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 4\+ years of experience with Azure and data tooling or equivalent.
* Experience working on end\-to\-end data solutions and stakeholder management.
* Experience with Python.
* Experience with Microsoft Fabric is nice to have.
* Experience in fintech/trading is nice to have.



  





**Benefits:** 



* Up to 85K base salary including holiday allowance
* 15%\-20% bonus (achieved company\-wide for the past 9 years)
* Full pension support
* Language lessons
* Discount on the gym
* Travel reimbursement
* 25 vacation days
* Other benefits
* VISA \& 30% Ruling
* Hybrid: 3 times office.



  





**Location: Amsterdam. Only candidates in the Netherlands.** 




  





**Interested? Please contact me at mette@doghouse\-recruitment.nl**

title: Data engineer (medior)
description:
**About the role** 





 As part of the overall data strategy, the Medior Data Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, ensuring high data availability, quality, and performance. This role plays a key part in enabling analytics, reporting, and machine learning workflows across the company.
 




  






 This position is for you if:
 



* You enjoy working across all phases of the data lifecycle: data ingestion, transformation, validation, monitoring, and optimization.
* You take pride in ensuring data quality, availability, and performance.
* You enjoy working collaboratively, and you raise your hand quickly when you’re blocked or uncertain.
* You’re intentional in your work — you plan first, code second.
* You stand by your architectural decisions and take ownership of the systems you build.
* You can clearly communicate technical concepts to non\-technical colleagues, and enjoy cross\-functional collaboration.



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable and high\-performance ETL/ELT pipelines.
* Ensuring data integrity, availability, and performance across the data infrastructure.
* Oversee and optimize database performance and reliability
* Ensure high standards of data quality and reliability
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with data processing and storage.
* Developing and maintaining unit tests, logging, debugging, and code review processes.
* Utilizing cloud\-based services, particularly AWS, to enhance data processing capabilities.
* Collaborating with cross\-functional teams to translate business needs into scalable data engineering solutions.
* Support downstream analytics and machine learning use cases with clean, well\-structured data
* Processing and managing Big Data workflows efficiently.
* Documenting technical implementations and processes for knowledge sharing and collaboration.
* Adhere to security and compliance policies for data handling.



  





**Key Performance Indicators** 



* Data pipeline reliability and performance.
* Compliance with best practices in coding, security, and data management.
* Efficient processing and transformation of large\-scale datasets.
* Effective collaboration across teams and successful delivery of data solutions.



  





**Requirements** 



* 3\+ years of professional experience in a data engineering or backend data role
* MSc in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, or any other relevant field
* Strong Python skills (intermediate\+\+)
* Solid understanding of relational databases and proficiency in SQL
* Proven experience with data processing libraries like pandas and numpy
* Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines
* AWS experience (S3, Lamda)
* Good coding practices (PEP8, unit tests, mocking, logging, debugging, code reviews, GitHub, etc.)
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* Living in Amsterdam or willing to relocate



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience working with time series or event\-based data
* Exposure to MLOps or machine learning workflows
* Knowledge of data warehousing and dimensional modeling





 ﻿
 





**About the company** 





 Neurocast is at the forefront of revolutionizing brain health monitoring. Their platform enables unobtrusive, real\-time, remote monitoring, providing valuable insights into brain health for both patients and researchers. With a focus on privacy and accessibility, Neurocast helps patients manage brain\-related diseases and supports pharmaceutical and academic research. By offering clinically validated tools, Neurocast accelerates research and enhances patient care while reducing barriers to participation. They are dedicated to improving lives through innovative solutions in brain health and continue to build a passionate, forward\-thinking team. Learn more at
 
 Neurocast
 
 .

description:

* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
 
  




* Ensure data is cleansed, mapped, transformed, and optimized for storage and use based on business and technical requirements.
* Develop and maintain innovative solutions using Microsoft Azure services and other relevant tools.
* Design solutions using Microsoft Azure and associated services.
* Automate tasks and deploy production\-quality code, including unit testing, continuous integration, and versioning.
* Load transformed data into storage and reporting structures, including data warehouses, high\-speed indexes, real\-time reporting systems, and analytics applications.
* Build data pipelines to efficiently consolidate data from multiple sources.
* Responsible for extracting data, troubleshooting, and maintaining the data warehouse.

* Experience with Azure services: ADLS, Databricks, Stream Analytics, SQL DW, Cosmos DB, Analysis Services, Azure Functions, Serverless Architecture, ARM Templates, Azure DataFactory
* Knowledge of Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform
* Experience with Machine Learning and AI
* Proven experience as an Azure Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.
* Strong analytical skills, particularly in working with unstructured datasets.
* Ability to design and implement well\-structured, efficient code.
* Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Experience in testing data from source to presentation layer.
* Expertise in supporting and troubleshooting data pipelines.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to foster alignment, collaboration, and efficiency within teams.


 Benefits
 * A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Azure Data engineer
description: Design, develop, and maintain complex data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks.? Build and optimize large\-scale data processing solutions using PySpark and Databricks.? Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver efficient data solutions.? Implement CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps for automated testing, integration, and deployment of data solutions.? Develop, test, and maintain robust data solutions in Python for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.? Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.? Ensure data security and compliance with company standards and best practices.? Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in cloud data engineering and Azure services.Required Skills and Qualifications:? Experience with Azure Data Factory for orchestrating and automating data movement and transformation.? Proficiency in Azure Databricks for building and managing scalable data processing frameworks.? Strong programming skills in Python and experience working with PySpark for big data processing.? Knowledge of Azure DevOps and experience with CI/CD pipeline implementation.? Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing large datasets.? Strong problem\-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.? Excellent communication and documentation skills.We are seeking a highly skilled Azure Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and PySpark. Additionally, knowledge of Azure DevOps and proficiency in Python is essential for building and managing data pipelines, developing scalable data solutions, and ensuring continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) within the cloud environment.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We are Leads.io — the world's \#1 tech\-driven lead generation agency. With a determination to become an ever\-better growth catalyst for our clients, we are on the lookout for fresh faces to join our team! Do you have what it takes to join Leads.io?
   

  

 You're a skilled Software Engineer who loves to help our company grow by building enterprise software. You'll be working with multiple colleagues on many projects to improve our primary processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As our Software Engineer (32\-40 hours) with PHP \& Laravel experience, you'll build the enterprise software that helps our company with its primary processes to a competitive advantage over our competition. We've built our own marketing platform, project management system, client portal, and more. You'll work on a project in a team, depending on the scope of the project. We have daily stand\-ups and a scrum session every two weeks, guided by our Scrum Master, where you can present your ideas and work together with the Product Owner to create the best product.
   

  

 You will be in a Scrum Team. Every morning, you will join the stand up with other developers in the team with a dedicated scrum master and product owner. During the week, you will have refinement, planning, demo and retrospective.
   

  

 This is part of what made us the leading agency, and an important part of our strategy for the future.
   

  

 After a week full of exciting projects, Friday has arrived and we are ready for a well\-deserved weekend and maybe a few drinks to close off the week.
   

  

 If you're curious check our Technology page on our website!
   

  

**About Leads.io**
 Leads.io is your technology\-driven partner in effective lead generation. As a global team spread out across eleven offices in nine countries, our mission is to provide empowering business solutions on a global scale. By delivering high\-quality leads through diverse channels such as Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, display, native, paid search and organic, Leads.io aims to elevate our clients' ventures to new heights of success.
   

  

 As a team of result\-oriented experts in marketing, technology, strategy, and content, we remain committed to excelling at our craft with every step we take. We think big, act fast, and confidently pave the way for the future. Through a dedication to personal excellence, teamwork, and accountability, Leads.io fosters an environment in which you can shape your path to success whilst engaged in a dynamic and successful company environment.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Your qualifications**
* You have PHP \& Laravel Experience
* You enjoy working with multiple systems
* You're located in the Netherlands
* You value clean and maintainable code
* You score points when you have experience with Typescript and Docker
* You get energy from working with our own enterprise software
* You can guide junior developers to improve their craftsmanship


 As Leads.io, we take great pride in our diversity and inclusivity as a hallmark of our success. For this reason, we ensure that all candidates from all backgrounds will receive fair consideration irrespective of their race, gender, faith, religion, or disability. We invite all qualified and motivated individuals to take a chance at joining our team!
   

  

**Benefits**
**What's in it for you?**
* 25 holidays per year and 8% holiday pay
* Hybrid working/ working from home allowance
* Working in an open culture with plenty of room for personal initiative and growth
* Knowledge sessions hosted by internal and external experts multiple times a year
* Daily fresh arranged lunch at the office
* Flexible working hours
* Macbook, and mouse/keyboard
* Possibility to work fully remote at your dream location for up to a month a year


**Excited? Wait until you see our cultural values!**
*✨ Trust \-* 
 At Leads.io, we emphasize accountability and transparency, setting the foundation for genuine partnerships.
   

  

 ✨
 *Own it \-* 
 Ownership entails having pride in both your work and yourself. We each aim to take a personal initiative in improving our business, so being the best version of yourself is the best\-case scenario for us.
   

  

 ✨
 *Grow smart \-* 
 Our vision is to become a global frontrunner in lead generation. We are committed to continually scaling our business whilst also growing as individuals in the process.
   

  

 ✨
 *Thrive as a team \-* 
 We believe that teamwork is a key ingredient to obtaining outstanding results. While holding personal work ethics in high regard, we also encourage a working environment that is both social and more enjoyable through teamwork.
   

  

 Our recruitment process is designed to ensure the best fit. It comprises a phone meeting to discuss qualifications, followed by two interviews for skills and cultural alignment and an assessment. If successful, we will extend a formal offer. Upon acceptance, you'll embark on your exciting journey with Leads.io.
   

  

**Does this sound like your new challenge? Apply now, and we'll be in touch with you soon!**

title: Digital Business Architect
description:
At COO Tech, our mission is to bring transparency, control, and standardization to the IT products and services delivered across ING. By doing so, we help drive faster, more cost\-efficient, and effective technology solutions company\-wide.
  
  

The top structure of COO Tech consists of four subdepartments, with several teams operating under its leadership: 1\) CTO Development \& Support, 2\) Change \& Transformation, 3\) Product \& Service Management and 4\) Reporting \& Insights (CDO). This function will report into the lead Product Catalogue and Standards Management under the Product \& Service management department.
  
  

Join us in this team where we aim to bridge the gap from our central organisation to the diverse Tech domains across ING group. This means you’ll be at the forefront of driving centralized improvements while ensuring local implementations remain agile, relevant, and efficient.
  
What you will do
  
  

**Defining the business framework:** Establish the framework and guidelines necessary to map IT solutions across the entire ING group. This includes identifying key business processes, capabilities, and objectives to ensure that IT solutions align with business goals.
  
  

**Strategic alignment:** Work closely with stakeholders to ensure that the business framework supports the strategic objectives of ING. Continuously assess and refine the framework to adapt to changing business needs and technological advancements.
  
  

**Ensuring robust connections:** Facilitate strong linkages between providers and consumers within the organization. Ensure seamless integration and communication between different departments and teams to optimize the flow of information and services .
  
  

**Developing a marketplace :** Contribute to developing a marketplace between internal IT providers and consumers within ING. This involves creating a platform where IT services can be efficiently matched with business needs, enhancing internal service delivery and utilization.
  
  

How to succeed
  
We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  
  

**What are we looking for. Experience:**  

8\+ years of experience in business architecture with a proven track record of designing and implementing digital strategies, aligning IT solutions with business goals, and facilitating digital transformation within organizations.
  
  

Knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks and the ability to align IT strategy with business goals is essential. This includes experience in designing and implementing enterprise\-wide solutions
  
  

Demonstrated experience in engaging with stakeholders at various levels, gathering and documenting requirements, and developing actionable solutions.
  
  

Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to dissect complex issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions.
  
  

Experience in conducting workshops, developing business process models, and delivering comprehensive documentation.
  
  

Familiarity with Agile \& Lean methodologies.
  
  

**Skills:**  

**Analytical Skills:** Proficiency in analysing business requirements, process capabilities, and data to develop effective IT solutions.
  
  

**Business Process Knowledge:** In\-depth understanding of IT and business processes, particularly within the banking sector, to ensure alignment with organizational goals.
  
  

**Communication and Documentation:** Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey technical and business information to stakeholders and team members; proficiency in English.
  
  

**Innovation:** Ability to think creatively and develop new solutions to improve existing frameworks and operating models.
  
  

**Collaboration and Leadership:** Strong teamwork and leadership abilities to work effectively with cross\-functional teams and drive initiatives to successful completion.
  
  

**Resilience :** Capacity to manage ambiguity and complexity, maintaining effectiveness under pressure.
  
  

**Education:**  

Master’s or bachelor’s degree and relevant certifications (e.g. Lean, Agile, BusDevOps)
  
  

Rewards and benefits
  
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.
  
  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**  

A gross salary between € 5\.212,06 and € 8\.387,68
  
  

24\-27 vacation days depending on contract
  
  

Pension scheme
  
  

13th month salary
  
  

8% Holiday payment
  
  

Hybrid working
  
  

Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
  
  

An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
  
  

About us
  
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward ? Discover what we do and what we can offer you .
  
  

Questions?
  
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.
  
  

A motivated cover letter (explaining your qualifications for the role) is required.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.

title: Ice Cream – SAP Master Data Expert Manufacturing & Material
description:
**Note: Deadline for applying is 23\.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.**

**ICE CREAM IS LOOKING FOR AN Ice Cream – SAP Master Data Expert Manufacturing \& Material**

  

Location: The Netherlands (Amsterdam) – *PREFERED*, UKI (100 VE), India (Bangalore), Turkey (Umraniye)


Full\-time: Yes


Local conditions apply

 *For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but* ***at this stage we will not take your application forward.*** *We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.*

  

The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8\.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025\. We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences \- transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.


**ABOUT THE MAGNUM ICE CREAM COMPANY:**


The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.


With 19\.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben \& Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.


We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025\.


We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.


If you want to **grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream**, this is the place for you!

**JOB PURPOSE:**


As part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a dedicated and knowledgeable **SAP Master Data Expert**, to serve as the **Global Functional Data Owner** for the **Manufacturing \& Material (primarily, Indirect Materials) master data domains** during our SAP S4/HANA implementation. In this critical role, you will lead the transformation from current (“as\-is”) to future (“to\-be”) state, identifying and driving harmonization opportunities, standardizing data models, unifying process and technology, and overseeing data migration. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, integrity, and alignment with business objectives.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


All responsibilities are centered around the Manufacturing \& Material master data domains:

* Act as the primary point of contact for the respective domain(s), including but not limited to: data structure, data governance, data management, data cleansing, data migration etc.
* Own domain(s) end\-to\-end.
* Lead the design of the future global data model and data orchestration process.
* Document future data model and data orchestration process (incl. standard operating procedures), business and data quality rules, definitions and standards.
* Define and establish data governance policies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders within and outside of the project to identify potential data harmonization opportunities.
* Steer data migration scope definition, transformation and enrichment.
* Direct data profiling \& data cleansing activities.
* Coordinate with cross\-functional teams, including IT, business and external partners to ensure seamless data migration execution.
* Co\-deliver the data migration workshops.
* Partner with regional SME (subject matter experts) to ensure adherence to global data model during deployment.
* Supervise conversion data documents and any other data migration artifacts.
* Oversee data validation and reconciliation processes as part of data migration cycles.
* Analyze relevant defects during test cycles and cutovers, translate them into actionable items (e.g. new or updated data transformation rules, data selection criteria, data enrichment etc.).
* Develop and conduct key user trainings.
* Proactively address any risks associated with data cleansing and migration.
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders, keeping them informed of progress, milestones, and any potential issues or challenges. Foster open communication channels to facilitate transparency and collaboration.


This role will exist in its current form for 2\.5\- 3 years.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:**

* Proven experience (3\-5 years) in **master** **data management** *(respective domain)*, with a focus on **data process**, **data governance** and **data migration** within the large multinational CPG company, preferably in the context of SAP S4/HANA implementations.
* Experience in identifying and implementing **data harmonization opportunities** to drive process efficiency and standardization.
* Broad understanding of business process and associated data.
* Familiarity with **regulatory requirements and compliance standards** related to data management and governance.
* Proficiency in **Microsoft Office solutions**, including SharePoint, Teams, Excel, and PowerPoint, leveraging these tools to facilitate communication, collaboration, and documentation throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Excellent communication and interpersonal skills**, with the ability to collaborate, influence and engage effectively with diverse stakeholders across business and technical functions to achieve project milestones.
* Excellent proficiency in **written and verbal communication in English**, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to diverse stakeholders.
* **Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills**, detail\-oriented, with the ability to translate business requirements into practical data solutions and driving results in a fast\-paced, dynamic environment.
* **Experience with data cataloging, cleansing and migration** tools and techniques, as well as **metadata management** principles.
* Familiarity with **regulatory requirements and compliance standards** related to data migration.
* Strong track record of **driving change and innovation**, with the ability to think outside the box and embrace an agile and growth mindset.
* **Result\-oriented** with a strong focus on delivering **high\-quality outcomes**.
* **Proactive** and **adaptable**, with the ability to **manage multiple priorities** in a fast\-paced environment.
* Ability to **travel globally** to support market\-specific requirements during design, build and deployment of the project.

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**  

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting \& dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme.
* Flexible cross\-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities \& wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company\-paid holidays to further ensure your work\-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Home work allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy

**EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!

  

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

 *Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.*

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*


NOTE: Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.

100 Victoria Embankment
London EC4Y 0DY
United Kingdom

title: Ice Cream -Source to Pay – Indirect Materials Lead
description:
**Note: Deadline for applying is 23\.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.**

**ICE CREAM IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM – Source to Pay – Indirect Materials Lead**

  

Location: The Netherlands (Amsterdam)


Full\-time: Yes


Local conditions apply


This role will exist in its current form for 2\.5\- 3 years.

 *For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but* ***at this stage we will not take your application forward.*** *We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.*

  

The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8\.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025\. We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences \- transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.


**ABOUT THE MAGNUM ICE CREAM COMPANY:**


The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.


With 19\.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben \& Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.


We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025\.


We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.


If you want to **grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream**, this is the place for you!

**JOB PURPOSE:**


As part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a dedicated and knowledgeable **Source to Pay Lead for indirect Materials**, to serve as the **Global Functional Partner to Procurement** during our SAP S4/HANA implementation and mid\-term digital procurement strategy. In this critical role, you will lead the transformation from current (“as\-is”) to future (“to\-be”) state, identifying and driving harmonization and simplification opportunities, standardizing data models, unifying process and technology, and overseeing data migration. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, integrity, and alignment with business objectives.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


All responsibilities are centered around Procurements indirect material domains:

* Act as the primary point of contact for the respective domain(s), including but not limited to: media, marketing, IT, business services, MRO, etc.
* Lead the design and implementation of ERP solutions focused on the S2P process for indirect materials
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to gather requirements and configure the ERP system accordingly
* Analyze current S2P processes and workflows, identifying areas for improvement in the ERP system
* Implement best practices and features within the ERP to enhance efficiency and productivity in procurement and payment processes
* Develop and deliver training programs for end\-users to ensure effective utilization of the ERP system
* Provide on going support to users post go\-live, addressing any issues identified
* Oversee data integrity and accuracy within the data migration process, ensuring all procurement and payment data is correctly entered and maintained
* Generate and analyze reports from the ERP system to provide insights into procurement performance and spending patterns
* Work closely with procurement, finance, IT and other departments to ensure seamless integration of the ERP system with other business processes and systems
* Serve as a liaison between the business, our integration partner and procurement solution providers
* Ensure adherence to internal controls, compliance requirements, and procurement policies

We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences \- transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.


**ABOUT THE MAGNUM ICE CREAM COMPANY:**


The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.


With 19\.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben \& Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.


We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025\.


We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.


If you want to **grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream**, this is the place for you!

**JOB PURPOSE:**


As part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a dedicated and knowledgeable **Source to Pay Lead for Direct Materials**, to serve as the **Global Functional Partner to Procurement** during our SAP S4/HANA implementation and mid\-term digital procurement strategy. In this critical role, you will lead the transformation from current (“as\-is”) to future (“to\-be”) state, identifying and driving harmonization and simplification opportunities, standardizing data models, unifying process and technology, and overseeing data migration. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, integrity, and alignment with business objectives.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Analyze current S2P processes and workflows, identifying areas for improvement in the ERP system
* Implement best practices and features within the ERP to enhance efficiency and productivity in procurement and payment processes
* Develop and deliver training programs for end\-users to ensure effective utilization of the ERP system
* Provide on going support to users post go\-live, addressing any issues identified
* Oversee data integrity and accuracy within the data migration process, ensuring all procurement and payment data is correctly entered and maintained
* Generate and analyze reports from the ERP system to provide insights into procurement performance and spending patterns
* Work closely with procurement, finance, IT and other departments to ensure seamless integration of the ERP system with other business processes and systems
* Serve as a liaison between the business, our integration partner and procurement solution providers
* Ensure adherence to internal controls, compliance requirements, and procurement policies
* Identify and mitigate risk associated with the S2P process through effective system controls
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders, keeping them informed of progress, milestones, and any potential issues or challenges. Foster open communication channels to facilitate transparency and collaboration
* Lead initiatives for process improvement and automation within the S2P function for direct materials


This role will exist in its current form for 2\.5\- 3 years.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Supply Chain Management or a related field
* Proven experience with SAP systems specific to **procurement and finance modules**, preferably in the context of SAP S4/HANA
* Strong understand of the **Source to Pay** process and procurement best practices
* Broad understanding **of procurement process**
* Proficiency in **Microsoft Office solutions**, including SharePoint, Teams, Excel, and PowerPoint, leveraging these tools to facilitate communication, collaboration, and documentation throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Excellent communication and interpersonal skills**, with the ability to collaborate, influence and engage effectively with diverse stakeholders across business and technical functions to achieve project milestones.

* **Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills**, detail\-oriented, with the ability to translate business requirements into practical data solutions and driving results in a fast\-paced, dynamic environment.

* Strong track record of **driving change and innovation**, with the ability to think outside the box and embrace an agile and growth mindset.
* **Result\-oriented** with a strong focus on delivering **high\-quality outcomes**.
* **Proactive** and **adaptable**, with the ability to **manage multiple priorities** in a fast\-paced environment.

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**  

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting \& dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme.

**JOB PURPOSE:**


As part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a dedicated and knowledgeable **SAP Master Data Expert**, to serve as the **Global Functional Data Owner** for the **Vendor (Supplier) master data domain** during our SAP S4/HANA implementation. In this critical role, you will lead the transformation from current (“as\-is”) to future (“to\-be”) state, identifying and driving harmonization opportunities, standardizing data models, unifying process and technology, and overseeing data migration. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, integrity, and alignment with business objectives.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


All responsibilities are centered around the Vendor master data domain:

* Act as the primary point of contact for the respective domain, including but not limited to: data structure, data governance, data management, data cleansing, data migration etc.
* Own domain end\-to\-end.
* Lead the design of the future global data model and data orchestration process.
* Document future data model and data orchestration process (incl. standard operating procedures), business and data quality rules, definitions and standards.
* Define and establish data governance policies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders within and outside of the project to identify potential data harmonization opportunities.
* Steer data migration scope definition, transformation and enrichment.
* Direct data profiling \& data cleansing activities.
* Coordinate with cross\-functional teams, including IT, business and external partners to ensure seamless data migration execution.
* Co\-deliver the data migration workshops.
* Partner with regional SME (subject matter experts) to ensure adherence to global data model during deployment.
* Supervise conversion data documents and any other data migration artifacts.
* Oversee data validation and reconciliation processes as part of data migration cycles.
* Analyze relevant defects during test cycles and cutovers, translate them into actionable items (e.g. new or updated data transformation rules, data selection criteria, data enrichment etc.).
* Develop and conduct key user trainings.
* Proactively address any risks associated with data cleansing and migration.
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders, keeping them informed of progress, milestones, and any potential issues or challenges. Foster open communication channels to facilitate transparency and collaboration.


This role will exist in its current form for 2\.5\- 3 years.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:**

* Proven experience (3\-5 years) in **master** **data management** *(respective domain)*, with a focus on **data process**, **data governance** and **data migration** within the large multinational CPG company, preferably in the context of SAP S4/HANA implementations.
* Experience in identifying and implementing **data harmonization opportunities** to drive process efficiency and standardization.
* Broad understanding of business process and associated data.
* Familiarity with **regulatory requirements and compliance standards** related to data management and governance.
* Proficiency in **Microsoft Office solutions**, including SharePoint, Teams, Excel, and PowerPoint, leveraging these tools to facilitate communication, collaboration, and documentation throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Excellent communication and interpersonal skills**, with the ability to collaborate, influence and engage effectively with diverse stakeholders across business and technical functions to achieve project milestones.
* Excellent proficiency in **written and verbal communication in English**, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to diverse stakeholders.
* **Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills**, detail\-oriented, with the ability to translate business requirements into practical data solutions and driving results in a fast\-paced, dynamic environment.
* **Experience with data cataloging, cleansing and migration** tools and techniques, as well as **metadata management** principles.
* Familiarity with **regulatory requirements and compliance standards** related to data migration.
* Strong track record of **driving change and innovation**, with the ability to think outside the box and embrace an agile and growth mindset.
* **Result\-oriented** with a strong focus on delivering **high\-quality outcomes**.
* **Proactive** and **adaptable**, with the ability to **manage multiple priorities** in a fast\-paced environment.
