title: Patient Navigator - Register Interest - 0.1 FTE -...
description:
**About Us:**  

Innovative Trials is a global leader in patient recruitment and retention for clinical trials with an opportunity for work in early 2025 we want to hear from you! We’re committed to making a difference by supporting patients through their clinical trial journey, ensuring they receive the care, guidance, and assistance they need.  

  

We are currently seeking a passionate and skilled Patient Navigator to join our team. This role is ideal for independent in country individuals on a contract basis with a strong background in clinical research who are enthusiastic about patient care and supporting clinical trial processes.  

  

**Job Purpose:**  

As a Patient Navigator (PN), you will play a critical role in supporting patients participating in clinical trials. This includes:

  

* Providing empathetic and informed support to patients and caregivers through live inbound and outbound communication.
* Guiding participants through prescreening processes to determine initial eligibility.
* Acting as a liaison between patients, clinical sites, and other stakeholders to ensure a seamless and supportive clinical trial experience.
  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Engage with patients and caregivers to build trust and address any barriers or concerns they face during the trial process.
* Manage inbound and outbound communications via phone, email, and web chat while maintaining professionalism and urgency.
* Conduct prescreening calls to determine study eligibility and liaise with study sites for follow\-up.
* Navigate helpdesk systems to track and resolve patient queries efficiently.
* Provide timely reporting on patient queries, prescreening outcomes, and site follow\-ups.
* Support sites by improving communication and promoting effective use of recruitment and retention tools.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clinical research associates (CRAs) and other vendors.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including HIPAA, GCP, GDPR, and country\-specific data privacy laws.
  

  

**Key Skills and Attributes:**

  

* Nursing degree or background
* At least two years of relevant clinical research experience.
* Current GCP certification and familiarity with country\-specific data privacy regulations.
* Exceptional communication skills in English and local languages (verbal, written, and listening).
* Proficiency in tools like Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and video conferencing platforms is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail, organisational skills, and the ability to work independently.
* A compassionate approach to supporting patients with diverse needs.
* Mental Health First Aid certification is a plus.
* Extensive knowledge of local healthcare systems is highly desirable.
  

  

**What We can provide:**

  

* Comprehensive onboarding and training tailored to assigned studies.
* Flexible working hours with opportunities to accept assignments based on your availability and needs of the study.
* Reimbursement for travel expenses in line with company policy.
* The opportunity to make a significant impact on clinical trial experiences while working on a flexible, contract basis.
company_addresses:
Innovative House, 
Avenue One, 
Letchworth Garden City, 
SG6 2WW
company_description: Innovative Trials specialises in delivering effective global clinical research patient recruitment strategies by adopting a patient and site-centric approach

title: Finance Business Partner
description:
**Who we are**  

At Fagron we are creating the future of personalizing medicine. We strive to make a difference and bring a positive impact in every aspect of our endeavours:  

* Enabling accessibility to compounding and personalizing medicine.
* Demonstrating social responsibility, ethical practices, and diversity to benefit the environment and community.
* Driving excellence in our operations, leaving a global imprint.
* Cultivating a collaborative and entrepreneurial working environment where innovation can thrive.
  

We started our journey in 1990 in the Netherlands, and quickly expanded to over 30 countries serving more than 80 locations worldwide, becoming the world’s leading pharmaceutical compounding company. As we continue our growth, we are looking for talented individuals, that could be you, to join our Fagron Family!

  


If you are excited to join an organization with an 84% engagement score, where every day is a new adventure, your contributions are valued and celebrated, you can grow both personally and professionally. We are committed to providing equal opportunities for all applicants, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, age, or any characteristic.

 **About the job**  

For our Emerging Markets Region we are looking for a Finance Business Partner who thrives in a fast\-paced work environment and reports to the EMEA Finance Manager. In this role you are responsible for advising and monitoring the business processes, and searching for opportunities for quality/efficiency improvements. You evaluate and interpret financial data and translate this into understandable reports. Good accounting is the starting point for this. You support commercial thinking, but you also know how to challenge this when necessary.



Function:


* Provide management with financial and analytical support and detailed insights to act as a trusted partner on strategic decisions in the short and long term.


* Coordinate and supervise the various financial activities of entities within this region and formulate and oversee the finance strategy and policies in line with the business strategy.


* Coordinate the annual budget process and quarterly forecast process together with management and local controllers.


* Manage the closing and reporting processes for the companies within the region together with management, local finance teams and Shared Service Centre (Barcelona, Spain).


* Proactively analysing, delivering and communicating results (monitoring variances, identifying trends, etc) across the different departments.


* Set up, control and follow up on finance procedures in line with the Fagron guidelines to improve the quality of the current processes and tools.


* Motivate and coach a team of local controllers and finance professionals to (further) develop their capabilities, skills and knowledge.


* Participate in Ad hoc projects (i.e. advice on contract negotiations, lead local ERP implementations…).

 **Set yourself apart*** You have experience in a dynamic environment in which you will fully operational, but also think along at strategic level.


* A Bachelor or Master’s degree in Business Economics, Accounting or Controlling.


* At least 3 years of experience in management and controlling position.



• Excellent accounting knowledge (IFRS). • Experience with Financial and ICT processes (Microsoft Dynamics 365 is an advantage).


* Clear interest in new IT tools in the area of financial analysis and reporting, Power BI is a plus.


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, any other language is a plus.


* Expert in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel).


* Affinity with a sales and innovation\-driven organization.


* Positive and collaborative attitude, solid team player with the ability to work independently in a confident, deliberate and productive manner, being analytical, accurate and performance driven.



• Ability to research issues and arrive at logical well\-documented analysis and conclusions. • Willing to travel.

 **What's on offer?*** Market conform salary, all in line with your knowledge \& experience.
* Annual bonus, based on company and personal targets.
* Hybrid working with 3 days in the office.
* 100% travel allowance.
* Pension \& healthcare plan.
* Laptop \& mobile phone.
* 28 holiday days.

 **Ready for the challenge?**  

Are you interested in this role and joining the Fagron team? Apply online.  

Job Reference: FA03517

title: Lead, Retail Development - Project Management (Paternity Cover)
description:
**Values \& Innovation**
------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values \- Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality \- serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further \- no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state\-of\-the\-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------

**The paternity coverage will last approximately 6 months.**


The Retail Project Manager is responsible for managing the new space opening and refit program in the EMEA region for our DTC (Direct to Consumer) Owned \& Operated business and reporting directly to the Real Estate Sr. Manager.

  

You will manage multiple projects simultaneously across our owned full price and outlet channels from project initiation till completion.


Additionally, you will lead work \& you will collaborate with internal cross functional departments (Real Estate, DTC Operations, Store Design, Retail Marketing, Visual Merchandising, Merchandising, Sales) and external stakeholders (landlords, contractors, UA vendors \& agencies); to ensure the projects are delivered on time, in scope, within budget \& meeting UA’s quality standards.

  

In this position you will be the primary point of contact for DTC O\&O to drive the new store opening and refit process, influencing key stakeholders in decision making, manage the construction schedules \& processes; you will also be responsible to initiate improvements, set up tools – process \& procedures to support the business for long time success.

  

As a Project Manager you lead, manage and organize construction projects with a high level of professionalism and according to routines, company policies, guidelines and local legislations. You prepare and present budgets as well as follow\-up on cost and suppliers to secure financial transparency. You drive tendering and contracting for your projects and coordinate feasibility studies, design, execution and logistics for your projects. Through strong teamwork and clear communication, you secure that the relevant stakeholders receive needed information on time.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Manages the EMEA DTC O\&O new space opening and refits program; ensures the projects will be delivered on time, within budget \& quality and brand standards.
* Setting budgets and timelines for all projects and tracking against these.
* Run projects in line with UA routines and policies to secure financial transparency.
* Supports the Real Estate Sr. Manager in the business case preparation and during leasing process with feasibility and technical input.
* Works closely with NSO Lead and cross\- functional project teams with internal (Operations, Merchandising, VM, RM) and external (Architects, consultants, contractors) stakeholders on a continuous basis,
* Leads procurement, contracting and management of all consultants and vendors per project.
* Coordinate tenders, evaluate bids and select final contractors.
* Manages supply chain of (project specific) directly supplied materials from our Global/Regional vendors.
* Drives improvement actions, makes recommendations \& develops processes, tools \& vendors to set the department up for long term success and elevate the brand.
* Optimizes planning and follow up.
* Supports the EMEA Expansion strategy.
* Provides continuous value engineering; acts proactively in making data driven decisions on alternative approaches,
* Acts as primary program lead \& contact for O\&O DTC in EMEA for assigned projects within region.
* Secure that all stores are built in line with the general/local building standards and UA portfolio brand specifications.
* Secure a good communication between internal and external stakeholders.
* Ensure compliance with project documentation, time schedule, quality reporting, project closure and handover.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* University degree in Construction or Architecture.
* 8 \+ years of relevant experience in Project Management for an international retailer.
* Proficiency in Autocad; Ms Office including Ms Project,
* Fluent in English,
* Strong Analytical \& Proactive Problem\-Solving Ability,
* Strong cross functional communication skills and conflict management.
* High ability to multitasking, organizing and prioritizing.
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location**: Amsterdam office
* **Work life Integration Designation**: Starting in October, teammates are required to work on\-site for 3 days per week. This will increase to 4 days per week beginning January 2026\.


\#LI\-KC1


\#LI\-HYBRID

**Benefits \& Perks**
---------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health \& fitness benefits, discounts and resources\- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well\-being.

**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Director Tax
description:
**Your role**

Reporting to the VP Tax EMEA, this position will work as part of the EMEA tax leadership team responsible for leading and overseeing all tax strategy, compliance and operations within the EMEA region. This role ensures adherence to local and international tax laws while optimizing the companyâ€™s tax position and mitigating risks. The EMEA tax director works cross functionally with the global tax team, internal finance and business teams.


* Developing and executing tax strategies tailored to the specific regulatory and economic environment of the region.
* Identifying opportunities for tax efficiency and risk mitigation while ensuring full compliance with tax regulations.
* Assisting EMEA investment team on acquisitions, dispositions and M\&A related tax structuring, due diligence and modeling requests.
* Leading tax related projects through effective collaboration with finance teams.
* Leading key income tax accounting judgments, significant tax estimates, technical tax accounting conclusions, and tax disclosures.
* Collaborating with external advisors and auditors to manage tax audits disputes and regulatory reviews.
* Overseeing tax compliance and tax reporting for the region including US GAAP reporting.
* Monitoring and interpreting changes in tax legislation, assessing potential impacts on the business and implementing necessary changes.
* Identifying and implementing process improvement/automation initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of tax processes.
* Partnering with a network of internal stakeholders (accounting, FP\&A, country MDs, commercial teams, and the global tax group) and external consultants and service providers
* Co\-leading, mentoring, and developing a high\-performing regional tax team.
* Fostering a culture of continuous improvement, compliance, and knowledge\-sharing within the organization.

**What youâ€™ll need**

* Tax qualified with a minimum of 12 yearsâ€™ experience in international tax including working in an international tax function of a multinational listed group.
* Demonstrated technical strength and knowledge spanning international tax, tax accounting and compliance and M\&A.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills. Ability to influence and impact others and take initiative and ownership of results.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills. Team player with strong interpersonal skills, flexible and adaptable to change.
* Proven leadership and team management skills.
* Self\-starter with strong analytical, time management and project management skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and complete tasks within time constraints and deadlines.

**A bit about us**

Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITALÂ®, the company's global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDxâ„¢) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300\+ facilities in 50\+ metros across 25\+ countries on six continents.


**What we can offer you**

Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers. Join us and youâ€™ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, youâ€™ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. Weâ€™ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us. This is an exciting time to join our business so apply now and make your mark on our future.
company_description: Our purpose at Digital Realty is “To bring companies and data together, in bold new ways, to power the innovation determining our future.”

title: Lead HR Services
description:
What does the role of Lead HR Services entail?



As a Lead HR Services, you will oversee and optimize HR operations, payroll, compliance, and system processes within a dynamic manufacturing/high\-tech environment. You will be responsible for HR administration, ensuring compliance with Dutch labor laws and CLA regulations, and act as a strategic partner to the company and the whole HR team. This role requires leadership, analytical skills, and experience in HR optimization, payroll processes, and applying CLA. In this role you will lead a team of two HR Officers and report to the HR Director Europe \& US. You also be part of the HR MT.



What will you be doing:



HR Operations \& Payroll


* Lead the HR team and ensure efficient HR activities.


* Support the HR Business Partners


* Supervise monthly salary processing with ADP, including handling mutations, payslip verification and salary changes together with the team.


* Ensure compliance with Dutch employment legislation and the collective labour agreement.


* Maintain and update the HR Handbook and policies, in collaboration with the team and external advisors.


* Manage and optimize HR processes, HR systems and templates (e.g. Workday, HRIS).



Compliance \& Risk Management


* Ensure correct input and output of HR data in systems.


* Guarantee data accuracy for internal reporting and annual reports


* Monitor and enforce compliance with visa regulations (30% ruling) and other Dutch labor laws.


* Oversee pension regulations and payroll administration.


* Act as the template owner, ensuring all HR\-related templates are up\-to\-date and legally compliant.



HR Strategy \& Business Partnership


* Serve as a strategic business partner for the organization and the HR Team.


* Advise on HR policies and the application of the collective labour agreement.



System \& Process Optimization


* Analyze and improve HR systems, workflows, and data accuracy.


* Ensure proper registration and documentation of HR processes, including QESH compliance.


* Utilize the HR ticket system to analyze trends, resolve issues, and predict HR support needs.



Are you our Lead HR Services?



Like no other, you see opportunities to improve HR processes, and you have already implemented numerous HR related processes and compliance improvements.



Furthermore, you have:


* An HBO/Bachelor’s degree or demonstrate an equivalent level of thinking (HBO denk niveau) in HR, Business Administration, or a related field.


* 5\+ years of experience in HR, with expertise in payroll processes, CLA, and Dutch labor law.


* Experience with HR systems optimization in a technical/global environment (e.g., Workday).


* Leadership and analytical skills to manage and improve HR functions effectively.


* Fluency in Dutch and English (written and spoken).


* Strong understanding of HR compliance, payroll frameworks, and pension regulations.



About Us



Frencken Mechatronics develops and assembles high\-tech industrial systems for the semiconductor, healthcare, and analytical markets. Our expertise includes cleanroom and non\-cleanroom precision assembly of mechanical parts, machine assemblies, and vacuum systems. We also produce high\-quality components and modules for leading companies in the high\-tech industry.



Why join us?



In this role, you'll be stepping into a key leadership position within a fast\-growing high\-tech and manufacturing environment.



We believe in rewarding our team, so you’ll enjoy 25 vacation days plus 13 ADV days, along with an 8% holiday allowance and a profit\-sharing bonus.



We also offer a pension plan through PMT and flexible working hours to help maintain a healthy work\-life balance.



On top of that, you'll have plenty of opportunities for professional growth and career development, all while being part of a collaborative work culture that values innovation and efficiency.



If you are an experienced HR professional passionate about HR operations, compliance, payroll, and system optimization, we would love to hear from you!



If you have any questions, please contact our corporate recruiter Theresa Apostol on 062 938 0241\.

title: Accounts Payable Supervisor
description:
**Accounts Payable Supervisor**


**Location:** Amsterdam (Netherlands) **Education level:** Bachelor / Graduate
  

**Job category:** Finance ops **Target start date:** 6/1/2025
  

**Work Location:** Hybrid **Shift:** 1st  

  

  

uniQure is a leader in the field of gene therapy, seeking to develop single treatments with potentially curative results for patients suffering from genetic and other devastating diseases. uniQure is advancing a pipeline of innovative gene therapies, including our clinical candidate for the treatment of Huntington’s disease and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (“ALS”) as well as preclinical product candidates, including candidates for the treatment of refractory temporal lobe epilepsy (“rTLE”) and Fabry disease.

  



uniQure is dedicated to bringing innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. This responsibility should be part of our day\-to\-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) by recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.

  


**The Role**

  



The Accounts Payable Supervisor is part of our Accounting Team based in Amsterdam (uniQure Corporate HQ) and will be operating in a dynamic environment, reporting into the Senior Director of Global Accounting and supporting the European Finance Manager. The position will focus on managing the Accounts Payable for uniQure European entities, as well as monthly AP close activities and reconciliations of AP and Cash balance sheet accounts.

  



This position will also be contributing to and owning workstreams related to global and/or regional finance projects (e.g. new SAP ERP implementation and P2P Process improvements projects). Experience with working in a US public company environment and with SOx404 requirements is a plus. The right person will have the experience, passion, and energy to successfully fulfill a wide variety of AP tasks.

  


**Key result areas (major duties, accountabilities and responsibilities)**


* Accountable for AP operations, Lead for day\-to\-day planning and guiding the Accounts Payable Team based in Amsterdam.
* Perform monthly close activities related to AP, enter monthly accounting journals, reconcile ledgers and other records detailing financial business transactions.
* Handle Finance e\-mailboxes and researching and resolving AP issues with Vendors.
* Coding Non\-PO invoices and matching PO invoices and entering in Exact.
* Process Expense Reimbursements and Credit Card Expenses.
* Proactively follow up with business owners for approval of invoices.
* Processing daily bank statements for all entities.
* Weekly payment batches and manual payments all entities.
* Enter Intercompany transactions and invoices all entities.
* Create correct and complete VAT assessments, CBS and Intrastat reporting.
* Assist in external \& internal audit preparations and queries.
* Actively participate and bring value to cross functional meetings intended to improve or automate accounting and control processes


\#LI\-EB1

  


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Economics.
* Ability to perform the essential functions of the job typically acquired through extensive experience in an international company, including experience with accounting systems (Exact Globe, ELVY is a plus).
* A background in managing people is required
* Knowledge of SAP as a potential future ERP landscape, is a plus.
* Good communication skills.
* Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office products, performing data analytics and presentation through, i.e. x\-lookup, SUMIF, pivot tables etc.
* Ability to perform accurate and detailed work in a dynamic environment \- Knows how to prioritize and get things done. Be a self\-starter.
* Experience or affinity with working in a diverse and international environment.
* Maintains an innovative mindset and on the lookout for process improvements, automation and the development of dashboard metrics.
* Excellent knowledge of the English language, both verbal and written.

title: HR Project & Communication Support
description:
We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken


13e maand en vakantiegeld


27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag


Hybride werken


Waarom NN Group


Meest menselijke corporate


Internationale werkomgeving


Support \+20 miljoen klanten


Werken waar en wanneer jij wil


At NN we have a clear ambition; we want to be known for the way we service our customers, for our talented people, and for our contribution to society. To ensure we are able to deliver on our ambition as an HR team, we have three objectives: invest in a Future Ready workforce, create the best Employee Experience, and build a digital and data\-driven One HR. To reach these objectives, the team HR Strategy \& Change plays a crucial role in building and managing the HR transformation roadmap. Are you experienced in project and communication support? Do you have experience with employee listening strategies? And is execution power your specialty? Then this role may be just right for you!

**What you are going to do**


As an HR Project and Communication Support, you will play a vital role in supporting various HR projects and communication strategies. Concurrently, you will be responsible for the coordination and follow\-up of the annual engagement survey. In this role, as HR Project and communication support, you are responsible for:

* Supporting portfolio management and various projects on the HR roadmap ensuring a smooth execution and timely completion. Your responsibilities will include coordinating project activities, maintaining documentation, and facilitating communication between team members
* You will also assist in tracking project progress and resolving any issues that arise
* Coordination of the Employee engagement survey (Peakon): conducting the survey, reporting on progress, analysing results and provide actionable insights and recommendations to HR leadership
* Contributing in developing, implementing, and evaluating initiatives aimed at improving the overall employee experience within the organisation. You collaborate with various departments to create a culture where employees feel valued, engaged, and inspired
* Assisting in the development and implementation of change management strategies and communication plans to ensure smooth transitions
* Working closely with different stakeholders to ensure that HR objectives are met and that employees are involved in the changes

**What we offer you**  

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:

* Salary between €4,414 and €6,306 (based on 40 hours) depending on your knowledge and experience
* 13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
* 27 vacation days for a 5\-day working week and one Diversity Day
* A modern pension administered by BeFrank
* Plenty of training and learning opportunities
* NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled
* Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use

**Who you are**

* Requires a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
* Three to five years relevant experience in project/communication support
* Strong project support skills, communicatively strong and with the ability to work with diverse groups of people
* Knowledge of, or affinity with, change management (e.g., PROSCI methodology) is preferred
* Able to work in a dynamic and international environment
* Solid understanding of the wider HR work field (preferred)
* Solid understanding of data and analytics
* Fluent in English and Dutch

**Who you will work with**


The HR Strategy \& Change team consists of specialists on portfolio \& projects, change \& transformation, communication, employee experience and sustainability. The team is responsible for building, managing, accelerating and monitoring our HR strategy.


The team works together closely with other HR Centers of Expertise (Learning \& Talent Development, Talent Acquisition and Reward), HR shared services, the broader HR Community (both NL and International), and with a wide variety of other stakeholders within NN – such as Strategy, Corporate Relations and the various business units.

**Any questions?**

If you have any questions about the job, you can reach out via phone or WhatsApp to Claudia Slavenburg, Head of HR Strategy \& Change, via \+31(0\)654371079\. Any questions about the process can be directed to Michèle Borsjé, Principal Talent Acquisition Specialist via \+31(0\)646360105\.

title: Senior Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning Advisor Seas of Change Strategic Partnership
description:
**Company Description**  

SNV is a global development partner, deeply rooted in the countries where we operate. Driven by a vision of a better world where all people live with dignity and have equitable opportunities to thrive sustainably, SNV strengthens capacities and catalyses partnerships that transform agri\-food, energy, and water systems. We help strengthen institutions and effective governance, reduce gender inequalities and barriers to social inclusion and enable adaptation and mitigation to the climate and biodiversity crises.


With 60 years of experience and a team of approximately 1,600 people, we support our partners in more than 20 countries in Africa and Asia, tailoring our approaches to different contexts to achieve large\-scale impact and create more equitable lives for all.


Our core values of people\-centeredness and respect, equity and equality, and diversity and inclusion, are fundamental to who we are, and what we do. This is reflected in our vision and mission, and strategy, which sets out our aspirations and commitments as our compass towards 2030\.


For more information on SNV, please refer to our website: www.snv.org

 **Job Description** **We are currently looking for a**  

**Senior Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning Advisor Seas of Change Strategic Partnership**  

*Full\-time – The Hague or alternatively Kampala, Nairobi, Kigali or Addis Ababa*  

*Reporting to Strategic Partnership Programme Coordinator*


Are you a forward thinking and insights driven MEL Advisor, who enjoys leading evidence generation and connected story telling across countries in support of the strategic partnership program to unluck a movement that creates impactful outcome? Then this is your role!

**Context of the position**  

SNV and partners aim to transform the agri\-food system in Eastern Africa promoting and implementing Regenerative Agriculture (RA) and Productive Use of Renewable Energy (PURE). Although examples of success (and failures) in RA and PURE are emerging, these are isolated and limited in scale and therefore function as islands of change. These successes (and failures) must be captured, documented, and shared for broader adoption to achieve Seas of Change.


The Seas of Change (SoC) strategic partnership aims to utilise the learnings and evidence built with, in particular, smallholder farmers and small and medium\-sized enterprises – to adopt regenerative practices powered by renewable energy. To reach this ambitious goal we seek to build a network of like\-minded partners at national, regional, and global level to institutionalize these ways of working and further embed them in policies and practices of government, private sector, knowledge institutes, and civil society. We will actively engage private actors, public actors, and donors to co\-invest €55 million to secure this transformation. The strategic partnership includes a portfolio of SoC country programmes in Ethiopia, Kenya, Rwanda, and Uganda.


The programmes will have three intervention pathways of LEARN: Practice\-based learning and evidence, LINK: Action\-oriented collaboration among system actors and LEVERAGE: Embedding ways of working in policies and practices. Through these pathways, the strategic partnership seeks to facilitate a new way of working to achieve an integrated, sustainable and resilient agri\-food system powered by renewable energy.

**Your role**  

SNV is seeking an experienced and inspiring Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) Advisor**.** In this pivotal role you will ensure consistency and quality in the data collected and the tools used for programme level reporting. In doing so, you will work closely with in\-country programme MEL officers. Your key contribution is to generate evidence and understanding on the programmes contribution to (potential) changes in systems dynamics of the combination of Regenerative Agriculture and Productive Use of Renewable Energy is delivering on impact within the East\-Africa region.


You will lead the organisation of annual ToC and MEL Framework reflection workshops, globally and in\-country, with support of the Knowledge and Learning Advisor and the wider MEL team in the programme. Moreover, you will lead a developmental evaluation assessing how the program is leveraged within SNV.


In this role, you will lead and amplify MEL strategies based on the ToC and ongoing findings. Reporting to the Strategic Partnership Lead, you will join a dynamic team of three advisors and a Finance Officer a thriving in multicultural settings. You will collaborate closely with the Seas of Change programme teams in Uganda, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Rwanda, as well as other SNV colleagues globally and locally, to integrate MEL insights into knowledge products, advocacy, and programme development. Your leadership and expertise will be crucial in driving the success of our initiatives and ensuring impactful outcomes.


All Strategic Partnership team members will:

* Ensure alignment with the program’s Theory of Change and RA\-PURE objectives.
* Build in\-country team and partner capacity.
* Drive strategic positioning and advocacy.
* Use digital tools to streamline their work

**Your key responsibilities include:**

* Data monitoring and analysis at Strategic Partnership level: Lead on the development of the program level MEL framework. Ensuring the program level learning questions are being answered and tracking progress towards program level indicators of success. Lead in the compilation and analysis of all Strategic Partnership outcome and impact data to produce annual data\-driven reports submitted to funder and for external\-facing documentation. This also includes coordinating the review of ToCs for alignment or adaptation based on emerging realities.
* Innovative MEL methods: co\-create innovative MEL methods to measure systems transformation and the impact of a RA/PURE nexus approach. The MEL Advisor will lead on the design of such MEL methodologies and will coordinate, and where needed coach, the country level MEL officers to collect and analyse data with these methods and ensure they are aligned to quality standards. The MEL Advisor also leads on the developmental evaluation – the evaluation of how SNV is leveraging the Seas of Change programme to internally spread systems thinking and ways of working.
* Enable learning to feed adaptive management: In coordination with the KM\&L Advisor organise regular Pause and Reflect sessions (or similar critical reflection processes) with country teams and the strategic partnership team. Support the K\&L Advisor with extracting overarching learnings and recommendations for adaptation. MEL Advisor will also enable capacity building with and for country leads and Country MEL officers on Strategic Partnership MEL methodologies.
* Business development: Supports Strategic Partnership proposal development efforts by helping design and write high\-quality ToCs that align with overall programme framework and approach.
* Positioning: Support the production of high\-quality documents for external publication by providing relevant support evidence and data, as well as strategic reflections.

  

**Qualifications** **Your background**  

You are a seasoned insights driven professional with a passion for data and evidence. You have the ability to generate progress stories underpinned with data and you have extensive experience with different MEL tools and methodologies. Your ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and translate findings to next level products and concept with the use of digital tools sets you apart.

**What you bring**

* Beside a post\-graduate degree in Social Sciences, Development Studies, International Relations and/or other relevant field and a proven progressive experience (10\+ years) in MEL, you bring team\-leadership experience within an international, multi\-country context.
* You have a proven track record in agriculture and energy and in familiarity with SNV’s thematic areas (climate, governance, gender equality, and social inclusion) preferably in East Africa. You also have experience with systems thinking and developing MEL approaches to measure contributions to systems change.
* Your proficiency in data analysis software (e.g., NVivo, Stata/R/SPSS speaks for itself, and you excel in designing and implementing MEL frameworks across different context, ensuring quality assurance across (country) programs.
* You possess strong interpersonal skills, allowing you to collaborate effectively with diverse teams creating trust\-based relationships. You have excellent writing skills (English C1 level); weaving data and insights into a persuasive impact story enabling change.
* Additionally, your advisory and mentoring experience will be evident as you guide and support team members demonstrating your strong organizational capabilities.

  

**Additional Information** **Working at SNV**  

SNV offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We offer a challenging work environment, opportunities to lead and innovate, and a commitment to growing your skills in a fulfilling and diverse working environment. Our staff benefit from, and contribute to, an internal global network of experts.


SNV strives to be an inclusive employer, thriving on the diversity of its people and does not discriminate on the basis of disability status, religion, ethnic origin, gender and sexual orientation, etc.

**Additional information:**

* Contract Type: National contract, Full time (40 hours per week)
* Contract Duration: 2 years with the possibility of extension
* Expected Start Date: January 2025
* Information Duty Station: Global Office in the Netherlands *or any* of the SoC country offices (Uganda, Kenya, Rwanda, Ethiopia)

**How to Apply**  

If you meet the requirements and are excited about this opportunity, we would love to hear from you. Apply by uploading your CV and motivation letter by 11 April 2025 at the latest.

  

**Reference \& vetting check**  

At SNV, we conduct thorough background and reference checks for all candidates applying for internationally determined positions, with a strong focus on safeguarding. You will be asked to provide contact details for two individuals who can serve as references. Please note, we will only contact your referees with your explicit permission.


As a participant in the Inter\-Agency Misconduct Disclosure Scheme, our reference checks also include a request to your previous employers to complete a "Statement of Conduct" questionnaire. This questionnaire addresses any instances of misconduct, including sexual exploitation, abuse, or harassment, in line with the Scheme's definitions.

* We do not appreciate third\-party mediation based on this advertisement.

title: Revenue Analyst
description:
At **Workwize**, we're revolutionizing how businesses support their global teams.  

The rise of a global workforce has enabled companies to access a broader talent pool but has also brought logistical challenges, such as local vendor availability, timely laptop delivery, equipment management, and local retrieval and storage.


**Workwize's SaaS platform**, integrated with suppliers and warehouses worldwide, simplifies and automates the deployment, management, and retrieval of IT hardware for distributed teams. Currently, Workwize facilitates fast, local deliveries in 100\+ countries, supporting the IT lifecycle for over 25,000 users and managing 100,000\+ devices globally.

### 


### **About the Role**



As we continue to scale rapidly, we're focused on optimizing our go\-to\-market strategies to fuel sustained growth. We're looking for a **driven Revenue Operations Specialist** to join our team and help build a high\-performing revenue engine.



In this role, you'll play a pivotal part in streamlining sales, marketing, and customer success operations, ensuring alignment across these teams. You'll analyze data to uncover actionable insights and implement scalable systems and processes to drive revenue growth. If you're passionate about SaaS, thrive in dynamic environments, and excel at turning data into strategy, we'd love to hear from you!

  


### **What you'll do**


#### **Key Responsibilities**


* **Systems and Tools Management:**


* Own and optimize the revenue tech stack, including CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot or Salesforce), marketing automation platforms, and customer success tools.
* Ensure data accuracy and streamline workflows across systems.
* Train team members on tools and best practices.

* **Process Optimization:**


* Develop and refine scalable processes for lead generation, pipeline management, and customer lifecycle management.
* Collaborate with sales, marketing, and customer success teams to improve communication and handoffs.

* **Data Analysis and Reporting:**


* Build and maintain dashboards to track key metrics (e.g., lead conversion rates, customer acquisition cost, churn, and lifetime value).
* Analyze trends and deliver actionable recommendations to stakeholders.

* **Strategic Alignment:**


* Partner with go\-to\-market teams to align on revenue goals, forecasts, and strategic initiatives.
* Act as a central hub for cross\-functional collaboration and communication.

* **Project Management:**


* Drive key revenue\-focused projects, such as implementing new tools or optimizing processes.
* Ensure timely delivery with measurable outcomes.


#### **Qualifications \& Skills:**

**Experience:**


* 2\-4 years of experience in revenue operations, sales operations, or marketing operations, preferably in a SaaS environment.
* Hands\-on experience with CRMs and other go\-to\-market tools (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Gong).

#### **Skills:**


* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities.
* Proficient in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or BI platforms (e.g., Tableau or Looker).
* Excellent communication skills to convey insights to both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Detail\-oriented with a knack for process optimization.

#### **Mindset:**


* Thrives in a fast\-paced, high\-growth startup environment.
* A self\-starter who takes initiative and consistently delivers results.
* Eager to learn, grow, and make a meaningful impact.
  


**Wokrwize offers:**


* A position in a fast\-growing, dynamic environment.
* Flexibility to work in a hybrid/remote setup, balancing office and home settings.
* All the tools and equipment needed for your ideal working setup.
* A vibrant, entrepreneurial work environment that fosters innovation and personal growth.
* Weekly team lunches and monthly surprise events to build team spirit and have fun along the way.

title: Senior Indirect Tax Specialist
description:
Do you believe that sport has the power to uplift the mind? Does joining a truly purpose\-driven brand align with your values? Well, then, we are looking for you.  

As our **Senior Indirect Tax Specialist,** you will be responsible for supporting end\-to\-end the ASICS EMEA VAT compliance function and its transformation to automation, including third\-party co\-source, as well as partnering with existing IT, Finance and other business teams in the areas of International VAT, matters.  

Here at ASICS, we welcome diversity in our people, their backgrounds and life experiences. So, you could be the right person for this role regardless of your age, nationality, religious beliefs, or gender identification. **Our perfect fit.**
As an ambassador of our brand, you’ll play an important role in bringing our purpose to life and reinforcing the positive message that movement uplifts body and mind.
**Does this sound like you?**
* **You’re a leader:** You can connect with and motivate team members.
* **You’re organised:** You pay attention to detail and have a first\-time\-right mentality but are pragmatic when required.
* **You’re knowledgeable:** You have experience with international running and an active interest in new developments.
* **You’re strong\-willed.** You thrive when presented with problem\-solving opportunities.
* **You’re thorough**. You pride yourself on your accurate and careful approach.

 **How you’ll help us.**
Based at our EMEA Headquarters, just outside of Amsterdam, Netherlands, you will be reporting to the **Indirect Tax Manager**, and as part of the role, you’ll:
* Prepare and file indirect tax returns (to be done in\-house) on time and accurately, adhering to all deadlines and under local regulations.
* Monitor changes in tax laws and regulations to ensure compliance with up\-to\-date requirements.
* Comply with tax authorities and support the team with data reconciliation, simplification, and understanding across different data sources.
* Work proactively to improve internal controls, ensuring processes are robust and compliant.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams, including finance, legal, and operations, to ensure tax compliance across all business areas.

 **More about you.**
* 4\-6 years of experience in VAT advisory, planning and compliance at an international tax advisory firm.
* Experience with VAT compliance, including VAT reconciliations.
* Knowledge of indirect tax technical principles and regulations in EMEA countries.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret and analyse tax technical data.
* Good communicator, and stakeholder management skills.

 **How we’ll help you.**
Your wellbeing is our top priority. That is why we will provide you with these resources to help you achieve and maintain a sound mind in a sound body.
* **Free fitness and 60% off sports membership.** We will reimburse you for keeping a sound mind and body.
* **Calm app**. Unlimited access to help develop your mental fitness through sleep, mindfulness, and meditation.
* **Runkeeper Go™ app**. Free premium subscription to our running app.
* **Employee wellness programme.** Free mindfulness sessions, online yoga, bootcamp sessions.
* **OpenUp Access.** A platform that offers professional psychological and medical assistance as well as meditation classes.
* **Free running club.** Join our beginners or intermediate groups for a weekly running session.

  

  

We’ll give you all the support you need to develop your skills along the way, too, thanks to our innovative Learning \& Development programme.  

  

We are ASICS. And our five letters have meaning. ‘Anima Sana in Corpore Sano’ or a Sound Mind in a Sound Body. We’re committed to supporting more people to experience the transformative power of movement.  

 So, this is your chance to join a truly purpose\-driven brand and become part of a family. You will join a company focused on creating an inclusive environment that fosters diversity and individualism, healthy bodies, and healthy minds.
company_description: ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and a wide variety of sport accessories.

title: Agile Coach
description:
### **Job Applicant Privacy Notice**


**Agile Coach**
===============

Publication Date: Mar 24, 2025
Ref. No: 529264
Location:
Amstelveen, NL
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data\-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high\-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world\-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

  


 **Elevate Agile Excellence and Lead Transformative Change as Our Agile Coach!**

  


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Agile Coach to join our team. This role will focus on guiding and supporting teams and stakeholders in adopting and scaling Agile practices, with a specific emphasis on the unique challenges and requirements. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Agile frameworks (such as Scrum, Kanban, SAFe) and be able to apply them in complex, high\-stakes environments where security, compliance, and operational excellence are critical.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Agile Transformation \& Coaching:** Lead the organization’s Agile transformation efforts by coaching and mentoring teams, leadership, and stakeholders on Agile methodologies, including Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe,
* **Stakeholder Engagement:** Work closely with senior leadership and key stakeholders to align Agile practices with organizational goals, ensuring a smooth and effective implementation of Agile principles.
* **Training \& Development:** Conduct workshops, training sessions, and one\-on\-one coaching to foster a deeper understanding of Agile principles across all levels of the organization.
* **Facilitation of Agile Practices:** Facilitate Agile ceremonies such as daily stand\-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, and backlog grooming.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Drive a culture of continuous improvement by identifying and removing impediments, facilitating problem\-solving sessions, and promoting a mindset of adaptation and learning.
* **Collaboration with Cross\-Functional Teams:** Support cross\-functional teams in delivering high\-quality software and systems in complex, high\-security environments, collaborating with development, security, and operational teams to ensure alignment and smooth workflows.
* **Metrics \& Reporting:** Use metrics and data to measure team performance, identify areas for improvement, and communicate progress to leadership and other stakeholders.

  




**Required Qualifications:**


* Proven experience as an Agile Coach, Scrum Master, or Agile Consultant
* Strong understanding of Agile frameworks such as Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe, and experience applying these in complex environments.
* Exceptional facilitation and communication skills, with the ability to influence and inspire teams at all levels.
* Experience working with cross\-functional, geographically dispersed teams, and managing multiple stakeholders with differing priorities.
* Ability to build trust and relationships with both technical and non\-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem\-solving skills and a proven ability to overcome obstacles and remove impediments in Agile teams.

  




**Personal Attributes:**


* Excellent communicator and active listener.
* Strong coaching and mentoring abilities.
* High level of adaptability and a proactive approach to continuous improvement.
* Strategic thinker with a focus on both immediate outcomes and long\-term success.

  




**What we offer:**


* A market\-competitive salary with a mobility budget
* Medical insurance
* Challenging career opportunities at both national and international levels
* Being part of bringing the latest and greatest tech to solve complex business cases;
* Working with large, established clients
* Internal and external (technology) courses and certifications

  


**Let’s grow together.**

title: Accountant
description:

This role will assist with other accounting related tasks such month end closing entries and group reporting under US GAAP, preparation of local statutory financial statements and support with audits.

**What youâ€™ll need**

* Solid US\-GAAP \& local GAAP
* Part\-qualified accountant, while not essential, is an advantage
* Understanding \& working knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley preferable
* Strong systems knowledge and intermediate/advanced Excel skills are required

* Fluent in English

**A bit about us**

Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITALÂ®, the company's global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDxâ„¢) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300\+ facilities in 50\+ metros across 25\+ countries on six continents.


**What we can offer you**

Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers. Join us and youâ€™ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, youâ€™ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. Weâ€™ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us. This is an exciting time to join our business so apply now and make your mark on our future.

title: Patient Navigator - Register Interest - 0.1 FTE -...
description:
**About Us:**  

Innovative Trials is a global leader in patient recruitment and retention for clinical trials with an opportunity for work in early 2025 we want to hear from you! We’re committed to making a difference by supporting patients through their clinical trial journey, ensuring they receive the care, guidance, and assistance they need.  

  

We are currently seeking a passionate and skilled Patient Navigator to join our team. This role is ideal for independent in country individuals on a contract basis with a strong background in clinical research who are enthusiastic about patient care and supporting clinical trial processes.  

  

**Job Purpose:**  

As a Patient Navigator (PN), you will play a critical role in supporting patients participating in clinical trials. This includes:

  

* Providing empathetic and informed support to patients and caregivers through live inbound and outbound communication.
* Guiding participants through prescreening processes to determine initial eligibility.
* Acting as a liaison between patients, clinical sites, and other stakeholders to ensure a seamless and supportive clinical trial experience.
  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Engage with patients and caregivers to build trust and address any barriers or concerns they face during the trial process.
* Manage inbound and outbound communications via phone, email, and web chat while maintaining professionalism and urgency.
* Conduct prescreening calls to determine study eligibility and liaise with study sites for follow\-up.
* Navigate helpdesk systems to track and resolve patient queries efficiently.
* Provide timely reporting on patient queries, prescreening outcomes, and site follow\-ups.
* Support sites by improving communication and promoting effective use of recruitment and retention tools.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clinical research associates (CRAs) and other vendors.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including HIPAA, GCP, GDPR, and country\-specific data privacy laws.
  

  

**Key Skills and Attributes:**

  

* Nursing degree or background
* At least two years of relevant clinical research experience.
* Current GCP certification and familiarity with country\-specific data privacy regulations.
* Exceptional communication skills in English and local languages (verbal, written, and listening).
* Proficiency in tools like Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and video conferencing platforms is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail, organisational skills, and the ability to work independently.
* A compassionate approach to supporting patients with diverse needs.
* Mental Health First Aid certification is a plus.
* Extensive knowledge of local healthcare systems is highly desirable.
  

  

**What We can provide:**

  

* Comprehensive onboarding and training tailored to assigned studies.
* Flexible working hours with opportunities to accept assignments based on your availability and needs of the study.
* Reimbursement for travel expenses in line with company policy.
* The opportunity to make a significant impact on clinical trial experiences while working on a flexible, contract basis.

title: Data Modeller
description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler for one of our clients in the financial sector. You will be part of a squad that receives, processes and standardizes data for reporting. title: Junior People Operations Specialist
description:
**The position**


We are looking for a Junior People Operations Specialist to join our international People team in our Amsterdam office! In this role you will support our People Operations Team with a focus on HR administration, payroll, onboarding and employee support.


This is a great opportunity if you are an organised and proactive HR enthusiast looking to develop your career in a dynamic and mission\-driven environment. You’ll be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious People Team, helping to build a strong HR foundation as we scale.

**What is in it for you**


We are committed to creating an inclusive, values\-based culture where everyone feels that they belong and has the opportunity to do meaningful work.


We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:

* 30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
* 1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
* 1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
* Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
* Pawternity Leave
* Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
* Remote Office Budget
* Internet Allowance
* Development Plan \& Budget
* Stock Appreciation Rights
* 2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave


Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.

 **What you will do**

* Onboarding \& Employee experience: assist in preparing employment contracts, managing onboarding documentation, and maintaining HR systems. You’ll also help with the coordination and facilitation of our onboarding programs for new employees.
* HR administration: support the maintenance of HR systems, update employee records, manage administration of benefits for our different locations
* Employee support: you act as the first point of contact for employees regarding HR\-related inquiries (e.g. contracts, payroll, benefits, leave)
* Payroll assistance: you help prepare and process the monthly payroll to ensure timely and accurate payments
* HR Processes and documentation: you assist in improving HR policies and processes, and supporting with HR reporting and analytics

**What you'll need:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in HR Management
* 0\.5\-1 years of experience in an HR Operations or HR Administrative, or related internship role
* Fluent in English
* Available to work from our office in Amsterdam at least a few days per week
* Strong organizational and administrative skills with a high level of detail
* Passion for building relationships and providing a great employee experience
* Ability to take ownership of tasks
* Experience in a fast\-growing start\-ups preferred (but not required)
* Basic knowledge of Dutch labor law or any other EU country labor law is a plus but not required

**Who we are**


Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net\-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.


We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand\-side response services.


Learn more about us in this video.


In 2022, Sympower became a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

*Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.*

*Your personal data will be processed in accordance with ou**r* *Privacy Policy**.*

***MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.***

title: Transport and Trade Operations Analyst, EMEA (Remote)
description:
**Company Description** **Job Description**


We are seeking a detail\-oriented and analytical professional to support inbound transportation and trade operations into the EMEA region. This role plays a critical part in managing the end\-to\-end flow of goods from origin through final mile delivery to regional distribution centers, while ensuring compliance with global trade regulations. The ideal candidate will bring strong logistics expertise, experience managing third\-party carriers and customs brokers, and a commitment to operational excellence. This role is remote with occasional travel to our distribution center.

**What Will You Be Doing?**

* Manage inbound transportation operations into the EMEA region, with a focus on timely final mile deliveries to distribution centers.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with third\-party carriers and logistics providers to ensure service reliability, cost efficiency, and performance accountability.
* Serve as the primary contact for customs brokerage partners, ensuring accurate and timely clearance of goods in accordance with trade compliance regulations.
* Ensure adherence to global trade compliance processes, including documentation accuracy, tariff classification, and record\-keeping requirements.
* Partner closely with the regional leadership team to align transportation and trade operations with broader business goals.
* Support performance management of carriers and customs brokers through KPI tracking, regular service reviews, and RFP/RFI processes.
* Analyze transportation and trade data to identify risks, resolve issues, and uncover process improvement and cost\-saving opportunities.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with teams in Sourcing, Merchandising, Finance, and Distribution to coordinate inbound shipments and resolve exceptions.
* Maintain SOPs, dashboards, and reporting tools to support operational visibility and decision\-making.
* Monitor changes in transportation regulations and trade compliance requirements, and communicate key insights to stakeholders.

**What Do You Need To Bring?**

* Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, International Business, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Experience in transportation or trade operations, with a focus on international inbound shipments and customs processes.
* Strong understanding of final mile delivery to distribution centers and EMEA regional logistics.
* Experience managing third\-party carriers and customs brokerage partners.
* Knowledge of trade compliance practices and familiarity with customs clearance procedures.
* Proficiency with transportation management systems (TMS) and data analysis tools (Excel, reporting dashboards).
* Strong communication, collaboration, and problem\-solving skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, cross\-functional, and global environment.
* Experience working within inbound logistics networks supporting the EMEA region
* Familiarity with Free Trade Agreements (FTAs), duty optimization strategies, or trusted trader programs is a plus.

**Our Company**


Abercrombie \& Fitch Co. (A\&F Co.) is a global, digitally\-led, omnichannel specialty retailer of apparel and accessories catering to kids through millennials with assortments curated for their specific lifestyle needs.

**Our Values**


Our corporate purpose of being here for you on the journey to being and becoming who you are, fuels our customer\-led brands and our global associates. We lead with this purpose and always put our people first, which is evidenced by our Great Place to Work™ Certification, as well as being named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ\+ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign. In addition to equitable compensation and benefit offerings, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, we offer a range of educational and engagement opportunities, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.

**What You'll Get**


As an Abercrombie \& Fitch Co. (A\&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A\&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward

* Incentive bonus program
* Annual companywide review process
* Flexible spending accounts
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Life and disability insurance
* Associate assistance program
* Paid parental and adoption leave
* Access to fertility and adoption benefits through Carrot
* Access to mental health and wellness app, Headspace
* Paid time off \& one paid volunteer day per year, allowing you to give back to your community
* Seven associate wellness half days per year
* Merchandise discount on all of our brands
* Opportunities for career advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* Access to multiple Associate Resource Groups
* Global team of people who will celebrate you for being YOU!

  

**Additional Information**  

ABERCROMBIE \& FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

title: Sustainable Sourcing Specialist - Ingredients
description:
About the job
**Hybrid/Hoofddorp**

  



Are you a passionate and detail\-oriented Sustainability Specialist? Do you want to support our category teams in building a climate mitigation and adaptation plan? Then join us as our next **Sustainable Sourcing Specialist \- Ingredients!** You will focus on ingredients (commodities, fruit/food, and specialties categories) and play a crucial role in advancing our sustainability initiatives. Your responsibilities will include collecting and validating supplier\-specific emission factors, developing decarbonization plans, and supporting comprehensive reporting on CO2, land use change, human rights, water, and biodiversity.

  


**Your main responsibilities will be:**



1\. Sustainability Reporting \& Supplier Data Collection and Validation:  

* Develop and implement processes for collecting data from suppliers.
* Support validation of data accuracy and granularity from suppliers.
* Support preparing and submission of reports on C02, vDCF, human rights, water risks assessment, and regenerative agriculture.
  



2\. Decarbonization Planning \& Strategy support:  

* Support collaborations with suppliers to develop Net Zero plans.
* Monitor and report on the progress of these plans.
* Assist in the development of the company's climate mitigation and adaptation strategies.
  

3\. Project Management:  

* Independently manage projects to support Category action plan.
* Coordinate with cross\-functional teams \& external parties.
* Track project milestones and deliverables, ensuring timely completion.
  



Meet your future Manager! You will be reporting to Oliver LINCOLN DAVIS.

  


About you

To succeed in this role, you need to be detailed oriented and have strong data skills to analyze and interpret data sets. You need to be a team player, with excellent communication skills and project management capabilities. You also need to be pro\-active, have strong problem solving skills, and hold a passion about sustainability \& environmental stewardship.

  

You also have  

* Master's degree preferred in Sustainability, Finance, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, or a related field.
* Background in sustainability, finance, supply chain management, or procurement.
* Min 2\-3 years of experience in Procurement, or strongly related field.
* Proficiency in Excel and Power Bi.
* Experience with GHG accounting.
* Knowledge of sustainability reporting standards; especially related to SBTi 1\.5 FLAG and GHG LSRg reporting.
* Understanding of decarbonization strategies.
* Agility to operate in complex organization with many internal and external stakeholders.

About us

Working at Danone is a unique experience. It’s fast\-paced and complex and, at times, it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities to learn and grow working with some of the best\-known brands in the world, like Evian, Alpro, Nutricia, Activia and Nutrilon. Bring your unique perspective, ambitions and entrepreneurial ideas to the table – the impact you could make might just surprise you. One Planet. One Health – BY YOU.

  



We’re proud to be a B\-Corp certified company. That means we meet the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability in everything we do.



We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we base our hiring decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

  


**We offer**



It’s an exciting time to join Danone. You’ll be empowered to use your analytical skills to codrive our movement towards a healthier and more sustainable future. And the best part? You’ll be supported to grow an impactful career that you can be proud of. Together, we’ll build a healthier world.

  



All Danoners receive a complete package of benefits. This includes a competitive salary and yearly bonus, a premium free pension and great discounts on health insurance and Danone products. We understand the importance of flexibility and offer 30 days of annual leave (with the opportunity to purchase more) and a hybrid working environment.

  


**What's Next?**



It’s simple – hit the “apply” button. You have until 10th April to apply. In order to comply with GDPR we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you.



Need more information? Please contact Camila Grosso, Talent Specialist via camila.grosso1@danone.com.

title: Marketplace Operations Assistant
description:
**Who We Are:**


Since 1906, New Balance has empowered people through sport and craftsmanship to create positive change in communities around the world. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We foster a culture in which every associate feels welcomed and respected, where leaders and creatives are inspired to shape the world of tomorrow by taking bold action today.

**JOB MISSION:**

  

We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Marketplaces Operations Assistant to join our Marketplaces Team. Reporting to the Marketplace Operations Lead, you will play a vital role in ensuring the Marketplaces engine works smoothly and bringing our operations to the next level as part of the wider Marketplace Operations Team within Marketplaces. Two key activities: be responsible for the end\-to\-end product onboarding process, making sure we display New Balance products fast and with quality content. Further, you will be responsible for our order fulfilment excellence, coordinate with our logistics, customer service and IT teams to ensure we hit the SLAs. The role is composed by a combination of completing day\-to\-day activities and improving our existing processes.

  

Do you enjoy making things work, are you detailed oriented, target driven, and capable of coordinating tasks across multiple teams, then this is your position!

 **MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:**

* Taking ownership and becoming the main point of contact for Marketplaces operational tasks, incidents, and improvements.
* You are responsible for ensuring products launch across our Marketplace accounts on time and with quality product data.
* Coordinating across teams to ensure products have the vital requirements to release on Marketplaces.
* Working with our middleware providers and Marketplace accounts on error resolution.
* Coordinating samples and the send\-out to different Marketplaces.
* Reviewing our existing product onboarding processes, defining, and implementing improvements.
* Producing, utilizing, and distributing product onboarding reporting to give visibility on go\-live status and triggering partners' actions.
* You are responsible for hitting the order fulfilment SLAs. You monitor important metrics and coordinate actions with our logistics, IT, and customer service teams to meet targets.
* Working closely with Marketplaces Key Account Leads to support capturing Marketplaces opportunities.
 **REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS:**

* Relevant years of experience with Marketplace and/or Partner Program operations.
* Detailed oriented and passion to make things work.
* Strong analytical skills and focus on improving processes.
* Comfortable chasing different (internal and external) stakeholders to get things done.
* Understanding on reporting and KPIs, and how to take actions based on these.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel.
* Experience with middleware providers (Rithum and Cymbio).
* Fluent in English, other European languages are an advantage.
 **BENEFITS:**

* Discretionary Bonus Opportunity
* Discount on the health insurance
* 8% holiday allowance
* Flexible Working Hours
* Pension Scheme
* 25 days Annual Leave per year
* Up to €250 travel allowance each month
* Hybrid working
* On\-Site Gym
* Employee Discount
* Work from\-home allowance
* Home working equipment
* Sports Subscription Services
* Opportunity to work from anywhere for up to four weeks per year
* Wellbeing and Mental Health Benefit (24/7 Employment Assistance Program \& Support)
**Equal Opportunity Employer:**


New Balance is committed to equality of opportunity for all current and prospective associates regardless of age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, marriage and civil partnership and gender reassignment. We are an equal opportunity employer and support a culture of diversity and inclusion.


If you have not already done so, please let us know if you require any support so we can make the right adjustments and considerations should they be required.

title: People Generalist (EdTech)
Data Center Security officer
description:
Salute is a leading provider of cutting\-edge Data Center Infrastructure Services, dedicated to serving data center clients worldwide. We pride ourselves on delivering sustainable solutions, unparalleled reliability, and outstanding customer service. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced Security Officer to join our team and drive our relationships with hyperscale clients to new heights.


Data Center Security Guards conduct unarmed patrols (interior and/or exterior), control facility access and egress, monitor closed\-circuit televisions and alarm systems, compose reports, deter criminal activity and misconduct, and perform other duties as specified by the client. The Data Center Construction Security Guard is trained to work on all posts at the assigned site location and is available to work all shifts. Data Center Construction Security Guards facilitate a pleasant experience for our client and their customers through interactions. Customer service is primary.


Responsibilities \& Main Tasks:

* Maintain a visible presence to enhance security
* Conduct access controls and manage the access system
* Assist individuals in need and uphold order, peace, and security
* Monitor Building Management Systems/Energy Management Systems/Closed\-Circuit Television
* Respond promptly to customer tickets/requests/emails/calls
* Manage incidents and follow escalation procedures
* Identify and report any deviations or problems
