title: Community Operations Specialist (Remote Europe)
description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no\-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500\+ integrations and fair\-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.
   

  

 We were founded end of 2019 and currently:
   

  

* 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We’re a diverse team of \+ 90 talented people 🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing 3x year\-over\-year
* ⭐️ With \+70k GitHub stars, we are in the top 150 most popular projects of all time on Github
* 🍾 We’re Europe’s 25th fastest growing startup in 2024 according to Sifted
* 🌱 We now count a total of $58m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our €35m Series B (February 2025 \- led by Highland)


 At n8n, we have an incredibly passionate and growing community of technical users, YouTube creators, ambassadors, and automation experts. Your mission will be to
 **streamline and scale our community programs** 
 , ensuring our members receive the right support while helping our internal teams leverage the power of our engaged audience.
   

  

 To achieve this, you will take charge of operational tasks, content coordination, and program execution, allowing our Senior Community Manager to focus on high\-level strategy.
   

  

 1\-
 **Support \& Scale Community Onboarding**
* 🎤 Onboard new ambassadors, YouTube creators, and experts community members.
* 🛠 Manage licenses and Slack access, ensuring smooth entry into our ecosystem.
* 📅 Assist in coordinating community events, helping ambassadors with venue selection and logistics.


 2\-
 **Optimize Community Engagement \& Content**
* 📢 Support social media activities, ensuring consistent engagement across platforms.
* 📝 Support production of the community newsletter, including editing and production.
* 🎬 Assist with live streams and webinars, coordinating speakers and production logistics.


 3\-
 **Leverage Community for Demand Generation**
* 🔗 Support content distribution, handling marketing campaigns (LinkedIn and beyond) around YouTube creators and experts content to amplify user\-generated content.
* 📊 Help track community\-driven impact, ensuring our marketing and sales teams can leverage key insights.
* 🎯 Collaborate with PMMs and DevRels, aligning community efforts with broader business goals.


 4\-
 **Automate \& Scale Operations**
* 🤖 Streamline repetitive tasks through automation and low\-code workflows.
* 📂 Improve internal processes, making community management more efficient.
* 📈 Continuously optimize programs, reducing manual workload while increasing engagement.


**Requirements**
**Must\-have**
* 🎯 Community or Marketing Experience: You have 1\-2 years of experience in community management, marketing, or communications at a startup (Series A\-B).
* 🔗 Experience with No\-Code/Low\-Code Tools: You have used automation platforms before (Zapier, Make, n8n..)
* 💻 Basic CMS \& Content Skills: You can edit or create simple web pages using a CMS.
* 📊 Data \& Reporting Knowledge: You understand basic marketing analytics and can work with spreadsheets.
* 🤖 Process \& Automation Mindset: You are eager to optimize workflows and automate manual tasks.


**Nice\-to\-have**
* 🚀 Hands\-on n8n Experience: You’ve used n8n for your own projects or in a professional setting.
* 🖥 Headless CMS Experience: You’ve worked with tools like Strapi, Contentful, or Builder.io.
* 📱 Social Media \& Community Engagement: You understand best practices for engaging online communities.
* 🎥 Content Creation Knowledge: You have experience working with video creators or influencer marketing.


*n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
*We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.*
***Our company language is English.***
*You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our* 
*Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n* 
*(* 
*https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity\-inclusion\-and\-belonging\-n8n\-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35* 
*).*
***Location disclaimer:** 
 If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.*
**Benefits**
* Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
* Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
* Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
+ Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
+ US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.

* Health \& wellness 🩺 –
+ Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
+ US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200\), dental, and vision plans.

* Future planning 💰 –
+ Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.\*
+ US: 401(k) retirement plan.

* Financial security 🛡️ –
+ Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
+ US: Short\-term \& long\-term disability insurance, life \& AD\&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.

* Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
* A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
* Remote\-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off\-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
* Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
* Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
* An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
* Country\-specific details are provided in your contract.

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
**Data Specialist**
**Location:** 
 Remote, Netherlands
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full\-Time
   

  

**Summary**
 OneStream is looking for a Data Specialist dedicated to providing an impact to the Data Team’s workload, productivity, data quality, and contribute to the overall team performance. The ideal candidate will be solution\-oriented and demonstrate excellence in organization and attention to detail in order to effectively manage an often high volume of data from a variety of sources.
   

  

 This role will report to the Data Team Manager and work closely with other cross\-functional teams across the Revenue Operations team, providing crucial support specific to data accuracy, integrity, quality assurance, data management, and governance practices. Since this role is based in Europe, the candidate will need to work well independently and feel comfortable managing the ticket queue until North American counter\-parts start their work day.
   

  

**Primary Duties And Responsibilities**
* Data quality assurance, reducing errors, enforcing data quality standards, and ensuring data is accurate, complete, and up to date.
* Assist with ongoing data clean\-up and data migration related projects. Research contact and account information across various databases. Update / add contact, company and territory information in Salesforce.
* Cross\-functional consistency, unified data that will ensure continual alignment and improvements for data optimization.
* Team contribution to managing the stability of the internal day\-to\-day Sales Support ticketing queue.
* Contribute to any all\-hands team projects that arise throughout the year.
* Ability to “wear multiple hats” and knowing the data end\-to\-end across Revenue Operations. Eagerness and willingness to work cross\-functionally.
* Develop and maintain discrepancy reporting tools and dashboards to provide real\-time insights into data governance and performance.


**Required Education And Experience**
* Experience with Salesforce.
* Experience with Microsoft Office Tools, specifically Excel.
* 1\-2 years relevant experience in Sales Operations and/or Data Quality.


**Preferred Education And Experience**
* Bachelors Degree or higher preferred.
* Experience working with Data Loader is a plus.
* Experience working in a SaaS or high\-tech company is a plus.
* Experience working with ServiceNow.


**Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities**
* Excellent verbal and interpersonal skills.
* Business acumen for effective cross\-collaboration.
* Ability to work independently.
* Results\-driven.
* Analytical.
* Detail oriented.
* Flexible and adaptable.


**Travel**
 Travel requirement: Occasional travel (including international travel) may be required for team building.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 OneStream is how today’s Finance teams can go beyond just reporting on the past and Take Finance Further™ by steering the business to the future. It’s the only enterprise finance platform that unifies financial and operational data, embeds AI for better decisions and productivity, and empowers the CFO to become a critical driver of business strategy and execution. Our vision is to be the operating system for modern finance, digitizing core financial functions and empowering the CFO to become a critical driver of business strategy. To learn more visit www.onestream.com.
   

  

**Why Join The OneStream Team**
* Transparency around corporate structure, salary, and benefits
* Core value of customer success
* Variety of project work (not industry\-specific)
* Strong culture and camaraderie
* Multiple training opportunities


 All candidates must be legally authorized to work for any company in the country where this position is located without sponsorship.
   

  

 OneStream is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Credit Analyst
description:
**About Flexport:**
 At Flexport, we believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global commerce so easy there will be more of it. We’re shaping the future of a $10T industry with solutions powered by innovative technology and exceptional people. Today, companies of all sizes \- from emerging brands to Fortune 500s \- use Flexport technology to move more than $19B of merchandise across 112 countries a year.
   

  

 The recent global supply chain crisis has put Flexport center stage as we continue to play a pivotal role in how goods move around the world. We are proud to have the support of the best investors in the game who believe in our mission, solutions and people. Ready to tackle global challenges that impact business, society, and the environment? Come join us.
   

  

**What you can expect from the role:**
 Investing your time with Flexport means keeping pace with a rapidly growing business, learning new skills, and seeking opportunities to fill the gap. We appreciate your contributions to making Flexport an amazing place to work and we encourage upwards or lateral movement and transfers that align with current business needs.
   

  

 We are on the Credit team and our key accountabilities include: develop long\-term customer relationships, support collections, minimize credit losses and protect working capital. We're looking for a
 **Credit Analyst;** 
 this position will help assess the creditworthiness of new clients and manage risk across our existing portfolio by designing more efficient processes, timely data reporting, and analytics. This individual will be responsible for analyzing credit bureau reports, financial information, and customers’ payment history to make sound business judgments. This position must have strong attention to detail, problem\-solving, and effective communication with external and internal customers. You will also have the opportunity to work cross\-functionally with different teams across the organization (Sales, Ops, Legal and Customs).
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Oversee day\-to\-day activities and support all Collections efforts by managing open receivables on assigned accounts through emails and phone calls with customers to ultimately drive DSO set by Flexport
* Assist with day\-to\-day credit risk decisions ensuring compliance with the internal controls and guidelines.
* Timely escalation of high risk customers to the Team Lead, Director, Credit and other Stakeholders.
* Prepare business cases for extending credit limit and terms for onward submission and approval as per the competency levels.
* You will assist with credit block releases by following the parameters outlined per policy.
* You will create and maintain internal trackers (e.g. payment plans, credit terms outliers).
* You will be responsible for periodic account Renewal and closely monitor Credit Limit Excess on a weekly basis.
* You will proactively monitor AR aging/past due balance and outline appropriate action items to lower our exposure.
* Coordinating calls with customers for Financial Statements review and negotiating payment plans.
* Coordinating with a third party insurance company to review decisions and insured accounts from time\-to\-time.
* You will manage the legal letter process for delinquent accounts.
* Work on project specific requirements as assigned by the management.


**What you’ll need:**
* ≥ 2 years experience in both Credit \& Collections
* You have a degree in Finance/Accounting and are familiar with financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements)
* Strong analytical and communication skills
* Ability to work in a matrixed environment with multiple stakeholders
* Ability to interpret data and present to the key stakeholders
* Self\-motivated and ability to manage multiple tasks
* Strong Collaboration skills
* You are proficient G Suite and Microsoft Excel
* Proficiency in in Netsuite and SQL/Looker is a plus
* Fluency in German and English (written and spoken)


**What's in it for you?**
* An opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest\-growing companies, where you’ll have the chance to create a global impact while being a part of a thriving multinational environment
* Daily catered lunches incl. vegetarian options, breakfast, snacks and soft drinks available in our office on daily basis
* Commute expenses: Flexport will cover home\-office commuting costs for employees living outside of Amsterdam
* 25 working days as vacation days based on full time employment.
* Health insurance: Flexport offers a collective health insurance plan including a basic package and any available additional packages. Your monthly premium is fully paid by Flexport.
* A defined pension contribution scheme
* Equity program: every team member becomes a shareholder, aligning our success with yours. As a private company in a multi\-trillion dollar industry, you have a direct stake in our collective growth and success.
* Hybrid work arrangements offer you the flexibility of working from home with the collaboration of in\-office days
* Employee Assistance Program through Aetna Resources for Living: Flexport provides an employer\-sponsored program at no cost to you and your household members
* Parental leave benefit: Flexport is here to support you and your families in one of the most important times in life – the birth of a child! Our parental leave program allows both mothers and partners to take time off from work for pregnancy, childbirth, and to bond with your new child.


 Commitment to Equal Opportunity
   

  

 At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global commerce easy and accessible relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants
   

  

 Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. Please see our Privacy Notice available at www.flexport.com/privacy for additional information.

title: Financial Controller Fintech
description:
To join its international team, Yoursafe is seeking to hire a
 



  





**Financial Controller Fintech** 




  





 Full\-Time Position
 



  





**About Yoursafe** 




 Yoursafe is an Electronic Money Institution licensed by the Dutch Central Bank (De Nederlandsche Bank N.V.), committed to providing financial freedom and accessibility to individuals and businesses worldwide. We operate in a dynamic, technology\-driven environment, offering pay\-as\-you\-go payment accounts, IBANs, debit cards, and transaction processing. Our focus is on customer groups underserved by traditional financial institutions, including the LGBTQI\+ community, online content creators, refugees, and asylum seekers.
 



 At Yoursafe, we champion individuality, privacy, and inclusivity, ensuring that financial services are accessible to all. We embrace innovation and regulatory compliance to maintain the highest standards in financial integrity and trust. As a Fintech company, Yoursafe is at the forefront of digital payments, continuously improving transaction processing, wire transfers, and fee structures to optimize revenue and cost efficiency.
 



  





**About the Role: Financial Controller Fintech** 




 We are looking for a Financial Controller to join our Finance team in Amsterdam. This role is responsible for gathering relatively large amounts of data from both internal and external sources, repackaging it, verifying its accuracy, and integrating it into the general ledger. The position plays a crucial part in preparing financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting while ensuring financial data integrity and compliance. Reporting directly to the Head of Finance, you will collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to support financial operations and business growth.
 



  





  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Work with relatively large amounts of financial data, ensuring proper collection, verification, and repackaging before integrating it into the general ledger.
* Gather financial data from both internal and external sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
* Process and analyze revenue and cost data related to transactions, transaction processing, wire transfers, debit card revenue and fees and other financial activities.
* Utilize existing technologies such as Excel and SQL, while exploring new technologies such as AI\-driven financial analysis.
* Prepare financial reporting, including monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting.
* Manage budgeting and forecasting cycles, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
* Act as a financial liaison to management and key stakeholders.
* Conduct financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
* Improve and optimize financial processes, internal controls, and reporting frameworks.
* Perform variance analysis between actual results, forecasts, and prior years to drive performance improvements.
* Ensure compliance with accounting principles, internal controls, and regulatory requirements.
* Support cash forecasting, liquidity planning, and financial risk management.
* Work with internal teams to assess the financial feasibility of new products and initiatives.
* Continuously improve financial systems and data accuracy, ensuring strong financial governance.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We are looking for an independent and analytical financial professional who thrives in a fast\-paced Fintech environment. You have:
 


* A Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics, or a relevant certification (RA/RC/ACCA preferred).
* At least 3 years of experience in financial analysis, controlling, or a related role within financial services or Fintech.
* Experience in financial controlling, general ledger accounting, budgeting and forecasting.



  




* Experience in working with large data sets, verifying, repackaging, and ensuring accuracy in financial data management.
* Experience gathering financial data from both internal and external sources.
* Strong Excel skills and knowledge of financial software (Exact Online preferred).
* Proficiency in SQL, with an interest in utilizing AI\-based financial tools.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills with attention to detail.
* A hands\-on mentality and ability to work independently.
* Excellent communication skills in English (Dutch is a plus).



  





**What We Offer** 



* A fast\-growing, international Fintech environment.
* A competitive salary and attractive employment conditions.
* A modern, spacious office with a stunning view over ‘Het IJ’ in the Houthavens, Amsterdam.
* Free healthy daily lunches prepared by our in\-house chef.
* Opportunities for professional growth and career development.
* A dynamic and inclusive company culture that values innovation, diversity, and ethics.



  





**Join Us!** 




 If you are a finance professional looking for an opportunity to make a real impact in a progressive Fintech company, apply today!
 



  





  





*Note to Recruiters: We kindly request that recruitment agencies do not contact us regarding this vacancy.*

title: Supply Chain Specialist
description:
**Position Overview** 
 :
   

 As a Supply Chain Specialist, you will play a key role in supporting and optimizing the end\-to\-end supply chain activities, from procurement to distribution. You will be responsible for ensuring timely, cost\-effective, and efficient movement of goods, working closely with internal departments and external suppliers. This position requires a strong understanding of supply chain processes, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to solving operational challenges.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* **Procurement \& Inventory Management** 
 : Coordinate the procurement of raw materials, components, and supplies needed for production, ensuring optimal inventory levels and minimizing excess stock.
* **Supplier Relationship Management** 
 : Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers and logistics partners to ensure consistent quality, on\-time delivery, and cost\-effectiveness.
* **Logistics Coordination** 
 : Collaborate with logistics teams to plan and execute transportation strategies, ensuring timely deliveries and cost\-efficient shipping solutions.
* **Order Management** 
 : Oversee the order fulfillment process, ensuring customer orders are processed accurately and delivered on time.
* **Data Analysis \& Reporting** 
 : Analyze supply chain data and key performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement. Prepare regular reports for senior management on inventory levels, supplier performance, and order fulfillment.
* **Process Improvement** 
 : Identify and implement process improvements to enhance supply chain efficiency, reduce costs, and improve overall performance.
* **Collaboration with Cross\-Functional Teams** 
 : Work closely with production, planning, and quality control teams to ensure smooth coordination of supply chain activities and resolve any issues or disruptions.
* **Compliance \& Documentation** 
 : Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and company policies, maintaining accurate and up\-to\-date records for all supply chain transactions.



**Qualifications** 
 :
 


* Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field.
* 2\-4 years of experience in supply chain management or logistics, preferably within a manufacturing environment.
* Strong understanding of supply chain processes, including procurement, inventory management, logistics, and demand planning.
* Experience with supply chain management software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, or similar systems).
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data\-driven decisions.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast\-paced environment.

title: Data Analytics Officer
description:
**Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?**
 Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world’s leading financial groups. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long\-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
   

  

 With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
   

  

 Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
   

  

**Would you like to work for one of the World's largest banks in an exciting, dynamic and international environment?**
 We are currently recruiting for a
 **Data Analytics Officer** 
 for our
 **Data Management Office** 
 in
 **Amsterdam** 
 .
   

  

 MUFG Bank Europe N.V. (MBE) is a fully\-owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the largest ranked Financial Groups in the world in terms of assets. A world\-class set of businesses and more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. MUFG offers stability in an ever\-changing market, providing services to high\-profile clients worldwide.
   

  

 For more than 50 years MBE offers corporate and investment banking services to both Japanese and non\-Japanese corporate customers in The Netherlands and, through its branches. The goal is to be among the top performing foreign\-owned banks operating in The Netherlands, providing value\-added banking services and excellent operations, fulfilling both Japanese and Global Multinational Corporate customers' needs.
   

  

 At MBE we are committed to contributing to a more sustainable future. Thus, we will encourage you to embed environmental, social \& governance (ESG) factors in your everyday work and in our culture.
   

  

 The MBE subsidiary based in The Netherlands is a network of branches (Germany Branch (Dusseldorf, Hamburg, Frankfurt, Munich), Spain Branch (Madrid, Barcelona), Belgium Branch (Brussels), Austria Branch (Vienna)), managed from Amsterdam.
   

  

**Your impact at MUFG**
 Reporting to the Head of Data Management, Data Analytics (Engineer) role contributing to and driving forward a number of key project deliverables including Data and Reporting requirements.
   

  

* Undertake analysis activities in line with the project schedule to obtain and validate data definitions
* Undertake investigations of questions around data in the strategic projects and coordinating data gap resolution activities
* Ensure all relevant information is available to guide the design of data and reporting solutions
* Building data attribute definitions, model table structures, source system interfaces and business rules to ensure quality control and deliver exception reporting
* Delivering comprehensive test plans, scripts, execution of same across the full testing life cycle i.e. component, UAT, regression, integration, post implementation etc.
* Analysis of Azure / Fabric / Snowflake solutions to meet the requirements for complex data processing as part of a quantitative model
* Supporting the database/calculation/reporting applications during testing and rollout
* Ensuring that all model data related work meets regulatory and internal policy standards
* Liaise with and support the Project Manager, developers, end users, and other related workstreams to understand the business requirements
* Assist with the design and execution of user training and project documentation


 In addition, you will also proactively identify potential benefits and available options for consideration and work with business users in designing acceptance tests for new systems or changes to existing systems or business processes.
   

  

 You will also document and maintain the traceability of requirements through to deliverables on any project, with the aim of ensuring the final delivery meets the business’ requirements.
   

  

**In order to be successful in the role, you will need the following:**
 Data Analytics (Engineer) role contributing to and driving forward a number of key initiative in the space of Data expected to have below skills
   

  

 Industry Knowledge
   

  

* Must have experience of the specific domain Financial Service and/or Banking to tailor models and analyses effectively


 Technical Skills
   

  

* Programming skills in Python, Scala (For data manipulation, pipelines, and automation) and SQL (Proficiency in querying, processing and managing databases)
* Data Warehousing: Experience with tools like Amazon Redshift, Google Big Query, Snowflake, or Azure Synapse
* ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Processes: Designing pipelines with tools like ADF, DBT or AWS Glue
* Data Analysis and Visualization: Analyzing large datasets to extract trends and patterns with Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or Excel
* Cloud Platforms: Proficiency in cloud environments like AWS, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or Microsoft Azure
* Databases: Familiarity with both relational (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and non\-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra)
* DevOps \& CI/CD: Tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and version control systems like Git for building automated deployment pipelines
* Knowledge of Data Formats: Understanding of file formats like JSON, Parquet, Avro, and ORC
* Data Security and Governance: Knowledge of encryption, access controls, and compliance with data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)


 Analytical Skills
   

  

* Problem\-solving: Addressing performance bottlenecks, system failures, or data inconsistencies
* Data analysis: Understanding data trends and how to structure data for analysis


 Soft Skills
   

  

* Communication: Explaining complex systems to stakeholders in English
* Teamwork: Collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and software engineers
* Time Management: Handling multiple priorities in fast\-paced environments


**Personal requirements:**
 Integrity and Responsibility
   

  

* Balance Risk with Opportunity
* Customer Focus
* Demonstrate Global Perspective


 Professionalism and Teamwork
   

  

* Drive For Results
* Collaborate and Build Partnerships
* Communicate Effectively and Professionally


 Challenge Ourselves To Grow
   

  

* Influence and Inspire Others
* Lead Change \& Seek Continuous Improvement
* Think Strategically
* Manage and Develop Talent


**What do we have to offer:**
 We offer you a role in one of the largest banks of the world in a growing and international environment. You have various opportunities to develop yourself and we will support you with that by offering various training and development possibilities.
   

  

* We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life.
* Monthly team events.
* To work in an ambitious, international environment with colleagues from different countries and cultures, who strive for the best.


**Besides that we will offer you:**
* Gross salary based on experience and consistent with the market
* 8% holiday allowance and 13th month payment.
* 30 vacation days per year. Optional you can buy 15 additional days.
* Commuting allowance based on annual public transport 2nd class, most economical way, or €0,23 per km with a max of 75 km one way.
* €5,00 net remote working compensation per day, with a maximum of €60,00 per month.
* Possibility to order a mobile phone (up to €800,\-)
* Possibility to order Office Equipment’s for the home office, (up to €500,\-)
* Remote Working Policy i.e. Working From Home (WFH) and Remote Working in another Country.
* Bicycle plan (fiscal benefit)
* Company fitness (fiscal benefit)
* Mental health workshops and budget for external courses (i.e. Dutch language classes).
* Employee contribution towards Pension insurance (max 5%, currently 2%), our pension scheme is based on a defined contribution scheme.
* Training \& development possibilities paid by the bank


**Additional information** 
 :
   

  

 Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.
   

  

 The role is based in the Netherlands. All candidates need to be willing to relocate to the Netherlands. Internal employees will be supported in case of relocation.
   

  

 For more information regarding this position you can contact our Talent Acquisition Specialist at: recruitment@nl.mufg.jp
   

  

 We are open to considering flexible working requests in line with organisational requirements.
   

  

 MUFG is committed to embracing diversity and building an inclusive culture where all employees are valued, respected and their opinions count. We support the principles of equality, diversity and inclusion in recruitment and employment, and oppose all forms of discrimination on the grounds of age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy and maternity, race, gender reassignment, religion or belief and marriage or civil partnership.
   

  

 We make our recruitment decisions in a non\-discriminatory manner in accordance with our commitment to identifying the right skills for the right role and our obligations under the law.

title: Senior FP&A Analyst
description:
**Senior FP\&A Analyst** 




**Location: Enschede, Netherland** 




**Sector: Technology** 




**Salary: Up to 90,000€** 




  





 We are working with a fast\-growing, private equity\-backed technology company is looking for an FP\&A Analyst to join its expanding finance team. Operating at the intersection of cutting\-edge technology, data analytics, and innovation, the company provides advanced solutions used across industries such as entertainment, sports, and healthcare.
 



  





 This role offers the chance to be part of a high\-growth, dynamic environment, where you will contribute to shaping the finance function and drive data\-driven decision\-making at a global scale.
 



  





 As a Senior FP\&A Analyst, you will act as a key business partner, providing transparent financial insights to support strategic decision\-making. You will collaborate with teams across Europe, the US, and Asia, working closely with senior stakeholders to drive financial performance, optimize reporting processes, and support business growth.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Partnering with various teams to achieve short\- and long\-term financial objectives.
* Conducting P\&L analysis, KPI reporting, margin analysis, cost control reviews, and trend analysis to provide accurate financial insights.
* Leading the monthly forecasting and annual budgeting processes.
* Preparing and maintaining cash flow forecasts to ensure financial stability.
* Supporting business case validation, process optimization, and benchmarking initiatives.
* Delivering insights that drive efficiency and profitability through ad\-hoc reporting and analysis.
* Collaborating with the Finance team to streamline reporting and accounting processes.



  





**The Ideal Candidate** 



* Bachelor's in Business Economics or equivalent, plus a Master’s in Business Administration or related field.
* Experience in finance roles within mid\-to\-large international industrial or technology companies.
* Strong knowledge of budgeting, forecasting, and financial modelling.
* Proficiency in MS Office, Navision, and cloud\-based reporting tools
* Proven track record in financial control and business control at a business unit level.
* Fluent in English and Dutch.



  





 For more information, please apply for this role or contact Onam Agarwal or Alba Amigo at onam.agarwal@phippscameron.com /alba.amigo@phippscameron.com

title: Interim Head of FP&A
description:
**Role:** 
 Interim Head of FP\&A \- SaaS Business
 



**Location:** 
 Amsterdam/Hybrid (3 days on\-site)
 



**Length:** 
 6\-9 Months
 



**Day Rate:** 
 €700\-€900 \+ Expenses
 



**Ref:** 
 CR1084
 



  





 Finatal is partnered exclusively with a Private Equity growth fund seeking an Interim Head of FP\&A for their International SaaS business with revenues of c. €150m ARR. As Head of FP\&A, you will be a critical leadership team member, working closely with the Group CFO \& executive team to drive financial strategy, ensure financial sustainability, and support continued growth globally.
 



  





**The Role and Key Deliverables** 



* Hands\-on experience with Excel modeling, particularly in the context of SaaS financial analysis.
* Understand manual data processes and inputting, hands\-on mentality (Team of 2\) whilst working towards transitioning to automated processes.
* Lead and improve processes related to reporting, forecasting process, and MI reporting.
* Support the Group CFO and collaborate with a lean FP\&A function to create a scalable finance infrastructure.



  





**Key Requirements** 



* Proven experience in FP\&A leadership roles within a Private Equity\-backed and SaaS environment.
* Knowledge of SaaS financial metrics, including ARR, MRR, and CAC.

title: Ice Cream - Legal Counsel Benelux & France
description:
**Note: Deadline for applying is 23\.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.**

**ICE CREAM IS LOOKING FOR Ice Cream \- Legal Counsel Benelux \& France**


Location: The Netherlands (Amsterdam)


Full\-time: Yes


Local conditions apply


For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will first consider candidates based in the Netherlands. If you are based outside of the Netherlands and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but we can only take your application on if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the Netherlands.


The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8\.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025\. We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences \- transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.


**ABOUT THE MAGNUM ICE CREAM COMPANY:**


The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.


With 19\.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben \& Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.


We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025\.


We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.


If you want to **grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream**, this is the place for you!

**JOB PURPOSE:**


Find your purpose at Unilever Ice Cream. Help to protect and land innovations that drive our business to win and grow. Be a frontline lawyer to help business navigate uncertainties and comply with the law, being the guardians of our values. Learn from brilliant leaders and diverse colleagues in a global environment, becoming your best self.


Are you a lawyer with (7\-9 years’ experience) passionate about ice cream innovation and commercial negotiations, in a constant evolving world, and would like to be part of a multi\-cultural European legal team, for the leading ice cream business in the world? Then this role is tailored for you.

**WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE?**


The **Benelux and France Legal Counsel** will have a rich and engaging role, business partnering the Benelux General Manager and his leadership teams and will be responsible for:

* Ensuring compliance of all operations in Benelux (Competition Law, Business Integrity, Data Privacy, Anti\-Bribery, Governance, Corporate Secretary) through effective business partnering to the Benelux Leadership Team and the wider Benelux Ice Cream organisation (Marketing, Sales, Procurement, Supply Chain, R\&D and Finance). Collaboration across the European Legal team as well as the Corporate Centre (for Tax, IP, Corporate, M\&A, Business Integrity and Data Protection teams).
* Partnering the Benelux Leadership team and support transformational projects arisen around the creation and development of the Ice Cream Company, manage the Legal Department budget.
* Managing legal risks \& reputation for operations in Benelux by supervising any major crisis and/or litigations in relationship with Authorities (Competition, Consumer, Environmental, Data Protection Authorities amongst others) and Competitors, and implementing policies and compliance program in Benelux.
* External legal issues impacting the Ice Cream business such as Competition/ Commercial, Corporate, Marketing, regulatory, and Advertising Environmental/sustainability, related and where relevant.
* Supporting both to the Benelux and French Sales team in managing supplier/distributor relations by negotiating, analyzing, and drafting the various contractual agreements (single agreement, GTC/GTS, international agreements) whether for In\-Home Retail Clients, European Alliances, Wholesalers \& chains (Foodservices \& OOH), Direct to Consumer \& E\-commerce.
* Advising both the Benelux and French teams on sales and route to market topics and projects / alternative business models, including Business2Business/Customer Development models /ecommerce;
* Advising on all legal aspects, including contracts assessments with suppliers, distributors, Ecommerce, Logistics, Factory maintenance and contractors;

**EXPERIENCE YOU SHOULD HAVE/****THE QUALITIES WE LOOK FOR**

**SKILLS:** Legal Expertise, Advanced Risk Management, Business Partnering, Stakeholder Management, Problem Solving, Decision Making, Business Acumen, Project Management, Collaboration, Influential Leadership, Negotiation Skills, Digital Curiosity, Versatility, Advocacy, Emotion Intelligent, Prioritisation Skills, Multitasking, External Network, External Communications, External Network, Budget and Management Controls.

**EXPERIENCES \& QUALIFICATIONS:** Dutch or Belgium/French lawyer (6 \- 9 years’ experience/PQE), experienced in both Dutch and French/ Belgium corporate law, commercial \& sales contracts, competition law, factory support, issues management.

**LEADERSHIP:**

* You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team delivers with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins.
* You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
* Passion, energy and enthusiasm for your work and for everything that makes Ice Cream unique
* Outstanding communication and problem\-solving skills
* A team player who is highly collaborative, flexible and enjoys working with others
* Boundaryless – will go above and beyond to get the job done
* Curious with an unquenchable desire to learn
* Strives for constant improvement
* A commitment to unyielding integrity who will serve as a role model
* A great sense of humor, enjoys fun and strives for a proper work\-life balance
* Able to work across time zones and possessing global sensibilities
* A doer more than manager – always willing to roll up own sleeves to get something done
* Ability to assimilate information quickly, identify and articulate risks and provide pragmatic solutions
* A business partner mindset that emphasizes practical and effective solutions
* Close attention to detail
* Strong organizational skills
* Capable of multi\-tasking, address changing demands in a fast\-paced environment and juggling multiple projects while always meeting deadlines
* Lead with a global mindset to ensure our teams operate on a consistent legal practice on a worldwide, cross\-jurisdictional basis.
* Able to work with team members in different jurisdictions, in a truly distributive leadership.

**WHAT DOES UNILEVER OFFER/****WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**  

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting \& dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
* Flexible cross\-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities \& wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company\-paid holidays to further ensure your work\-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40%\-60% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office , you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Home work allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy.

 **EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!


Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

*Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.*

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*

*Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.*

London EC4Y 0DY
United Kingdom
