title: E00F0: Operations Support Agent (ID)
description:
* 

  

We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Operation Support Agents.  

  

**Who we are:**  

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day\-to\-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.  

  

**What you will be doing:**  

* Ensuring that customers' urgent packages get to the right place, on time
* Answering incoming calls from customers in relation to shipment collection requests and delivery inquiries
* Checking and investigating failed shipments deliveries or collections when needed; prioritising and reallocating any failed deliveries for the next day delivery
* Entering data into our in\-house tracking system
* Running clear and effective communication and collaboration with the team, your manager, and other operations stations
* Adhering to FedEx processes, procedures and controls, and regulatory requirements

  

**What do you bring with you:**  

* Good communication and social skills
* Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment with strict timelines
* Ability to manage own time effectively with attention to detail

  

**What do we offer:**  

* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on\-the\-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced\-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year

  

Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path \- we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.  



  

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

**Our Company**
---------------


FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

**Our Philosophy**
------------------


The People\-Service\-Profit philosophy (P\-S\-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People\-Service\-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P\-S\-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well\-being, and value their contributions to the company.

**Our Culture**
---------------


Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Procurement Stock Planner
description:
bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain! We skip the auction and wholesale, to shorten the journey for our flowers. And we harness technology, brand and innovation to deliver gifts and subscriptions that delight our customers across Europe.  

We launched in Amsterdam in 2014, and in 2021 joined forces with Bloom \& Wild, the UK's fastest growing ecommerce company (according to the Financial Times). Our group is backed by top tier investors and is now home to a family of 3 strong brands, Bloom \& Wild, bloomon and Bergamotte. Together, we’ve delivered over 20 million orders (and counting!), making us the largest direct to consumer flower business in Europe.  

Our vision is to create the destination for making life a little more thoughtful and beautiful. And we won't stop at flowers and plants. Starting with the Bloom \& Wild brand, we're expanding our gifting offering to other categories like cakes, candles and cocktails. This is all part of our ambition to build Europe's \#1 direct to consumer gifting destination.  

We care wildly about people and our planet. Which is why we’re so proud to be a certified B Corp™ – committed to making long\-term positive change for our community, and the world around us. **️** **Operations Team @ Bloom \& Wild Group**
The Operations team at bloomon and Bloom \& Wild is split into two sub\-teams, although in practice there is a close collaboration between all these sub\-teams on a daily basis:  

\- Production and Supply Chain \- centralized around our two main warehouses near Amsterdam and Birmingham the teams run our sourcing, supply chain, production and fulfilment operation. They cover the full range of products we process in our own warehouses: flowers, plants, gifts, food \& drinks, packaging material and much more. They optimise for customer satisfaction, On Time\-In Full fulfilment, quality and associated COGS.  

\- Fulfilment and Customer Operations \- managing our partially outsourced sourcing, production and fulfilment in the UK, optimising our delivery organisation in all countries we are active in and servicing our customers with the Customer Delight team. The team works closely with our partners to achieve operational excellence and optimise for quality and customer satisfaction, delivery performance, capacity and associated COGS.  

The procurement and inventory team is part of our Production and Supply chain domain, and is responsible for the inventory of all non\-horti products used in all warehouses of our group. Among others this covers packaging materials (eg. flowerboxes, wrapping paper, ribbons), lifestyle products (eg. vases, candles, baby clothing), food \& drinks (chocolates, biscuits, alcoholic beverages). With our rapidly expanding range, the amount of categories and products is continuously growing.  

The main responsibility of the procurement and inventory team is ensuring that we have the right materials, in the right place, with the right quality for the best price and in the most sustainable way possible.  

This team is also responsible for optimizing our inventory position to balance maximising availability for customers and limiting our stock holding in line with stock cover goals and supply chain timelines.
* **️ What you'll be doing:**
* **Stock levels:** Ensure optimal stock levels across all SKUs (packaging/lifestyle/food/drinks) for the Amstelveen (NL) warehouse by working closely with the warehouse team and category managers
* **Supply chain:** Coordinate daily purchase orders with our suppliers, follow up on deliveries, guarantee that materials arrived at our warehouses
* **Replenishment:** Determine optimal replenishment setup (frequency, amounts, warehouse capacity etc.) to balance material availability and costs of stock on hand \- avoid wastage on shorter shelflife items
* **Stock counts:** Monitor warehouse stock counts, spot potential count discrepancies and drive issue resolution in collaboration with suppliers and warehouse teams
* **Forecasting:** Understand forecast mechanism and optimise quantity and price based on current stock vs forecast
* **Supplier relations:** Owning (some) supplier relationships
* **Communication:** Internal communication with relevant stakeholders on upcoming deliveries, issues with deliveries, quality of deliveries, etc.
* **Data:** Guarantee that materials’ database (material’s code/name, respective commercial conditions per supplier) is updated
* **ERP:** Working with our ERP system (Netsuite) for data maintenance and orders placement
* **Contracts:** Ensure legal/contractual agreements are correct and up to date.
### **✅ You’ll love this role if you…**

* + Bachelors degree in operations, supply chain or related field
	+ At least 2 years of relevant working experience in supply chain / operations / logistics / procurement / warehousing / backoffice
	+ You work in a structured way and keep an overview, and you're comfortable working with multiple stakeholders
	+ Excellent attention to detail and experience working with Excel/Google sheets and data processing
	+ You have strong and proven communication skills
	+ Able to develop relationships with external stakeholders (like suppliers)
	+ You are independent, proactive and a real team player
	+ You are resilient and aren’t phased by last\-minute change!
	+ You’re passionate about sustainability and want to help us move forward with our sustainability goals
	+ You bring in ideas for change or improvement, and challenge applicable guidelines and procedures appropriately and where necessary
	+ You’re obsessed with quality, customer experience, people and processes
	+ Experience in working with ERP/WMS systems is a plus
	+ Willing and able to work from our Amstelveen warehouse at least once a week (but preferably more often!).
These are some of the skills and experience we think will enable success in this role, but please don’t worry if you are missing some of these. We’re committed to building a team made up of different strengths, skills and experiences, so if you’re excited about our values, passionate about what you do and would like to join us in doing things more thoughtfully, we’d love to hear from you.  

**Belonging at Bloom \& Wild Group**
We know that we learn through our differences, and building a diverse team has always been central to creating the best experience for our customers. We value all backgrounds, perspectives, ideas and experiences, and encourage everyone to share their opinions openly within our caring and inclusive team.  

**Our ways of working**
We do things a little bit differently. From inventing letterbox flowers to founding The Thoughtful Marketing Movement. We’re big on collaboration, empathy, knowledge sharing and growth, and our values drive our priorities every day: **Lead change for good:** we have the guts to try new things and step up to do what matters most**Think deeply, act swiftly:** we make sure there’s thoughtful rationale behind our approach and always act swiftly to implement ideas**Care wildly:** we pour care and creativity into everything we do and pay attention to the things that make a difference**Stay open, be curious:** we’re open about what we’re doing and why, and we welcome challenges from each other  

We really believe in the power of face\-to\-face connections \- be that through a shared project, a learning and development opportunity, or an after work social \- and trust our teams to make the right decisions (for them and us) about where and how they work each day. Our working patterns are flexible and vary across the business, depending on the type of work, need for collaboration, and personal and wellbeing circumstances.  

 **(Some of) The good stuff**
To care wildly for our customers, firstly we care wildly for our teams. We work hard to craft a culture of thoughtfulness and care, where there is a strong sense of inclusion and belonging, enabling all of our people to thrive and be successful each day.  

**Work that works for you*** Flexible working (core hours from 10\-4pm)
* Work Abroad for up to 30 days each year
* Share in our success with a choice to take equity options from day 1
* 1 day per year to volunteer on a project that’s close to your heart
* We’ll support your commute to our office and site locations. Depending on your journey to work, this may include a Swapfiets, an NS business card or expense reimbursement
* Phone allowance

  

**Time off*** 24 vacation days and an option to buy an extra 5 each year
* Happiness days (1 extra day each quarter for your personal ‘me time’)
* 1 celebration day per year, to celebrate a holiday that’s important to you


\- Flexible bank holidays \- trade a bank holiday for another day that fits your beliefs, values and celebration calendar  

**Health and wellbeing*** Mental health support through Open Up, including access to online therapy sessions
* Allies and champions groups
* Mental Health First Aiders and awareness training for our managers
* In person and virtual yoga every week
* Our office kitchen is stocked with healthy drinks and snacks to keep you going
* Workplace pension contributions

  

 **Growth \& Development*** A flexible training framework for every stage of your career development through our Bloom \& Learn programme
* Internal \& external Speaker Sessions on a variety of different inspirational topics.

  

 **Moments that matter*** We love having lunch together! We offer daily fresh and healthy lunch options at our locations in Amsterdam and Amstelveen,
* A BBQ\-worthy rooftop terrace (Amsterdam HQ)
* Social \& wellbeing monthly calendar
* We love to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries and other important milestones!
* Summer and End of Year events, team lunches and post\-peak celebrations
* Irresistible discounts on our products, blooms \& subscriptions!

 **‍** **Getting hired**
We know that job searching can be daunting, and we want to do everything we can to ensure that your experience with us is a good one. Interviewing is a 2\-way process, and we’re keen to answer all of the questions you have, so that you can be sure (and excited!) that we’re the right move for you.  

We believe in **leading change for good**, so do let us know if there’s anything we can do to support your application process. Also, if you have any feedback, please help us to improve our candidate experience by sharing (anonymously) here.

title: Performance Marketing Specialist - (US & Canada Markets)
description:
At Instapro group, we’re proud to be the **market leaders** in Europe and Canada, connecting homeowners with skilled tradespeople.


Our mission is clear: to become the **most reliable and trusted way to hire a tradesperson**, providing exceptional experiences for both customers and professionals. We’ve achieved remarkable growth so far, but we’re driven to accelerate even faster, making an impact in one of the last big industries transitioning to digital\-first. Joining Instapro group means being part of a team that’s shaping the future of home services.


As the Performance Marketing Specialist for the Northern American market, you will play a key role in driving growth and profitability through expertly managed paid search campaigns. You will have the opportunity to work on high\-impact initiatives, shaping how we connect with both sides of our marketplace—homeowners and tradespeople. Within the paid search team, we are committed to consistently improving performance while exploring new opportunities to innovate and expand.

**Reporting directly to the Paid search director, your responsibilities will include:**

* Owning the day\-to\-day management and optimization of Google Ads and Microsoft Ads campaigns, ensuring they deliver maximum profitability.
* Conducting in\-depth keyword research, running ad copy tests, and analyzing performance to continually improve profitability and ROI.
* Partnering with our Product and Analytics teams to implement advanced tracking, reporting, and actionable insights.
* Collaborating with the Creative team to produce compelling and effective ad assets that resonate with our target audience.
* Staying ahead of the curve by monitoring industry trends, testing new strategies, and exploring untapped opportunities for paid search growth.


This role gives you the chance to make a real impact while working in an environment that encourages innovation and data\-driven experimentation. Your contributions will directly shape the success of our paid marketing efforts in these markets.

* 2\-5 years of experience in Paid Search Marketing, specifically with Google Ads and Microsoft Ads
* Experience with budget management, bid optimization, and performance tracking
* Analytical mindset with a focus on data\-driven decision\-making
* Native written and verbal communication skills in English

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with display or video advertising as a supplementary skill
* Experience with marketplace management
* Familiarity with conversion rate optimization (CRO) techniques

### **Why you’ll enjoy working at the Instapro Group**

**You can make an Impact.** Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital\-first. We’re leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.

**We care**. We don’t believe in one size fits all. Whether it’s flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you’ll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.

 **These are the benefits you'll enjoy:**

* Highly competitive salary package
* Hybrid work environment
* Hybrid allowance/benefit
* Temporary work from abroad policy
* Mental health support
* Regular team and social events
* Further benefits depending on location

**These are the values that guide everything we do:**

* **We put integrity first**. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
* **We are all stewards.** We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
* **We follow the evidence.** We are objective, evidence\-based and pragmatic in our decision\-making.
* **We never stop learning.** We are open\-minded and curious.
* **We win together.** We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
* **We are inclusive.** We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.


Read our values in full here


Interested in applying? Submit your application below and we will get back to you.

title: Senior Compliance Officer
description:
Our user wants a bank that is centered around their needs, which includes trust in ongoing services. Your challenge in this mission is to strengthen our regulatory framework, and ensure that our services remain compliant to local laws and regulations \- and through this, help us keep Making Life Easy for our users  

  

Up for it? Kick off your application by taking our assessment and find out if bunq is your perfect match ️

 **What you'll do**  

As our Senior Compliance Officer, you will be taking ownership by:

* Using a data\-driven approach to prioritize and improve compliance processes and models without losing efficiency
* Engaging with key stakeholders (i.e. first line, risk, audit) and work cooperatively to present, create, develop and/or implement the requirements related to AML/CFT \& Sanctions regulation
* Maintaining internal policies and guidelines on different subject matters, and ensuring bunq stays compliant with local laws and regulations
* Strong knowledge of AML / WWFT laws and regulations
* Affinity within Duty of Care and Data Privacy is a big plus
* Previous interactions within / with the financial sector
* You speak data and processes \- your accuracy and attention to detail help you communicate efficiently with internal stakeholders ‍
* Strong analytical skills when working with large amounts of information
* Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross\-functional teams ️
* Excellent communication skills in English

 **Your space to perform**


We give you the space and the tools you need to succeed

  

 Join forces with great colleagues across the globe to revolutionize banking


 Make lasting impact by working on complex \& exciting challenges  

 Accelerate your career growth with bunq Academy and learning budgets  

﹩ A competitive base salary of €73,500 \- €94,000  

 Bonus potential based on the impact you make  

 Monthly contributions to your phone and internet bills  

 A Macbook to keep with you while you're with us  

‍ Working hybrid \& earn Digital Nomad perks over time  

 Travel expenses are covered whether you come walking or by bike, bus or car (though we prefer green choices )  

 Lunch and snacks at the office, vegan options included  

* ️ Stay fit \& healthy with a fierce discount for OneFit
* ️ A monthly contribution if you sign up for the bunq Pension


 Friday drinks, team events, and other celebrations \- bunq style!

title: Database Architect
description:
Hey! We're Dyflexis. A workplace where the CEO challenges you to a pool match, developers debate algorithms over table tennis, and yes – there's an actual shark head watching over our Friday beers. Since 2010, we've grown from a rebellious startup into the market leader in workforce management, with over 5,000 international clients rating us 4\.9/5 on Trustpilot.

As Database Architect, you'll shape how millions work and live. Whether you're optimizing queries or scaling our systems: you'll have the freedom to make an impact, without the corporate nonsense.

**What you'll do**  
As our Database Architect, you'll oversee an ecosystem of 4,500\+ databases that power workforce management for 800k users worldwide. Reporting to our Lead DevOps, you'll combine technical expertise with analytical skills to solve complex challenges at scale. Here's what that looks like:

* Design and implement efficient database migrations
* Optimize performance across our database ecosyste
* Scale our architecture to handle growing data demand
* Share knowledge and upskill team member
* Solve complex problems that directly impact our user
* Create structured solutions for technical challenges

**What you'll need**

* Proven track record in database management at scale
* Experience solving complex database challenges across organizations
* Development experience is a big plus
* Ability to explain complex concepts to both technical and non\-technical stakeholders
* Strong analytical skills and problem\-solving mindset
* Excellence in knowledge sharing and team collaboration

**The important part**  
At Dyflexis, you'll be part of an ambitious, energetic, and customer\-focused team. We offer:

* Fixed salary up to €6\.000 per month based on experience
* Personal development budget to level up your skills
* 25 vacation days \+ your birthday off in exchange for cake
* Freedom to work hybrid, because great work can happen anywhere.
* An in\-house chef surprising you daily with fresh lunch.
* Insanely cool office with pool table, indoor golf \& DJ booth overlooking The Hague.
* The best parties, drinks \& trips (Winter sports, Ibiza \& more)
* Membership at ARJ Training boxing gym (home of champion Tarik \& Levi Rigters).
* Solid pension plan \& 8% holiday allowance.
* Buy or sell vacation days \- you decide.
* Travel allowance or WFH compensation.
* Friday chair massages to kick off your weekend

Ready to join? Don't hesitate and apply directly! Don't worry about a cover letter \- we'll just ask you a few questions. After that, we'll get in touch quickly and tell our chef to set a plate for you ;)

Questions? Send an e\-mail to Chanté at chante.vanwyk@dyflexis.com

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: Up to €6\.000,00 per month

Language:

* English (Required)

Work authorization:

* Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 2516 BE Den Haag

title: Cloud Engineer
Product Marketeer
description:
* Faber LABS
* Veemarktkade 8, 's\-Hertogenbosch
* Permanent Employee


  
Hey, Product Marketeer! Are you a Storys(t)eller and Sustainable? If yes, perfect! At Faber LABS, we’re looking for a Product Marketeer who’s as versatile as they are creative. We’re the tech division of the Faber Group, digitalizing our load carrier management tools. Our digital products and processes are complex, therefor we need your marketing expertise to make them understandable and exciting for everyone – from customers to internal stakeholders. This so our software is used to its fullest and we achieve our sustainability goals. Interested? We will plan the interviews from the second week of January on!


### **Who you are**

We’re looking for a marketing generalist who’s hands\-on, creative, and knows how to get things done. If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you:

  

  

* **You’re a storyteller.** You can turn complex ideas into simple, powerful messaging that resonates with both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Fluent in **English;**
* **3\+ years of experience** in marketing, product marketing or a related role.
* You understand that you cannot use an agency for every idea or story you want to tell but understand the value of consistency for a brand.
* **You’re tech\-savvy.** While you don’t need to be a developer, you’re comfortable working with tech products and understanding their value.
* **Execution and strategy go hand in hand.** You can plan, create, and deliver compelling marketing materials and campaigns.
* You know your (creative) tools. Experience working with Adobe Creative Suite (or similar like canva).

  

  

Bonus points if you:


* Worked in tech, SaaS or logistic industries.
* Know your way around tools like JIRA or Confluence.
* Are proficient in Dutch or German.


### **Your impact**

Just as you give your best, we do too. At Faber LABS, we value work\-life balance so you can excel in your role, while being all\-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary (42K to 60K per annum depending on skills and experience);
* Hybrid working: **from home and our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch;**
* Flexible working hours to fit your lifestyle;
* The tools that you need to do your job: phone and laptop;
* Freedom and responsibility;
* **Room to grow:** we’re building something new with experienced leaders, and you’ll have the chance to grow with us.
* A chance to help build a brand\-new product portfolio in a fast\-evolving new company.
* **Colleagues who are as inspiring as they are diverse** —coming together to innovate and solve challenges every day.

  

  

**Who are we?**


We are Faber LABS, part of the family\-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS we aim to accelerate digital transformation within our divisions and logistic supply chains. We make them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever.


Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data\-driven load carriers with automated processes and data\-driven decision\-making that enables us to carry more impact.

  

  

The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge? **Apply now and help us shape the future and make impact.**


### **What we offer**


**Your role as Product Marketeer**
As a Product Marketeer, you’ll play a key role in explaining our products and make them stand out – both inside and outside the company. You’re crafting clear product messaging, arming sales with battle cards, and promote LABS’ achievements internally. You’ll be a central figure in connecting our work to its audience.  

  

Here’s what you will do:
* **Craft clear messaging.** Take our technical products and make them explainable in two sentences—so their \- non\-techy – target group gets it. Words aren’t enough you understand how to use visualisation to make our product come to life and make them stick.
* **Develop assets and materials:** Create battle cards, presentations, blogs and other tools that show what our product can (and can’t) do. Define USP’s (or OSP’s) and equip our teams to confidently engage with customers and prospects.
* **Keep an eye on the market.** Support PO’s in gathering feedback from customers. Keep an eye out on the market so we know what the competition is doing.
* **Promote internal successes:** Keep our internal teams and divisions excited and informed about what we’re building. Share our LABS milestones and achievements in engaging ways.
* **LABS Communication.** As we are a growing company we ask you to support us with our (internal) branding and communication as well to support our growing group of colleagues.

  

  

In short you simplify our complex products with clear messaging and visuals that resonate with everyone—making a big impact. You will get support from our Head of Marketing \& Product, our product owners, CDO, sales and marketing people from other divisions. And off course everyone will have an opinion.
### **Hast Du Fragen und möchtest direkten Kontakt mit unserem HR Team aufnehmen?**

Dann wende Dich bitte per Mail oder telefonisch direkt an uns: Kontaktdetails

title: Product Compliance Specialist
description:
The goal of this team is to ensure innovation and supply at the right price, with sustainability and quality as our guiding stars in product development. Are you ready to join them with your expertise?


**Share your talents**
----------------------


At Rituals, we’re growing fast—expanding into new markets, opening 200\+ stores a year, and strengthening our global online presence. With this rapid growth, ensuring the quality and compliance of our products is more important than ever.


As a Product Compliance Specialist, you’ll play a key role in ensuring that our products meet all regulatory requirements before they reach our customers. Working closely with cross\-functional teams, suppliers, and regulatory authorities, you’ll help shape compliance processes and maintain the highest product standards.


In this role, you will:

* Report to the Compliance Manager as part of the Sourcing, Quality \& Regulatory Department.
* Manage compliance documentation (artworks, product information files, packaging files, safety data sheets) to ensure our assortment meets international regulations.
* Act as a key contact for local and international suppliers, collaborating with them on technical compliance documentation.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to integrate compliance into sourcing, supply planning, and innovation processes.
* Follow\-up on regulatory changes, working closely with the Regulatory Affairs team to ensure continuous product compliance.
* Support the Manager's Product Compliance in communication with market surveillance authorities.
* Participate in rework operations projects, providing compliance expertise to ensure all assortment updates align with evolving legislation.

**Bring all of you**
--------------------


We’re looking for a detail\-oriented compliance professional with a proactive mindset and strong organizational skills. You have:

* A degree in Chemistry, Law, or equivalent experience.
* 4\+ years of experience in a Compliance or Regulatory Affairs role, preferably in cosmetics or FMCG.
* Knowledge of EU and international regulations (EU Cosmetics Regulation, CLP, REACH, etc.).
* Experience in packaging compliance (PPWD/PPWR) is a big plus.
* Strong project management and planning skills.
* Excellent problem\-solving skills, with the ability to simplify complex compliance requirements.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, working effectively across teams and with external partners.
* Fluency in English (both written and verbal).

**Location and Working Conditions**


While flexible working is available, this role requires a strong on\-site presence to engage with stakeholders and build relationships effectively.

**Grow With Us – Apply Now!**


The next steps in our process:

* Our recruiter, Nadette, will contact you within 10 working days for a phone call.
* An introductory meeting with a team member and the hiring manager follows.
* A second interview with a team member and the recruiter follows where we will discuss the outcome of your online assessment.
* If successful, you will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


Questions? Our recruiter Nadette is happy to speak with you via nadette.pluis@rituals.com. Please note that applications via email are not considered.

**Benefits of working at Rituals**
----------------------------------

* Training, coaching \& development opportunities
* Staff discount on Rituals products
* Attractive bonus
* Numerous health \& wellbeing initiatives
* Company \& team events

title: Head of Innovation Strategy
description:
**Why we are here**


Tony’s Chocolonely is committed to ending exploitation in cocoa. We are an impact company that makes chocolate, not a chocolate company that makes impact. With incredibly tasty chocolate, we lead by example, demonstrating that ethical practices and success can go hand in hand. Through Tony's Open Chain (TOC), mission allies like Albert Heijn, Ben \& Jerry's, Jokolade, and Aldi have embraced a fairer, more transparent supply chain for their chocolate too.

**What you will do**


We are seeking a new Head of Innovation Strategy to lead the global strategy and roadmap of our chocolate product portfolio across all markets and channels. With your leadership, Tony’s Chocolonely will deliver tasty chocolate that consumers love, in great packs, on budget, and at the right time. You will lead the team to use consumer insights, category data, and trend analysis to identify long\-term growth platforms. Using these to envision the future product portfolio, engaging with the local market teams to get their input, and then working with the project management and development teams to create the roadmap of projects to deliver this vision. For each of these projects (both ongoing and new), you and your team will act as the internal product ambassador and ensure outstanding product launches across all markets by collaborating closely with a lot of stakeholders across the organization. You will lead and coach a team of 4 product innovation and renovation professionals and report to the Chief Product Officer.

**All wrapped up, in this role you will**

* Identify consumer\-led platforms for growth, by leveraging consumer insights, category data, and trend analysis across markets.
* Lead the vision for a product portfolio of the future: Together with the team, review the current portfolio and create a vision for the future across markets, channels, and segments.
* Ensure continuous product ideation and renovation: Ensure there’s a robust funnel of new product ideas that surprise and charm consumers, balancing science and art. You know what good looks like, set the approach, and bring people along.
* Work closely with the broader product team to ensure the product roadmap is brought to life, accepting where and if compromises, trade\-offs, or changes need to be made, but keeping the golden thread of the ideas alive.
* Lead the team by coaching and empowering, fostering an environment of consumer\-first thinking.
* Inspire and work closely with the brand team on packaging design and launch campaigns.
* Foster strong relationships with markets and ensure their unique market conditions, consumer preferences, and trends are heard and considered.

 **Our New Flavour**

* Product or innovation strategy creation and execution experience in the food and beverage industry.
* Product marketing experience: You have launched or been involved in product launches and understand the process from ideation to store shelf.
* Passion for brilliance and innovation balanced with respect for reality and potential financial and manufacturing constraints.
* P\&L literacy.
* Strong business understanding and strategic mindset: Ability to see the big picture, but not afraid to roll up your sleeves to ensure brilliant execution.
* Previous leadership experience: Strong leadership \& coaching experience and experience in building high performing, engaged, and happy teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and stakeholder management skills: Ability to work with and influence colleagues and decision\-making at all levels of the organization.
* Eagerness to work in a fast\-paced scaleup environment and deal smoothly with the changes that come with a growing company.
* Data\-driven decision\-maker who utilizes data to identify areas of improvement and make objective, informed decisions.
* Believe wholeheartedly in Tony’s purpose.
* We are all about being more in person than apart; this means we offer flexibility but see each other in the Amsterdam office on average 3 days a week. More is fine too!

**Our benefits (the icing on the cake)**


At Tony's you will get the opportunity to be part of something extraordinary; first and foremost, by making real impact in the world but also enjoying the nice benefits we provide as you help us succeed. We’re dedicated to enabling all Tonys to grow and develop their careers and therefore we offer training programs, regular feedback cycles, coaching and a generous L\&D budget. We also offer a wide range of additional benefits, including a luxurious vega\-lunch, company bonus, minimum of 28 holidays, inspirational team updates, unforgettable events like the Tony's Carnaval and unlimited chocolate. But we also know chocolate won’t cover the bills, so we’ve made sure your salary is just as rewarding, for this role that means a salary between 87 and 109k on a yearly basis, including holiday pay.

**Sounds like you?**


Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Look no further! If you're ready to take the chocolate industry to new heights with us, we'd love to hear from you! Please send your direct application, no agencies. We can't wait to hear from you!

*At Tony's we are convinced that diversity of thought, background and perspectives will make us stronger (...just like the different flavours of our chocolate assortment). Our mission is founded on principles of equity and justice, and we are actively seeking candidates who bring new perspectives and life experiences, especially from underrepresented groups. We look forward to your application!*

title: Data Analytics - Trading
description:
We are partnering with a prestigious international bank to find a skilled
 **Market Data Analytics Analyst** 
 for their
 **Risk Management** 
 department. This is a key role in managing market data across areas like market risk, product control, and counterparty credit risk, supporting critical decision\-making and regulatory compliance.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Develop and Maintain** 
 market data and proxy models for various asset classes.
* **Analyse and Report** 
 on large data sets to drive insights and improve decision\-making.
* **Implement market data** 
 for market risk initiatives and regulatory changes.
* **Collaborate with Stakeholders** 
 including Trading, Risk, and Model Validation teams to resolve market data queries.
* **Coordinate Projects** 
 with IT and support teams to maintain high data quality standards.
* **Validate and Report** 
 on market data daily, ensuring compliance with internal policies.



  





**Qualifications \& Experience:** 




**Essential:** 




  




* A
 **graduate degree** 
 in Finance, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or Quantitative Field, CQF
* **3\+ years of experience** 
 in Market Risk or Product Control within a large, global financial institution.
* Proficient in
 **SQL** 
 and
 **Python** 
 , with experience analysing large market data sets.
* Strong understanding of
 **market risk metrics** 
 (e.g., VaR, HVaR, IRC).
* **Fluent in English** 
 , with excellent communication skills.



  





**Desirable:**

 **Summit, Murex, Reuters** 
 or
 **ActivePivot** 
 .
* Interest in
 **financial market regulations** 
 .



  





**Personal Competencies:** 




  




* **Proactive** 
 with strong problem\-solving and organizational skills.
* **Detail\-oriented** 
 and able to manage multiple tasks in a fast\-paced environment.
* Outside the box thinking, can think on your feet
* Excellent
 **collaboration skills** 
 , able to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

title: Data Engineer
description:

 ASAP

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description:
**About the role…** 




 We are seeking an experienced Operational Tools \& Reporting Specialist to support our transition to SAP S/4HANA. This role requires deep expertise in SQL, data modeling, and visualisation tools (Alteryx, Tableau), Microsoft Excel Add\-ins, SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), and SAP data structures. Knowledge of DBT is a strong plus.
 



 The ideal candidate will work closely with business stakeholders and the Global Data Science team to ensure a smooth migration of reporting tools, data models, and operational dashboards while optimizing workflows in the new SAP S/4HANA environment.
 



 Additionally, as a Senior Data Analyst, you will help develop analytics by integrating data from multiple sources to drive insights that improve product flow speed, cost reduction, and service level goals for the clients Operations. This role requires close collaboration with internal and external Logistics business partners and Global Data Science teams to build foundational operational data feeds, reports, and tools.
 







**In this role you will…** 



* Assist the migration of Operational Tools and Reporting from the current system to S/4HANA.
* Develop and optimize SQL queries for extracting, transforming, and loading data from SAP.
* Work with Alteryx and Tableau to support and enhance data visualization, automation, and analysis.
* Ensure seamless integration of Microsoft Excel Add\-ins (AFO) with SAP S/4HANA.
* Support SAP EWM reporting and data extraction.
* Understand SAP's data structures and tables to enhance reporting efficiency.
* Collaborate with business analysts and developers to redesign reports and dashboards as per S/4HANA standards.
* Provide expertise on data modeling and pipeline optimization, with an optional focus on DBT for ETL processes.
* Assist with troubleshooting, performance tuning, and data validation during the transition.







 Required Qualifications
 


* Strong SQL skills (querying SAP data, performance tuning, and troubleshooting).
* Expertise in Tableau \& Alteryx (dashboard creation, automation, and data blending).
* Hands\-on experience with Microsoft Excel Add\-ins integrated with SAP.
* Experience with SAP EWM data structures and reporting.
* Strong understanding of SAP data tables, structures, and reporting capabilities.
* Ability to work with cross\-functional teams and business users to translate reporting needs into effective solutions.
* Strong problem\-solving skills, with an analytical and detail\-oriented mindset.







 Nice to have:
 


* Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) for data transformations.
* Previous experience in SAP S/4HANA migrations or similar ERP transitions.
* Knowledge of Python or R for advanced data processing (optional).

title: Vice President Regulatory Reporting and Data Management Business Analyst
description:
**Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?**
 Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world’s leading financial groups. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long\-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
   

  

 With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
   

  

 Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
   

  

**Would you like to work for one of the World's largest banks in an exciting, dynamic and international environment?**
 We are currently recruiting for a Vice President Regulatory Reporting and Data Management Business Analyst for our Finance division in Amsterdam.
   

  

**About MUFG**
 Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Inc. (MUFG) is one of the world’s leading financial groups. Headquartered in Tokyo and with over 360 years of history, MUFG has a global network with approximately 2,000 locations in more than 40 countries. The Group has about 120,000 employees and offers services including commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. The Group aims to “be the world’s most trusted financial group” through close collaboration among our operating companies and flexibly respond to all of the financial needs of our customers, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world. MUFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York stock exchanges. For more information, visit https://www.mufg.jp/english.
   

  

**About MUFG In The European Economic Area**
 Following the decision taken by the UK in 2016 to leave the European Union, MUFG has taken all of the necessary steps to ensure the continuation of all services to clients, regardless of their location. Clients located in the European Economic Area (EEA) access services through MUFG Bank (Europe) N.V. as well as MUFG Securities (Europe) N.V.
   

  

**About MUFG Bank (Europe) N.V.**
 MUFG Bank (Europe) N.V. (MBE) is a fully\-owned subsidiary of MUFG Bank, headquartered in Amsterdam. With offices throughout Europe, our teams provide clients with comprehensive financing solutions spanning Coverage \& Structured Finance, Capital Markets and Transaction Banking, using MUFG’s global reach to provide bespoke solutions. With 73 green, sustainability, sustainability\-linked and transition bond tranches in 2021 and 51 sustainability\-linked loans in EMEA in 2021, MUFG is committed to supporting clients to achieve sustainable business growth.
   

  

 Please visit our website for more information – https://www.mufgemea.com/mbe
   

  

**Your impact at MUFG**
 Reporting to the Senior Business Analyst within the Regulatory Reporting and Data Management Office, you will support the bank by seeking effective business solutions for the delivery of data to enable quality management information as well as reporting to meet the bank’s external regulatory disclosures. You will also play a key role in the delivery of continuous improvement initiatives of existing processes within the bank.
   

  

 You will lead the analysis of stakeholder requirements and work closely with IT colleagues to ensure those requirements are delivered. You will manage multiple initiatives and lead the coordination of tasks required to ensure timely delivery of these initiatives. In addition, you will also proactively identify potential benefits and available options for consideration and work with business users in designing acceptance tests for new systems or changes to existing systems and business processes.
   

  

 You will also document and maintain the traceability of requirements through to deliverables on any project, with the aim of ensuring the final delivery meets the business’ requirements.
   

  

**The role includes the following:**
* Leading the analysis of stakeholder requirements and working closely with IT colleagues to ensure those requirements are delivered.
* Playing a leading role in the delivery of continuous improvement initiatives.
* Delivering effective business solutions to key stakeholders including the Regulatory Reporting department to the meet new regulatory requirements.
* Managing multiple initiatives and lead the coordination of tasks required to ensure timely delivery of these initiatives.
* Managing diverse stakeholders at all levels of seniority and technical / non\-technical backgrounds to deliver business requirements.
* Proactively identifying potential benefits, and available options for consideration.
* Working with users in defining acceptance tests for new systems or changes to existing systems or business processes.
* Documenting and maintaining the traceability of requirements through to deliverables on projects / change or improvement initiatives.
* Facilitating stakeholder workshops and presenting issues and solutions both orally and in writing.
* Producing clearly defined acceptance tests for automated systems.
* Defining and justifying (in business terms) initiatives to develop/implement automated and non\-automated components of new or changed business processes.


**In order to** 
**be successful in the role, you will need the following skills and experience:**
* Educated to degree level (Bachelor’s or higher)
* Minimum 7 years’ experience as Business Analyst in data focused projects
* Ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels
* Excellent communication skills through English, both oral and written
* Experience with preparing project artefacts including business requirements and project plans
* Strong organisational and planning capabilities and experience
* Ability to communicate complex information to a variety of audiences.
* Ability to work independently and to delegate tasks to others
* Strong programming skills in SQL and preferably Python
* Ability to make sense of complex situations and rapidly prioritise issues to take effective decisions.
* Team player with the ability to prioritise effectively and work to tight deadlines
* Solid experience in Power BI preferred
* Current Prince II Foundation (or equivalent) preferred
* SCRUM/Agile (basics) is an advantage
* Experience of Regulatory Reporting in a banking environment (preferred)
* Product testing / test design experience (preferred)


**Personal requirements:**
 Integrity and Responsibility
   

  

* Balance Risk with Opportunity
* Customer Focus
* Demonstrate Global Perspective


 Professionalism and Teamwork
   

  

* Drive For Results
* Collaborate and Build Partnerships
* Communicate Effectively and Professionally


 Challenge Ourselves To Grow
   

  

* Influence and Inspire Others
* Lead Change \& Seek Continuous Improvement
* Think Strategically
* Manage and Develop Talent


**What do we have to offer:**
 We offer you a role in one of the largest banks of the world in a growing and international environment. You have various opportunities to develop yourself and we will support you with that by offering various training and development possibilities.
   

  

* We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life.
* Monthly team events.
* To work in an ambitious, international environment with colleagues from different countries and cultures, who strive for the best.


**Besides** 
**that we will offer you:**
* Gross salary based on experience and consistent with the market
* 8% holiday allowance and 13th month payment.
* 30 vacation days per year. Optional you can buy 15 additional days.
* Commuting allowance based on annual public transport 2nd class, most economical way, or € 0,23 per km with a max of 75km one way.
* € 5,00 net remote working compensation per day, with a maximum of € 60,00 per month.
* Possibility to order a mobile phone (up to € 800,\-)
* Possibility to order Office Equipment’s for the home office, (up to € 500,\-)
* Remote Working Policy i.e. Working From Home (WFH) and Remote Working in another Country.
* Bicycle plan (fiscal benefit)
* Company fitness (fiscal benefit)
* Mental health workshops and budget for external courses (i.e. Dutch language classes).
* Employee contribution towards Pension insurance (max 5%, currently 2%), our pension scheme is based on a defined contribution scheme.
* Training and development possibilities paid by the bank


**Additional** 
**information** 
 :
   

  

 Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.
   

  

 The role is based in the Netherlands. All candidates need to be willing to relocate to the Netherlands. Internal employees will be supported in case of relocation.
   

  

 For more information regarding this position you can contact our Talent Acquisition Specialist at: recruitment@nl.mufg.jp
   

  

 We are open to considering flexible working requests in line with organisational requirements.
   

  

 MUFG is committed to embracing diversity and building an inclusive culture where all employees are valued, respected and their opinions count. We support the principles of equality, diversity and inclusion in recruitment and employment, and oppose all forms of discrimination on the grounds of age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy and maternity, race, gender reassignment, religion or belief and marriage or civil partnership.
   

  

 We make our recruitment decisions in a non\-discriminatory manner in accordance with our commitment to identifying the right skills for the right role and our obligations under the law.

title: Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
description:
**Job Description**
 AWM delivers innovative investment solutions through a global, multi\- product platform that offers clients the advantages that come with working with a large firm, while maintaining the benefits of a boutique. AWM is one of the pre\-eminent investment management organizations globally. Critical to the success of AWM is our ability to leverage a global team of talented professionals to define solutions and lead change across the operational infrastructure.
   

  

 The AM Operations Global Data Governance team is seeking to add a highly motivated professional to its organization. This team is primarily focused on building \& maintaining a scalable Data Governance framework for data attributes published in internal and external reports. The Data Governance team works closely with Operations, Business, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing data pipelines and maintaining data value chains connected to various reporting outputs of the organization.
   

  

 With your expertise, our data owners, stewards, and subject matter experts can ensure the integrity of our data throughout its lifecycle. Your contribution will lead to trusted data for our clients, our investment processes, and operations.
   

  

**Data Governance Analyst**
* Leverage analytical skills, creative problem solving and project management skills to steer and uplift the existing Data Governance model.
* Organize discussions with key stakeholders to understand how our technology works, thereby empowering you to define specific data attributes, identify the relevant owners, and source system(s) along with Data flows.
* Improve the risk framework for data governance by documenting existing controls, analyzing their suitability, and recommending new controls for implementation.
* Develop strong working relationships with Sales, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing the Data Governance model and keeping it up to date.
* Proficiency in Business Intelligence \& Low code Automation solutions to digitize the Data Governance framework and improve efficiency.
* Regularly assess and refine data governance processes and policies in line with the industry best practice to promote continuous improvement.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s/ Master’s Degree (Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Management)
* Understanding of data governance concepts, principles, and best practices (e.g., DCAM, DAMA)
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Excellent communication, both in listening and conveying messages to a wide range of stakeholder groups
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to handle multiple projects, deadlines, personalities, and broad based coverage
* Knowledge and understanding of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and adaptability to other software products
* Ability to work in a fast\-paced, team\-oriented environment
* Knowledge of the investment management industry and GSAM is a bonus
* A basic idea of Business Intelligence and data visualisation tools is a bonus


**About Goldman Sachs**
 At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
   

  

 We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
   

  

 We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability\-statement.html
   

  

 © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2024\. All rights reserved.
   

  

 Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veterans status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Quality Data Analyst
description:
**Requistion ID** 
 : 80133
   

  

 Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130\-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high\-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.
   

  

**Bringing out the best in people**
 As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.
   

  

**Working At Dentsply Sirona You Are Able To**
**Develop faster** 
 \- with our commitment to the best professional development.
   

  

**Perform better** 
 \- as part of a high\-performance, empowering culture.
   

  

**Shape an industry** 
 \- with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.
   

  

**Make a difference** 
 \-by helping improve oral health worldwide.
   

  

**Quality Data Analyst**
 The Quality Data Analyst plays an important role in ensuring the accuracy, integrity and compliance of data within the ERP and related platforms. This position combines data analysis with operational coordinating, supporting Quality Assurance (QA) and Regulatory Affairs (RA) teams by managing, analyzing and optimizing data workflows to ensure compliance with industry regulations (e.g. EU MDR, FDA 21 CFR Part 820\).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Ensure compliance with the ISO13485 based Quality Management System, in accordance with Dentsply Sirona Policy, applicable worldwide regulations and standards (e.g. EU MDR, FDA and ISO)
* Coordinate data entry change management related to global and local ERP release processes and changes to products, ensuring proper documentation and validation.
* Support system improvements and QARA related data migration projects related to ERP processes.
* Analyze quality and regulatory product release status data to identify risks and improvement opportunities
* Generate and maintain reports, dashboards and KPIs for QA/RA teams, supporting process monitoring and audits.
* Act as the liaison between QA/RA and Supply Chain data management teams to ensure data accuracy and regulatory compliance.
* Work with cross\-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of QARA data in the ERP system.
* Train and support ERP users on best practices for managing QARA\-related data.
* Identify and implement process improvements for better data management and workflow efficiency.
* Work with IT teams to troubleshoot data integrity issues and system inconsistencies.
* Support data collection and coordination of QA/RA data related to support commercial \& supply chain improvement projects
* Support internal and external audits


**Requirements And Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s level education and/or work experience in data management, Life sciences, QA, Business administration or equivalent
* 3\+ years’ experience in establishing and maintaining regulated Quality Management Systems
* Excellent communication skills in English, as well as interpersonal relationship
* Experience in project management and leading process improvement methodologies
* Expertise in ERP Data management (e.g. SAP S/4\)
* Demonstrated experience in driving progress, taking initiative to achieve results.
* Have sound knowledge of data management principles, problem\-solving techniques and operational excellence


 DentsplySirona is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. We appreciate your interest in DentsplySirona.
   

  

 If you need assistance with completing the online application due to a disability, please send an accommodation request to careers@dentsplysirona.com. Please be sure to include “Accommodation Request” in the subject.

title: IT Risk & Controls Analyst (Data and Machine Learning)
description:
***This job is with Booking.com, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ\+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**About Us:** 
 At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you encounter. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the memories you make. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
   

  

**Role Description**
 As an IT Risk \& Control Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the Data and Machine Learning vertical to identify, assess and advise management on financial, regulatory, operational and strategic risks including a role in contributing to activities which form part of the annual SOx Program as well as assessing risks for new and ongoing initiatives within the department as a second line risk function. This position will require you to have a detail oriented approach for the processes and associated controls under your scope but also have a strong big picture focus to understand wider impacts across the business as a whole.
   

  

**Key Job Responsibilities And Duties**
* Support the business stakeholders to understand IT risks, including regulatory compliance risks (e.g., Cloud Security, SOx, GDPR etc.)
* Support respective business teams to develop and improve IT controls in complex IT environments
* Responsible for facilitating SOx activities such as process walkthroughs, documentation of process narratives and Risk \& Control Matrices (RACMs) and supporting the business in addressing audit requests (internal audit and external auditors)
* Responsible for facilitating identification, assessment and management of issues impacting the control environments of these departments
* Responsible for uploading and maintaining risks, controls and issues in our GRC platform (ServiceNow)


**Qualifications \& Skills**
* Previous work experience across one (ideally two) or more of these areas: Risk Management, IT Audit, Financial Audit, and/or Internal Controls
* Knowledge on Cloud, data governance
* Strong working knowledge of risk management and ITGCs with the experience in applying them in complex IT environments
* Working knowledge / experience with SOx audits and auditor testing methodology
* Familiarity with specific technology (AWS, Snowflake, Big Data Lakes/Platforms) is preferred


**Benefits \& Perks \- Global Impact, Personal Relevance**
 Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, as well unique\-to\-Booking.com benefits which include:
   

  

* Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
* Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
* Industry leading product discounts \- up to 1400 per year \- for yourself, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and Booking.com wallet credit


**Diversity, Equity And Inclusion (DEI) At Booking.com**
 Diversity, Equity \& Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.
   

  

 Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just build an outstanding workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”
   

  

 We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
   

  

**Application Process**
* Let’s go places together: How we Hire
* Interview process: Recruitment phone screen \-\> Technical Skills Interview \-\> Case Study\-\> Behavior/Culture fit interview
* This role does not come with relocation assistance.


 Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.
   

  

**Pre\-Employment Screening**
 If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre\-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre\-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

title: Workday Integration Specialist
description:
A dynamic team is looking for a skilled Workday Integration Specialist to maintain and develop integrations between Workday and other internal systems via Azure. The role combines hands\-on technical work with cloud, automation, and secure data transfer solutions.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Develop, manage, and optimize Workday integrations (EIB, Core Connector, PICOF/PEIC, API, Studio)
* Handle transformations using XSLT
* Deploy and maintain integrations on Azure Cloud
* Apply DevOps practices (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
* Configure and manage MFT (Managed File Transfer) flows
* Maintain clear, up\-to\-date documentation for integrations

**What You Bring:**


* Bachelor’s degree in IT or related field
* 5\+ years of experience with Workday integrations
* Solid hands\-on with Azure services
* Experience with DevOps tools (Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes)
* Strong API and REST service knowledge
* Familiarity with MFT protocols and systems
* Strong communicator and team player
* Proactive, detail\-oriented, and able to lead integration projects

title: AWS Cloud Engineer
description:
***Pax8*** have an exciting opportunity for you to join us as an ***AWS Cloud Engineer*** and become a member of our close\-knit ***Professional Services Team*** in our amazing offices in ***Zwolle***, where collaboration, continuous learning, and service excellence are at the core of everything we do! Come join us at ***Pax8***and embark on a thrilling journey with our ***Professional Services*** ***Team*** as an ***AWS Cloud Engineer***

  


***Picture this:*** As a pivotal member of a high\-performing group, you'll play a crucial role within the AWS and Azure department and wider delivery team to provide excellent service in customer facing technical project work items. They will be driven to build, enhance, and hand over completed workloads to customers and support colleagues. If you're passionate about making an impact and excelling as part of a collaborative team, then the ***AWS Cloud Engineer***role is for you!

  


***The Team:*** Join a dynamic team of technology specialists dedicated to delivering valued projects to our customers while advising on best practices and approaches. The ***Professional Services Team*** foster an open and honest collaborative environment, where a specialised team brings expertise across Modern Work, Dynamics, Azure, and AWS. While team members focus on their respective areas, this role will serve as a vital link between Azure and AWS, ensuring seamless integration and cross\-platform collaboration. A fast\-paced journey where every day is a blend of passion, fun, and innovation

  


**Your day as an** ***AWS Cloud Engineer*** **includes:**


* Deliver high\-quality AWS and Azure migrations and build projects for partners and clients
* Support AWS and Azure Solution Architects with the creation of cloud architectures
* Support long\-standing retainer clients with high\-touch customer service
* Drive digital transformation by leveraging cloud technologies to enhance business operations
* Build and maintain strong relationships with partners to support their cloud journey
* Play a key role within the AWS and Azure teams, contributing to technical project success
* Provide exceptional service in customer facing technical projects and support initiatives

  


**You'll be the ideal** ***AWS Cloud Engineer*** **for us if you:**


* Significant experience required within an AWS Delivery Role with experience in build and migration projects
* Top skills required:
	+ AWS Compute (EC2, ECS, EKS),
	+ Database (RDS),
	+ Storage (S3, EBS),
	+ Networking (VPC),
	+ Security (IAM),
	+ Linux and/or Windows administration, etc.
* DevOps (AWS CloudFormation, Terraform, Ansible, GitOps, CI/CD, YAML, Pipelines)
* Familiar with Kubernetes/EKS and containerization technologies such as Docker
* Ability to work in Agile Methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban
* Excellent customer service and strong communication skills
* Ability to consult with both technical professionals and business stakeholders
* Knowledge of other public cloud technologies (such as GCP) is a plus
* *Must be able to speak professional level of Dutch*


**Desirable** ***Cloud Engineer*** **skills:**


* Azure IaaS and PaaS (App Services, Virtual Machines, VMSS), Azure Databases (SQL, Cosmos), Networking (VPNs, Firewalls), Security (private endpoints, NSGs), Scripting (Az CLI, PowerShell)

  


***To fulfil this role, you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.***


**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don't meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where there are a diversity of perspectives.**


**We review and acknowledge every application using real humans \- please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!**

  


**Salary \& benefits** **for our** ***AWS Cloud Engineer******:***


* **Salary:** **€3,500 \- €4,300 gross per month/****€42,000 \- €52,000 gross per annum**
* 26 days holiday \+ 8% Holiday Allowance
* Short Term Incentive Plan (Annual Bonus)
* Long term Incentive Plan (Stock Options after qualified period)
* Travel Expenses Reimbursement
* Participation company pension plan
* Homeworking Allowance
* Dedicated time for training and personal development
* Health \& Wellbeing coaching support
* Fun and frequent company and team socials
* And a lot more...

  


**Pax8 Zwolle Office Environment:**


* Located in the centre of Zwolle
* Regular social and community events
* Inside Ping Pong and fun breakout areas
* Dedicated desks and breakout areas with laptop dock and monitors

  


**Pax8 Office Environment:** Step into vibrant offices, dynamic workspaces that merge creativity with comfort! Imagine quirky offices filled with endless snacks, refreshing drinks, and bustling social events. Hot\-desking with extra monitors keeps you connected. For those seeking wellness, enjoy light\-filled environments with breakout spaces, wellness areas, and state\-of\-the\-art coffee machines. Our offices are designed to energise and inspire every day!

  



If you struggle to get "time out" we're happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring **Will**, the talent partner managing this role on **\+44117 471 3268** DDI (No Agencies Please)

  


**About Pax8:**



Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI\-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.

  


**More about Pax8:**


* For all you tech minded people \- discover our Marketplace: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/marketplace/
* Best Companies: Awarded Number 50 in the UKs Best Companies
* Our Journey from the US to EMEA: https://www.pax8\.com/blog/office\-opening\-bristol/


**Get a feel for our progress, culture and how we constantly strive to be better and do better below**:


* Taste our values \& culture here: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/careers/
* Check our HR Leaders people ethos here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v\=\-IO3JTx\-Dlo
* See our progress in Awards: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/news\-post/pax8\-triumphs\-with\-three\-awards\-at\-the\-comptia\-uki\-spotlight\-awards/
* Pax8 Named Best Mid\-Sized Company to Work For in the UK: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/news\-post/pax8\-named\-50th\-best\-mid\-sized\-company\-to\-work\-for\-in\-the\-uk/
* Scott Chasin: Exciting Times \- meet our new CEO
* UK: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/
* EU: https://www.pax8\.com/en\-eu/

  



We are Pax8 where our employee experience meets customer experience \- come and be "work happy" with us! It's an exciting time to join us as Pax8 EU enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth! As we expand across Europe, we have 8 offices supporting 23 languages and our teams continue to grow! You will be working in a mature Cloud market. We help our partners build revenue and succeed with cloud services. It's our mission to be the world's favourite place to buy cloud products \- why not be a part of that success story?



You would be joining a rapidly growing team bringing the success of a new cloud model to the UK from Denver, Colorado (Awarded number 50 in the UK's Best Companies, Best Places to Work 2022 by Glassdoor and Employer of the year Women in IT UK Awards 2021\). We're listed on the Inc 500\. We have recently achieved $2bn annual recurring revenue, we've pioneered simplifying the cloud buying journey for thousands of partners by reinventing the IT cloud model with more than 140 vendors globally giving customers and partners real choice.



We're proud to be listed on the Inc 500, have been Awarded Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2022 and Employer of the Year in the UK Women in IT Awards 2021\.

  


**Overview:**



Our mission is to be the world's favourite place to buy cloud products. We are a fast\-growing, dynamic, and high\-energy organisation with a start\-up feel, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it's business, and it IS personal. We are passionate, creative, and unconventional. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best! We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life



Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it's business, and it IS personal. We are passionate, creative, and humorously offbeat. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best. We **Elev8** each other. We **Advoc8** for our partners. We **Innov8** continuously. We **Celebr8** life.

  


**Equal Opportunities:**



Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the UK. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.



Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.pax8\.com/en\-uk/job\-applicant\-privacy\-notice/)

**\#IND\-LP**
