Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: €65\.000,00 \- €80\.000,00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Real Estate Analyst
description:
Company Overview:

Along with its affiliate companies, Affinius Capital invests across the risk spectrum for a global client base, managing over $64 billion in gross assets under management within a diversified portfolio across North America and Europe. Affinius Capital provides strategic equity and debt capital, including to capitalize on the accelerating demand for technology\-driven real estate assets, to meet the critical need for housing solutions, and for other market and capital structure opportunities exhibiting compelling risk\-return characteristics. For more information, visit affiniuscapital.com.  

Affinius Capital Europe, B.V. is the European subsidiary company of Affinius Capital. The company was formed in 2014 and is based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. Affinius Capital is a pan\-European investor that is primarily focused on the creation of a modern logistics portfolio. With time, it is expected that Affinius Capital may include other property types in Europe as well as expand its co\-investment activities in Europe through the creation of fund and separate account vehicles.
Job Description:

Affinius Capital Europe, B.V. is seeking to appoint a Real Estate Analyst within its Amsterdam office to support the real estate team. In this role the Analyst will support and be directly involved in the management and coordination of multi\-country logistics and build\-to\-rent real estate portfolios, and additional property sectors as needed. The Analyst will be assist the team in conducting preliminary transaction underwriting, preparation of investment memos, market feasibility analysis, coordination and execution of the due diligence process, tenant/client interaction, site acquisition, oversight of development partners, contractors and other 3rd party vendors (leasing, management, construction management, environmental, etc.), and all aspects of the development, asset management and portfolio management process as deemed appropriate and/or needed. The Analyst may also provide valuable support and assistance with dispositions, capital markets, credit, research and accounting as needed.  

Affinius Capital Europe, B.V. is looking for an analytical and communicative professional with a strong interest in the real estate industry. The continued growth in the European platform means that the successful candidate may also have the opportunity to be involved in a wider range of activities, depending on the individual’s profile and skills.  

***Essential Duties:***

* Prepare detailed financial analyses of real estate assets including but not limited to preparing of development budgets and financial models, discounted cash flow analysis, time\-weighted returns, leveraged and unleveraged IRRs, equity multiples, promote calculations, and other various financial and performance measurement metrics.
* Coordinate internal approvals including the preparation of investment committee memos and cash flows as necessary for approvals.
* Coordinate development activities with existing and potential partners to include the preparation of pro\-forma financial assumptions, assisting supervisor in the formation and structuring of joint venture and investment structures, and implementing Affinius Capital B.V. required due diligence and closing procedures on land acquisitions.
* Cultivate brokerage, tenant, and developer relationships and assist with the expansion and maintenance of existing relationships.
* Coordinate with the legal department, field personnel and other due diligence vendors.
* Coordinate and assist with the marketing efforts of development and existing projects.
* Perform feasibility studies for various projects and continually monitor market conditions to help identify opportunities in the marketplace.
* Maintain project status reporting database including monitoring and coordination of investor rotation procedure and pipeline databases. Also track department performance, cash flow projections and provide regular updates for internal use.
* Provide support to the development teams projects to include, but not limited to, the functions of venture, legal, leasing, design, construction, construction management, material testing, development, due diligence, and transition to Asset Management upon project completion.
* Perform property\-level market valuations and investment models for assigned real estate assets each quarter. Maintain ARGUS and DCF models to support market valuations. Provide support and oversight of external valuations.
* Prepare, coordinate and ensure timely completion of property\-level, portfolio and joint venture partner reporting such as annual business plans, quarterly fund reports, monthly status reports, investor specific reports, and other reports as required.
* Assist with dispositions of various assets as required.
* Support compliance efforts including all OFAC, entity creation, and other necessary database search and compliance measures.
* Contribute to the improvement of existing processes and promote the adoption of best practices as related to the above duties and responsibilities.
* Provide secondary support to the Acquisitions and Capital Markets departments as required. May also support other departments with various projects related to Global Investors Group, Credit, Portfolio Management, Research and Dispositions.
* Maintain ongoing knowledge of projects and elevate any potential issues and track solution implementation.
* Additional duties as assigned.


Requirements:
* BSc degree in Finance, Real Estate, Economics or related field, MSc degree preferred.
* 0 – 3 years of commercial real estate industry work experience, graduate degree will be considered in lieu of one year experience.
* Relevant Development, Acquisitions, Asset Management and/or Brokerage experience preferred.
* Solid understanding of financial analysis concepts.
* Ability and willingness to travel (abroad) if necessary. Flexibility to work extended hours as/if required.
* High level of proficiency in Excel and experience with/ability to learn applications such as Argus.
* Accuracy and attention to detail.
* Ability to prioritize assignments to meet numerous deadlines.
* Ability to handle multiple priorities and unforeseen situations.
* Excellent analytical, quantitative and problem\-solving skills.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Eligible to work in the European Union (EU).
* Ability to work onsite full time in the Amsterdam office.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written) and preferably another European language.


Affinius Capital complies with laws and regulations that permit certain requests related to your data in our files, including, but not limited to, the California Consumer Privacy Act (the “CCPA”). The Company's privacy policy and contact information for questions regarding your data or the policy may be found here.  

At Affinius Capital our employees enjoy generous benefits packages including comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401k, educational and professional designation assistance, casual dress attire and much more! Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre\-employment background screen. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. *Affinius Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Continuous Improvement Lead
description:
Flex is the diversified manufacturing partner of choice that helps market\-leading brands design, build and deliver innovative products that improve the world.
We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion and cultivate a workplace culture of belonging that views uniqueness as a competitive edge and builds a community that enables our people to push the limits of innovation to make great products that create value and improve people's lives.
A career at Flex offers the opportunity to make a difference and invest in your growth in a respectful, inclusive, and collaborative environment. If you are excited about a role but don't meet every bullet point, we encourage you to apply and join us to create the extraordinary.
Job Summary
To support our extraordinary teams who build great products and contribute to our growth, we’re looking to add a Continuous Improvement Lead located in Venray.
The Continuous Improvement Lead (CI lead) is part of the PMO \& Engineering department and reports to the Business \& Operations Excellence Manager. As a CI lead, you will play a crucial role in identifying, analyzing, and implementing Lean process improvements within our warehouse logistics operations. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams to enhance productivity, reduce waste, and optimize our internal logistics processes.
What a typical day looks like:* Be the first point of contact for continuous improvement related questions for the Venray/Venlo site.
* Analyze current warehouse processes and identify areas for improvement by using the Lean methodology.
* Conduct Kaizen workshops (IKW) and organize Kaizen\-weeks (KW) to be planned across several departments//accounts/year.
* Follow\-up on the Lean opportunity tracker and work closely together with the 3 Business Unit OPEX Leads to ensure sufficient CI projects are completed across the year (lean pipeline) to meet the aligned targets.
* Provide dedicated Lean Green Belt training and certification support across all buildings.
* Collaborate with warehouse management and staff to gather data and insights on operational performance.
* Support and execute with Gemba Walks on the shopfloor.
* Support the OpEx manager regarding KPI reporting for several site and corporate stakeholders.


The experience we’re looking to add to our team:* HBO\+/WO working and thinking level.
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills.
* Proven experience in continuous improvement roles, preferably in warehouse logistics or supply chain environments.
* Strong knowledge and experience with LEAN methodology is a pre\-requisite.
* Lean Green Belt certification is a must\-have, Black Belt certification is a plus.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.


What you’ll receive for the great work you provide:* Additional benefits: Cafeteria, bonus
* Stable, dynamically developing multinational corporate background
* Unique, forward\-looking manufacturing technologies, professional work environment
* Exposure to wide range of businesses
* Opportunity for continuous professional development provided by various and challenging tasks


AS108
Job Category
Production Engineering
Required Skills:
Optional Skills:
Flex is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the application process. Please email accessibility@flex.com and we'll discuss your specific situation and next steps (NOTE: this email does not accept or consider resumes or applications. This is only for disability assistance. To be considered for a position at Flex, you must complete the application process first).

title: Portfolio Optimization Business Analyst
description:
Are you an aviation enthusiast who is looking for a career with a high\-flying and rapidly growing company? Look no further! As the world’s largest independent, employee\-owned distributor of aircraft parts and with over 10 locations around the globe, we are looking for ambitious and talented individuals who are ready to propel Proponent to new heights. If you’re ready to take your career to the skies, apply today and embark on an exciting journey with Proponent.

 **Portfolio Optimization Business Analyst**

 **Job Location: Essex, CT / Brea, CA / Tamarac, FL**

**Job Summary:**


The Portfolio Optimization Business Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring the integrity of product\-related business intelligence and the effectiveness of associated processes that touch virtually all areas of the organization. The Analyst works in a fast\-paced, deadline\-driven, global business environment, successfully juggling multiple, simultaneous, high\-priority projects and processes. S/he: translates price strategies, contractual and product line requirements into efficient operational processes (i.e. business rule\-based automated pricing routines, data structure for new transactions such as surplus, pipeline data, etc.). S/he maintains and manages data and classification across pricing and product assortment S/he: performs commercial and data analysis to support product line and customer management and new business opportunities. S/he: leads the execution and continuous improvement of key product line management processes (i.e. assortment review, dead stock review, win\-rate review). Analysts add core value by taking ownership to offer and drive efficient, innovative, and effective product\-related data and process solutions.

**Requirements for Success:** ***(list 4 – 5 primary requirements)***

* Market Research
* Advanced MS Office, such as Access and Excel.
* SQL or Automation Analysis
* Advanced Math Skills
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
* 3\-4 Years of Related Work Experience in Business Analytics or Data Science

 **Our Company Culture:**


As an employee\-owned company for more than 30 years, we have learned that when we listen to our employees and do what is best for them, our success becomes the success of our customers and suppliers. Ownership is deeply ingrained throughout the company, and this creates a culture where employees have a strong personal investment in the company’s success. This in turn leads to actions driven by values rather than rules, and a commitment to upholding the values of integrity, agility, empathy, and intelligence.

**Benefits and Perks of joining the team:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision plan options
* Employee Stock Ownership Plan
* Vacation, Sick, and Holidays
* Good work\-life balance

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
At Dataiku, we're not just adapting to the AI revolution, we're leading it. Since our beginning in Paris in 2013, we've been pioneering the future of AI with a platform that makes data actionable and accessible. With over 1,000 teammates across 25 countries and backed by a renowned set of investors, we're the architects of Everyday AI, enabling data experts and domain experts to work together to build AI into their daily operations, from advanced analytics to Generative AI.
   

  

 At Dataiku, we’re not just adapting to the AI revolution, we’re leading it. Since our beginning in Paris in 2013, we’ve been pioneering the future of AI with a platform that makes data actionable and accessible. With over 1,000 teammates across 25 countries and backed by a renowned set of investors, we’re the architects of Everyday AI, enabling data experts and domain experts to work together to build AI into their daily operations, from advanced analytics to Generative AI.If you’re ready to take your pre\-sales career to the next level, the Dataiku Sales Engineering team would like to hear from you. Together, we’ve built a team that has closed some of Dataiku’s most important sales with companies whose names you hear and products you use everyday. We do it by working together to serve our customers in ways that ensure their success.How You’ll Make An Impact
   

  

* Qualify deals through collaboration with the Account Executive (AE), the Business Development Representative (BDR), and sales management
* Conduct Discovery meetings and learn from the customer and the BDR about the customer’s business requirements and technical environment
* Articulate to the Opportunity Team and to the customer usage scenarios that illustrate the business value desired by the customer
* Use Dataiku to demonstrate the business value articulated in the usage scenarios
* Design and create Dataiku additional demonstrations, Proofs\-of\-Concept (POC), and evaluations that clearly illustrate how to apply Dataiku to deliver the required customer value
* Execute demonstrations, POCs, and evaluations through coordination of the physical and human resources of Dataiku and the customer; lead the combined team to carry out the agreed upon course of action to prove that Dataiku delivers the needed value better than our competitors
* Answer questions and provide technical guidance to the customer’s technical team regarding the demonstrated or evaluated solutions
* Assist in sales pipeline building activities including attendance at live and/or virtual trade\-shows and industry conferences, working with marketing and or partners on campaign design and execution and other activities specified by sales and pre\-sales management
* Provide regular updates on your activities to support accurate regional forecasting, participate in continuous development activities that expand or build on your knowledge and skills with new product releases, GTM programs and initiatives \& relevant enablement sessions, participate in departmental activities like GTM or SE offsites.


 What You’ll Need To Be Successful
   

  

* Strong natural and intellectual curiosity especially around the application of technology to solve all kinds of problems, with the confidence to ask deep questions to understand prospective customer’s current and desired future state.
* Experience in technical pre\-sales, preferably in a high\-growth environment
* Experience in value orientated selling of product and platform solutions.
* Experience in the data science, analytics, or big data markets preferred but not required
* Familiarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Kubernetes, Spark, etc)
* Comfortability talking to all levels of customer teams from individual contributors to C\-level executives
* Experience in Analytics/AI or other enterprise software
* Previously worked in a fast paced, growing company


**What are you waiting for!**
 At Dataiku, you'll be part of a journey to shape the ever\-evolving world of AI. We're not just building a product; we're crafting the future of AI. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that values innovation, collaboration, and your personal growth, we can't wait to welcome you to Dataiku! And if you’d like to learn even more about working here, you can visit our Dataiku LinkedIn page.
   

  

*Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at:* 
 reasonable\-accommodations@dataiku.com
   

  

**Protect yourself from fraudulent recruitment activity**
*Dataiku will never ask you for payment of any type during the interview or hiring process. Other than our video\-conference application, Zoom, we will also never ask you to make purchases or download third\-party applications during the process. If you experience something out of the ordinary or suspect fraudulent activity, please review our page on identifying and reporting fraudulent activity here.*

title: Senior Director, Head of Trial Operations
description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra\[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock\-your\-socks\-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact\-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
   

  

**The Role \& Department**
 We’re on an exciting journey to become an integrated, end\-to\-end biotech innovation powerhouse. With our groundbreaking cancer treatment products now on the market, we’re shifting our focus to direct commercialization—and we need a visionary leader to drive our clinical trial operations to new heights.
   

  

 As the Senior Director, Head of Trial Operations, you will be at the forefront of ensuring our clinical trials are executed efficiently, innovatively, and to the highest quality standards.
   

  

 Reporting to the Vice President, Head of Trial Strategy and Delivery in the US, this hybrid role requires 60% onsite presence in either Copenhagen or Utrecht.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include**
* Define and drive the strategic direction for our Trial Operations, aligning it with broader Development Operations and commercial goals.
* Lead initiatives to enhance trial execution, boosting efficiency, scalability, and regulatory compliance.
* Collaborate with the Head of Program Leadership to manage clinical trials from start to finish, ensuring adherence to global regulatory standards, ICH\-GCP guidelines, and internal SOPs.
* Provide strategic oversight on trial budgets, timelines, and risk management to ensure seamless operations.
* Manage recruitment, coaching, and performance evaluations to ensure your team reaches its full potential.
* Work closely with clinical strategy, regulatory affairs, Development Operations, and external vendors/CROs to align trial operations with overall development strategies.


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience in clinical trial management and operations with a strong track record in strategic and operational leadership.
* 15\+ years in Pharma, Biotech, or CRO roles, with a preference for candidates with oncology expertise.
* In\-depth understanding of global clinical development processes, ICH\-GCP guidelines, and regulatory requirements.
* Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to build, inspire, and manage high\-performing teams.
* Excellent project management, organizational, and decision\-making skills.


**About You**
* You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
* You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted\-in\-science approach to problem\-solving
* You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
* You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
* You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
* You have experience working in a fast\-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
* You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


**Locations**
 Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work\-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community\-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state\-of\-the\-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
   

  

**About Genmab**
 Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose guiding its unstoppable team to strive towards improving the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For more than 20 years, its passionate, innovative and collaborative team has invented next\-generation antibody technology platforms and leveraged translational research and data sciences, which has resulted in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T\-cell engagers, next\-generation immune checkpoint modulators, effector function enhanced antibodies and antibody\-drug conjugates. To help develop and deliver novel antibody therapies to patients, Genmab has formed 20\+ strategic partnerships with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. By 2030, Genmab’s vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock\-Your\-Socks\-Off (KYSO™) antibody medicines.
   

  

 Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with locations in Utrecht, the Netherlands, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S. and Tokyo, Japan.
   

  

**Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion**
 We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
   

  

 Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website Job Applicant Privacy Notice (genmab.com).
   

  

 Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed\-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed\-term employment contract.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**About Us**
 Optiply is at the forefront of three rapidly expanding sectors: Software as a Service, Artificial Intelligence, and E\-commerce. With our intelligent purchasing software, we empower over 300 web shops and wholesalers to make smarter buying decisions, using predictive analytics to optimize inventory management.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you a proactive and driven professional looking to make an impact in a multifaceted role? Optiply is seeking a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team in the Netherlands!
   

  

 As an SDR, you will take the lead in cold calling and outbound prospecting while also tackling a wide variety of tasks that help shape our commercial success. You’ll play a pivotal role as the first point of contact for potential clients and contribute to multiple areas of our commercial strategy, including event outreach, market insights, and pipeline generation. This is your chance to make a tangible impact on a fast\-growing, innovative company.
   

  

**This Is What You'll Be Doing**
* Cold calling and outbound prospecting: Actively reaching out to leads through cold calls, LinkedIn, and other channels.
* Pipeline generation: Creating targeted email campaigns and coordinating outreach for events and industry fairs.
* Qualifying inbound leads: Ensuring potential clients are a good fit for our solution.
* Market research \& insights: Keeping up\-to\-date on industry trends, competitor activities, and new market opportunities.
* CRM and data management: Keeping our systems organized and ensuring data accuracy.
* Nurturing relationships: Building rapport with prospects and maintaining strong connections over time.
* Metrics and continuous improvement: Tracking your performance, learning from metrics, and suggesting improvements for outreach strategies.


**This Is Who We’re Looking For**
* You thrive on making impactful first connections and uncovering opportunities.
* At least 2 years of sales experience, preferably in SaaS, tech, or B2B environments.
* A natural communicator with a knack for engaging prospects and presenting ideas.
* Highly organized and detail\-oriented, with experience using CRM systems.
* Self\-motivated and creative, eager to learn and contribute to business growth.
* Comfortable with the fast\-paced nature of a high\-growth company.
* Fluent in English and Dutch.


**This It What We Offer**
* Good salary with a nice bonus structure;
* Free lunch at the office;
* Training opportunities;
* Hybrid work;
* Flexible Schedule;
* Proactive Career Management;
* Up to 1 month "work from anywhere"
* Bike Plan;
* Annual gathering;
* Thematic days (Dinner/Karts/Boat trip etc);
* Friday Drink;
* An awesome team so you always come home with a smile.


**This Job Description made your day?**
 Then you can proceed with the first step on our recruitment process here: https://assessment.testgorilla.com/testtaker/publicinvitation/de4156e2\-8a95\-4910\-9854\-aef2ef632917
   

  

 As the first step of our recruitment process, we will ask you to do our Cultural and Position fit assessment. This assessment will provide you with the opportunity to showcase your skills, talents, and personality. It will take around 30 minutes and you can do them either on your computer or phone!

title: Senior Sales Operations Analyst
description:
As the Manager of Sales Operations for the EMEA region, based in Amsterdam/London, you will be a key driver of customer retention and revenue growth across the organization. You will work with a team of professionals and collaborate closely with Sales, Finance, Strategy, and IT departments to optimize processes, enhance customer experiences, and strengthen client relationships. Your role will be pivotal in shaping our strategic approach and ensuring the long\-term success of our business. You will be directly aligned to Area, Regional Sales VP’s and their Regional Directors and become their trusted advisor/business partner.
   

  

 Your Impact
   

  

* Forecasting and Analytics
+ Lead the development and maintenance of accurate sales forecasts to support strategic decision\-making

* Pipeline Analytics
+ Support Sales Leadership in meaningful Pipeline analytics and drive jointly PG progress call

* Revenue Accuracy and Financial Collaboration
+ Partner with Finance and Sales teams to ensure all metrics are reported accurately and timely

* Team Leadership and Performance Enhancement
+ Drive the productivity of the team to consistently meet and exceed performance targets \- Utilize strong leadership and motivational skills to foster a high\-performance culture and improve team effectiveness

* Policy Compliance and Process Management
+ Ensure adherence to policies and procedures through collaboration with relevant stakeholders \- For example, ensure compensation policy, and company booking policy are strictly followed in the field

* Strategic Planning and Process Optimization
+ Own the annual planning process for EMEA, work on setting the sales quota, territory design, headcount planning, and all related tasks


 Your Experience
   

  

* 5\+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Planning, and Finance or a similar role
* Proven ability to execute and drive results – demonstrates a relentless focus on achieving challenging goals and a strong commitment to following through on initiatives from start to finish
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability – takes full responsibility for organizational, team, and personal commitments, and holds others accountable for delivering results in line with assigned responsibilities
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across departments and regions
* Strategic mindset with a focus on long\-term planning and a demonstrated ability to adapt to evolving business needs
* Bachelor degree from an accredited university
* Experience in the B2B software industry is a must


 Join Us in Securing the World's Data
   

  

 Rubrik (NYSE: RBRK) is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, we help organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. We help organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitor data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.
   

  

 Linkedin \| X (formerly Twitter) \| Instagram \| Rubrik.com
   

  

 Inclusion @ Rubrik
   

  

 At Rubrik, we are dedicated to fostering a culture where people from all backgrounds are valued, feel they belong, and believe they can succeed. Our commitment to inclusion is at the heart of our mission to secure the world’s data.
   

  

 Our goal is to hire and promote the best talent, regardless of background. We continually review our hiring practices to ensure fairness and strive to create an environment where every employee has equal access to opportunities for growth and excellence. We believe in empowering everyone to bring their authentic selves to work and achieve their fullest potential.
   

  

 Our inclusion strategy focuses on three core areas of our business and culture:
   

  

* Our Company: We are committed to building a merit\-based organization that offers equal access to growth and success for all employees globally. Your potential is limitless here.
* Our Culture: We strive to create an inclusive atmosphere where individuals from all backgrounds feel a strong sense of belonging, can thrive, and do their best work. Your contributions help us innovate and break boundaries.
* Our Communities: We are dedicated to expanding our engagement with the communities we operate in, creating opportunities for underrepresented talent and driving greater innovation for our clients. Your impact extends beyond Rubrik, contributing to safer and stronger communities.


 Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
   

  

 Rubrik is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
   

  

 Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please contact us at hr@rubrik.com if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
   

  

 EEO IS THE LAW
   

  

 NOTIFICATION OF EMPLOYEE RIGHTS UNDER FEDERAL LABOR LAWS

title: Account Executive (Outbound)
description:
**Shape the future of innovation, startups \& economies** 




 Dealroom is the world’s startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100\+ governments, to discover the world’s next generation of transformative companies.
 



 We’re on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision\-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.
 



 Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value transparency, openness, and candour \- the freedom to take risks, admit failures and speak openly.
 



  





**As an Account Executive, you’ll** 



* **Own the Full Sales Cycle:** 
 Manage the entire sales process, from prospecting and lead qualification to closing deals and onboarding new clients. This is a 100% outbound role. You need to generate your own leads and opportunities
* **Drive Outbound Success** 
 : Research and target accounts, leveraging tools like LinkedIn Sales Navigator to identify and engage high\-potential leads.
* **Build a Robust Pipeline** 
 : Execute effective cold outreach strategies, including email campaigns, phone calls, and social selling, to generate qualified leads.
* **Present Solutions** 
 : Demonstrate the value of Dealroom's platform to prospective clients through tailored presentations, demos, and conversations.
* **Collaborate Across Teams** 
 : Work closely with marketing and product teams to ensure alignment on messaging, content, and feedback loops.
* **Meet and Exceed Targets** 
 : Consistently achieve and surpass sales quotas, contributing to the growth of our client base and market presence.



  





**What You Bring** 



* Proven Sales Experience: 3\+ years in an outbound\-focused sales role, preferably in SaaS or startup ecosystems.
* Strong Communication Skills: Confidence in crafting and delivering compelling messages to diverse audiences.
* Tech and Ecosystem Passion: A genuine interest in the tech and startup landscape, with the ability to connect with clients on this shared passion.
* Data\-Driven Approach: Familiarity with CRMs like Hubspot and an analytical mindset for tracking and improving sales performance.
* You have a strong sense of urgency and are proactive and accountable.
* You feel right at home in a startup environment where learning is constant, and OKRs, continuous feedback, and curiosity form the backbone of our operations.
* You’re eligible to work in the EU and are fluent in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.



  





**What We Bring to the Deal** 



* A job you own. Show us what you’ve got, and we’ll help you get there!
* Benefits to support your work and well\-being: laptop of your choice, flexible hours, home office setup, travel expenses, development budget, weekly workouts, and more.
* A global and inclusive culture: our team spans 25\+ nationalities and values diversity.
* We embrace working remotely but stimulate frequent visits to our Amsterdam office to stay connected and energized.
* A meritocratic lab for your ideas \- we value entrepreneurial mindsets and turn great ideas into reality.



  





 Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let’s create something transformative together.

title: Head of RevOps
description:
**Epassi** 
**is an innovative fintech company, our** 
**purpose is to boost everyday well\-being** 
 .
   

  

 We are the market leader in mobile payments for employee benefits in Northern Europe – our solution combines all the benefits into a single mobile app. Epassi’s team is made of highly skilled people from top notch business developers, designers and software engineers to passionate sales, marketing, and customer support professionals. Epassi is awarded by the Financial Times as one of the fastest growing companies in Europe.
   

  

**Epassi expands outside of the Nordics!**
 We have recently acquired the UK's largest health and fitness network
 **Incorpore,** 
 leading Italian corporate welfare and employee benefits company
 **Eudaimon** 
 as well two of the leading corporate fitness companies in Western Europe,
 **Hansefit, i\-gb** 
 in Germany \&
 **BFNL** 
 in Netherlands.
   

  

 Are you excited about building and scaling a Revenue Operations function in one of Europe’s fastest\-growing tech companies? Do you have a passion for driving data\-driven strategies and aligning sales, marketing, and customer success to accelerate growth? Then you should continue reading. Epassi is growing, and we are looking for a
 **Head of Revenue Operations** 
 to establish and scale our RevOps function.
   

  

 Epassi’s purpose is to boost everyday well\-being. We are the market leader in mobile payments for employee benefits in Northern Europe – our solution combines all benefits into one mobile app. Epassi’s team is made of highly skilled people, from top\-notch business developers, designers, and software engineers to passionate sales, marketing, and customer support professionals. Epassi has been recognized by the Financial Times as one of the fastest\-growing companies in Europe.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for setting up and scaling the RevOps function, working closely with the CRO, Heads of Sales, and Heads of Marketing in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, and the UK. You will address system challenges, improve forecasting accuracy, and drive process optimization across multiple regions and acquired businesses.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build and scale the RevOps function, developing processes, tools, and metrics to support Epassi’s growth across six markets and multiple acquisitions.
* Overhaul current systems to support RevOps functions, including data integrity, e\-sign processes, and data definition guidelines.
* Partner with tech and data teams to optimize HubSpot, PowerBI, and other sales tools for accurate forecasting and reporting.
* Develop and implement standardized processes for revenue operations, including pipeline management, lead handling, and data entry.
* Create handbooks and guidelines to drive adoption and consistency across markets.
* Refine forecasting processes, ensuring alignment with sales and marketing strategies to drive revenue growth.
* Utilize data to identify market\-specific opportunities and ROI\-focused investments.
* Partner with sales, marketing, and customer success leaders to ensure unified strategies and execution.
* Work with regional leads to address market\-specific nuances and cross\-sell opportunities.
* Lead change initiatives across regions to drive best practices and align the company’s revenue operations strategy.
* Establish a data\-driven culture that supports agile decision\-making.


**Key Challenges**
* Address system limitations and data inconsistencies to support scalable RevOps functions.
* Focus on high\-priority growth markets, specifically Germany and Italy, and adapt strategies to local market regulations.
* Integrate multiple acquired businesses, CRMs, and pricing models to create a unified approach to revenue operations.
* Build data\-driven GTM strategies for individual markets, accounting for differing customer profiles, deal sizes, and conversion rates.


**Key Qualifications**
* Proven experience in a senior Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or a similar role, ideally within a SaaS or FinTech company.
* Experience setting up and scaling RevOps functions, including process optimization and data management.
* Strong understanding of sales and marketing operations, with the ability to drive alignment across functions.
* Hands\-on expertise with CRM systems (HubSpot preferred) and data analytics tools (e.g., PowerBI).
* Strong communication skills, with a track record of working effectively across regions and with senior stakeholders.
* Experience in leading change management initiatives and driving cultural adoption of new systems and processes.


**Why You Should Join Epassi**
* We are a fast\-growing tech company; you will have a chance to impact meaningful initiatives and grow together with us as a professional.
* We have an inspiring and supportive culture and take care of the well\-being of our employees.
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work\-life balance.
* We take care of the professional development of Epassians by creating personal development plans and providing a yearly budget for growth.
* We have a unique team environment – international, motivated, supportive colleagues with a great sense of humor.
* Epassi offers a great benefits package, including wide well\-being \& culture benefits


 If you are a strategic and hands\-on RevOps leader with a passion for driving change in a growing tech company, we would love to hear from you! Apply now to be part of our exciting journey.

title: Sales Account Executive
description:

*Location: Netherlands \| Full\-time \| Hybrid* 




  





 At

 , we’re reshaping the future of warehouse logistics. Born from the strategic merger of

 and

 in

 ,
 **Logistics** 
 ,
 **Supply Chain Management** 
 , or a related field.

* Excellent communication and presentation skills in

 .
* Experience working with
 **Salesforce** 
 or
 **HubSpot CRM** 
 .
* Self\-motivation, accountability, and a growth mindset.

**Why Join Us** 



* Be part of a
 **new industry leader** 
 formed by the merger of
 **Davanti** 
 and
 **WICS** 
 — combining agility with experience.

 **inbound opportunity flow** 
 , backed by marketing and partner referrals.

* Competitive base salary, attractive commission structure, mobility support, and personal development budget.



  





  





**Ready to help warehouses run smarter?** 




 Apply now and become part of the
 **Davanti\-WICS** 
 journey.

title: Head of Sales
description:
**About the Role** 




  





 In this role, you will lead a high\-performing team across
 **inbound and outbound sales, account management, and customer service** 
 functions. Your primary objective will be to drive new business acquisition while ensuring the retention and growth of existing accounts. You will be responsible for setting sales targets, optimizing processes, and implementing strategies to maximize revenue and customer satisfaction.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**Leadership \& Team Management** 




  




* Lead, coach, and develop a team of
 **11 full\-time employees (FTEs)** 
 across inbound and outbound sales, account management, and customer service.
* Set clear performance expectations, KPIs, and sales targets, ensuring team members are motivated and equipped to succeed.
* Foster a high\-performance sales culture through continuous training, feedback, and development initiatives.



  





**Sales Growth \& Revenue Generation:** 




  




* Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to
 **drive revenue growth** 
 within the assigned territories.
* Identify new business opportunities and implement targeted campaigns to increase market share.
* Collaborate with marketing and product teams to refine sales messaging and promotional efforts.



  





**Customer Acquisition \& Expansion** 




  




* Oversee
 **lead generation, prospecting, and pipeline management** 
 to ensure a steady flow of new customers.
* Work with the team to develop tailored sales approaches, focusing on
 **high\-conversion tactics** 
 to maximize new customer acquisition.
* Analyze market trends, customer data, and competitor activity to identify opportunities for business expansion.



  





**Account Management \& Customer Retention** 




  




* Ensure a
 **seamless customer experience** 
 by aligning sales, account management, and customer service efforts.
* Support the team in managing existing accounts, identifying upsell and cross\-sell opportunities, and increasing customer lifetime value.
* Implement customer engagement strategies to enhance retention, satisfaction, and long\-term loyalty.


- 


**Operational Excellence \& Reporting** 




  




* Monitor sales performance and generate regular reports to track progress against business objectives.

**Ideal Candidate Profile** 




  




* Proven experience in

 , ideally in a B2B environment.

 **building and managing high\-performing sales teams** 
 .
* Results\-driven mindset with a passion for

 .

title: Junior Account Executive
description:
**About us** 




 Optiply is at the forefront of three rapidly expanding sectors: Software as a Service, Artificial Intelligence, and E\-commerce. With our intelligent purchasing software, we empower over 300 web shops and wholesalers to make smarter buying decisions, using predictive analytics to optimize inventory management.
 



  





**Job Description** 




 Are you a sales enthusiast ready to kickstart your career and grow into an Account Executive role within 6\-12 months? At Optiply, we believe the foundation of sales success lies in mastering the art of prospecting and deeply understanding our products and customers. That’s why we’re looking for a Junior Account Executive to join our dynamic and ambitious team.
 



  





**This is what you'll be doing** 




*In your first 6\-12 months:* 



* Learn the Basics of Sales and Product Knowledge: Dive deep into understanding Optiply’s software, its features, and the value it brings to customers.
* Master Prospecting: Build and manage a pipeline of potential clients by researching and identifying Ideal Customer Profiles (ICP).
* Hone Your Outreach Skills: Conduct cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn outreach to engage decision\-makers and spark interest in Optiply.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with marketing and sales leadership to refine outreach strategies and understand how sales cycles unfold.
* Track and Optimize: Use CRM tools to log activities, analyze data, and optimize approaches to deliver measurable results.



  





***After successfully demonstrating your capabilities in this phase:***




 Transition to an Account Executive Role: Take on the responsibility of managing your own sales pipeline, conducting product demos, and closing deals with potential clients.
 



  





**This is who we’re looking for** 



* Previous experience in a sales role
* You thrive on making impactful first connections and uncovering opportunities.
* Resilient and persistent, with a growth mindset and eagerness to learn.
* Organized and detail\-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively.
* Comfortable with cold outreach and excited to engage with potential clients.
* Fluent in English and Dutch (mandatory).
* Knowledge of CRM systems is advantageous.



  





**This it what we offer** 



* Good salary with a nice bonus structure;
* Free lunch at the office;
* Training opportunities;
* Hybrid work;
* Flexible Schedule;
* Proactive Career Management;
* Up to 1 month "work from anywhere"
* Bike Plan;
* Annual gathering;
* Thematic days (Dinner/Karts/Boat trip etc);
* Friday Drink;
* An awesome team so you always come home with a smile.



  





 This Job Description made your day?
 



 Send your CV in English and let's talk!

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**Sales Development Representative** 




  





**About Female x Finance** 





 Female x Finance is the fastest\-growing career platform connecting ambitious female talent with finance companies that are verified by Female x Finance for their commitment to gender diversity and inclusion.
 





 For companies, we are a trusted business partner in attracting, hiring, and retaining top female talent.
 




  






 With our team of 11 employees, we collaborate with over 60 Finance companies and serve a community of 7,500\+ women globally. Ready to make an impact from day one? 
 




  






 Female x Finance is looking for a driven sales executive to join the team! In this role you will be responsible for the full sales funnel \- generating leads, onboarding new partners through the FxF Quality Mark, and building strong relationships with Finance companies across the Netherlands (and more..).
 




  





**Role Responsibilities: What You’ll Do** 




  





**Own the outbound sales process:** 

 Develop, test, and refine outreach strategies, ensuring a structured and repeatable process for identifying and engaging new B2B clients.
 




**Be a hunter with a partnership mindset:** 

 Proactively seek out and build relationships with Finance companies that align with FxF’s mission, focusing on meaningful, long\-term partnerships.
 




**Develop your own outbound workflows and best practices:** 

 Leverage data, automation tools, and creativity to optimize lead generation efforts.
 




**Design and implement outbound lead generation strategies** 

 to ensure a consistent pipeline of high\-quality prospects in the Netherlands and key European markets.
 




**Conduct in\-depth research** 

 to identify, engage, and convert potential clients, initiating conversations that highlight the value of FxF’s services.
 




**Qualify and nurture leads** 

 through a consultative sales approach, ensuring alignment with client needs and DE\&I objectives.
 




**Onboard new clients:** 

 Educate them on the FxF Quality Mark, our platform, and how they can effectively attract and retain female talent.
 




**Collaborate closely with the Talent Management and Marketing teams** 

 to align messaging, share insights, and drive engagement with our growing community.
 




**Contribute to B2B marketing efforts:** 

 Support thought leadership initiatives, outbound email campaigns, LinkedIn outreach, and event\-driven lead generation.
 




**Track and optimize performance:** 

 Measure outreach effectiveness, report on key sales metrics, and continuously iterate on outbound approaches for maximum impact.
 




  





**Role Requirements: What You Need to Succeed** 



* **1\-3 years of work experience** 

 in sales, business development, or a client\-facing role (preferably in B2B, recruitment, HR tech, or finance\-related industries).
* **A strong affinity** 

 with the Finance sector and diversity \& inclusion topics—you understand the industry’s challenges and FxF’s mission.
* **A proactive, creative, and solution\-oriented approach** 

 to communication that builds trust and inspires potential clients.
* **Fluency in English.**
* Excellent
 
**listening skills** 

 and the ability to communicate confidently and with purpose.
* **Self\-starter mentality:** 

 You take initiative, experiment with new approaches, and continuously optimize your sales processes.
* **Ability to set up and optimize outbound workflows:** 

 Experience with CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce), email automation, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or other sales tools is a big plus.
* **Hunter mentality with a partnership approach:** 

 You love identifying opportunities, initiating conversations, and nurturing leads into long\-term relationships.



  





**What’s in it for You?** 





 🌍 The chance to make a real impact in the finance industry and D\&I space.
 





 📈 A fast\-growing startup environment with room for leadership and ownership.
 





 🎉 A fun, energetic, and mission\-driven team.
 





 🏡 Hybrid work setup (min. 2 days per week in our Amsterdam office) Remote? lets' discuss.
 





 🛫 International travel opportunities as we expand.
 





 💰 Competitive salary (€38,880 \- €43,000\) and commission bonus (% closed deals), based on 40h/week
 




 \*We are open for both full\-time employees and freelancers!
 



  





**Bring Your Drive. Make a Difference.** 





 Join the Sales team at Female x Finance and help transform the Finance industry. This is your chance to make a big impact, not just for yourself, but for the women and companies shaping the future of work.
 




  




-

title: Head of Revenue Operations
description:
**Head of Revenue Operations (RevOps)** 




**Location:** 
 Utrecht, The Netherlands
 



**Working style:** 
 Hybrid working
 



**Salary:** 
 €120,000 – €150,000
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




 An established European software company specialising in Construction Tech and Infrastructure Management solutions is seeking an experienced Head of Revenue Operations to join their leadership team on a permanent basis. This strategic position will be responsible for aligning and optimising the company’s revenue\-generating functions across the organisation. The successful candidate will replace the current Head of RevOps, whose contract concludes in August 2025, ensuring comprehensive knowledge transfer and a smooth transition.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead and develop the Revenue Operations function, ensuring alignment between Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams.
* Drive revenue growth strategies through data\-driven insights and process optimisation.
* Oversee forecasting, pipeline management, and revenue reporting across the organisation.
* Manage and further develop the SalesOps, RevOps analysts, and Sales Enablement teams.
* Optimize and maintain the revenue tech stack, with a particular focus on CRM systems.
* Collaborate with executive leadership to establish and meet growth objectives.

- 


**Requirements** 



* 15\+ years of experience in Revenue Operations, Sales Operations OR Commercial Ops related fields.
* Proven track record of building and optimising RevOps functions in scaling environments.
* Strong commercial acumen with demonstrated ability to contribute to revenue growth through Ops strategies.
* Extensive experience with CRM systems, preferably Salesforce, and revenue technology stacks.
* Exceptional analytical skills with expertise in forecasting and data\-driven decision\-making.

**Location** 



* Primarily based in France or the Netherlands.



  





**Compensation \& Benefits** 



* Annual salary range: €120,000 – €150,000 gross.
* Comprehensive benefits package.
* Opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast\-growing international company.

title: Data Engineer
description:

title: Process Automation Analyst
description:
**What’s The Role**
 Shell Trading \& Supply (T\&S) is a core part of Shell's Downstream, Renewables \& Energy Solutions (DR) business. We aim to maximise sustained value creation across commodity markets, supporting DR's objectives of generating material cash and returns on capital. The business is global, focusing on five core commodity trading hubs: Houston, London, Rotterdam, Singapore, Dubai and Canada.
   

  

 You will join the Process Automation \& Analytics team within the T\&S Products organization, where you will play a key role in driving digital innovation aligned with business priorities.
   

  

 The team is responsible for developing fast and cost\-effective solutions for Commercial Operations Products using Shell’s DIY technology platforms. We excel in managing the lifecycle of automation and analytics products and enhancing digital literacy through the digitalization of business insights, analytics, and automation solutions. Our team collaborates with various business units, Information and Digital Technology (IDT), and delivery partners for technology and digital transformation, leveraging Shell’s extensive Process \& Improvement technical capabilities.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Process Automation Analyst with low\-code/pro\-code developer experience, advanced Microsoft Power Platforms skills and a strong business analysis background, you will focus on designing and programming solutions to streamline operations and enhance efficiency. You will collaborate with IT and Trading organizations, support global strategic innovation roadmaps through rapid prototyping, and work closely with commercial and operational stakeholders. Your role involves contributing to various functions such as blending, freight management, scheduling, and more within a leading organization.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities \& Accountabilities:
   

  

* Identify, prioritize, and scope Automation \& Analytics opportunities with stakeholders globally
* Design and implement advanced automation solutions using Microsoft Power Platforms (Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI)
* Conduct detailed business analysis to map and optimize operational processes, identifying opportunities for efficiency and innovation
* Oversee the maintenance and continuous improvement of existing automation systems, enhancing value recovery whilst ensuring they meet evolving business needs
* Plan for scaling \& replication of Automation \& Analytics capabilities within the team and across the regions
* Ensure automation \& analytics solutions are built according to coding standards and control frameworks (EUC, IRM, BIA, PIA), and maintain solution documentations
* Provide technical expertise to complex projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and meet quality standards
* Establish partnerships with DIY Centers of Excellence and related IDT functions to maximize automation benefits and drive implementation best practices
* Serve as a key point of contact for stakeholders in IT and Trading organizations, managing expectations and ensuring the delivery of tailored automation solution
* Facilitate training sessions and provide ongoing support to users, promoting the adoption and effective use of automation tools
* Stay informed about industry trends and advancements in process automation, applying this knowledge to drive the organization's strategic goals
* Champion the Eliminate Simplify Standardize Automate (ESSA) mindset in T\&S
* Develop Business Continuity Plans to ensure robust response and recovery procedures are in place to maximize uptime of automation and analytics solutions


**What You Bring**
 To be successful in this role, you must demonstrate a proven track record of leading the discovery, design, development, deployment and maintenance of automation and analytics use cases that will enable maximum business value.
   

  

 The T\&S business environment is dynamic, with a highly complex regulatory and system landscape. The organisation is located globally, with multiple interfaces to our Trading hubs in London, Rotterdam, Houston, Dubai and Singapore and will therefore require a successful candidate to possess strong communication and relationship management skills.
   

  

 Key Experiences and Qualifications:
   

  

* Relevant experience in process automation, business analysis, or a related field
* Extensive expertise in Microsoft Power Platform, encompassing Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI
* Proficiency in developing AI Builder and Azure ML models, or using data science programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL
* Skilled in setting up, configuring, and processing workloads from Azure or similar managed hosting environments
* Proven experience in business process mapping and optimization
* Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to navigate complex organizational structures
* Project management expertise, with a history of leading successful automation initiatives
* Analytical mindset with exceptional problem\-solving abilities
* Ability to present complex technical concepts to non\-technical stakeholders and end\-users effectively
* Resilient and delivery\-focused when faced with evolving requirements
* Proven track record of embedding ESSA principles in business process optimization use cases
* Experience in operating Life of a Deal processes in Trading, Operations, or Supply business is advantageous


 We'd like you to know that Shell has a bold goal: to become one of the world’s most diverse and inclusive companies. You can get to know more about how we're working towards that goal, click here.
   

  

**Shell in The Netherlands**
 Most Dutch people know us from the 570 retail stations where they can fill up, recharge and buy fresh sandwiches and coffee. But Shell is more than the stations. The company that started over 130 years ago grew into one of the world’s largest energy companies. And during that time, operations in the Netherlands have continued to expand.
   

  

 For example, from Rotterdam, Shell coordinates the supply of lubricants for transport and agriculture, aviation fuel and raw materials. Shell Pernis produces the building blocks for healthcare disinfectants and muscle relaxants in Intensive Care. Amsterdam is home to one of our largest research centres in the world: the open Energy Transition Campus Amsterdam. From our campus in The Hague, we lead Shell’s global energy transition. Pernis is home to one of our main refineries and Moerdijk is home to our Dutch chemical plants.

title: Senior ServiceNow Developer Platform Data Governance
description:
**Introduction to the job**
 For our NOW Agile Release Train (ART), we are looking for an experienced senior ServiceNow developer to strengthen the Platform Data Governance DevOps team in this ART. NOW is positioned within IT and more specifically in Core IT Generic \& Platform Services. At NOW we improve ASML’s people productivity, through an enterprise wide, one\-stop\-shop that makes it easy for employees to get fast and high\-quality services. We do this with 5 DevOps teams delivering integrated and automated workflows making use of the ServiceNow platform.
   

  

 The platform Data Governance team is responsible for the overall quality of the CMDB in collaboration with all the teams that register information in the CMDB. This includes identification, analysis and control of data model changes and the orchestration of CI data integrity and relationships. The developer will also help in setting up the life cycle of CMDB classes and CIs within the ServiceNow platform. Ultimately, this role will contribute to the Configuration Management Database maturity process.
   

  

**Role and responsibilities**
 A sr. Developer is responsible for turning functional specifications into the best possible technical implementation that is delivering maximum value for our stakeholders. This role is in the heart of a highly empowered team making its own decisions on how to best design, build and deliver new demand. All of this within guardrails set by the organization and architectural guidelines defined by the System and Product Architects. A sr. Developer supports his Product Owner with the definition of crisp User Stories and more, supports the Scrum Master with building a high performing team and supports other team members with their personal development and growth by coaching and challenging them. Bringing the complete team to a higher level in value delivery, delivery predictability and agility is your mission.
   

  

**Education and experience**
 As a senior developer with at least 7\+ years development experience in ServiceNow you are a master in designing, planning, building, delivering, and administering ServiceNow developments/changes. You advise on the solution direction and create technical solution designs, work with stakeholders and functional consultants to translate business requirements into sustainable ServiceNow developments, improvements and implementations. You perform the development of the more complex technical components and integrations and create reusable components which can be leveraged in future engagements. You act as a mentor, a coach and train junior ServiceNow developers.
   

  

 A grasp of some skills that fit this position:
   

  

* 5\+ years of experience with Configuration Management (CMDB) in ServiceNow in a large IT organization, including defining data management processes and governance around CMDB is required.
* Thorough understanding and experience with CSDM, the ServiceNow ITAM and ITOM modules.
* Strong consulting skills and able to identify, define, present and deliver solutions supporting business data need following (data) security and platform standards.
* Experience in creating, updating and maintaining CMDBs, Asset Management Databases and other asset/configuration management repositories in a complex IT environment.
* Experience in identifying and tracking CIs, implementing change control and accounting for discovered/manual CIs in a complex IT system.
* Minimum of 3\+year experience with ServiceNow Discovery and a good understanding of plugins, patterns, mid servers, and integrations.


 Besides the more technical skills and competences, you’re Agile and or SAFe certified. You’re highly motivated and energetic and can pass your enthusiasm towards the teams and others. Your mentoring and coaching skills are strong and you are a great result driven person and communicator. You are outgoing, actively building relationships while building value for your stakeholders. You act like an entrepreneur and take ownership.
   

  

 As ASML is an international organization, we are looking for a senior with excellent English communication and presentation skills, both verbal and in written communication.
   

  

**Skills**
 Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. Where automation is the new norm and where is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
   

  

 To thrive in this job, we expect the following behavior:
   

  

* Act as a CMDB champion, who owns CMDB data quality management process and overall data model (based on the Common Service Data Model (CSDM) framework) and makes sure that the ASML organization is speaking the same language when talking about CMDB data and its quality.
* Lead without hierarchy: be the engine of the team and empower your co\-developers.
* Collaborate with Product Owner to create and refine user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Feel end2end ownership for the Team Scope as agreed in the Sprint Planning.
* Challenge your Product Owner and peers to continuously strive for the highest level of quality.
* Participate in PI planning and create iteration plans and team PI objectives.
* Use pairing and other practices for frequent review.
* Adhere to the agreed team rituals and way of working.
* Conduct research, design, prototype, and other exploration activities.
* Coach (junior) developers.


*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the* 
*United States* 
 Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R.
   

  

* 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.


**Diversity and inclusion**
 ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
   

  

 Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

 Join a 1\-4 person team as the Quant Dev to get new HFT strategies off the ground and frankly do whatever is necessary to make the team successful. You will wear multiple hats. It will not be perfect. You will learn a TON, and there's a lot of financial upside for you.

title: Senior Risk Model Developer Pillar 2
Software Engineer ESS
description:
Are you ready to use your technical expertise to contribute to a sustainable future? Join the software team behind our energy storage systems and work on groundbreaking innovations that accelerate the global energy transition. Grow with us and make an impact!
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As a Software Engineer ESS at Alfen, you will have the opportunity to apply your technical skills to develop, test, and maintain high\-quality software for our energy storage systems (TheBattery). Whether your expertise lies in Embedded Systems, Application Programming, Fullstack, Frontend, Backend, Data Engineering, or Infrastructure, you will be working on projects that truly make a difference.
   

  

 Collaborating with colleagues from various disciplines—such as Product Development, Testing \& Compliance, Service, and Operations—you will contribute to innovative and scalable software solutions that align with our customers' needs and our vision for a sustainable future. You will be part of a team that values quality, collaboration, and personal growth.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
**Analysis and Development**
* Analyze product and design requirements and translate them into software implementations.
* Develop, program, and enhance software for control, monitoring, and testing purposes.


**Quality and Testing**
* Ensure designs meet requirements and perform software tests.
* Implement improvements based on feedback.


**Collaboration and Support**
* Actively participate in a multidisciplinary Scrum team.
* Support prototypes and provide assistance to production, service, and test engineering.


**Innovation and Knowledge Sharing**
* Explore new techniques and share insights within the team.
* Collaborate across disciplines to optimize products.


**Documentation**
* Document software designs and create technical documentation.
* Use diagrams to clarify concepts.


**Safety**
* Adhere to quality and safety standards according to QHSE procedures


**What are we looking for?**
 We Are Seeking a Software Professional With a Hands\-on, Results\-driven, And Structured Approach. Someone Who Communicates Effectively At All Levels And Gains Support For Technical Solutions And Innovations. Additionally
   

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree (HBO/WO), preferably in a technical or science\-related field.
* Knowledge of and experience with both front\-end and back\-end development.
* Proven expertise in programming languages such as C, C\+\+, and Python.
* Relevant Linux and networking knowledge.
* Experience with system integration, including knowledge of networks and/or affinity with energy storage systems, grid codes, and grid balancing.
* Familiarity with scalable and redundant systems.
* Experience with the Scrum/Agile methodology.
* Excellent proficiency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.


**What do we offer you?**
**Role**
 At Alfen, we provide a role with autonomy, responsibility, and ample room for personal input, new ideas, initiatives, and entrepreneurship. Additionally, we offer:
   

  

* A competitive salary and benefits according to the CAO Metalektro.
* 27 vacation days \+ 13 additional leave days per year, with the option to sell 10 vacation days.
* Hybrid working possibilities ( up to 2 days per week with a 40\-hour workweek ).
* A company\-provided phone and laptop.
* Free and unlimited access to our online learning platform.
* Engaged colleagues and fun activities organized by our active employee associations, AlFun and Young Alfen.
* Free sports activities through Alfen to stay physically and mentally fit.
* Pension contributions through the PME Pension Fund, with Alfen covering more than half of the premium.
* Travel allowance of €0\.23 per km, up to a maximum of 50 km one way.


**Where will you work?**
 At Alfen, you will work for a company at the heart of the energy transition. With our wide range of in\-house developed products and extensive experience as a system integrator, we are shaping the electricity grid of the future: reliable, sustainable, and innovative. Alfen is the place for anyone who thrives on innovation and growth. As a fast\-growing international organization in the sustainable energy sector, we are dedicated to developing our products and our people.
   

  

 R\&D \& Engineering Department
   

  

 At R\&D \& Engineering, we work on innovations that shape the energy landscape of tomorrow. Our specialized teams focus on software, electrical engineering, power electronics, and mechanical engineering. By combining these disciplines, we quickly bring unique new concepts and products to market and continuously improve our existing solutions.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If this role excites you, apply directly via the “Apply Now” button.
   

  

 Your application is an important step toward a future at Alfen. Want to know what to expect during the recruitment process? Click here.
   

  

**Note:** 
 A reference check, screening, and Certificate of Conduct (VOG) may be part of the selection process. Applications are reviewed continuously, and the vacancy may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found. Unsolicited recruitment offers in response to this vacancy are not appreciated.

title: Senior Software Test Engineer EVCE
description:
Join Alfen as a Senior Software Test Engineer ACE in the R\&D \& Engineering Department! Work on cutting\-edge technologies that accelerate the global energy transition. Use your technical expertise to contribute to a sustainable future and grow with us!
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As a Senior Software Test Engineer ACE at Alfen, you will focus on developing and improving advanced software testing solutions for the energy transition. You will work on cutting\-edge technologies such as fast\-charging stations, energy storage systems, and smart grids. Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, you will test complex software solutions and help deliver high\-quality, reliable products that meet customer needs and market demands.
   

  

 You will be involved in projects like AFIR and other leading initiatives in the sector.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities Include**
* Developing, defining, and executing software test plans for embedded software, control technology, electrical engineering, and hardware.
* Leading the development of software test environments and setups, guiding the assembly of test setups and instruments.
* Performing software tests according to established protocols and methodologies, analyzing results, and reporting findings.
* Advising on software solutions based on test results and contributing to product design improvements.
* Enhancing software testability and advising Business Units on necessary testing tools.
* Mentoring and instructing less experienced colleagues, ensuring knowledge transfer within the team.
* Representing the department in multidisciplinary projects and overseeing the technical progress of software development.


**What do we ask of you?**
 We Are Looking For a Senior Software Test Engineer With a Hands\-on, Results\-driven, And Structured Approach. Someone Who Communicates Effectively At All Levels And Gains Support For Technical Solutions And Innovations. Additionally, You Should Have
   

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of relevant experience in software testing, preferably in embedded systems or power electronics.
* Availability for a minimum of 32 hours per week.
* Excellent command of Dutch and English, both spoken and written.
