**What do we offer?**
**Responsibilities**
 At Alfen, we offer a dynamic and responsible position with plenty of room for your ideas, initiatives, and entrepreneurship. Additionally, we provide:
   

  

* A competitive salary with conditions under the CAO Metalektro.
* 27 vacation days \+ 13 ADV days per year, with the option to sell 10 vacation days.

* Engaged colleagues and fun activities organized by our employee associations AlFun and Young Alfen.

* Pension scheme at PME Pension Fund, with Alfen covering more than half of the premium.

**Where will you work?**
 At Alfen, you will be part of a company at the heart of the energy transition. With our wide range of in\-house developed products and extensive experience as a system integrator, we are building the electricity grid of the future: reliable, sustainable, and innovative.
   

  

 R\&D \& Engineering Department
   

  

 The R\&D \& Engineering department is dedicated to shaping the energy landscape of the future. Our specialized teams focus on software, electrical engineering, power electronics, and mechanical engineering. By combining these disciplines, we can swiftly develop and market unique new concepts and products, while continuously improving our existing solutions.

title: PLC Software Engineer
description:
The Business Unit Food Processing and Packaging offers leading processing technology for the poultry, meat, fish, vegetarian and meat\-replacement markets. Our portfolio contains \- either stand\-alone or complete automated lines, which can be integrated with freezing and packaging solutions. Within our Division Food \& Health Technologies we are looking for a PLC Software Engineer. The location for this position will be our machine manufacturing plant Bakel in the Netherlands which is part of the Business Unit Food Processing and Packaging.
   

  

**Responsibilities / Tasks**
 As a PLC Software Engineer, you are responsible for the design and realization of the software for our single machines, complete production lines, lifecycle development.
   

  

**Tasks**
* Developing and Programming of software on your own and as part of a team depending on the size of the project.
* Developing standard and customer specific applications and install these globally at our customers.
* Support other GEA colleagues globally via remote support.
* Training customers on our machines and software applications.
* Translating a customer request to a workable software solution.


**Your Profile / Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
* Self\-supportive, result driven, team player.
* Willingness to travel globally (10 to 20%).
* Fluent in English, spoken and written.
* Experience within similar function is preferred.
* Knowledge of IEC 61131\-3 and Structured Text is a preferred.
* Knowledge of Rockwell is preferred.
* Knowledge of B\&R PLC’s is preferred.
* Knowledge of Object\-Oriented Programming software (Java)is preferred.


**What Do We Offer**
* Competitive salary and 8% holiday payment.
* Travel allowance.
* 25 vacation days and 13 ADV days based on full\-time employment.
* Participation pension fund (PMT).
* Possibility of collective health insurance.
* Possibility of working from home.
* Compensation for your sports subscription.


**What happens once your application is submitted?**
 You will receive an email when your application has been processed.
   

  

 One of our TA Partners will review and verify if your application meets the qualifications of the role.
   

  

 If your application has been successfully verified, you will be invited to a first interview either virtually or face\-to\-face.
   

  

 Usually after the second/third interview round we will make a decision.
   

  

 Please do not hesitate to reach out to our team at any stage of your application.
   

  

**Did we spark your interest?**
 Then please click apply above to access our guided application process.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**That feeling when you're working with technologies others can only read about…**
 We are continuously working on creating a better future, and we need great minds to reach that goal thus we're looking for a talented and motivated
 **Software Engineer/PLC programmer** 
 with experience in programming our machines to expand our teams in
 **Nieuwkuijk and Boxmeer** 
 . You are part of a team of 10 software engineers that is located in both Denmark and the Netherlands.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer you work closely with all other team members within Innovation, like Electrical Engineers, Project Managers and Mechanical Engineers.
   

  

 As a
 **Software Engineer/PLC programmer** 
 at Marel, you have the freedom to take initiative and make a real impact in a growing global company.
   

  

 As part of your daily responsibility, you will::
   

  

* Collaborate with the innovation team to design and develop machines for the food industry.
* Work with software from multiple vendors: e.g. B\&R, Schneider, Beckhoff, SigmaTEK (Lasal, Sigmatek's development environment, based on Structured Text with an OOP architecture).
* Maintain and optimize communication protocols like Modbus, OPC\-UA, and OpenCan.
* Further standardize our library to improve efficiency and ease of maintenance.
* Perform evaluations, testing and analyses at customer site


**Who are we?**
 Marel designs and installs food processing solutions for the global food processing industry. Marel is an international team of people for whom passion is not just a buzzword. We have a significant goal \- creating a world where quality food is sustainably and affordably produced \- and we're excited to achieve this. As world leaders in advanced food processing solutions, we're uniquely positioned to transform the future of food and make a real impact, but we need people with diverse perspectives and skills to get there.
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
**There's nothing like the feeling of doing something valuable for a living.** 
 That being said, coming home from work knowing you've made a difference is just one of the great things you can experience at Marel. The required expertise for this role is developed and maintained within the company, offering excellent opportunities for career growth. This is achieved through self\-study, seminars, and targeted courses. In summary, this is a challenging and responsible role within a professional, internationally oriented company.
   

  

 You Can Expect Recognition For Your Achievements, Clear Goals And Realistic Demands, An Environment Of Trust And Respect, Access To a Global Network Of Specialists. Furthermore, You Can Also Expect
   

  

* Opportunities to build your knowledge.
* Room to explore, fail, and learn.
* A good salary and attractive secondary benefits (including 27 vacation days and 13 ADV days, travel allowance, pension, etc.).


**What kind of person are you?**
 We Encourage Each Of Our 8,000\+ Employees To Bring Their Unique Selves To Work And Strive For Everyone To Feel Recognized, Valued, And Free To Explore Their Potential. We Are Committed To Creating An Inclusive Culture And Welcome New Colleagues From All Walks Of Life. You Recognize In Yourself That You
   

  

* Have a drive to continue developing yourself and us
* Take responsibility for your work and are decisive
* Enjoy collaborating with others and are open to new ideas
* You have completed a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a similar technical discipline
* Experience in programming industrial machines
* Strong problem\-solving and analytical skills
* The ability to prioritize and work effectively under pressure
* Excellent communication skills in a multidisciplinary team
* Fluency in both Dutch and English, spoken and written
* Willingness to travel 20\-30%


**Interested?**
 So if you want to work with technologies others can only read about, contact us by applying for this position. For more information about this position, please contact our Talent Acquisition specialist: Katarzyna Strzelczyk, via email: Katarzyna.strzelczyk\-kus@marel.com
